programme.title: K-19: The Widowmaker
programme.desc: When a nuclear sub malfunctions, captains Harrison Ford and Liam Neeson clash as they battle to avert disaster. Gripping action from Hurt Locker director Kathryn Bigelow. (2002)(133 mins)(n)

programme.title: The 6th Day
programme.desc: Arnold Schwarzenegger is cloned by an evil corporation and finds himself in great danger when he stumbles upon a shocking conspiracy. Action-packed sci-fi thriller. (2000)(119 mins)(n)

programme.desc: A replicated Ripley battles mutant DNA and slime-dripping fiends in Sigourney Weaver's fourth sci-fi skirmish. Contains strong language, violence, flashing images. (1997)(105 mins)(n)

programme.title: The King of Queens
programme.desc: Doug encourages Carrie to go on a date with the policeman who gave her a speeding ticket, hoping he will drop the charges and prevent their car insurance from increasing. Comedy, starring Kevin James.(n)

programme.title: Will & Grace
programme.desc: Will is unimpressed when Matt pretends they are brothers in front of his bosses, and Karen is shocked to learn Stan has been persuaded to bequeath a third of his money to charity. With Eric McCormack and Patrick Dempsey.(n)

programme.title: Will & Grace
programme.desc: An old car left to Grace by her late uncle causes sentimental problems when a nun wishes to buy it. Jack is given the impression his absent father is African-American, while Rosario goes to work for a wealthy friend of Karen's in secret. Ellen DeGeneres guest stars.(n)

programme.title: Will & Grace
programme.desc: Will thinks his dad is in town to visit him, but Grace spots him on the arm of a beautiful woman and seeks Karen's advice on the matter, unwittingly convincing her that Stan is seeing someone else. American sitcom, guest starring Sydney Pollack, with Eric McCormack and Debra Messing.(n)

programme.title: Everybody Loves Raymond
programme.desc: When Robert asks if he can borrow the suitcase sitting on the stairway landing, Ray explains he and Debra have been locked in a two-week battle of wills over who is responsible for putting the item away. Ray Romano and Brad Garrett star.(n)

programme.title: Everybody Loves Raymond
programme.desc: Debra and Marie shame Ray into giving Robert a second bachelor party to make up for his disappointing first attempt.(n)

programme.title: Everybody Loves Raymond
programme.desc: Part one of two. Robert and Amy prepare to tie the knot in a classic Barone family wedding ceremony - but the groom becomes suspicious when his future brother-in-law Peter tries to make peace with both him and Ray. Comedy, starring Ray Romano and Brad Garrett.(n)

programme.title: Frasier
programme.desc: The radio psychiatrist dates a beautiful woman, but drives everyone crazy when he begins to feel insecure about his own looks. Comedy, starring Kelsey Grammer.(n)

programme.title: Frasier
programme.desc: Niles tries to ask Daphne for a date but she misunderstands his intentions, and Frasier has a frustrating episode of his own. Comedy, starring Kelsey Grammer, David Hyde Pierce and Jane Leeves.(n)

programme.title: Frasier
programme.desc: The number of large noses in Rick's family causes concern for Roz as she thinks about what her baby will look like. Comedy, starring Kelsey Grammer and Peri Gilpin.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay visits Down City, a restaurant in Providence, Rhode Island. The no-nonsense chef struggles to persuade hot-headed owner Abby to make his suggested changes, and a confrontation results in him being thrown out of the building in the middle of a dinner service. The eatery's co-owner and financier begs Gordon to return, but his success hinges on his ability to win Abby over.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition begins at 20 Albany Street in Edinburgh, where mother-and-daughter duo Denise and Heather Walker hope their B&B will win over their fellow competitors. First impressions seem a success, with each of the guests happy with the high standards of the rooms, however one couple do not hesitate to comment on their poor night's sleep.(n)

programme.title: Channel 4 News Summary
programme.desc: Includes news headlines and weather.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The B&B owners visit the Highland Guesthouse in Callander, run by Tom and Angela Jones. The guests are impressed by the hotel's cleanliness on arrival, but not everyone enjoys a traditional Scottish dancing activity - or the morning bagpipes.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The third B&B of the week is the Fairfax Hotel in Skegness, where owner Kath Milward makes an early departure after a subdued dinner fails to wow her guests. Things do not look up for the hostess when Denise and Heather Walker discover something in their toilet, and Tom and Angela Jones decide to go on the hunt for a new room.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Chris and Sally Brealey welcome the contestants to the Wolds Village guest house in Bainton, East Yorkshire, where they will stay in themed rooms, but Kath Milward is not impressed with the gothic decor. The hosts organise an afternoon of mosaic-making, pitting Denise Walker against her artistic daughter Heather, and their breakfast gets the guests' approval. However, at feedback time some criticism comes as a shock.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The B&B owners settle some scores and discover how much they have been paid, before the winner is revealed. Denise and Heather Walker from Albany Street tackle what they feel are unfair comments over the comfort of one of their beds, while Tom and Angela Jones of the Highland Guest House apologise for the lingering paint smells during Chris and Sally Brealey's time at their hotel. Kath Milward from the Fairfax Hotel discusses her low hosting scores from the other owners and accuses them of not being sympathetic, and Chris and Sally Brealey of Wolds Village challenge a complaint about bed size.(n)

programme.title: Fifteen to One
programme.desc: Sandi Toksvig hosts the general knowledge quiz, in which 15 contestants are pitted against one another in the hope of securing a place in the end-of-series final when a £40,000 jackpot will be up for grabs.(n)

programme.title: Countdown
programme.desc: Nick Hewer and Rachel Riley present the words-and-numbers game, with ex-tennis star Greg Rusedski in Dictionary Corner with Susie Dent.(n)

programme.title: Couples Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Three couples from the north Kent coast compete, with engaged Emma and Craig kicking things off with their menu of simple fare, but the starter isn't popular and there are issues with the dessert. Darren and Dan are next up and their food goes down a storm, while well-to-do Edward and Catherine conclude proceedings, hoping to impress with their grand house and fine dining. Who will take home the £1,000 prize money?.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition begins at Alston House in Cumbria, where owners Michael and Carole Allchorne are brimming with confidence, but Yvonne Copeland and Gail Wells are less than impressed with the decor. The guests are impressed with chef Michael's breakfast, but the hosts are left reeling by the criticisms levelled at their hotel during the feedback session.(n)

programme.title: Shipping Wars UK
programme.desc: Part-time wrestler and van driver Phil wins the bid to transport six boxes of live crayfish, while Shahbaz's load is two grand pianos worth thousands.(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Homer discovers a talent for styling hair and opens a salon that becomes very popular, but begins to feel his gift is a curse as he must listen to people's problems and gossip. Meanwhile, Milhouse decides to live each day to the fullest and professes his love for Lisa - only to have his heart broken.(n)

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: Sienna and Ben prepare to get married, and Nico volunteers to be `best man' at the ceremony. Meanwhile, Ste is worried when he gets a text from the hospital, Harry asks for James's help, and Tony panics about the re-launch of The Hutch.(n)

programme.title: Channel 4 News
programme.desc: Including sport and weather.(n)

programme.title: Eating Well with Hemsley + Hemsley
programme.desc: New series. Sisters Jasmine and Melissa Hemsley take healthy eating to innovative new levels, showcasing fun and delicious recipes that are packed with flavour, but free from grains, gluten and refined sugar. In the first episode, they prepare dishes for when friends come round for dinner, including huevos rancheros with guacamole, slow-cooked lamb with anchovies, and a chocolate dessert that's free from refined sugar.(n)

programme.title: Food Unwrapped
programme.desc: The programme returns with reports on more unusual, intriguing and surprising secrets behind food. Jimmy Doherty heads off to Israel on the trail of the fresh date, with his search taking him to a vast water purification plant where the raw sewage of Tel Aviv is used to turn barren desert into fertile farmland. Kate Quilton is in Belfast to meet a sausage-maker whose sales suffered in the wake of the recent World Health Organisation report linking processed meat to cancer, while Matt Tebbutt is in Kent, where experts have perfected the science of growing apples.(n)

programme.title: What Britain Buys
programme.desc: A look at how Britons shop, which products they buy and what the £6.7bn spent a week says about the nation today. Mary Portas meets the high-street buyers, trend forecasters, celebrity endorsers and the public to discover what's flying off the shelves and what's not shifting.(n)

programme.title: Very British Problems
programme.desc: Celebrities including James Corden, Jack Whitehall, David Tennant and Catherine Tate offer their observations on Brits at school. Topics up for discussion include sex education classes, the horror of mouldy PE kits, and how the UK became a nation of binge drinkers. Julie Walters narrates.(n)

programme.title: Random Acts
programme.desc: Eric Wareheim showcases creative short films from the worlds of avant-garde visual art, music video, animation, contemporary dance and spoken word among others. The first edition features an apocalyptic vision from artists Jake and Dinos Chapman, poet Hollie McNish's take on breastfeeding in public, a small explosion of psychedelic claymation, and a mesmeric art film by Ursula Mayer.(n)

programme.title: 24 Hours in Police Custody
programme.desc: Cameras follows officers from Bedfordshire Police as Tommy Robinson, the founder of the English Defence League, is held in Luton police station following a vicious assault on a Muslim man. They also help a Muslim woman seeking protection from her husband, who is threatening to take her to Syria against her will.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: The chef travels to La Grange, a suburb of Chicago, to help the owners of Cafe 36, an upmarket bistro threatening to destroy the marriage of its owners due to the scale of their financial losses. The head chef's attitude to quality control is driving customers away, and it is up to Gordon Ramsay to turn the business around.(n)

programme.title: Alan Carr: Chatty Man
programme.desc: Game of Thrones actress Maisie Williams (Arya Stark) reveals what she can about the new series, Anna Friel discusses ITV drama Marcella and Nick Grimshaw talks about Radio 1's Big Weekend at the end of the month. Music is provided by Canadian singer Alessia Cara, performing her new single Here. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: The World's Most Extreme
programme.desc: The series visiting exciting places around the globe takes a look at the 10 most extreme bridges. Electricians at New York's George Washington Bridge are seen changing light bulbs some 60 storeys above ground level, while Bolivian farmers use zip wires to transport their harvest of coca leaves across steep jungle valleys. In Russia, there's a wooden bridge that requires nerves of steel to cross, and thrill-seekers in southern France are filmed base-jumping from the Millau Viaduct, the world's highest bridge.(n)

programme.title: Four Rooms
programme.desc: A 16th-century silver figure, a rare processional cross and a dress worn by a Lady Gaga waxwork are among the items offered to dealers Alex Proud, Gordon Watson, Celia Sawyer and Johnny Elichaoff as members of the public try to sell their collectibles for potentially life-changing sums of money. Presented by Anita Rani.(n)

programme.title: Kirstie's Handmade Treasures
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp learns how to create a flower arrangement for the petite category at the Royal Cornwall Show, under the instruction of master florist Sioned Rowlands.(n)

programme.title: Supershoppers
programme.desc: Andi Osho and Anna Richardson present a consumer advice show that puts products to the test and gives viewers the inside scoop on Britain's biggest brands and retailers. They begin by revealing how to pay less for a holiday, finding out how a £20 waterproof from a supermarket compares with a £155 jacket from a leading manufacturer and checking out a range of hairdryers.(n)

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer help two families in the south-east of England struggling to find new homes. Paul and Stephanie's house is bursting at the seams as the couple try to run three businesses and bring up three boys in the property, while Noni and partner George relocated to her mother's spare bedroom after the arrival of their first child and have been searching for their own place for six months.(n)

programme.title: Countdown
programme.desc: Nick Hewer and Rachel Riley present the words-and-numbers game, with ex-tennis star Greg Rusedski in Dictionary Corner with Susie Dent.(n)

programme.title: Will & Grace
programme.desc: Will finds it hard to break up with a boyfriend because he likes his dog, and Karen resolves to stop Grace falling for her nephew. Comedy, starring Eric McCormack and Debra Messing.(n)

programme.title: Will & Grace
programme.sub-title: Poker? I Don't Even Like Her.
programme.desc: Will's friends urge him to tell Grace she cannot play poker with them any more, so she hatches a plan for one last big game. Karen convinces an acquaintance to be a guinea pig for the new shoulder implants she is considering.(n)

programme.title: Everybody Loves Raymond
programme.desc: Part two of two. Robert and Amy finally get married in the Barone family tradition. Brad Garrett and Monica Horan star.(n)

programme.title: Everybody Loves Raymond
programme.desc: Debra complains she and Ray do not have any fun together - and persuades him to let her join him in his game of golf. Ray Romano and Patricia Heaton star.(n)

programme.title: Everybody Loves Raymond
programme.desc: Marie tries to gain the upper hand in her relationship with new daughter-in-law Amy, but Debra is determined the latest Barone wife will not endure the kind of interference she has had to put up with.(n)

programme.title: Frasier
programme.desc: Niles and Frasier throw a singles party and end up chasing the same woman - but Roz steals the whole show. Comedy, starring Kelsey Grammer, David Hyde Pierce and Peri Gilpin.(n)

programme.title: Frasier
programme.desc: A broken Swiss watch, car trouble, a birthday surprise and a party thrown by Niles's latest lover all combine to ruin Frasier's chances of romance with an attractive new acquaintance. With Kelsey Grammer and Lisa Waltz.(n)

programme.title: Frasier
programme.desc: The radio psychiatrist is outraged when Kenny orders him to read adverts for a new sponsor on air, and rallies his fellow presenters to stage a protest. Kelsey Grammer stars.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay heads for the Grasshopper Also in Carlstadt, New Jersey, a family-owned Irish restaurant. There, he lends a helping hand to Mitch Sandler, who has been struggling to live up to the expectations of his father-in-law since he invested heavily in the business. The chef also tries to improve the presentation of dishes emerging from the kitchen.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition begins at Langsmeade House in Thame, Oxfordshire, where Dutch-born owner Marianne Abben and her housekeeper Fran Birch hope to demonstrate that their B&B offers the best value for money. The quirky pair's hosting style proves a hit with some of their guests, before others reveal their competitive side during a Charleston dance lesson.(n)

programme.title: Channel 4 News Summary
programme.desc: Includes news headlines and weather.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The owners visit the Stratford House Guesthouse in Stratford-upon-Avon on their second outing, where couple Natasha and Dai Pollock hope to impress their peers. But things do not run smoothly, as the guests are left unimpressed with the decor and discover nasty surprises in some of the drawers.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The third B&B of the week is pet-friendly Edmund House in Deal, Kent, where owner Michael Prime is joined by his mum Lorna. On arrival, Marianne Abben and Fran Birch love the seaside-inspired room, but entrepreneur Mark Genders is far from thrilled by the `no frills' experience. Over dinner, tensions run high after self-confessed trouble-maker Marianne asks Mark to reveal which of the group he would and would not employ, and Lorna gets short shrift when she puts forward her application.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Entrepreneur Mark Genders welcomes the contestants to the Five Bells Pub in Berkshire and hopes they will approve of his small but perfectly formed rooms. He organises an ale-tasting activity, although it fails to please all of his guests. Michael and Lorna admit they have seen a new side of Mark - however, will it affect their feedback?.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The B&B owners settle some scores and discover how much they have been paid, before the winner is revealed. Marianne and Fran from Langsmeade House begin by explaining that their worn rug is in fact a 200-year-old antique, Natasha and Dal from Stratford House confront Michael and Lorna about their strong language and cleaning techniques, while Mark Genders compares his experience at Edmund House to flying with a low budget airline.(n)

programme.title: Fifteen to One
programme.desc: Sandi Toksvig hosts the general knowledge quiz, in which 15 contestants are pitted against one another in the hope of securing a place in the end-of-series final when a £40,000 jackpot will be up for grabs.(n)

programme.title: Countdown
programme.desc: Nick Hewer and Rachel Riley present the words-and-numbers game, with ex-tennis star Greg Rusedski in Dictionary Corner with Susie Dent.(n)

programme.title: Couples Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Boat-dwelling Steven kicks off the competition in East Anglia, accompanied by his partner of 10 years, Lisa, with a Sunday lunch-inspired roast dinner with a fresh fish starter. Day two sees self-confessed snob Justine and partner Ben bring some class to the competition with an Italian themed evening. Finally it's the turn of Rosa and Darren who outsource all their ingredients from Spain.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit of the week is to Scotia House in Harrogate, where host Marie Lock is hoping her obsessive cleaning regime will give her the edge in the competition. In the rooms, both Michael and Carole and Yvonne and Gail find the deluxe teddy bears freaky, and for Billy and Billy, things are a little on the cosy side. In the afternoon, Marie's keen to show off her moves and pits her guests against each other in a Northern Soul dance off.(n)

programme.title: Shipping Wars UK
programme.desc: Russell must transport a motor rickshaw worth £10,000 from Axminster in Devon to Hamilton, Scotland. In London, Shahbaz must somehow load up a second grand piano.(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Lisa gets her hands on a collection of keys to every door in Springfield, and soon uncovers a hidden classroom beneath the school, telling Principal Skinner about her discovery. He confiscates the key from her, but she remains determined to investigate the mysterious room.(n)

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: After Harry shows him the engraving on the floor of the shack, Ste confronts Cameron about why there is no record on his phone of his call to Lockie yesterday. Meanwhile, James is unsettled by his mother's latest tactics, while Alfie arrives at the Boarding House to help Jade with her French homework.(n)

programme.title: Channel 4 News
programme.desc: Including sport and weather.(n)

programme.title: Sun, Sea and Supersavers
programme.desc: Bargain hunters go head to head to see who can get the best value for their holiday. They include professionals Ashleigh Swan and Jenny Drew, who attempt to find the cheapest weekend break in Great Yarmouth, while two amateur money saving families battle it out in Mallorca, where a five night stay in May half term can cost £2,500 for a family of four.(n)

programme.title: How to Get a Council House
programme.desc: The return of the programme that goes behind the scenes with council housing officers, this time in the London borough of Hounslow. Beverley has fallen behind with her rent and is facing eviction along with her 21-year-old son Zane, who has epilepsy, while Shane is living at his mother's with his three children and wants a home of his own, but a turn of events forces the council's hand when the case becomes more complex.(n)

programme.title: Children on the Frontline: The Escape
programme.desc: Documentary following the fortunes of a Syrian family over four years, from the ruins of their life in Aleppo to beginning new lives as refugees in Germany. Set against the backdrop of the biggest refugee crisis since the Second World War, the story is told by three sisters and their brother.(n)

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: A five-year-old is rushed into St George's struggling to breathe, and her mum reveals how she has spent months in Great Ormond Street Hospital after being diagnosed with a rare form of juvenile arthritis. Meanwhile, an 83-year-old man in a confused state arrives in A&E after falling over, and as doctors carry out tests and a CT scan, his wife helps them understand the reason behind his confusion. Plus, a twelve-year-old girl must be brave as she undergoes treatment for a nasty cut on her leg.(n)

programme.title: Four Rooms
programme.desc: A rare printer's chest, a telegram about the sinking of the Titanic, a collection of Elton John's suits and a Thomas Weaver painting are among the items offered to dealers Shaun Clarkson, Tom Bolt, Wendy Meakin and Maurice Amdur, as members of the public try to sell their valuables for potentially life-changing sums of money. Anita Rani presents.(n)

programme.title: The King of Queens
programme.desc: Doug encourages Carrie to go on a date with the policeman who gave her a speeding ticket, hoping he will drop the charges and prevent their car insurance from increasing. Comedy, starring Kevin James.(n)

programme.title: Will & Grace
programme.desc: Will is unimpressed when Matt pretends they are brothers in front of his bosses, and Karen is shocked to learn Stan has been persuaded to bequeath a third of his money to charity. With Eric McCormack and Patrick Dempsey.(n)

programme.title: Will & Grace
programme.desc: An old car left to Grace by her late uncle causes sentimental problems when a nun wishes to buy it. Jack is given the impression his absent father is African-American, while Rosario goes to work for a wealthy friend of Karen's in secret. Ellen DeGeneres guest stars.(n)

programme.title: Will & Grace
programme.desc: Will thinks his dad is in town to visit him, but Grace spots him on the arm of a beautiful woman and seeks Karen's advice on the matter, unwittingly convincing her that Stan is seeing someone else. American sitcom, guest starring Sydney Pollack, with Eric McCormack and Debra Messing.(n)

programme.title: Everybody Loves Raymond
programme.desc: When Robert asks if he can borrow the suitcase sitting on the stairway landing, Ray explains he and Debra have been locked in a two-week battle of wills over who is responsible for putting the item away. Ray Romano and Brad Garrett star.(n)

programme.title: Everybody Loves Raymond
programme.desc: Debra and Marie shame Ray into giving Robert a second bachelor party to make up for his disappointing first attempt.(n)

programme.title: Everybody Loves Raymond
programme.desc: Part one of two. Robert and Amy prepare to tie the knot in a classic Barone family wedding ceremony - but the groom becomes suspicious when his future brother-in-law Peter tries to make peace with both him and Ray. Comedy, starring Ray Romano and Brad Garrett.(n)

programme.title: Frasier
programme.desc: The radio psychiatrist dates a beautiful woman, but drives everyone crazy when he begins to feel insecure about his own looks. Comedy, starring Kelsey Grammer.(n)

programme.title: Frasier
programme.desc: Niles tries to ask Daphne for a date but she misunderstands his intentions, and Frasier has a frustrating episode of his own. Comedy, starring Kelsey Grammer, David Hyde Pierce and Jane Leeves.(n)

programme.title: Frasier
programme.desc: The number of large noses in Rick's family causes concern for Roz as she thinks about what her baby will look like. Comedy, starring Kelsey Grammer and Peri Gilpin.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay visits Down City, a restaurant in Providence, Rhode Island. The no-nonsense chef struggles to persuade hot-headed owner Abby to make his suggested changes, and a confrontation results in him being thrown out of the building in the middle of a dinner service. The eatery's co-owner and financier begs Gordon to return, but his success hinges on his ability to win Abby over.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition begins at 20 Albany Street in Edinburgh, where mother-and-daughter duo Denise and Heather Walker hope their B&B will win over their fellow competitors. First impressions seem a success, with each of the guests happy with the high standards of the rooms, however one couple do not hesitate to comment on their poor night's sleep.(n)

programme.title: Channel 4 News Summary
programme.desc: Includes news headlines and weather.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The B&B owners visit the Highland Guesthouse in Callander, run by Tom and Angela Jones. The guests are impressed by the hotel's cleanliness on arrival, but not everyone enjoys a traditional Scottish dancing activity - or the morning bagpipes.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The third B&B of the week is the Fairfax Hotel in Skegness, where owner Kath Milward makes an early departure after a subdued dinner fails to wow her guests. Things do not look up for the hostess when Denise and Heather Walker discover something in their toilet, and Tom and Angela Jones decide to go on the hunt for a new room.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Chris and Sally Brealey welcome the contestants to the Wolds Village guest house in Bainton, East Yorkshire, where they will stay in themed rooms, but Kath Milward is not impressed with the gothic decor. The hosts organise an afternoon of mosaic-making, pitting Denise Walker against her artistic daughter Heather, and their breakfast gets the guests' approval. However, at feedback time some criticism comes as a shock.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The B&B owners settle some scores and discover how much they have been paid, before the winner is revealed. Denise and Heather Walker from Albany Street tackle what they feel are unfair comments over the comfort of one of their beds, while Tom and Angela Jones of the Highland Guest House apologise for the lingering paint smells during Chris and Sally Brealey's time at their hotel. Kath Milward from the Fairfax Hotel discusses her low hosting scores from the other owners and accuses them of not being sympathetic, and Chris and Sally Brealey of Wolds Village challenge a complaint about bed size.(n)

programme.title: Fifteen to One
programme.desc: Sandi Toksvig hosts the general knowledge quiz, in which 15 contestants are pitted against one another in the hope of securing a place in the end-of-series final when a £40,000 jackpot will be up for grabs.(n)

programme.title: Countdown
programme.desc: Nick Hewer and Rachel Riley present the words-and-numbers game, with ex-tennis star Greg Rusedski in Dictionary Corner with Susie Dent.(n)

programme.title: Couples Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Three couples from the north Kent coast compete, with engaged Emma and Craig kicking things off with their menu of simple fare, but the starter isn't popular and there are issues with the dessert. Darren and Dan are next up and their food goes down a storm, while well-to-do Edward and Catherine conclude proceedings, hoping to impress with their grand house and fine dining. Who will take home the £1,000 prize money?.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition begins at Alston House in Cumbria, where owners Michael and Carole Allchorne are brimming with confidence, but Yvonne Copeland and Gail Wells are less than impressed with the decor. The guests are impressed with chef Michael's breakfast, but the hosts are left reeling by the criticisms levelled at their hotel during the feedback session.(n)

programme.title: Shipping Wars UK
programme.desc: Part-time wrestler and van driver Phil wins the bid to transport six boxes of live crayfish, while Shahbaz's load is two grand pianos worth thousands.(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Homer discovers a talent for styling hair and opens a salon that becomes very popular, but begins to feel his gift is a curse as he must listen to people's problems and gossip. Meanwhile, Milhouse decides to live each day to the fullest and professes his love for Lisa - only to have his heart broken.(n)

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: Sienna and Ben prepare to get married, and Nico volunteers to be `best man' at the ceremony. Meanwhile, Ste is worried when he gets a text from the hospital, Harry asks for James's help, and Tony panics about the re-launch of The Hutch.(n)

programme.title: Channel 4 News
programme.desc: Including sport and weather.(n)

programme.title: Eating Well with Hemsley + Hemsley
programme.desc: New series. Sisters Jasmine and Melissa Hemsley take healthy eating to innovative new levels, showcasing fun and delicious recipes that are packed with flavour, but free from grains, gluten and refined sugar. In the first episode, they prepare dishes for when friends come round for dinner, including huevos rancheros with guacamole, slow-cooked lamb with anchovies, and a chocolate dessert that's free from refined sugar.(n)

programme.title: Food Unwrapped
programme.desc: The programme returns with reports on more unusual, intriguing and surprising secrets behind food. Jimmy Doherty heads off to Israel on the trail of the fresh date, with his search taking him to a vast water purification plant where the raw sewage of Tel Aviv is used to turn barren desert into fertile farmland. Kate Quilton is in Belfast to meet a sausage-maker whose sales suffered in the wake of the recent World Health Organisation report linking processed meat to cancer, while Matt Tebbutt is in Kent, where experts have perfected the science of growing apples.(n)

programme.title: What Britain Buys
programme.desc: A look at how Britons shop, which products they buy and what the £6.7bn spent a week says about the nation today. Mary Portas meets the high-street buyers, trend forecasters, celebrity endorsers and the public to discover what's flying off the shelves and what's not shifting.(n)

programme.title: Very British Problems
programme.desc: Celebrities including James Corden, Jack Whitehall, David Tennant and Catherine Tate offer their observations on Brits at school. Topics up for discussion include sex education classes, the horror of mouldy PE kits, and how the UK became a nation of binge drinkers. Julie Walters narrates.(n)

programme.title: Random Acts
programme.desc: Eric Wareheim showcases creative short films from the worlds of avant-garde visual art, music video, animation, contemporary dance and spoken word among others. The first edition features an apocalyptic vision from artists Jake and Dinos Chapman, poet Hollie McNish's take on breastfeeding in public, a small explosion of psychedelic claymation, and a mesmeric art film by Ursula Mayer.(n)

programme.title: 24 Hours in Police Custody
programme.desc: Cameras follows officers from Bedfordshire Police as Tommy Robinson, the founder of the English Defence League, is held in Luton police station following a vicious assault on a Muslim man. They also help a Muslim woman seeking protection from her husband, who is threatening to take her to Syria against her will.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: The chef travels to La Grange, a suburb of Chicago, to help the owners of Cafe 36, an upmarket bistro threatening to destroy the marriage of its owners due to the scale of their financial losses. The head chef's attitude to quality control is driving customers away, and it is up to Gordon Ramsay to turn the business around.(n)

programme.title: Alan Carr: Chatty Man
programme.desc: Game of Thrones actress Maisie Williams (Arya Stark) reveals what she can about the new series, Anna Friel discusses ITV drama Marcella and Nick Grimshaw talks about Radio 1's Big Weekend at the end of the month. Music is provided by Canadian singer Alessia Cara, performing her new single Here. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: The World's Most Extreme
programme.desc: The series visiting exciting places around the globe takes a look at the 10 most extreme bridges. Electricians at New York's George Washington Bridge are seen changing light bulbs some 60 storeys above ground level, while Bolivian farmers use zip wires to transport their harvest of coca leaves across steep jungle valleys. In Russia, there's a wooden bridge that requires nerves of steel to cross, and thrill-seekers in southern France are filmed base-jumping from the Millau Viaduct, the world's highest bridge.(n)

programme.title: Four Rooms
programme.desc: A 16th-century silver figure, a rare processional cross and a dress worn by a Lady Gaga waxwork are among the items offered to dealers Alex Proud, Gordon Watson, Celia Sawyer and Johnny Elichaoff as members of the public try to sell their collectibles for potentially life-changing sums of money. Presented by Anita Rani.(n)

programme.title: Kirstie's Handmade Treasures
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp learns how to create a flower arrangement for the petite category at the Royal Cornwall Show, under the instruction of master florist Sioned Rowlands.(n)

programme.title: Supershoppers
programme.desc: Andi Osho and Anna Richardson present a consumer advice show that puts products to the test and gives viewers the inside scoop on Britain's biggest brands and retailers. They begin by revealing how to pay less for a holiday, finding out how a £20 waterproof from a supermarket compares with a £155 jacket from a leading manufacturer and checking out a range of hairdryers.(n)

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer help two families in the south-east of England struggling to find new homes. Paul and Stephanie's house is bursting at the seams as the couple try to run three businesses and bring up three boys in the property, while Noni and partner George relocated to her mother's spare bedroom after the arrival of their first child and have been searching for their own place for six months.(n)

programme.title: Countdown
programme.desc: Nick Hewer and Rachel Riley present the words-and-numbers game, with ex-tennis star Greg Rusedski in Dictionary Corner with Susie Dent.(n)

programme.title: Will & Grace
programme.desc: Will finds it hard to break up with a boyfriend because he likes his dog, and Karen resolves to stop Grace falling for her nephew. Comedy, starring Eric McCormack and Debra Messing.(n)

programme.title: Will & Grace
programme.sub-title: Poker? I Don't Even Like Her.
programme.desc: Will's friends urge him to tell Grace she cannot play poker with them any more, so she hatches a plan for one last big game. Karen convinces an acquaintance to be a guinea pig for the new shoulder implants she is considering.(n)

programme.title: Everybody Loves Raymond
programme.desc: Part two of two. Robert and Amy finally get married in the Barone family tradition. Brad Garrett and Monica Horan star.(n)

programme.title: Everybody Loves Raymond
programme.desc: Debra complains she and Ray do not have any fun together - and persuades him to let her join him in his game of golf. Ray Romano and Patricia Heaton star.(n)

programme.title: Everybody Loves Raymond
programme.desc: Marie tries to gain the upper hand in her relationship with new daughter-in-law Amy, but Debra is determined the latest Barone wife will not endure the kind of interference she has had to put up with.(n)

programme.title: Frasier
programme.desc: Niles and Frasier throw a singles party and end up chasing the same woman - but Roz steals the whole show. Comedy, starring Kelsey Grammer, David Hyde Pierce and Peri Gilpin.(n)

programme.title: Frasier
programme.desc: A broken Swiss watch, car trouble, a birthday surprise and a party thrown by Niles's latest lover all combine to ruin Frasier's chances of romance with an attractive new acquaintance. With Kelsey Grammer and Lisa Waltz.(n)

programme.title: Frasier
programme.desc: The radio psychiatrist is outraged when Kenny orders him to read adverts for a new sponsor on air, and rallies his fellow presenters to stage a protest. Kelsey Grammer stars.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay heads for the Grasshopper Also in Carlstadt, New Jersey, a family-owned Irish restaurant. There, he lends a helping hand to Mitch Sandler, who has been struggling to live up to the expectations of his father-in-law since he invested heavily in the business. The chef also tries to improve the presentation of dishes emerging from the kitchen.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition begins at Langsmeade House in Thame, Oxfordshire, where Dutch-born owner Marianne Abben and her housekeeper Fran Birch hope to demonstrate that their B&B offers the best value for money. The quirky pair's hosting style proves a hit with some of their guests, before others reveal their competitive side during a Charleston dance lesson.(n)

programme.title: Channel 4 News Summary
programme.desc: Includes news headlines and weather.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The owners visit the Stratford House Guesthouse in Stratford-upon-Avon on their second outing, where couple Natasha and Dai Pollock hope to impress their peers. But things do not run smoothly, as the guests are left unimpressed with the decor and discover nasty surprises in some of the drawers.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The third B&B of the week is pet-friendly Edmund House in Deal, Kent, where owner Michael Prime is joined by his mum Lorna. On arrival, Marianne Abben and Fran Birch love the seaside-inspired room, but entrepreneur Mark Genders is far from thrilled by the `no frills' experience. Over dinner, tensions run high after self-confessed trouble-maker Marianne asks Mark to reveal which of the group he would and would not employ, and Lorna gets short shrift when she puts forward her application.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Entrepreneur Mark Genders welcomes the contestants to the Five Bells Pub in Berkshire and hopes they will approve of his small but perfectly formed rooms. He organises an ale-tasting activity, although it fails to please all of his guests. Michael and Lorna admit they have seen a new side of Mark - however, will it affect their feedback?.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The B&B owners settle some scores and discover how much they have been paid, before the winner is revealed. Marianne and Fran from Langsmeade House begin by explaining that their worn rug is in fact a 200-year-old antique, Natasha and Dal from Stratford House confront Michael and Lorna about their strong language and cleaning techniques, while Mark Genders compares his experience at Edmund House to flying with a low budget airline.(n)

programme.title: Fifteen to One
programme.desc: Sandi Toksvig hosts the general knowledge quiz, in which 15 contestants are pitted against one another in the hope of securing a place in the end-of-series final when a £40,000 jackpot will be up for grabs.(n)

programme.title: Countdown
programme.desc: Nick Hewer and Rachel Riley present the words-and-numbers game, with ex-tennis star Greg Rusedski in Dictionary Corner with Susie Dent.(n)

programme.title: Couples Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Boat-dwelling Steven kicks off the competition in East Anglia, accompanied by his partner of 10 years, Lisa, with a Sunday lunch-inspired roast dinner with a fresh fish starter. Day two sees self-confessed snob Justine and partner Ben bring some class to the competition with an Italian themed evening. Finally it's the turn of Rosa and Darren who outsource all their ingredients from Spain.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit of the week is to Scotia House in Harrogate, where host Marie Lock is hoping her obsessive cleaning regime will give her the edge in the competition. In the rooms, both Michael and Carole and Yvonne and Gail find the deluxe teddy bears freaky, and for Billy and Billy, things are a little on the cosy side. In the afternoon, Marie's keen to show off her moves and pits her guests against each other in a Northern Soul dance off.(n)

programme.title: Shipping Wars UK
programme.desc: Russell must transport a motor rickshaw worth £10,000 from Axminster in Devon to Hamilton, Scotland. In London, Shahbaz must somehow load up a second grand piano.(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Lisa gets her hands on a collection of keys to every door in Springfield, and soon uncovers a hidden classroom beneath the school, telling Principal Skinner about her discovery. He confiscates the key from her, but she remains determined to investigate the mysterious room.(n)

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: After Harry shows him the engraving on the floor of the shack, Ste confronts Cameron about why there is no record on his phone of his call to Lockie yesterday. Meanwhile, James is unsettled by his mother's latest tactics, while Alfie arrives at the Boarding House to help Jade with her French homework.(n)

programme.title: Channel 4 News
programme.desc: Including sport and weather.(n)

programme.title: Sun, Sea and Supersavers
programme.desc: Bargain hunters go head to head to see who can get the best value for their holiday. They include professionals Ashleigh Swan and Jenny Drew, who attempt to find the cheapest weekend break in Great Yarmouth, while two amateur money saving families battle it out in Mallorca, where a five night stay in May half term can cost £2,500 for a family of four.(n)

programme.title: How to Get a Council House
programme.desc: The return of the programme that goes behind the scenes with council housing officers, this time in the London borough of Hounslow. Beverley has fallen behind with her rent and is facing eviction along with her 21-year-old son Zane, who has epilepsy, while Shane is living at his mother's with his three children and wants a home of his own, but a turn of events forces the council's hand when the case becomes more complex.(n)

programme.title: Children on the Frontline: The Escape
programme.desc: Documentary following the fortunes of a Syrian family over four years, from the ruins of their life in Aleppo to beginning new lives as refugees in Germany. Set against the backdrop of the biggest refugee crisis since the Second World War, the story is told by three sisters and their brother.(n)

programme.title: The King of Queens
programme.desc: Doug encourages Carrie to go on a date with the policeman who gave her a speeding ticket, hoping he will drop the charges and prevent their car insurance from increasing. Comedy, starring Kevin James.(n)

programme.title: Will & Grace
programme.desc: Will is unimpressed when Matt pretends they are brothers in front of his bosses, and Karen is shocked to learn Stan has been persuaded to bequeath a third of his money to charity. With Eric McCormack and Patrick Dempsey.(n)

programme.title: Will & Grace
programme.desc: An old car left to Grace by her late uncle causes sentimental problems when a nun wishes to buy it. Jack is given the impression his absent father is African-American, while Rosario goes to work for a wealthy friend of Karen's in secret. Ellen DeGeneres guest stars.(n)

programme.title: Supershoppers
programme.desc: Andi Osho and Anna Richardson present a consumer advice show that puts products to the test and gives viewers the inside scoop on Britain's biggest brands and retailers. They begin by revealing how to pay less for a holiday, finding out how a £20 waterproof from a supermarket compares with a £155 jacket from a leading manufacturer and checking out a range of hairdryers.(n)

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer help two families in the south-east of England struggling to find new homes. Paul and Stephanie's house is bursting at the seams as the couple try to run three businesses and bring up three boys in the property, while Noni and partner George relocated to her mother's spare bedroom after the arrival of their first child and have been searching for their own place for six months.(n)

programme.title: Countdown
programme.desc: Nick Hewer and Rachel Riley present the words-and-numbers game, with ex-tennis star Greg Rusedski in Dictionary Corner with Susie Dent.(n)

programme.title: Will & Grace
programme.desc: Will finds it hard to break up with a boyfriend because he likes his dog, and Karen resolves to stop Grace falling for her nephew. Comedy, starring Eric McCormack and Debra Messing.(n)

programme.title: Will & Grace
programme.sub-title: Poker? I Don't Even Like Her.
programme.desc: Will's friends urge him to tell Grace she cannot play poker with them any more, so she hatches a plan for one last big game. Karen convinces an acquaintance to be a guinea pig for the new shoulder implants she is considering.(n)

programme.title: Everybody Loves Raymond
programme.desc: Part two of two. Robert and Amy finally get married in the Barone family tradition. Brad Garrett and Monica Horan star.(n)

programme.title: Everybody Loves Raymond
programme.desc: Debra complains she and Ray do not have any fun together - and persuades him to let her join him in his game of golf. Ray Romano and Patricia Heaton star.(n)

programme.title: Everybody Loves Raymond
programme.desc: Marie tries to gain the upper hand in her relationship with new daughter-in-law Amy, but Debra is determined the latest Barone wife will not endure the kind of interference she has had to put up with.(n)

programme.title: Frasier
programme.desc: Niles and Frasier throw a singles party and end up chasing the same woman - but Roz steals the whole show. Comedy, starring Kelsey Grammer, David Hyde Pierce and Peri Gilpin.(n)

programme.title: Frasier
programme.desc: A broken Swiss watch, car trouble, a birthday surprise and a party thrown by Niles's latest lover all combine to ruin Frasier's chances of romance with an attractive new acquaintance. With Kelsey Grammer and Lisa Waltz.(n)

programme.title: Frasier
programme.desc: The radio psychiatrist is outraged when Kenny orders him to read adverts for a new sponsor on air, and rallies his fellow presenters to stage a protest. Kelsey Grammer stars.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay heads for the Grasshopper Also in Carlstadt, New Jersey, a family-owned Irish restaurant. There, he lends a helping hand to Mitch Sandler, who has been struggling to live up to the expectations of his father-in-law since he invested heavily in the business. The chef also tries to improve the presentation of dishes emerging from the kitchen.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition begins at Langsmeade House in Thame, Oxfordshire, where Dutch-born owner Marianne Abben and her housekeeper Fran Birch hope to demonstrate that their B&B offers the best value for money. The quirky pair's hosting style proves a hit with some of their guests, before others reveal their competitive side during a Charleston dance lesson.(n)

programme.title: Channel 4 News Summary
programme.desc: Includes news headlines and weather.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The owners visit the Stratford House Guesthouse in Stratford-upon-Avon on their second outing, where couple Natasha and Dai Pollock hope to impress their peers. But things do not run smoothly, as the guests are left unimpressed with the decor and discover nasty surprises in some of the drawers.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The third B&B of the week is pet-friendly Edmund House in Deal, Kent, where owner Michael Prime is joined by his mum Lorna. On arrival, Marianne Abben and Fran Birch love the seaside-inspired room, but entrepreneur Mark Genders is far from thrilled by the `no frills' experience. Over dinner, tensions run high after self-confessed trouble-maker Marianne asks Mark to reveal which of the group he would and would not employ, and Lorna gets short shrift when she puts forward her application.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Entrepreneur Mark Genders welcomes the contestants to the Five Bells Pub in Berkshire and hopes they will approve of his small but perfectly formed rooms. He organises an ale-tasting activity, although it fails to please all of his guests. Michael and Lorna admit they have seen a new side of Mark - however, will it affect their feedback?.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The B&B owners settle some scores and discover how much they have been paid, before the winner is revealed. Marianne and Fran from Langsmeade House begin by explaining that their worn rug is in fact a 200-year-old antique, Natasha and Dal from Stratford House confront Michael and Lorna about their strong language and cleaning techniques, while Mark Genders compares his experience at Edmund House to flying with a low budget airline.(n)

programme.title: Fifteen to One
programme.desc: Sandi Toksvig hosts the general knowledge quiz, in which 15 contestants are pitted against one another in the hope of securing a place in the end-of-series final when a £40,000 jackpot will be up for grabs.(n)

programme.title: Countdown
programme.desc: Nick Hewer and Rachel Riley present the words-and-numbers game, with ex-tennis star Greg Rusedski in Dictionary Corner with Susie Dent.(n)

programme.title: Couples Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Boat-dwelling Steven kicks off the competition in East Anglia, accompanied by his partner of 10 years, Lisa, with a Sunday lunch-inspired roast dinner with a fresh fish starter. Day two sees self-confessed snob Justine and partner Ben bring some class to the competition with an Italian themed evening. Finally it's the turn of Rosa and Darren who outsource all their ingredients from Spain.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit of the week is to Scotia House in Harrogate, where host Marie Lock is hoping her obsessive cleaning regime will give her the edge in the competition. In the rooms, both Michael and Carole and Yvonne and Gail find the deluxe teddy bears freaky, and for Billy and Billy, things are a little on the cosy side. In the afternoon, Marie's keen to show off her moves and pits her guests against each other in a Northern Soul dance off.(n)

programme.title: Shipping Wars UK
programme.desc: Russell must transport a motor rickshaw worth £10,000 from Axminster in Devon to Hamilton, Scotland. In London, Shahbaz must somehow load up a second grand piano.(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Lisa gets her hands on a collection of keys to every door in Springfield, and soon uncovers a hidden classroom beneath the school, telling Principal Skinner about her discovery. He confiscates the key from her, but she remains determined to investigate the mysterious room.(n)

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: After Harry shows him the engraving on the floor of the shack, Ste confronts Cameron about why there is no record on his phone of his call to Lockie yesterday. Meanwhile, James is unsettled by his mother's latest tactics, while Alfie arrives at the Boarding House to help Jade with her French homework.(n)

programme.title: Channel 4 News
programme.desc: Including sport and weather.(n)

programme.title: Sun, Sea and Supersavers
programme.desc: Bargain hunters go head to head to see who can get the best value for their holiday. They include professionals Ashleigh Swan and Jenny Drew, who attempt to find the cheapest weekend break in Great Yarmouth, while two amateur money saving families battle it out in Mallorca, where a five night stay in May half term can cost £2,500 for a family of four.(n)

programme.title: How to Get a Council House
programme.desc: The return of the programme that goes behind the scenes with council housing officers, this time in the London borough of Hounslow. Beverley has fallen behind with her rent and is facing eviction along with her 21-year-old son Zane, who has epilepsy, while Shane is living at his mother's with his three children and wants a home of his own, but a turn of events forces the council's hand when the case becomes more complex.(n)

programme.title: Children on the Frontline: The Escape
programme.desc: Documentary following the fortunes of a Syrian family over four years, from the ruins of their life in Aleppo to beginning new lives as refugees in Germany. Set against the backdrop of the biggest refugee crisis since the Second World War, the story is told by three sisters and their brother.(n)

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: A five-year-old is rushed into St George's struggling to breathe, and her mum reveals how she has spent months in Great Ormond Street Hospital after being diagnosed with a rare form of juvenile arthritis. Meanwhile, an 83-year-old man in a confused state arrives in A&E after falling over, and as doctors carry out tests and a CT scan, his wife helps them understand the reason behind his confusion. Plus, a twelve-year-old girl must be brave as she undergoes treatment for a nasty cut on her leg.(n)

programme.title: Four Rooms
programme.desc: A rare printer's chest, a telegram about the sinking of the Titanic, a collection of Elton John's suits and a Thomas Weaver painting are among the items offered to dealers Shaun Clarkson, Tom Bolt, Wendy Meakin and Maurice Amdur, as members of the public try to sell their valuables for potentially life-changing sums of money. Anita Rani presents.(n)

programme.title: The King of Queens
programme.desc: Doug encourages Carrie to go on a date with the policeman who gave her a speeding ticket, hoping he will drop the charges and prevent their car insurance from increasing. Comedy, starring Kevin James.(n)

programme.title: Will & Grace
programme.desc: Will is unimpressed when Matt pretends they are brothers in front of his bosses, and Karen is shocked to learn Stan has been persuaded to bequeath a third of his money to charity. With Eric McCormack and Patrick Dempsey.(n)

programme.title: Will & Grace
programme.desc: An old car left to Grace by her late uncle causes sentimental problems when a nun wishes to buy it. Jack is given the impression his absent father is African-American, while Rosario goes to work for a wealthy friend of Karen's in secret. Ellen DeGeneres guest stars.(n)

programme.title: Will & Grace
programme.desc: Will thinks his dad is in town to visit him, but Grace spots him on the arm of a beautiful woman and seeks Karen's advice on the matter, unwittingly convincing her that Stan is seeing someone else. American sitcom, guest starring Sydney Pollack, with Eric McCormack and Debra Messing.(n)

programme.title: Everybody Loves Raymond
programme.desc: When Robert asks if he can borrow the suitcase sitting on the stairway landing, Ray explains he and Debra have been locked in a two-week battle of wills over who is responsible for putting the item away. Ray Romano and Brad Garrett star.(n)

programme.title: Everybody Loves Raymond
programme.desc: Debra and Marie shame Ray into giving Robert a second bachelor party to make up for his disappointing first attempt.(n)

programme.title: Everybody Loves Raymond
programme.desc: Part one of two. Robert and Amy prepare to tie the knot in a classic Barone family wedding ceremony - but the groom becomes suspicious when his future brother-in-law Peter tries to make peace with both him and Ray. Comedy, starring Ray Romano and Brad Garrett.(n)

programme.title: Frasier
programme.desc: The radio psychiatrist dates a beautiful woman, but drives everyone crazy when he begins to feel insecure about his own looks. Comedy, starring Kelsey Grammer.(n)

programme.title: Frasier
programme.desc: Niles tries to ask Daphne for a date but she misunderstands his intentions, and Frasier has a frustrating episode of his own. Comedy, starring Kelsey Grammer, David Hyde Pierce and Jane Leeves.(n)

programme.title: Frasier
programme.desc: The number of large noses in Rick's family causes concern for Roz as she thinks about what her baby will look like. Comedy, starring Kelsey Grammer and Peri Gilpin.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay visits Down City, a restaurant in Providence, Rhode Island. The no-nonsense chef struggles to persuade hot-headed owner Abby to make his suggested changes, and a confrontation results in him being thrown out of the building in the middle of a dinner service. The eatery's co-owner and financier begs Gordon to return, but his success hinges on his ability to win Abby over.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition begins at 20 Albany Street in Edinburgh, where mother-and-daughter duo Denise and Heather Walker hope their B&B will win over their fellow competitors. First impressions seem a success, with each of the guests happy with the high standards of the rooms, however one couple do not hesitate to comment on their poor night's sleep.(n)

programme.title: Channel 4 News Summary
programme.desc: Includes news headlines and weather.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The B&B owners visit the Highland Guesthouse in Callander, run by Tom and Angela Jones. The guests are impressed by the hotel's cleanliness on arrival, but not everyone enjoys a traditional Scottish dancing activity - or the morning bagpipes.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The third B&B of the week is the Fairfax Hotel in Skegness, where owner Kath Milward makes an early departure after a subdued dinner fails to wow her guests. Things do not look up for the hostess when Denise and Heather Walker discover something in their toilet, and Tom and Angela Jones decide to go on the hunt for a new room.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Chris and Sally Brealey welcome the contestants to the Wolds Village guest house in Bainton, East Yorkshire, where they will stay in themed rooms, but Kath Milward is not impressed with the gothic decor. The hosts organise an afternoon of mosaic-making, pitting Denise Walker against her artistic daughter Heather, and their breakfast gets the guests' approval. However, at feedback time some criticism comes as a shock.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The B&B owners settle some scores and discover how much they have been paid, before the winner is revealed. Denise and Heather Walker from Albany Street tackle what they feel are unfair comments over the comfort of one of their beds, while Tom and Angela Jones of the Highland Guest House apologise for the lingering paint smells during Chris and Sally Brealey's time at their hotel. Kath Milward from the Fairfax Hotel discusses her low hosting scores from the other owners and accuses them of not being sympathetic, and Chris and Sally Brealey of Wolds Village challenge a complaint about bed size.(n)

programme.title: Fifteen to One
programme.desc: Sandi Toksvig hosts the general knowledge quiz, in which 15 contestants are pitted against one another in the hope of securing a place in the end-of-series final when a £40,000 jackpot will be up for grabs.(n)

programme.title: Countdown
programme.desc: Nick Hewer and Rachel Riley present the words-and-numbers game, with ex-tennis star Greg Rusedski in Dictionary Corner with Susie Dent.(n)

programme.title: Couples Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Three couples from the north Kent coast compete, with engaged Emma and Craig kicking things off with their menu of simple fare, but the starter isn't popular and there are issues with the dessert. Darren and Dan are next up and their food goes down a storm, while well-to-do Edward and Catherine conclude proceedings, hoping to impress with their grand house and fine dining. Who will take home the £1,000 prize money?.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition begins at Alston House in Cumbria, where owners Michael and Carole Allchorne are brimming with confidence, but Yvonne Copeland and Gail Wells are less than impressed with the decor. The guests are impressed with chef Michael's breakfast, but the hosts are left reeling by the criticisms levelled at their hotel during the feedback session.(n)

programme.title: Shipping Wars UK
programme.desc: Part-time wrestler and van driver Phil wins the bid to transport six boxes of live crayfish, while Shahbaz's load is two grand pianos worth thousands.(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Homer discovers a talent for styling hair and opens a salon that becomes very popular, but begins to feel his gift is a curse as he must listen to people's problems and gossip. Meanwhile, Milhouse decides to live each day to the fullest and professes his love for Lisa - only to have his heart broken.(n)

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: Sienna and Ben prepare to get married, and Nico volunteers to be `best man' at the ceremony. Meanwhile, Ste is worried when he gets a text from the hospital, Harry asks for James's help, and Tony panics about the re-launch of The Hutch.(n)

programme.title: Channel 4 News
programme.desc: Including sport and weather.(n)

programme.title: Eating Well with Hemsley + Hemsley
programme.desc: New series. Sisters Jasmine and Melissa Hemsley take healthy eating to innovative new levels, showcasing fun and delicious recipes that are packed with flavour, but free from grains, gluten and refined sugar. In the first episode, they prepare dishes for when friends come round for dinner, including huevos rancheros with guacamole, slow-cooked lamb with anchovies, and a chocolate dessert that's free from refined sugar.(n)

programme.title: Food Unwrapped
programme.desc: The programme returns with reports on more unusual, intriguing and surprising secrets behind food. Jimmy Doherty heads off to Israel on the trail of the fresh date, with his search taking him to a vast water purification plant where the raw sewage of Tel Aviv is used to turn barren desert into fertile farmland. Kate Quilton is in Belfast to meet a sausage-maker whose sales suffered in the wake of the recent World Health Organisation report linking processed meat to cancer, while Matt Tebbutt is in Kent, where experts have perfected the science of growing apples.(n)

programme.title: What Britain Buys
programme.desc: A look at how Britons shop, which products they buy and what the £6.7bn spent a week says about the nation today. Mary Portas meets the high-street buyers, trend forecasters, celebrity endorsers and the public to discover what's flying off the shelves and what's not shifting.(n)

programme.title: Very British Problems
programme.desc: Celebrities including James Corden, Jack Whitehall, David Tennant and Catherine Tate offer their observations on Brits at school. Topics up for discussion include sex education classes, the horror of mouldy PE kits, and how the UK became a nation of binge drinkers. Julie Walters narrates.(n)

programme.title: Random Acts
programme.desc: Eric Wareheim showcases creative short films from the worlds of avant-garde visual art, music video, animation, contemporary dance and spoken word among others. The first edition features an apocalyptic vision from artists Jake and Dinos Chapman, poet Hollie McNish's take on breastfeeding in public, a small explosion of psychedelic claymation, and a mesmeric art film by Ursula Mayer.(n)

programme.title: 24 Hours in Police Custody
programme.desc: Cameras follows officers from Bedfordshire Police as Tommy Robinson, the founder of the English Defence League, is held in Luton police station following a vicious assault on a Muslim man. They also help a Muslim woman seeking protection from her husband, who is threatening to take her to Syria against her will.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: The chef travels to La Grange, a suburb of Chicago, to help the owners of Cafe 36, an upmarket bistro threatening to destroy the marriage of its owners due to the scale of their financial losses. The head chef's attitude to quality control is driving customers away, and it is up to Gordon Ramsay to turn the business around.(n)

programme.title: Alan Carr: Chatty Man
programme.desc: Game of Thrones actress Maisie Williams (Arya Stark) reveals what she can about the new series, Anna Friel discusses ITV drama Marcella and Nick Grimshaw talks about Radio 1's Big Weekend at the end of the month. Music is provided by Canadian singer Alessia Cara, performing her new single Here. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: The World's Most Extreme
programme.desc: The series visiting exciting places around the globe takes a look at the 10 most extreme bridges. Electricians at New York's George Washington Bridge are seen changing light bulbs some 60 storeys above ground level, while Bolivian farmers use zip wires to transport their harvest of coca leaves across steep jungle valleys. In Russia, there's a wooden bridge that requires nerves of steel to cross, and thrill-seekers in southern France are filmed base-jumping from the Millau Viaduct, the world's highest bridge.(n)

programme.title: Four Rooms
programme.desc: A 16th-century silver figure, a rare processional cross and a dress worn by a Lady Gaga waxwork are among the items offered to dealers Alex Proud, Gordon Watson, Celia Sawyer and Johnny Elichaoff as members of the public try to sell their collectibles for potentially life-changing sums of money. Presented by Anita Rani.(n)

programme.desc: Chloe and Lil lose their ball during a game of tennis. When they go searching for it they meet a new friend who needs their help.(n)

programme.title: Lily's Driftwood Bay
programme.desc: Lily finds Delilah's winch handle washed up on the beach, and as a reward Salty gives Lily a ball, but when it gets soggy, Lily and Gull invent a new game - Splatball.(n)

programme.title: Fireman Sam

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The first instalment of a two-part crossover with NCIS: New Orleans sees the Washington, DC team co-operating with their colleagues from the Big Easy to investigate a spate of lethal poisonings on board a New Orleans-to-DC flight. All the evidence seems to point to missing chef Luca, who happens to be Abby's brother, so the two investigative services join forces to locate him, and find out why a private tech firm seems to have been targetted by the killer. Naval crime drama, guest starring Scott Bakula.(n)

programme.title: Two Wrongs
programme.desc: Nurse and single mother Sarah struggles to balance her work and home life, but her worst nightmare is realised when her daughter Lauren is abducted while walking home alone from school and she faces a moral dilemma if she is to save her child. Thriller, starring Gillian Zinser.(n)

programme.title: Deep-Sea Super Predator
programme.desc: Documentary about the search for a mysterious predator that is large enough to hunt down and devour a three-metre great white shark. Plus, a look at the discovery of a bizarre natural phenomenon that, for only a few short weeks each year, sees some of the ocean's most fearsome creatures behave in an unusually aggressive manner.(n)

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc: Kev and Pete pursue a runaway car into a pitch-black farmer's field, Jacko takes part in a major heroin bust, and rookie police dog Elsa chases a runaway burglar through the streets of Middlesbrough. Meanwhile, Andy deals with the aftermath of a pursuit with a sting in the tail.(n)

programme.title: The Tube: Going Underground
programme.desc: After two years of work, engineer Anita and her team are about to break through a concrete wall separating her new passenger tunnels from those of Crossrail, the giant east-west rail link being built across the capital. Meanwhile, the network takes delivery of 192 multimillion-pound trains, which are put through the `rattle test' before being pressed into service, while customer service assistant Stan prepares to say goodbye to the Underground after 35 years' service.(n)

programme.title: Gotham
programme.sub-title: Gotham: Wrath of the Villains: Into the Woods.
programme.desc: Gordon turns to Edward Nygma for help in analysing the tape recording of the call that incriminated him - not realising the forensic analyst is the one who set him up in the first place. Elsewhere, Bruce reconsiders his decision to live on the streets with catburglar Selina, while Cobblepot's abuse at the hands of his deceased father's family drives him closer to madness, and Dr Strange releases another supposedly reformed criminal.(n)

programme.title: Up Late with Rylan

programme.title: Castle
programme.desc: Terminally ill retired detective John Raglan arranges a rendezvous with Beckett, telling her he has evidence of foul play in the investigation into the murder of her mother Johanna, a leading civil rights attorney. programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: The concluding instalment of a two-part crossover with the original NCIS series sees Sebastian joining Abby Sciuto in Washington, DC to pick through the forensic evidence relating to the aircraft murders. Meanwhile, DC agent Ellie Bishop flies to New Orleans to help Pride and his team track down the chief suspect - Abby's brother Luca. Naval crime drama, guest starring Pauley Perrette.(n)

programme.title: A Date to Die For
programme.desc: A recent divorcee, suffering from bipolar disorder, accepts a date with a single father. The next morning, she awakens to find her date's dead body in her bed, a knife plunged in his chest. Trying to piece together her memories of the previous night, she sets out to defend her reputation and the lives of her family by locating the killer herself. Thriller, starring Victoria Pratt.(n)

programme.title: 5 News at 5
programme.desc: Sian Williams presents a round-up of the day's headlines from around the world.(n)

programme.title: Neighbours
programme.desc: Brad goes to the police with his suspicions, Paige discovers the identity of a mystery man seen in a photo with John, while Amy rejects Terese's proposal.(n)

programme.title: Home and Away

programme.title: 5 News Tonight
programme.desc: A round-up of the evening's headlines, including coverage of the latest national and international stories.(n)

programme.title: Ben Fogle: The Great African Migration
programme.desc: The adventurer and Dr Grant Hopcraft continue to follow the four collared female wildebeest. The pair witness the first stampeding attempt at a river crossing, before a second attempt occurs at the Mara's most dangerous stretch, famed for its brutal current. However, crocodiles prowl this strait in huge numbers and not all the creatures make it. Ben also sees the destruction crop farmers contend with due to the animals' movement, then joins the Mara Elephant project whose workers are trying to find a solution for this human-animal conflict.(n)

programme.title: The Yorkshire Vet
programme.desc: Julian Norton answers an emergency callout to a herd of alpacas, where client Jacki is concerned about a lump in the mouth of her beloved Mariella. Meanwhile, Julian's partner and former Herriot trainee, Peter Wright, tries to save the eyesight of Whisper, a two-day-old lamb, and new vet Helen Blackburn performs an emergency caesarean on beagle Gale.(n)

programme.title: Penguin A&E with Lorraine Kelly
programme.desc: The presenter meets employees at South Africa's busiest penguin emergency department. The hospital rescues more than 1,500 vulnerable penguins every year, and works 24/7 to rehabilitate them. In the first episode, vet Natasha is faced with a case involving a feisty penguin with a fish hook in its stomach. The team must use their expertise to save Bandit's life in an operation that no-one has attempted before.(n)

programme.title: Beaver Las Vegas: Saving The Strip
programme.desc: Despite attracting more than 40 million visitors a year, the city of Las Vegas in Nevada is in desperate danger of collapsing. Not for a want of money, but due to dwindling water resources. This documentary charts the efforts of a small team of eco-engineers who are trying to harness and adapt the methods of beavers to solve the problem of water shortages in North America's western states.(n)

programme.title: Up Late with Rylan
programme.desc: Rylan Clark-Neal hosts the chat show, featuring celebrity guests and music as well as games for the studio audience and the viewers at home.(n)

programme.title: Can't Pay? We'll Take It Away
programme.desc: Paul and Ben face a challenging eviction in London, where a vulnerable tenant in rent arrears has barricaded her front door, and the agents receive a tirade of abuse. Meanwhile, Brian and Del chase a debt of nearly £2,000 in Surrey, before trying to recover almost £3,000 in Northamptonshire. Finally, Steve and Ru head to Portsmouth to evict a young family for a landlord who wants her property back.(n)

programme.title: Great Artists
programme.desc: Art historian Tim Marlow profiles influential painter JMW Turner, who divided the critics with his rapid brush-strokes, treatment of light and tendency toward abstraction, but is now hailed as one of the great British artists.(n)

programme.title: Divine Designs
programme.desc: Paul Binski chronicles the history of Britain's religious art, examining the legacies of two wealthy industrialists of the 17th and 18th centuries who demonstrated a flamboyant taste for kitsch in the baroque forms of churches in Great Witley, Worcestershire, and London's Little Stanmore.(n)

programme.title: Ben Fogle: The Great African Migration
programme.desc: The adventurer and Dr Grant Hopcraft continue to follow the four collared female wildebeest. The pair witness the first stampeding attempt at a river crossing, before a second attempt occurs at the Mara's most dangerous stretch, famed for its brutal current. However, crocodiles prowl this strait in huge numbers and not all the creatures make it. Ben also sees the destruction crop farmers contend with due to the animals' movement, then joins the Mara Elephant project whose workers are trying to find a solution for this human-animal conflict.(n)

programme.title: The Yorkshire Vet
programme.desc: Julian Norton answers an emergency callout to a herd of alpacas, where client Jacki is concerned about a lump in the mouth of her beloved Mariella. Meanwhile, Julian's partner and former Herriot trainee, Peter Wright, tries to save the eyesight of Whisper, a two-day-old lamb, and new vet Helen Blackburn performs an emergency caesarean on beagle Gale.(n)

programme.title: Penguin A&E with Lorraine Kelly
programme.desc: The presenter meets employees at South Africa's busiest penguin emergency department. The hospital rescues more than 1,500 vulnerable penguins every year, and works 24/7 to rehabilitate them. In the first episode, vet Natasha is faced with a case involving a feisty penguin with a fish hook in its stomach. The team must use their expertise to save Bandit's life in an operation that no-one has attempted before.(n)

programme.title: Beaver Las Vegas: Saving The Strip
programme.desc: Despite attracting more than 40 million visitors a year, the city of Las Vegas in Nevada is in desperate danger of collapsing. Not for a want of money, but due to dwindling water resources. This documentary charts the efforts of a small team of eco-engineers who are trying to harness and adapt the methods of beavers to solve the problem of water shortages in North America's western states.(n)

programme.title: GPs: Behind Closed Doors

Plus, a look at the discovery of a bizarre natural phenomenon that, for only a few short weeks each year, sees some of the ocean's most fearsome creatures behave in an unusually aggressive manner.(n)

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc: Kev and Pete pursue a runaway car into a pitch-black farmer's field, Jacko takes part in a major heroin bust, and rookie police dog Elsa chases a runaway burglar through the streets of Middlesbrough. Meanwhile, Andy deals with the aftermath of a pursuit with a sting in the tail.(n)

programme.title: The Tube: Going Underground
programme.desc: After two years of work, engineer Anita and her team are about to break through a concrete wall separating her new passenger tunnels from those of Crossrail, the giant east-west rail link being built across the capital. Meanwhile, the network takes delivery of 192 multimillion-pound trains, which are put through the `rattle test' before being pressed into service, while customer service assistant Stan prepares to say goodbye to the Underground after 35 years' service.(n)

programme.title: Gotham
programme.sub-title: Gotham: Wrath of the Villains: Into the Woods.
programme.desc: Gordon turns to Edward Nygma for help in analysing the tape recording of the call that incriminated him - not realising the forensic analyst is the one who set him up in the first place. Elsewhere, Bruce reconsiders his decision to live on the streets with catburglar Selina, while Cobblepot's abuse at the hands of his deceased father's family drives him closer to madness, and Dr Strange releases another supposedly reformed criminal.(n)

Meanwhile, Brian and Del chase a debt of nearly £2,000 in Surrey, before trying to recover almost £3,000 in Northamptonshire. Finally, Steve and Ru head to Portsmouth to evict a young family for a landlord who wants her property back.(n)
