programme.title: Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles
programme.desc: The team battles an alien lurking in the sewers, but Raph realises he is here to help thwart a Kraang invasion using the Statue of Liberty to open a dimensional portal.(n)

programme.title: Football League Tonight
programme.desc: Kelly Cates and George Riley present extended highlights of the top matches from the final day of the Championship season, including Charlton Athletic v Burnley, and Middlesbrough v Brighton & Hove Albion. Plus, a round-up of all the goals, the main talking points, and interviews with a selection of players and managers.(n)

programme.title: Football League Tonight
programme.desc: A round-up of all the goals from the final day of the season in League Two, including Accrington Stanley v Stevenage, and Oxford United v Wycombe Wanderers. Plus, a look at all the talking points and the latest league tables.(n)

programme.title: The Gadget Show
programme.desc: The team takes viewers behind the scenes of the UK's biggest live tech show - the annual Gadget Show: Live! event. Yue Xu crosses the pond to hit the GSL floors, where she seeks out all the big stories, while helping the crew construct the multi-million pound A/V rig that powers the 3,000-seat Super Theatre at Birmingham's NEC. Jon Bentley becomes the subject of an attempt to break a 3D-printing world record, while singer-songwriter Nina Nesbitt and a live theatre of people answer the big burning tech question of the moment - does vinyl really sound better than mp3?.(n)

programme.title: The Secret Life of Puppies
programme.desc: The concluding part of the fly-on-the-wall documentary follows the puppies as they enter a new phase of their lives, leaving their mums and their litter-mates to join their human families. It's a wild ride of first-time experiences, each one of which will shape the rest of their lives. Labrador puppy Honey meets her new owners for the first time and has to work out her place in this new family. Rusty the fox red labrador faces his first major milestone - being left home alone - and Hamish the West Highland terrier, having moved to London, discovers the joys of big-city living on his first shopping trip.(n)

programme.title: Ace Ventura: Pet Detective
programme.desc: An eccentric but brilliant former cop sets himself up to champion the underdog - as a private eye specialising in locating missing animals. The zany detective is called in to find a kidnapped dolphin - the mascot of an American football team - and uncovers a plot involving high-level police corruption. Comedy, starring Jim Carrey, Courteney Cox, Sean Young, Tone Loc and Noble Willingham.(n)

programme.title: The Fifth Element
programme.desc: In the 23rd century, the world faces destruction from a seemingly unstoppable force of pure evil. Meanwhile, a New York cab driver encounters a mysterious woman destined to save the Earth from its fate, and has to protect her from a scheming arms dealer and a horde of alien mercenaries. Luc Besson's sci-fi adventure, starring Bruce Willis, Milla Jovovich and Gary Oldman.(n)

programme.title: Robin Hood: Prince of Thieves
programme.desc: An English nobleman returns home from the crusades to find his father has been murdered and the local people are repressed by the tyrannical rule of the Sheriff of Nottingham. Branded an outlaw, he recruits a group of bandits to fight for justice and protect the downtrodden. Action adventure, starring Kevin Costner, Alan Rickman, Morgan Freeman and Mary Elizabeth Mastrantonio.(n)

programme.title: Greatest Ever 90s Movies
programme.desc: A countdown of some of the most memorable films from the last decade of the 20th century.(n)

programme.title: Football League Tonight
programme.sub-title: Goal Rush: League One - The Final Day.
programme.desc: A round-up of all the goals from the final day of the season in League One, including Wigan Athletic v Barnsley, and Doncaster Rovers v Burton Albion. Plus, a look at all the talking points and the latest league tables.(n)

programme.title: Reservoir Dogs
programme.desc: Criminals are employed by a crime boss to carry out a diamond robbery that goes disastrously wrong. In the bloody aftermath of the heist, they try to establish what happened and how the police were aware of their plans all along - leading to the hardening suspicion that one of them betrayed the gang. Quentin Tarantino's thriller, starring Harvey Keitel, Tim Roth, Michael Madsen, Chris Penn and Steve Buscemi.(n)

programme.title: Neighbours
programme.desc: Sarah warns Karl and Susan that Angus could go off the rails once she leaves. Sheila takes drastic action over Xanthe's online bullying, while Stonefish pays Toadie a visit.(n)

programme.title: Neighbours
programme.desc: Sheila faces the daunting reality of what she has done, as she is advised that legal action may be taken against her. Paige's jealousy over John's friendship with Amy intensifies.(n)

programme.title: Chinese Food in Minutes
programme.desc: Two gospel singers learn how to cook up a feast for their choir. Ching-He Huang teaches them recipes for chicken and black bean stir-fry, and sweet and sour ribs.(n)

programme.title: The Wright Stuff
programme.desc: Journalist and broadcaster Matthew Wright is joined by a panel of guests and the studio audience to debate the issues of the day.(n)

programme.title: GPs: Behind Closed Doors
programme.desc: Veteran GP Don McKenzie performs a rectal examination, treats a young girl with a marble-sized growth on her forearm, and offers honest advice to a patient who has terminal cancer. Meanwhile, Dr Maria Wallace must bring all of her medical knowledge to bear if she is to correctly diagnose a man whose symptoms include a habit of hitting himself in the face, and Dr Tim King sees a patient with a gum infection that has caused the side of her face to swell up massively.(n)

programme.title: Cowboy Builders
programme.desc: Dominic Littlewood returns to Caerphilly to find out what happened to a couple the programme helped in 2012, after their cottage was left with no water, gas or heating when their builder disappeared without completing the extension they paid him for. Dom discovers how they have been getting on and learns the police have been trying to bring the tradesman to justice.(n)

programme.title: Home and Away
programme.desc: Hannah struggles to adjust to life after her operation, Irene starts to come to terms with Claire not being her daughter and Lindsay shakes things up again for Olivia and Hunter.(n)

programme.title: Neighbours
programme.desc: Piper and Tyler contemplate whether Ned was behind the blast, Terese deliver Amy an ultimatum regarding Paul, and Paige and John arrive in Geelong.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The first instalment of a two-part crossover with NCIS: New Orleans sees the Washington, DC team co-operating with their colleagues from the Big Easy to investigate a spate of lethal poisonings on board a New Orleans-to-DC flight. All the evidence seems to point to missing chef Luca, who happens to be Abby's brother, so the two investigative services join forces to locate him, and find out why a private tech firm seems to have been targetted by the killer. Naval crime drama, guest starring Scott Bakula.(n)

programme.title: Two Wrongs
programme.desc: Nurse and single mother Sarah struggles to balance her work and home life, but her worst nightmare is realised when her daughter Lauren is abducted while walking home alone from school and she faces a moral dilemma if she is to save her child. Thriller, starring Gillian Zinser.(n)

programme.title: Neighbours
programme.desc: Paige and John speak to a man from his past. Aaron goes out of his way to boost Xanthe's self-confidence, while Ned fears what Piper might find as she investigates the explosion.(n)

programme.title: Neighbours
programme.desc: Piper and Tyler contemplate whether Ned was behind the blast, Terese deliver Amy an ultimatum regarding Paul, and Paige and John arrive in Geelong.(n)

programme.title: Home and Away
programme.desc: Hannah struggles to adjust to life after her operation, Irene starts to come to terms with Claire not being her daughter and Lindsay shakes things up again for Olivia and Hunter.(n)

programme.title: Neighbours
programme.desc: Piper and Tyler contemplate whether Ned was behind the blast, Terese deliver Amy an ultimatum regarding Paul, and Paige and John arrive in Geelong.(n)

programme.title: Deep-Sea Super Predator
programme.desc: Documentary about the search for a mysterious predator that is large enough to hunt down and devour a three-metre great white shark. Plus, a look at the discovery of a bizarre natural phenomenon that, for only a few short weeks each year, sees some of the ocean's most fearsome creatures behave in an unusually aggressive manner.(n)

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc: Kev and Pete pursue a runaway car into a pitch-black farmer's field, Jacko takes part in a major heroin bust, and rookie police dog Elsa chases a runaway burglar through the streets of Middlesbrough. Meanwhile, Andy deals with the aftermath of a pursuit with a sting in the tail.(n)

programme.title: The Tube: Going Underground
programme.desc: After two years of work, engineer Anita and her team are about to break through a concrete wall separating her new passenger tunnels from those of Crossrail, the giant east-west rail link being built across the capital. Meanwhile, the network takes delivery of 192 multimillion-pound trains, which are put through the `rattle test' before being pressed into service, while customer service assistant Stan prepares to say goodbye to the Underground after 35 years' service.(n)

programme.title: Gotham
programme.sub-title: Gotham: Wrath of the Villains: Into the Woods.
programme.desc: Gordon turns to Edward Nygma for help in analysing the tape recording of the call that incriminated him - not realising the forensic analyst is the one who set him up in the first place. Elsewhere, Bruce reconsiders his decision to live on the streets with catburglar Selina, while Cobblepot's abuse at the hands of his deceased father's family drives him closer to madness, and Dr Strange releases another supposedly reformed criminal.(n)

programme.title: Up Late with Rylan
programme.desc: Rylan Clark-Neal hosts a chat show filmed on the evening of transmission from the Hospital Club in central London, featuring celebrity guests and music as well as games for the studio audience and the viewers at home.(n)

programme.title: Person of Interest
programme.desc: Root and Finch race to save the Machine, which has been located by Samaritan, while Reese is caught in the middle of the final showdown between rival crime bosses Elias and Dominic.(n)

programme.title: The Producers
programme.desc: A crooked Broadway producer and his neurotic accountant discover they can make a fortune by putting on a play that closes on opening night, then pocketing the unspent budget. The duo set out to put on the worst show of all time - a tasteless little number called Springtime for Hitler written by a deranged former Nazi. Mel Brooks' comedy, starring Zero Mostel, Gene Wilder and Kenneth Mars.(n)

programme.title: The Night of the Grizzly
programme.desc: Marshal Jim Cole leaves his job, packs up his family and heads out to the high plains and mountains of Wyoming when he inherits his uncle's ranch. However, any hopes of a quiet life raising livestock are soon dashed by a greedy neighbour, an ex-con turned bounty hunter and the emergence from hibernation of a vicious grizzly bear known to the locals as Satan. Western, starring Clint Walker.(n)

programme.title: Winchester '73
programme.desc: A gunslinger tracks down his father's killer, but is unable to exact his revenge because the sheriff of the town makes a point of confiscating all firearms. Instead he challenges him to compete in a shooting competition to win a superb rifle, but when the murderer loses, he steals the coveted prize. Western, starring James Stewart, Shelley Winters, Dan Duryea and Stephen McNally.(n)

programme.title: Kidnapped
programme.desc: A naive young man is cheated out of his inheritance by his conniving uncle, who sells him to the captain of a slave ship. On board he forms an alliance with a hardened rebel, and the pair make their escape when the ship is wrecked on the Scottish coast. Period adventure based on Robert Louis Stevenson's novel set during the Jacobite Uprising, with Michael Caine, Lawrence Douglas, Trevor Howard, Jack Hawkins and Donald Pleasence.(n)

programme.title: Terminal Velocity
programme.desc: A skydiving instructor tries to clear himself of responsibility for the death of a woman whose parachute failed to open. However, he later learns she is a Russian spy who faked her own demise, and now needs his help to foil an international criminal conspiracy out to steal a fortune in bullion. Action thriller, starring Charlie Sheen, Nastassja Kinski and James Gandolfini.(n)

programme.title: Battleship
programme.desc: A reckless slacker joins the Navy, hoping to win the respect of his girlfriend's father, a stern admiral. He and his shipmates are put to the ultimate test as part of a force of vessels that must battle an invading fleet of powerful alien spaceships. Sci-fi adventure, starring Taylor Kitsch, Liam Neeson and Alexander Skarsgard.(n)

programme.title: Second Coming
programme.desc: Premiere. A happily married woman is shocked to discover she is pregnant as it has been months since she slept with her husband. Afraid of her spouse's reaction, she tries to keep the news to herself, but she cannot hide the truth indefinitely. Drama, starring Nadine Marshall, Idris Elba and Kai Francis Lewis.(n)

programme.title: Doubt
programme.desc: A disciplinarian nun at a Catholic school in 1960s New York suspects a charismatic priest of behaving inappropriately with a student. A battle of wills ensues between the pair as she tries to gather definitive evidence beyond her own moral certainty. Drama based on director John Patrick Shanley's stage play, starring Meryl Streep, Amy Adams, Viola Davis and Philip Seymour Hoffman.(n)

programme.title: A Ticket to Tomahawk
programme.desc: The daughter of a railway pioneer sets out to prove her trains can beat a rival's stagecoaches to the same destination. However, the competition is marred by a campaign of dirty tricks, and the locomotive passengers - a travelling salesman and a chorus of showgirls - get dragged into the conflict. Comedy Western, starring Dan Dailey, Anne Baxter, Arthur Hunnicutt and Walter Brennan.(n)

programme.title: 20 Million Miles to Earth
programme.desc: An American space mission to Venus brings back a bizarre reptilian creature from the planet's surface, but once exposed to Earth's atmosphere it suddenly begins to grow at an alarming rate and wreaks havoc on the streets of Rome. Sci-fi thriller, starring William Hopper, Joan Taylor and Frank Puglia, with special effects by Ray Harryhausen.(n)

programme.title: Bend of the River
programme.desc: A trail guide saves a thief from being lynched and recruits him to help guide a party of settlers across the country. Once the homesteaders have reached their destination, the two men agree to go for supplies, but on the way back, the thief plots to sell their goods to a gold-mining camp. Western, starring James Stewart, Arthur Kennedy, Rock Hudson, Lori Nelson, Jay C Flippen and Julie Adams.(n)

programme.title: Escape to Athena
programme.desc: Second World War Allied PoWs incarcerated on a Greek island plan to defy the SS by breaking out of prison and pulling off an art robbery, with the help of their liberal-minded camp commandant. Action adventure, with Roger Moore, David Niven, Telly Savalas, Elliott Gould, Stefanie Powers and Claudia Cardinale.(n)

programme.title: Baggage Claim
programme.desc: Premiere. An air hostess is horrified at the thought of her younger sister getting married while she is still single. She realises her job gives her access to eligible men from across America, and begins clocking up thousands of air miles as she scours the country for a potential fiance. Romantic comedy, with Paula Patton and Taye Diggs.(n)

programme.title: Fast & Furious 6
programme.desc: A gang of fugitives is reunited by an FBI manhunter, who offers the criminals pardons in return for their help. They must go to Europe and bring down a criminal syndicate led by a ruthless London gangster, whose right-hand woman is an old friend of theirs assumed to be dead. Action thriller sequel, with Vin Diesel, Dwayne Johnson and Michelle Rodriguez.(n)

Action thriller sequel, with Vin Diesel, Dwayne Johnson and Michelle Rodriguez.(n)

programme.title: Now That's Funny
programme.desc: A bride gets cold feet at the altar, and various clips feature people who do not get what they want. Plus, a potential hit song and the latest Stars of the Week.(n)

programme.title: Jelly Jamm
programme.desc: Rita takes on the Queen's duties, but the power soon goes to her head.(n)

programme.title: LazyTown
programme.desc: Robbie plans to make his own dream team and to shoot Sportacus out of town with a cannon.(n)

programme.title: Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles
programme.desc: The team battles an alien lurking in the sewers, but Raph realises he is here to help thwart a Kraang invasion using the Statue of Liberty to open a dimensional portal.(n)

programme.title: Football League Tonight
programme.desc: Kelly Cates and George Riley present extended highlights of the top matches from the final day of the Championship season, including Charlton Athletic v Burnley, and Middlesbrough v Brighton & Hove Albion. Plus, a round-up of all the goals, the main talking points, and interviews with a selection of players and managers.(n)

programme.title: Football League Tonight
programme.desc: A round-up of all the goals from the final day of the season in League Two, including Accrington Stanley v Stevenage, and Oxford United v Wycombe Wanderers. Plus, a look at all the talking points and the latest league tables.(n)

programme.title: The Gadget Show
programme.desc: The team takes viewers behind the scenes of the UK's biggest live tech show - the annual Gadget Show: Live! event. Yue Xu crosses the pond to hit the GSL floors, where she seeks out all the big stories, while helping the crew construct the multi-million pound A/V rig that powers the 3,000-seat Super Theatre at Birmingham's NEC. Jon Bentley becomes the subject of an attempt to break a 3D-printing world record, while singer-songwriter Nina Nesbitt and a live theatre of people answer the big burning tech question of the moment - does vinyl really sound better than mp3?.(n)

programme.title: The Secret Life of Puppies
programme.desc: The concluding part of the fly-on-the-wall documentary follows the puppies as they enter a new phase of their lives, leaving their mums and their litter-mates to join their human families. It's a wild ride of first-time experiences, each one of which will shape the rest of their lives. Labrador puppy Honey meets her new owners for the first time and has to work out her place in this new family. Rusty the fox red labrador faces his first major milestone - being left home alone - and Hamish the West Highland terrier, having moved to London, discovers the joys of big-city living on his first shopping trip.(n)

programme.title: Ace Ventura: Pet Detective
programme.desc: An eccentric but brilliant former cop sets himself up to champion the underdog - as a private eye specialising in locating missing animals. The zany detective is called in to find a kidnapped dolphin - the mascot of an American football team - and uncovers a plot involving high-level police corruption. Comedy, starring Jim Carrey, Courteney Cox, Sean Young, Tone Loc and Noble Willingham.(n)

programme.title: The Fifth Element
programme.desc: In the 23rd century, the world faces destruction from a seemingly unstoppable force of pure evil. Meanwhile, a New York cab driver encounters a mysterious woman destined to save the Earth from its fate, and has to protect her from a scheming arms dealer and a horde of alien mercenaries. Luc Besson's sci-fi adventure, starring Bruce Willis, Milla Jovovich and Gary Oldman.(n)

programme.title: Robin Hood: Prince of Thieves
programme.desc: An English nobleman returns home from the crusades to find his father has been murdered and the local people are repressed by the tyrannical rule of the Sheriff of Nottingham. Branded an outlaw, he recruits a group of bandits to fight for justice and protect the downtrodden. Action adventure, starring Kevin Costner, Alan Rickman, Morgan Freeman and Mary Elizabeth Mastrantonio.(n)

programme.title: Greatest Ever 90s Movies
programme.desc: A countdown of some of the most memorable films from the last decade of the 20th century.(n)

programme.title: Football League Tonight
programme.sub-title: Goal Rush: League One - The Final Day.
programme.desc: A round-up of all the goals from the final day of the season in League One, including Wigan Athletic v Barnsley, and Doncaster Rovers v Burton Albion. Plus, a look at all the talking points and the latest league tables.(n)

programme.title: Chinese Food in Minutes
programme.desc: Two gospel singers learn how to cook up a feast for their choir. Ching-He Huang teaches them recipes for chicken and black bean stir-fry, and sweet and sour ribs.(n)

programme.title: The Wright Stuff
programme.desc: Journalist and broadcaster Matthew Wright is joined by a panel of guests and the studio audience to debate the issues of the day.(n)

programme.title: GPs: Behind Closed Doors
programme.desc: Veteran GP Don McKenzie performs a rectal examination, treats a young girl with a marble-sized growth on her forearm, and offers honest advice to a patient who has terminal cancer. Meanwhile, Dr Maria Wallace must bring all of her medical knowledge to bear if she is to correctly diagnose a man whose symptoms include a habit of hitting himself in the face, and Dr Tim King sees a patient with a gum infection that has caused the side of her face to swell up massively.(n)

programme.title: Cowboy Builders
programme.desc: Dominic Littlewood returns to Caerphilly to find out what happened to a couple the programme helped in 2012, after their cottage was left with no water, gas or heating when their builder disappeared without completing the extension they paid him for. Dom discovers how they have been getting on and learns the police have been trying to bring the tradesman to justice.(n)

programme.title: Home and Away
programme.desc: Hannah struggles to adjust to life after her operation, Irene starts to come to terms with Claire not being her daughter and Lindsay shakes things up again for Olivia and Hunter.(n)

programme.title: Neighbours
programme.desc: Piper and Tyler contemplate whether Ned was behind the blast, Terese deliver Amy an ultimatum regarding Paul, and Paige and John arrive in Geelong.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The first instalment of a two-part crossover with NCIS: New Orleans sees the Washington, DC team co-operating with their colleagues from the Big Easy to investigate a spate of lethal poisonings on board a New Orleans-to-DC flight. All the evidence seems to point to missing chef Luca, who happens to be Abby's brother, so the two investigative services join forces to locate him, and find out why a private tech firm seems to have been targetted by the killer. Naval crime drama, guest starring Scott Bakula.(n)

programme.title: Two Wrongs
programme.desc: Nurse and single mother Sarah struggles to balance her work and home life, but her worst nightmare is realised when her daughter Lauren is abducted while walking home alone from school and she faces a moral dilemma if she is to save her child. Thriller, starring Gillian Zinser.(n)

programme.title: Neighbours
programme.desc: Paige and John speak to a man from his past. Aaron goes out of his way to boost Xanthe's self-confidence, while Ned fears what Piper might find as she investigates the explosion.(n)

programme.title: Neighbours
programme.desc: Piper and Tyler contemplate whether Ned was behind the blast, Terese deliver Amy an ultimatum regarding Paul, and Paige and John arrive in Geelong.(n)

programme.title: Home and Away
programme.desc: Hannah struggles to adjust to life after her operation, Irene starts to come to terms with Claire not being her daughter and Lindsay shakes things up again for Olivia and Hunter.(n)

programme.title: Neighbours
programme.desc: Piper and Tyler contemplate whether Ned was behind the blast, Terese deliver Amy an ultimatum regarding Paul, and Paige and John arrive in Geelong.(n)

programme.title: Deep-Sea Super Predator
programme.desc: Documentary about the search for a mysterious predator that is large enough to hunt down and devour a three-metre great white shark. Plus, a look at the discovery of a bizarre natural phenomenon that, for only a few short weeks each year, sees some of the ocean's most fearsome creatures behave in an unusually aggressive manner.(n)

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc: Kev and Pete pursue a runaway car into a pitch-black farmer's field, Jacko takes part in a major heroin bust, and rookie police dog Elsa chases a runaway burglar through the streets of Middlesbrough. Meanwhile, Andy deals with the aftermath of a pursuit with a sting in the tail.(n)

programme.title: The Tube: Going Underground
programme.desc: After two years of work, engineer Anita and her team are about to break through a concrete wall separating her new passenger tunnels from those of Crossrail, the giant east-west rail link being built across the capital. Meanwhile, the network takes delivery of 192 multimillion-pound trains, which are put through the `rattle test' before being pressed into service, while customer service assistant Stan prepares to say goodbye to the Underground after 35 years' service.(n)

programme.title: Gotham
programme.sub-title: Gotham: Wrath of the Villains: Into the Woods.
programme.desc: Gordon turns to Edward Nygma for help in analysing the tape recording of the call that incriminated him - not realising the forensic analyst is the one who set him up in the first place. Elsewhere, Bruce reconsiders his decision to live on the streets with catburglar Selina, while Cobblepot's abuse at the hands of his deceased father's family drives him closer to madness, and Dr Strange releases another supposedly reformed criminal.(n)

programme.title: Up Late with Rylan
programme.desc: Rylan Clark-Neal hosts a chat show filmed on the evening of transmission from the Hospital Club in central London, featuring celebrity guests and music as well as games for the studio audience and the viewers at home.(n)

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: Round-up of national and international news, plus the latest from the money markets.(n)

programme.title: Rip Off Britain: Food
programme.desc: Gloria Hunniford, Angela Rippon and Julia Somerville explore where food comes from and how it is described, revealing why some pork labelled as outside-reared may actually refer to pigs that have spent most of their lives indoors. Plus, why so much of Britain's lamb is imported from New Zealand, despite the country having fields full of sheep, the perils of foraging for mushrooms, and unexpected dangers lurking in imported products.(n)

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Lucy Alexander, Martin Roberts and Dion Dublin explore six apartments in Liverpool, a house in Handsworth, Birmingham, and a three-storey building in Ramsgate, Kent, before meeting the people who bought them at auction.(n)

programme.title: Neighbourhood Blues
programme.desc: Rob McIvor investigates after art galleries in Bath are inundated with Nazi-themed hate mail, and police in Bridgwater carry out an early morning raid in a quiet residential street.(n)

programme.title: Oxford Street Revealed
programme.desc: PC Andy Pescott takes errant pedicab riders to court to try to stop their rule-bending, and the programme follows bus and tube drivers as they face their daily challenges.(n)

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Natasha Raskin presents from Oswestry in Shropshire as two brothers compete against a couple to buy three items each to make the most profit at auction, with expert advice from Jonathan Pratt and John Cameron.(n)

programme.title: Doctors
programme.desc: A confident Al sets out for his great walking adventure from Letherbridge to Lichfield, but ends up dealing with a medical crisis, while Jimmi sees a face from his past as a hostel closes its doors on the homeless, but all is not as it seems.(n)

programme.title: The Code
programme.desc: Matt Allwright hosts the quiz in which contestants must answer questions to help crack a three-digit code that will open a safe full of money. The jackpot starts at £3,000 and each time contestants fail - and that could be after just one wrong answer - they have to leave immediately and another £500 is added to the prize. Matt is assisted by quiz expert Lesley-Anne Brewis.(n)

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Alistair Appleton helps a retired couple who have returned from France find a rural home in Lincolnshire on a budget of £300,000. He also meets a local conservationist with an entrepreneurial approach to safeguarding the area's ancient woodland.(n)

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: Sarah Moore transforms items reclaimed from a Walsall tip, including an art deco train set and a broken sofa, with help from designer Jay Blades. Arthur Smith narrates.(n)

programme.title: Put Your Money Where Your Mouth Is
programme.sub-title: Katherine Higgins v Phil Serrell Foreign Antiques Market.
programme.desc: The return of the challenge in which antiques experts go head to head in a competition, beginning with Katherine Higgins and Philip Serrell visiting a market in Paris.(n)

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz show in which pairs of contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions posed to 100 people before the show. At the end of each round, the team with the most points is eliminated until the final two pairs battle for the chance to compete for a cash prize. Presented by Alexander Armstrong and Richard Osman.(n)

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: The first visit of the week to the One Show studio, where Matt Baker and Alex Jones present the usual mix of topical stories and celebrity chat.(n)

programme.title: Invictus Games 2016
programme.desc: New series. Gabby Logan and Ade Adepitan present coverage from Orlando, Florida, of the second staging of the international multi-sport event for wounded, injured or sick armed forces personnel and veterans, which had its inaugural event two years ago in London. Featuring highlights of the opening ceremony, which featured appearances by patron Prince Harry and First Lady Michelle Obama, as well as performances by James Blunt, Laura Wright and Gareth Malone's Invictus Choir, which was formed specially for the Games.(n)

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Buster continues in his mission to prevent the supermarket buying Ian's restaurant, only for things to fall apart when Kathy embarrasses him in the street. Determined not to give up, he takes a different approach with the help of Johnny and Lee - but they soon realise their new campaign needs money. Tension simmers between Bex and Louise, who both have eyes for Square newcomer Shakil, while Jack asks Ronnie if he and Amy can move in.(n)

programme.title: Invictus Games 2016
programme.desc: Gabby Logan and Ade Adepitan present coverage of the opening events as the sporting action gets underway, with Paralympian Jon-Allan Butterworth introducing highlights of the cycling. Former Royal Marine JJ Chalmers discovers how the athletes from the teams of the 14 countries taking part are finding living together.(n)

programme.title: Peter Kay's Comedy Shuffle
programme.desc: Another selection from the career of the comedian, actor, writer and director, featuring a clip from The Ice Cream Man Cometh episode of his series That Peter Kay Thing. Plus, Peter has a brief chat with Alan Carr, while Phoenix Night's Brian Potter and Andy Pipkin from Little Britain sing I'm Gonna Be (500 Miles) accompanied by star-studded cast.(n)

programme.title: I Want My Wife Back
programme.desc: Murray manages to persuade Bex to go for dinner with him at Lorenzo's, the Italian restaurant where he proposed to her, where he plans to ask her to marry him again. However, the evening gets off to a bad start when Grant loses the ring he was supposed to bring and things go from bad to worse when Julian Wolverton turns up. Comedy, starring Ben Miller and Caroline Catz.(n)

programme.title: Have I Got a Bit More News for You
programme.desc: Actor David Tennant hosts an extended edition of the satirical quiz, with comedian Phil Wang one of the guest panellists joining team captains Ian Hislop and Paul Merton to poke fun at the week's news stories.(n)

programme.title: The Graham Norton Show
programme.desc: Graham is joined by actor Tom Hiddleston, who is starring as country singer Hank Williams in I Saw The Light, John Malkovich, director of the play Good Canary, and Marvel's Nick Fury himself, Hollywood actor Samuel L Jackson. Comedian Sara Pascoe also appears, and there's music by Chvrches.(n)

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: Round-up of national and international news, plus the latest from the money markets.(n)

programme.title: Rip Off Britain: Food
programme.desc: Gloria Hunniford, Angela Rippon and Julia Somerville investigate the secrets of the food business and whether labels and special offers are always what they seem. In the first episode, they explore some of the best-known restaurants to discover how much of the food is actually prepared on each premises. Plus, a look at definitions of the word `local', free trials of diet pills and why wholemeal bread isn't always prepared in the way people might imagine.(n)

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Martin Roberts, Lucy Alexander and Dion Dublin meet the new owners of properties in Chesterton, Staffordshire, Bestwood in Nottingham, and Strawberry Hill, London.(n)

programme.title: Neighbourhood Blues
programme.desc: Officer Dom Bryant gets an anonymous tip-off that cannabis is being grown at a house in the small village of Burnham-on-Sea, but he finds out that all is not what it seems.(n)

programme.title: Oxford Street Revealed
programme.desc: A Tube strike brings chaos to Oxford Street and John Lewis prepares to overhaul its homeware department, while London's Ice Bar gets a refit.(n)

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Two teams are challenged to scour an antiques fair in Hexham, Northumberland and pick up bargains to sell for profit at auction. Experts David Harper and Anita Manning are on hand to offer advice on the best bargains as both sides find military-themed items. Meanwhile, presenter Tim Wonnacott samples the local cheese.(n)

programme.title: Doctors
programme.sub-title: A House is Not a Home.
programme.desc: Tempers fray when a `homeless' local is exposed as an undercover journalist, then makes a beeline for someone vulnerable, and Al takes an exciting detour en route to Lichfield.(n)

programme.title: The Code
programme.desc: Matt Allwright hosts the quiz in which contestants must answer questions to help crack a three-digit code that will open a safe full of money. The jackpot starts at £3,000 and each time contestants fail - and that could be after just one wrong answer - they have to leave immediately and another £500 is added to the prize. Matt is assisted by quiz expert Lesley-Anne Brewis.(n)

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Jules Hudson heads to Kent to help a Canadian couple with a budget of £650,000 move away from London and find a home in the county. She also takes a private tour of the garden at Sissinghurst Castle, which was created in the 1930s by writer Vita Sackville-West and her husband Harold Nicolson.(n)

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: Sarah Moore is in Altrincham hoping to find some hidden gems she can transform and send off to a new home. Meanwhile, Bex Simon almost meets her match with a filing cabinet that requires all her creative flair.(n)

programme.title: Put Your Money Where Your Mouth Is
programme.sub-title: Katherine Higgins v Phil Serrell Auction.
programme.desc: Philip Serrell and Katherine Higgins face off at a high end auctioneers in Sussex. She plays a risky game when she spends most of her money on a vintage poster she thinks is a sleeper, but will it pay off?.(n)

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz show in which pairs of contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions posed to 100 people before the show. At the end of each round, the team with the most points is eliminated until the final two pairs battle for the chance to compete for a cash prize. Presented by Alexander Armstrong and Richard Osman.(n)

programme.title: Invictus Games 2016
programme.desc: Gabby Logan, Daraine Mulvihill and Tanni Grey-Thompson present highlights of the morning's track and field events from Orlando, Florida. Also in the programme, ex-Royal Marine JJ Chalmers meets a remarkable powerlifter and Rachael Latham reports on the rowing and archery. Plus, Gabby hears the stories of some inspiring military wives.(n)

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Phil and Aunt Sal turn up at Ronnie's after hearing that a familiar face is back in Albert Square. But Peggy has bad news for her family. Johnny is concerned about the future of his law career if Belinda reports him and Buster to the police. It soon seems everything is forgotten when she invites Mick and Linda to a hot-tub party - only for the evening to take an unexpected turn. As Sonia prepares for her doctor's appointment, a worried Bex turns to Stacey for advice.(n)

programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: Arthur and Morven celebrate their love for each other on a day neither will forget. Meanwhile, Mo listens to her head instead of her heart, leading to a last minute dash to the airport, but is she too late? Elsewhere, Serena is devastated when her actions have terrible consequences for the hospital.(n)

programme.title: In the Club
programme.desc: After walking away from her high-flying career, Roanna is struggling to find a new job, so she reluctantly turns to ex-husband Ray for help. Meanwhile, Rick's release date is finally here so an anxious Diane prepares to welcome him home, and Vicky tries to juggle baby Ben with her full time job. However, when she gets caught up in work, things goes terribly wrong, with disastrous consequences. Elsewhere, Jasmin and Dev have to make the biggest decision of their lives.(n)

programme.title: Gareth's Invictus Choir
programme.desc: First in a two-part documentary in which Gareth Malone takes on a new challenge - to form a choir of wounded ex-servicemen and women to perform at the Invictus Games in May. He begins by meeting Prince Harry, the founder of the games, then sets out on his search to find 12 singers, each of whom has a story to tell of the struggles they have faced since medical discharge. Once together, there follows three days of singing lessons, where Gareth soon realises he has to learn a new way of working with such a fragile group. However, the song he chooses for them triggers unexpected emotions.(n)

programme.title: Room 101
programme.desc: Chat-show host Jonathan Ross, former England cricket captain Michael Vaughan and comedienne Sara Pascoe tell Frank Skinner what really gets on their wick, in the hope he will banish their bugbears to the infamous room for ever. The celebrities' gripes include pick 'n' mix, misuse of the word `literally' and the Grim Reaper.(n)

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: Round-up of national and international news, plus the latest from the money markets.(n)

programme.title: Rip Off Britain: Food
programme.desc: Gloria Hunniford, Angela Rippon and Julia Somerville explore where food comes from and how it is described, revealing why some pork labelled as outside-reared may actually refer to pigs that have spent most of their lives indoors. Plus, why so much of Britain's lamb is imported from New Zealand, despite the country having fields full of sheep, the perils of foraging for mushrooms, and unexpected dangers lurking in imported products.(n)

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Lucy Alexander, Martin Roberts and Dion Dublin explore six apartments in Liverpool, a house in Handsworth, Birmingham, and a three-storey building in Ramsgate, Kent, before meeting the people who bought them at auction.(n)

programme.title: Neighbourhood Blues
programme.desc: Rob McIvor investigates after art galleries in Bath are inundated with Nazi-themed hate mail, and police in Bridgwater carry out an early morning raid in a quiet residential street.(n)

programme.title: Oxford Street Revealed
programme.desc: PC Andy Pescott takes errant pedicab riders to court to try to stop their rule-bending, and the programme follows bus and tube drivers as they face their daily challenges.(n)

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Natasha Raskin presents from Oswestry in Shropshire as two brothers compete against a couple to buy three items each to make the most profit at auction, with expert advice from Jonathan Pratt and John Cameron.(n)

programme.title: Doctors
programme.desc: A confident Al sets out for his great walking adventure from Letherbridge to Lichfield, but ends up dealing with a medical crisis, while Jimmi sees a face from his past as a hostel closes its doors on the homeless, but all is not as it seems.(n)

programme.title: The Code
programme.desc: Matt Allwright hosts the quiz in which contestants must answer questions to help crack a three-digit code that will open a safe full of money. The jackpot starts at £3,000 and each time contestants fail - and that could be after just one wrong answer - they have to leave immediately and another £500 is added to the prize. Matt is assisted by quiz expert Lesley-Anne Brewis.(n)

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Alistair Appleton helps a retired couple who have returned from France find a rural home in Lincolnshire on a budget of £300,000. He also meets a local conservationist with an entrepreneurial approach to safeguarding the area's ancient woodland.(n)

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: Sarah Moore transforms items reclaimed from a Walsall tip, including an art deco train set and a broken sofa, with help from designer Jay Blades. Arthur Smith narrates.(n)

programme.title: Put Your Money Where Your Mouth Is
programme.sub-title: Katherine Higgins v Phil Serrell Foreign Antiques Market.
programme.desc: The return of the challenge in which antiques experts go head to head in a competition, beginning with Katherine Higgins and Philip Serrell visiting a market in Paris.(n)

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz show in which pairs of contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions posed to 100 people before the show. At the end of each round, the team with the most points is eliminated until the final two pairs battle for the chance to compete for a cash prize. programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: The first visit of the week to the One Show studio, where Matt Baker and Alex Jones present the usual mix of topical stories and celebrity chat.(n)

programme.title: Invictus Games 2016
programme.desc: New series. Gabby Logan and Ade Adepitan present coverage from Orlando, Florida, of the second staging of the international multi-sport event for wounded, injured or sick armed forces personnel and veterans, which had its inaugural event two years ago in London. Featuring highlights of the opening ceremony, which featured appearances by patron Prince Harry and First Lady Michelle Obama, as well as performances by James Blunt, Laura Wright and Gareth Malone's Invictus Choir, which was formed specially for the Games.(n)

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Buster continues in his mission to prevent the supermarket buying Ian's restaurant, only for things to fall apart when Kathy embarrasses him in the street. Determined not to give up, he takes a different approach with the help of Johnny and Lee - but they soon realise their new campaign needs money. Tension simmers between Bex and Louise, who both have eyes for Square newcomer Shakil, while Jack asks Ronnie if he and Amy can move in.(n)

programme.desc: First in a two-part documentary in which Gareth Malone takes on a new challenge - to form a choir of wounded ex-servicemen and women to perform at the Invictus Games in May. programme.title: Breakfast

programme.title: Rip Off Britain: Food

programme.title: The Code

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Buster continues in his mission to prevent the supermarket buying Ian's restaurant, only for things to fall apart when Kathy embarrasses him in the street. Determined not to give up, he takes a different approach with the help of Johnny and Lee - but they soon realise their new campaign needs money. Tension simmers between Bex and Louise, who both have eyes for Square newcomer Shakil, while Jack asks Ronnie if he and Amy can move in.(n)

programme.title: Invictus Games 2016
programme.desc: Gabby Logan and Ade Adepitan present coverage of the opening events as the sporting action gets underway, with Paralympian Jon-Allan Butterworth introducing highlights of the cycling. Former Royal Marine JJ Chalmers discovers how the athletes from the teams of the 14 countries taking part are finding living together.(n)

programme.title: Peter Kay's Comedy Shuffle
programme.desc: Another selection from the career of the comedian, actor, writer and director, featuring a clip from The Ice Cream Man Cometh episode of his series That Peter Kay Thing. Plus, Peter has a brief chat with Alan Carr, while Phoenix Night's Brian Potter and Andy Pipkin from Little Britain sing I'm Gonna Be (500 Miles) accompanied by star-studded cast.(n)

programme.title: I Want My Wife Back
programme.desc: Murray manages to persuade Bex to go for dinner with him at Lorenzo's, the Italian restaurant where he proposed to her, where he plans to ask her to marry him again. However, the evening gets off to a bad start when Grant loses the ring he was supposed to bring and things go from bad to worse when Julian Wolverton turns up. Comedy, starring Ben Miller and Caroline Catz.(n)

programme.title: Keepin 'er Country
programme.desc: Cameras follow the build-up to the nuptials of Crystal Swing's Dervla Burke, who has set her heart on a country music-theme for her wedding to Tim O'Connor. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Have I Got a Bit More News for You
programme.desc: Actor David Tennant hosts an extended edition of the satirical quiz, with comedian Phil Wang one of the guest panellists joining team captains Ian Hislop and Paul Merton to poke fun at the week's news stories.(n)

programme.title: The Graham Norton Show
programme.desc: Graham is joined by actor Tom Hiddleston, who is starring as country singer Hank Williams in I Saw The Light, John Malkovich, director of the play Good Canary, and Marvel's Nick Fury himself, Hollywood actor Samuel L Jackson. Comedian Sara Pascoe also appears, and there's music by Chvrches.(n)

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: Round-up of national and international news, plus the latest from the money markets.(n)

programme.title: Rip Off Britain: Food
programme.desc: Gloria Hunniford, Angela Rippon and Julia Somerville investigate the secrets of the food business and whether labels and special offers are always what they seem. In the first episode, they explore some of the best-known restaurants to discover how much of the food is actually prepared on each premises. Plus, a look at definitions of the word `local', free trials of diet pills and why wholemeal bread isn't always prepared in the way people might imagine.(n)

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Martin Roberts, Lucy Alexander and Dion Dublin meet the new owners of properties in Chesterton, Staffordshire, Bestwood in Nottingham, and Strawberry Hill, London.(n)

programme.title: Neighbourhood Blues
programme.desc: Officer Dom Bryant gets an anonymous tip-off that cannabis is being grown at a house in the small village of Burnham-on-Sea, but he finds out that all is not what it seems.(n)

programme.title: Oxford Street Revealed
programme.desc: A Tube strike brings chaos to Oxford Street and John Lewis prepares to overhaul its homeware department, while London's Ice Bar gets a refit.(n)

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Two teams are challenged to scour an antiques fair in Hexham, Northumberland and pick up bargains to sell for profit at auction. Experts David Harper and Anita Manning are on hand to offer advice on the best bargains as both sides find military-themed items. Meanwhile, presenter Tim Wonnacott samples the local cheese.(n)

programme.title: BBC Newsline; Weather
programme.desc: Local news worth watching from across Northern Ireland.(n)

programme.title: Doctors
programme.sub-title: A House is Not a Home.
programme.desc: Tempers fray when a `homeless' local is exposed as an undercover journalist, then makes a beeline for someone vulnerable, and Al takes an exciting detour en route to Lichfield.(n)

programme.title: The Code
programme.desc: Matt Allwright hosts the quiz in which contestants must answer questions to help crack a three-digit code that will open a safe full of money. The jackpot starts at £3,000 and each time contestants fail - and that could be after just one wrong answer - they have to leave immediately and another £500 is added to the prize. Matt is assisted by quiz expert Lesley-Anne Brewis.(n)

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Jules Hudson heads to Kent to help a Canadian couple with a budget of £650,000 move away from London and find a home in the county. She also takes a private tour of the garden at Sissinghurst Castle, which was created in the 1930s by writer Vita Sackville-West and her husband Harold Nicolson.(n)

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: Sarah Moore is in Altrincham hoping to find some hidden gems she can transform and send off to a new home. Meanwhile, Bex Simon almost meets her match with a filing cabinet that requires all her creative flair.(n)

programme.title: Put Your Money Where Your Mouth Is
programme.sub-title: Katherine Higgins v Phil Serrell Auction.
programme.desc: Philip Serrell and Katherine Higgins face off at a high end auctioneers in Sussex. She plays a risky game when she spends most of her money on a vintage poster she thinks is a sleeper, but will it pay off?.(n)

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz show in which pairs of contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions posed to 100 people before the show. At the end of each round, the team with the most points is eliminated until the final two pairs battle for the chance to compete for a cash prize. Presented by Alexander Armstrong and Richard Osman.(n)

programme.title: Invictus Games 2016
programme.desc: Gabby Logan, Daraine Mulvihill and Tanni Grey-Thompson present highlights of the morning's track and field events from Orlando, Florida. Also in the programme, ex-Royal Marine JJ Chalmers meets a remarkable powerlifter and Rachael Latham reports on the rowing and archery. Plus, Gabby hears the stories of some inspiring military wives.(n)

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Phil and Aunt Sal turn up at Ronnie's after hearing that a familiar face is back in Albert Square. But Peggy has bad news for her family. Johnny is concerned about the future of his law career if Belinda reports him and Buster to the police. It soon seems everything is forgotten when she invites Mick and Linda to a hot-tub party - only for the evening to take an unexpected turn. As Sonia prepares for her doctor's appointment, a worried Bex turns to Stacey for advice.(n)

programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: Arthur and Morven celebrate their love for each other on a day neither will forget. Meanwhile, Mo listens to her head instead of her heart, leading to a last minute dash to the airport, but is she too late? Elsewhere, Serena is devastated when her actions have terrible consequences for the hospital.(n)

programme.title: In the Club
programme.desc: After walking away from her high-flying career, Roanna is struggling to find a new job, so she reluctantly turns to ex-husband Ray for help. Meanwhile, Rick's release date is finally here so an anxious Diane prepares to welcome him home, and Vicky tries to juggle baby Ben with her full time job. However, when she gets caught up in work, things goes terribly wrong, with disastrous consequences. Elsewhere, Jasmin and Dev have to make the biggest decision of their lives.(n)

programme.title: Gareth's Invictus Choir
programme.desc: First in a two-part documentary in which Gareth Malone takes on a new challenge - to form a choir of wounded ex-servicemen and women to perform at the Invictus Games in May. He begins by meeting Prince Harry, the founder of the games, then sets out on his search to find 12 singers, each of whom has a story to tell of the struggles they have faced since medical discharge. Once together, there follows three days of singing lessons, where Gareth soon realises he has to learn a new way of working with such a fragile group. However, the song he chooses for them triggers unexpected emotions.(n)

programme.title: Room 101
programme.desc: Chat-show host Jonathan Ross, former England cricket captain Michael Vaughan and comedienne Sara Pascoe tell Frank Skinner what really gets on their wick, in the hope he will banish their bugbears to the infamous room for ever. The celebrities' gripes include pick 'n' mix, misuse of the word `literally' and the Grim Reaper.(n)

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: Round-up of national and international news, plus the latest from the money markets.(n)

programme.title: Rip Off Britain: Food
programme.desc: Gloria Hunniford, Angela Rippon and Julia Somerville explore where food comes from and how it is described, revealing why some pork labelled as outside-reared may actually refer to pigs that have spent most of their lives indoors. Plus, why so much of Britain's lamb is imported from New Zealand, despite the country having fields full of sheep, the perils of foraging for mushrooms, and unexpected dangers lurking in imported products.(n)

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Lucy Alexander, Martin Roberts and Dion Dublin explore six apartments in Liverpool, a house in Handsworth, Birmingham, and a three-storey building in Ramsgate, Kent, before meeting the people who bought them at auction.(n)

programme.title: Neighbourhood Blues
programme.desc: Rob McIvor investigates after art galleries in Bath are inundated with Nazi-themed hate mail, and police in Bridgwater carry out an early morning raid in a quiet residential street.(n)

programme.title: Oxford Street Revealed
programme.desc: PC Andy Pescott takes errant pedicab riders to court to try to stop their rule-bending, and the programme follows bus and tube drivers as they face their daily challenges.(n)

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Natasha Raskin presents from Oswestry in Shropshire as two brothers compete against a couple to buy three items each to make the most profit at auction, with expert advice from Jonathan Pratt and John Cameron.(n)

programme.title: Doctors
programme.desc: A confident Al sets out for his great walking adventure from Letherbridge to Lichfield, but ends up dealing with a medical crisis, while Jimmi sees a face from his past as a hostel closes its doors on the homeless, but all is not as it seems.(n)

programme.title: The Code
programme.desc: Matt Allwright hosts the quiz in which contestants must answer questions to help crack a three-digit code that will open a safe full of money. The jackpot starts at £3,000 and each time contestants fail - and that could be after just one wrong answer - they have to leave immediately and another £500 is added to the prize. Matt is assisted by quiz expert Lesley-Anne Brewis.(n)

programme.desc: Alistair Appleton helps a retired couple who have returned from France find a rural home in Lincolnshire on a budget of £300,000. He also meets a local conservationist with an entrepreneurial approach to safeguarding the area's ancient woodland.(n)

programme.desc: Sarah Moore transforms items reclaimed from a Walsall tip, including an art deco train set and a broken sofa, with help from designer Jay Blades. Arthur Smith narrates.(n)

At the end of each round, the team with the most points is eliminated until the final two pairs battle for the chance to compete for a cash prize. Presented by Alexander Armstrong and Richard Osman.(n)

programme.title: Home Ground
programme.desc: Gavin Andrews repairs dry-stone walls in the Mournes and Ruth Sanderson visits the Copeland Islands to take part in a once-in-a-decade survey of coastal birds.(n)

programme.title: Invictus Games 2016
programme.desc: New series. Gabby Logan and Ade Adepitan present coverage from Orlando, Florida, of the second staging of the international multi-sport event for wounded, injured or sick armed forces personnel and veterans, which had its inaugural event two years ago in London. Featuring highlights of the opening ceremony, which featured appearances by patron Prince Harry and First Lady Michelle Obama, as well as performances by James Blunt, Laura Wright and Gareth Malone's Invictus Choir, which was formed specially for the Games.(n)

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Buster continues in his mission to prevent the supermarket buying Ian's restaurant, only for things to fall apart when Kathy embarrasses him in the street. Determined not to give up, he takes a different approach with the help of Johnny and Lee - but they soon realise their new campaign needs money. Tension simmers between Bex and Louise, who both have eyes for Square newcomer Shakil, while Jack asks Ronnie if he and Amy can move in.(n)

programme.title: Invictus Games 2016
programme.desc: Gabby Logan and Ade Adepitan present coverage of the opening events as the sporting action gets underway, with Paralympian Jon-Allan Butterworth introducing highlights of the cycling. Former Royal Marine JJ Chalmers discovers how the athletes from the teams of the 14 countries taking part are finding living together.(n)

programme.title: Peter Kay's Comedy Shuffle
programme.desc: Another selection from the career of the comedian, actor, writer and director, featuring a clip from The Ice Cream Man Cometh episode of his series That Peter Kay Thing. Plus, Peter has a brief chat with Alan Carr, while Phoenix Night's Brian Potter and Andy Pipkin from Little Britain sing I'm Gonna Be (500 Miles) accompanied by star-studded cast.(n)

programme.title: I Want My Wife Back
programme.desc: Murray manages to persuade Bex to go for dinner with him at Lorenzo's, the Italian restaurant where he proposed to her, where he plans to ask her to marry him again. However, the evening gets off to a bad start when Grant loses the ring he was supposed to bring and things go from bad to worse when Julian Wolverton turns up. Comedy, starring Ben Miller and Caroline Catz.(n)

programme.title: Keepin 'er Country
programme.desc: Cameras follow the build-up to the nuptials of Crystal Swing's Dervla Burke, who has set her heart on a country music-theme for her wedding to Tim O'Connor. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Have I Got a Bit More News for You
programme.desc: Actor David Tennant hosts an extended edition of the satirical quiz, with comedian Phil Wang one of the guest panellists joining team captains Ian Hislop and Paul Merton to poke fun at the week's news stories.(n)

programme.title: The Graham Norton Show
programme.desc: Graham is joined by actor Tom Hiddleston, who is starring as country singer Hank Williams in I Saw The Light, John Malkovich, director of the play Good Canary, and Marvel's Nick Fury himself, Hollywood actor Samuel L Jackson. Comedian Sara Pascoe also appears, and there's music by Chvrches.(n)

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: Round-up of national and international news, plus the latest from the money markets.(n)

programme.title: Rip Off Britain: Food
programme.desc: Gloria Hunniford, Angela Rippon and Julia Somerville investigate the secrets of the food business and whether labels and special offers are always what they seem. In the first episode, they explore some of the best-known restaurants to discover how much of the food is actually prepared on each premises. Plus, a look at definitions of the word `local', free trials of diet pills and why wholemeal bread isn't always prepared in the way people might imagine.(n)

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Martin Roberts, Lucy Alexander and Dion Dublin meet the new owners of properties in Chesterton, Staffordshire, Bestwood in Nottingham, and Strawberry Hill, London.(n)

programme.title: Neighbourhood Blues
programme.desc: Officer Dom Bryant gets an anonymous tip-off that cannabis is being grown at a house in the small village of Burnham-on-Sea, but he finds out that all is not what it seems.(n)

programme.title: Oxford Street Revealed
programme.desc: A Tube strike brings chaos to Oxford Street and John Lewis prepares to overhaul its homeware department, while London's Ice Bar gets a refit.(n)

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Two teams are challenged to scour an antiques fair in Hexham, Northumberland and pick up bargains to sell for profit at auction. Experts David Harper and Anita Manning are on hand to offer advice on the best bargains as both sides find military-themed items. Meanwhile, presenter Tim Wonnacott samples the local cheese.(n)

programme.title: BBC Newsline; Weather
programme.desc: Local news worth watching from across Northern Ireland.(n)

programme.title: Doctors
programme.sub-title: A House is Not a Home.
programme.desc: Tempers fray when a `homeless' local is exposed as an undercover journalist, then makes a beeline for someone vulnerable, and Al takes an exciting detour en route to Lichfield.(n)

programme.title: The Code
programme.desc: Matt Allwright hosts the quiz in which contestants must answer questions to help crack a three-digit code that will open a safe full of money. The jackpot starts at £3,000 and each time contestants fail - and that could be after just one wrong answer - they have to leave immediately and another £500 is added to the prize. Matt is assisted by quiz expert Lesley-Anne Brewis.(n)

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Jules Hudson heads to Kent to help a Canadian couple with a budget of £650,000 move away from London and find a home in the county. She also takes a private tour of the garden at Sissinghurst Castle, which was created in the 1930s by writer Vita Sackville-West and her husband Harold Nicolson.(n)

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: Sarah Moore is in Altrincham hoping to find some hidden gems she can transform and send off to a new home. Meanwhile, Bex Simon almost meets her match with a filing cabinet that requires all her creative flair.(n)

programme.title: Put Your Money Where Your Mouth Is
programme.sub-title: Katherine Higgins v Phil Serrell Auction.
programme.desc: Philip Serrell and Katherine Higgins face off at a high end auctioneers in Sussex. She plays a risky game when she spends most of her money on a vintage poster she thinks is a sleeper, but will it pay off?.(n)

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz show in which pairs of contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions posed to 100 people before the show. At the end of each round, the team with the most points is eliminated until the final two pairs battle for the chance to compete for a cash prize. Presented by Alexander Armstrong and Richard Osman.(n)

programme.title: Invictus Games 2016
programme.desc: Gabby Logan, Daraine Mulvihill and Tanni Grey-Thompson present highlights of the morning's track and field events from Orlando, Florida. Also in the programme, ex-Royal Marine JJ Chalmers meets a remarkable powerlifter and Rachael Latham reports on the rowing and archery. Plus, Gabby hears the stories of some inspiring military wives.(n)

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Phil and Aunt Sal turn up at Ronnie's after hearing that a familiar face is back in Albert Square. But Peggy has bad news for her family. Johnny is concerned about the future of his law career if Belinda reports him and Buster to the police. It soon seems everything is forgotten when she invites Mick and Linda to a hot-tub party - only for the evening to take an unexpected turn. As Sonia prepares for her doctor's appointment, a worried Bex turns to Stacey for advice.(n)

programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: Arthur and Morven celebrate their love for each other on a day neither will forget. Meanwhile, Mo listens to her head instead of her heart, leading to a last minute dash to the airport, but is she too late? Elsewhere, Serena is devastated when her actions have terrible consequences for the hospital.(n)

programme.title: In the Club
programme.desc: After walking away from her high-flying career, Roanna is struggling to find a new job, so she reluctantly turns to ex-husband Ray for help. Meanwhile, Rick's release date is finally here so an anxious Diane prepares to welcome him home, and Vicky tries to juggle baby Ben with her full time job. However, when she gets caught up in work, things goes terribly wrong, with disastrous consequences. Elsewhere, Jasmin and Dev have to make the biggest decision of their lives.(n)

programme.title: Gareth's Invictus Choir
programme.desc: First in a two-part documentary in which Gareth Malone takes on a new challenge - to form a choir of wounded ex-servicemen and women to perform at the Invictus Games in May. He begins by meeting Prince Harry, the founder of the games, then sets out on his search to find 12 singers, each of whom has a story to tell of the struggles they have faced since medical discharge. Once together, there follows three days of singing lessons, where Gareth soon realises he has to learn a new way of working with such a fragile group. However, the song he chooses for them triggers unexpected emotions.(n)

programme.title: Room 101
programme.desc: Chat-show host Jonathan Ross, former England cricket captain Michael Vaughan and comedienne Sara Pascoe tell Frank Skinner what really gets on their wick, in the hope he will banish their bugbears to the infamous room for ever. The celebrities' gripes include pick 'n' mix, misuse of the word `literally' and the Grim Reaper.(n)

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: Round-up of national and international news, plus the latest from the money markets.(n)

programme.title: Rip Off Britain: Food
programme.desc: Gloria Hunniford, Angela Rippon and Julia Somerville explore where food comes from and how it is described, revealing why some pork labelled as outside-reared may actually refer to pigs that have spent most of their lives indoors. Plus, why so much of Britain's lamb is imported from New Zealand, despite the country having fields full of sheep, the perils of foraging for mushrooms, and unexpected dangers lurking in imported products.(n)

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Lucy Alexander, Martin Roberts and Dion Dublin explore six apartments in Liverpool, a house in Handsworth, Birmingham, and a three-storey building in Ramsgate, Kent, before meeting the people who bought them at auction.(n)

programme.title: Neighbourhood Blues
programme.desc: Rob McIvor investigates after art galleries in Bath are inundated with Nazi-themed hate mail, and police in Bridgwater carry out an early morning raid in a quiet residential street.(n)

programme.title: Oxford Street Revealed
programme.desc: PC Andy Pescott takes errant pedicab riders to court to try to stop their rule-bending, and the programme follows bus and tube drivers as they face their daily challenges.(n)

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Natasha Raskin presents from Oswestry in Shropshire as two brothers compete against a couple to buy three items each to make the most profit at auction, with expert advice from Jonathan Pratt and John Cameron.(n)

programme.title: Doctors
programme.desc: A confident Al sets out for his great walking adventure from Letherbridge to Lichfield, but ends up dealing with a medical crisis, while Jimmi sees a face from his past as a hostel closes its doors on the homeless, but all is not as it seems.(n)
