She also takes a private tour of the garden at Sissinghurst Castle, which was created in the 1930s by writer Vita Sackville-West and her husband Harold Nicolson.(n)

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: Sarah Moore is in Altrincham hoping to find some hidden gems she can transform and send off to a new home. Meanwhile, Bex Simon almost meets her match with a filing cabinet that requires all her creative flair.(n)

programme.title: Put Your Money Where Your Mouth Is
programme.sub-title: Katherine Higgins v Phil Serrell Auction.
programme.desc: Philip Serrell and Katherine Higgins face off at a high end auctioneers in Sussex. She plays a risky game when she spends most of her money on a vintage poster she thinks is a sleeper, but will it pay off?.(n)

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz show in which pairs of contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions posed to 100 people before the show. At the end of each round, the team with the most points is eliminated until the final two pairs battle for the chance to compete for a cash prize. Presented by Alexander Armstrong and Richard Osman.(n)

programme.title: Invictus Games 2016
programme.desc: Gabby Logan, Daraine Mulvihill and Tanni Grey-Thompson present highlights of the morning's track and field events from Orlando, Florida. Also in the programme, ex-Royal Marine JJ Chalmers meets a remarkable powerlifter and Rachael Latham reports on the rowing and archery. Plus, Gabby hears the stories of some inspiring military wives.(n)

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Phil and Aunt Sal turn up at Ronnie's after hearing that a familiar face is back in Albert Square. But Peggy has bad news for her family. Johnny is concerned about the future of his law career if Belinda reports him and Buster to the police. It soon seems everything is forgotten when she invites Mick and Linda to a hot-tub party - only for the evening to take an unexpected turn. As Sonia prepares for her doctor's appointment, a worried Bex turns to Stacey for advice.(n)

programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: Arthur and Morven celebrate their love for each other on a day neither will forget. Meanwhile, Mo listens to her head instead of her heart, leading to a last minute dash to the airport, but is she too late? Elsewhere, Serena is devastated when her actions have terrible consequences for the hospital.(n)

programme.title: In the Club
programme.desc: After walking away from her high-flying career, Roanna is struggling to find a new job, so she reluctantly turns to ex-husband Ray for help. Meanwhile, Rick's release date is finally here so an anxious Diane prepares to welcome him home, and Vicky tries to juggle baby Ben with her full time job. However, when she gets caught up in work, things goes terribly wrong, with disastrous consequences. Elsewhere, Jasmin and Dev have to make the biggest decision of their lives.(n)

programme.title: Gareth's Invictus Choir
programme.desc: First in a two-part documentary in which Gareth Malone takes on a new challenge - to form a choir of wounded ex-servicemen and women to perform at the Invictus Games in May. He begins by meeting Prince Harry, the founder of the games, then sets out on his search to find 12 singers, each of whom has a story to tell of the struggles they have faced since medical discharge. Once together, there follows three days of singing lessons, where Gareth soon realises he has to learn a new way of working with such a fragile group. However, the song he chooses for them triggers unexpected emotions.(n)

programme.title: Room 101
programme.desc: Chat-show host Jonathan Ross, former England cricket captain Michael Vaughan and comedienne Sara Pascoe tell Frank Skinner what really gets on their wick, in the hope he will banish their bugbears to the infamous room for ever. The celebrities' gripes include pick 'n' mix, misuse of the word `literally' and the Grim Reaper.(n)

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: Round-up of national and international news, plus the latest from the money markets.(n)

programme.title: Rip Off Britain: Food
programme.desc: Gloria Hunniford, Angela Rippon and Julia Somerville explore where food comes from and how it is described, revealing why some pork labelled as outside-reared may actually refer to pigs that have spent most of their lives indoors. Plus, why so much of Britain's lamb is imported from New Zealand, despite the country having fields full of sheep, the perils of foraging for mushrooms, and unexpected dangers lurking in imported products.(n)

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Lucy Alexander, Martin Roberts and Dion Dublin explore six apartments in Liverpool, a house in Handsworth, Birmingham, and a three-storey building in Ramsgate, Kent, before meeting the people who bought them at auction.(n)

programme.title: Neighbourhood Blues
programme.desc: Rob McIvor investigates after art galleries in Bath are inundated with Nazi-themed hate mail, and police in Bridgwater carry out an early morning raid in a quiet residential street.(n)

programme.title: Oxford Street Revealed
programme.desc: PC Andy Pescott takes errant pedicab riders to court to try to stop their rule-bending, and the programme follows bus and tube drivers as they face their daily challenges.(n)

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Natasha Raskin presents from Oswestry in Shropshire as two brothers compete against a couple to buy three items each to make the most profit at auction, with expert advice from Jonathan Pratt and John Cameron.(n)

programme.title: Doctors
programme.desc: A confident Al sets out for his great walking adventure from Letherbridge to Lichfield, but ends up dealing with a medical crisis, while Jimmi sees a face from his past as a hostel closes its doors on the homeless, but all is not as it seems.(n)

programme.title: The Code
programme.desc: Matt Allwright hosts the quiz in which contestants must answer questions to help crack a three-digit code that will open a safe full of money. The jackpot starts at £3,000 and each time contestants fail - and that could be after just one wrong answer - they have to leave immediately and another £500 is added to the prize. Matt is assisted by quiz expert Lesley-Anne Brewis.(n)

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Alistair Appleton helps a retired couple who have returned from France find a rural home in Lincolnshire on a budget of £300,000. He also meets a local conservationist with an entrepreneurial approach to safeguarding the area's ancient woodland.(n)

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: Sarah Moore transforms items reclaimed from a Walsall tip, including an art deco train set and a broken sofa, with help from designer Jay Blades. Arthur Smith narrates.(n)

programme.title: Put Your Money Where Your Mouth Is
programme.sub-title: Katherine Higgins v Phil Serrell Foreign Antiques Market.
programme.desc: The return of the challenge in which antiques experts go head to head in a competition, beginning with Katherine Higgins and Philip Serrell visiting a market in Paris.(n)

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz show in which pairs of contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions posed to 100 people before the show. At the end of each round, the team with the most points is eliminated until the final two pairs battle for the chance to compete for a cash prize. Presented by Alexander Armstrong and Richard Osman.(n)

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: The first visit of the week to the One Show studio, where Matt Baker and Alex Jones present the usual mix of topical stories and celebrity chat.(n)

programme.title: Invictus Games 2016
programme.desc: New series. Gabby Logan and Ade Adepitan present coverage from Orlando, Florida, of the second staging of the international multi-sport event for wounded, injured or sick armed forces personnel and veterans, which had its inaugural event two years ago in London. Featuring highlights of the opening ceremony, which featured appearances by patron Prince Harry and First Lady Michelle Obama, as well as performances by James Blunt, Laura Wright and Gareth Malone's Invictus Choir, which was formed specially for the Games.(n)

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Buster continues in his mission to prevent the supermarket buying Ian's restaurant, only for things to fall apart when Kathy embarrasses him in the street. Determined not to give up, he takes a different approach with the help of Johnny and Lee - but they soon realise their new campaign needs money. Tension simmers between Bex and Louise, who both have eyes for Square newcomer Shakil, while Jack asks Ronnie if he and Amy can move in.(n)

programme.title: Invictus Games 2016
programme.desc: Gabby Logan and Ade Adepitan present coverage of the opening events as the sporting action gets underway, with Paralympian Jon-Allan Butterworth introducing highlights of the cycling. Former Royal Marine JJ Chalmers discovers how the athletes from the teams of the 14 countries taking part are finding living together.(n)

programme.title: Peter Kay's Comedy Shuffle
programme.desc: Another selection from the career of the comedian, actor, writer and director, featuring a clip from The Ice Cream Man Cometh episode of his series That Peter Kay Thing. Plus, Peter has a brief chat with Alan Carr, while Phoenix Night's Brian Potter and Andy Pipkin from Little Britain sing I'm Gonna Be (500 Miles) accompanied by star-studded cast.(n)

programme.title: I Want My Wife Back
programme.desc: Murray manages to persuade Bex to go for dinner with him at Lorenzo's, the Italian restaurant where he proposed to her, where he plans to ask her to marry him again. However, the evening gets off to a bad start when Grant loses the ring he was supposed to bring and things go from bad to worse when Julian Wolverton turns up. Comedy, starring Ben Miller and Caroline Catz.(n)

programme.title: Have I Got a Bit More News for You
programme.desc: Actor David Tennant hosts an extended edition of the satirical quiz, with comedian Phil Wang one of the guest panellists joining team captains Ian Hislop and Paul Merton to poke fun at the week's news stories.(n)

programme.title: The Graham Norton Show
programme.desc: Graham is joined by actor Tom Hiddleston, who is starring as country singer Hank Williams in I Saw The Light, John Malkovich, director of the play Good Canary, and Marvel's Nick Fury himself, Hollywood actor Samuel L Jackson. Comedian Sara Pascoe also appears, and there's music by Chvrches.(n)

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: Round-up of national and international news, plus the latest from the money markets.(n)

programme.title: Rip Off Britain: Food
programme.desc: Gloria Hunniford, Angela Rippon and Julia Somerville investigate the secrets of the food business and whether labels and special offers are always what they seem. In the first episode, they explore some of the best-known restaurants to discover how much of the food is actually prepared on each premises. Plus, a look at definitions of the word `local', free trials of diet pills and why wholemeal bread isn't always prepared in the way people might imagine.(n)

programme.title: Oxford Street Revealed
programme.desc: A Tube strike brings chaos to Oxford Street and John Lewis prepares to overhaul its homeware department, while London's Ice Bar gets a refit.(n)

The jackpot starts at £3,000 and each time contestants fail - and that could be after just one wrong answer - they have to leave immediately and another £500 is added to the prize. Matt is assisted by quiz expert Lesley-Anne Brewis.(n)

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Jules Hudson heads to Kent to help a Canadian couple with a budget of £650,000 move away from London and find a home in the county. She also takes a private tour of the garden at Sissinghurst Castle, which was created in the 1930s by writer Vita Sackville-West and her husband Harold Nicolson.(n)

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: Sarah Moore is in Altrincham hoping to find some hidden gems she can transform and send off to a new home. Meanwhile, Bex Simon almost meets her match with a filing cabinet that requires all her creative flair.(n)

programme.title: Put Your Money Where Your Mouth Is
programme.sub-title: Katherine Higgins v Phil Serrell Auction.
programme.desc: Philip Serrell and Katherine Higgins face off at a high end auctioneers in Sussex. She plays a risky game when she spends most of her money on a vintage poster she thinks is a sleeper, but will it pay off?.(n)

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz show in which pairs of contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions posed to 100 people before the show. At the end of each round, the team with the most points is eliminated until the final two pairs battle for the chance to compete for a cash prize. Presented by Alexander Armstrong and Richard Osman.(n)

programme.title: Invictus Games 2016
programme.desc: Gabby Logan, Daraine Mulvihill and Tanni Grey-Thompson present highlights of the morning's track and field events from Orlando, Florida. Also in the programme, ex-Royal Marine JJ Chalmers meets a remarkable powerlifter and Rachael Latham reports on the rowing and archery. Plus, Gabby hears the stories of some inspiring military wives.(n)

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Phil and Aunt Sal turn up at Ronnie's after hearing that a familiar face is back in Albert Square. But Peggy has bad news for her family. Johnny is concerned about the future of his law career if Belinda reports him and Buster to the police. It soon seems everything is forgotten when she invites Mick and Linda to a hot-tub party - only for the evening to take an unexpected turn. As Sonia prepares for her doctor's appointment, a worried Bex turns to Stacey for advice.(n)

programme.title: River City
programme.desc: The Murdochs try evicting Caitlin and family from their latest property. Will the mayhem that ensues threaten Jenny's chances of clinching her crucial exams? Meanwhile, Robbie has the glad eye for the Tall Ship's latest bar manager.(n)

programme.title: In the Club
programme.desc: After walking away from her high-flying career, Roanna is struggling to find a new job, so she reluctantly turns to ex-husband Ray for help. Meanwhile, Rick's release date is finally here so an anxious Diane prepares to welcome him home, and Vicky tries to juggle baby Ben with her full time job. However, when she gets caught up in work, things goes terribly wrong, with disastrous consequences. Elsewhere, Jasmin and Dev have to make the biggest decision of their lives.(n)

programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: Arthur and Morven celebrate their love for each other on a day neither will forget. Meanwhile, Mo listens to her head instead of her heart, leading to a last minute dash to the airport, but is she too late? Elsewhere, Serena is devastated when her actions have terrible consequences for the hospital.(n)

programme.title: Gareth's Invictus Choir
programme.desc: First in a two-part documentary in which Gareth Malone takes on a new challenge - to form a choir of wounded ex-servicemen and women to perform at the Invictus Games in May. He begins by meeting Prince Harry, the founder of the games, then sets out on his search to find 12 singers, each of whom has a story to tell of the struggles they have faced since medical discharge. Once together, there follows three days of singing lessons, where Gareth soon realises he has to learn a new way of working with such a fragile group. However, the song he chooses for them triggers unexpected emotions.(n)

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: Round-up of national and international news, plus the latest from the money markets.(n)

programme.title: Rip Off Britain: Food
programme.desc: Gloria Hunniford, Angela Rippon and Julia Somerville explore where food comes from and how it is described, revealing why some pork labelled as outside-reared may actually refer to pigs that have spent most of their lives indoors. Plus, why so much of Britain's lamb is imported from New Zealand, despite the country having fields full of sheep, the perils of foraging for mushrooms, and unexpected dangers lurking in imported products.(n)

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Lucy Alexander, Martin Roberts and Dion Dublin explore six apartments in Liverpool, a house in Handsworth, Birmingham, and a three-storey building in Ramsgate, Kent, before meeting the people who bought them at auction.(n)

programme.title: Neighbourhood Blues
programme.desc: Rob McIvor investigates after art galleries in Bath are inundated with Nazi-themed hate mail, and police in Bridgwater carry out an early morning raid in a quiet residential street.(n)

programme.title: Oxford Street Revealed
programme.desc: PC Andy Pescott takes errant pedicab riders to court to try to stop their rule-bending, and the programme follows bus and tube drivers as they face their daily challenges.(n)

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Natasha Raskin presents from Oswestry in Shropshire as two brothers compete against a couple to buy three items each to make the most profit at auction, with expert advice from Jonathan Pratt and John Cameron.(n)

programme.title: Doctors
programme.desc: A confident Al sets out for his great walking adventure from Letherbridge to Lichfield, but ends up dealing with a medical crisis, while Jimmi sees a face from his past as a hostel closes its doors on the homeless, but all is not as it seems.(n)

programme.title: The Code
programme.desc: Matt Allwright hosts the quiz in which contestants must answer questions to help crack a three-digit code that will open a safe full of money. The jackpot starts at £3,000 and each time contestants fail - and that could be after just one wrong answer - they have to leave immediately and another £500 is added to the prize. Matt is assisted by quiz expert Lesley-Anne Brewis.(n)

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Alistair Appleton helps a retired couple who have returned from France find a rural home in Lincolnshire on a budget of £300,000. He also meets a local conservationist with an entrepreneurial approach to safeguarding the area's ancient woodland.(n)

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: Sarah Moore transforms items reclaimed from a Walsall tip, including an art deco train set and a broken sofa, with help from designer Jay Blades. Arthur Smith narrates.(n)

programme.title: Put Your Money Where Your Mouth Is
programme.sub-title: Katherine Higgins v Phil Serrell Foreign Antiques Market.
programme.desc: The return of the challenge in which antiques experts go head to head in a competition, beginning with Katherine Higgins and Philip Serrell visiting a market in Paris.(n)

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz show in which pairs of contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions posed to 100 people before the show. At the end of each round, the team with the most points is eliminated until the final two pairs battle for the chance to compete for a cash prize. Presented by Alexander Armstrong and Richard Osman.(n)

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: The first visit of the week to the One Show studio, where Matt Baker and Alex Jones present the usual mix of topical stories and celebrity chat.(n)

programme.title: Invictus Games 2016
programme.desc: New series. Gabby Logan and Ade Adepitan present coverage from Orlando, Florida, of the second staging of the international multi-sport event for wounded, injured or sick armed forces personnel and veterans, which had its inaugural event two years ago in London. Featuring highlights of the opening ceremony, which featured appearances by patron Prince Harry and First Lady Michelle Obama, as well as performances by James Blunt, Laura Wright and Gareth Malone's Invictus Choir, which was formed specially for the Games.(n)

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Buster continues in his mission to prevent the supermarket buying Ian's restaurant, only for things to fall apart when Kathy embarrasses him in the street. Determined not to give up, he takes a different approach with the help of Johnny and Lee - but they soon realise their new campaign needs money. Tension simmers between Bex and Louise, who both have eyes for Square newcomer Shakil, while Jack asks Ronnie if he and Amy can move in.(n)

programme.title: Invictus Games 2016
programme.desc: Gabby Logan and Ade Adepitan present coverage of the opening events as the sporting action gets underway, with Paralympian Jon-Allan Butterworth introducing highlights of the cycling. Former Royal Marine JJ Chalmers discovers how the athletes from the teams of the 14 countries taking part are finding living together.(n)

programme.title: Peter Kay's Comedy Shuffle
programme.desc: Another selection from the career of the comedian, actor, writer and director, featuring a clip from The Ice Cream Man Cometh episode of his series That Peter Kay Thing. Plus, Peter has a brief chat with Alan Carr, while Phoenix Night's Brian Potter and Andy Pipkin from Little Britain sing I'm Gonna Be (500 Miles) accompanied by star-studded cast.(n)

programme.title: I Want My Wife Back
programme.desc: Murray manages to persuade Bex to go for dinner with him at Lorenzo's, the Italian restaurant where he proposed to her, where he plans to ask her to marry him again. However, the evening gets off to a bad start when Grant loses the ring he was supposed to bring and things go from bad to worse when Julian Wolverton turns up. Comedy, starring Ben Miller and Caroline Catz.(n)

programme.title: Have I Got a Bit More News for You
programme.desc: Actor David Tennant hosts an extended edition of the satirical quiz, with comedian Phil Wang one of the guest panellists joining team captains Ian Hislop and Paul Merton to poke fun at the week's news stories.(n)

programme.title: The Graham Norton Show
programme.desc: Graham is joined by actor Tom Hiddleston, who is starring as country singer Hank Williams in I Saw The Light, John Malkovich, director of the play Good Canary, and Marvel's Nick Fury himself, Hollywood actor Samuel L Jackson. Comedian Sara Pascoe also appears, and there's music by Chvrches.(n)

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: Round-up of national and international news, plus the latest from the money markets.(n)

programme.title: Rip Off Britain: Food
programme.desc: Gloria Hunniford, Angela Rippon and Julia Somerville investigate the secrets of the food business and whether labels and special offers are always what they seem. In the first episode, they explore some of the best-known restaurants to discover how much of the food is actually prepared on each premises. Plus, a look at definitions of the word `local', free trials of diet pills and why wholemeal bread isn't always prepared in the way people might imagine.(n)

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Martin Roberts, Lucy Alexander and Dion Dublin meet the new owners of properties in Chesterton, Staffordshire, Bestwood in Nottingham, and Strawberry Hill, London.(n)

programme.title: Neighbourhood Blues

programme.title: Oxford Street Revealed
programme.desc: A Tube strike brings chaos to Oxford Street and John Lewis prepares to overhaul its homeware department, while London's Ice Bar gets a refit.(n)

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Two teams are challenged to scour an antiques fair in Hexham, Northumberland and pick up bargains to sell for profit at auction. Experts David Harper and Anita Manning are on hand to offer advice on the best bargains as both sides find military-themed items. Meanwhile, presenter Tim Wonnacott samples the local cheese.(n)

programme.desc: A confident Al sets out for his great walking adventure from Letherbridge to Lichfield, but ends up dealing with a medical crisis, while Jimmi sees a face from his past as a hostel closes its doors on the homeless, but all is not as it seems.(n)

programme.title: The Code
programme.desc: Matt Allwright hosts the quiz in which contestants must answer questions to help crack a three-digit code that will open a safe full of money. The jackpot starts at £3,000 and each time contestants fail - and that could be after just one wrong answer - they have to leave immediately and another £500 is added to the prize. Matt is assisted by quiz expert Lesley-Anne Brewis.(n)

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Alistair Appleton helps a retired couple who have returned from France find a rural home in Lincolnshire on a budget of £300,000. He also meets a local conservationist with an entrepreneurial approach to safeguarding the area's ancient woodland.(n)

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: Sarah Moore transforms items reclaimed from a Walsall tip, including an art deco train set and a broken sofa, with help from designer Jay Blades. Arthur Smith narrates.(n)

programme.title: Put Your Money Where Your Mouth Is
programme.sub-title: Katherine Higgins v Phil Serrell Foreign Antiques Market.
programme.desc: The return of the challenge in which antiques experts go head to head in a competition, beginning with Katherine Higgins and Philip Serrell visiting a market in Paris.(n)

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz show in which pairs of contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions posed to 100 people before the show. At the end of each round, the team with the most points is eliminated until the final two pairs battle for the chance to compete for a cash prize. Presented by Alexander Armstrong and Richard Osman.(n)

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: The first visit of the week to the One Show studio, where Matt Baker and Alex Jones present the usual mix of topical stories and celebrity chat.(n)

programme.title: Invictus Games 2016
programme.desc: New series. Gabby Logan and Ade Adepitan present coverage from Orlando, Florida, of the second staging of the international multi-sport event for wounded, injured or sick armed forces personnel and veterans, which had its inaugural event two years ago in London. Featuring highlights of the opening ceremony, which featured appearances by patron Prince Harry and First Lady Michelle Obama, as well as performances by James Blunt, Laura Wright and Gareth Malone's Invictus Choir, which was formed specially for the Games.(n)

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Buster continues in his mission to prevent the supermarket buying Ian's restaurant, only for things to fall apart when Kathy embarrasses him in the street. Determined not to give up, he takes a different approach with the help of Johnny and Lee - but they soon realise their new campaign needs money. Tension simmers between Bex and Louise, who both have eyes for Square newcomer Shakil, while Jack asks Ronnie if he and Amy can move in.(n)

programme.title: Invictus Games 2016
programme.desc: Gabby Logan and Ade Adepitan present coverage of the opening events as the sporting action gets underway, with Paralympian Jon-Allan Butterworth introducing highlights of the cycling. Former Royal Marine JJ Chalmers discovers how the athletes from the teams of the 14 countries taking part are finding living together.(n)

programme.title: Peter Kay's Comedy Shuffle
programme.desc: Another selection from the career of the comedian, actor, writer and director, featuring a clip from The Ice Cream Man Cometh episode of his series That Peter Kay Thing. Plus, Peter has a brief chat with Alan Carr, while Phoenix Night's Brian Potter and Andy Pipkin from Little Britain sing I'm Gonna Be (500 Miles) accompanied by star-studded cast.(n)

programme.title: I Want My Wife Back
programme.desc: Murray manages to persuade Bex to go for dinner with him at Lorenzo's, the Italian restaurant where he proposed to her, where he plans to ask her to marry him again. However, the evening gets off to a bad start when Grant loses the ring he was supposed to bring and things go from bad to worse when Julian Wolverton turns up. Comedy, starring Ben Miller and Caroline Catz.(n)

programme.title: Have I Got a Bit More News for You
programme.desc: Actor David Tennant hosts an extended edition of the satirical quiz, with comedian Phil Wang one of the guest panellists joining team captains Ian Hislop and Paul Merton to poke fun at the week's news stories.(n)

programme.title: The Graham Norton Show
programme.desc: Graham is joined by actor Tom Hiddleston, who is starring as country singer Hank Williams in I Saw The Light, John Malkovich, director of the play Good Canary, and Marvel's Nick Fury himself, Hollywood actor Samuel L Jackson. Comedian Sara Pascoe also appears, and there's music by Chvrches.(n)

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: Round-up of national and international news, plus the latest from the money markets.(n)

programme.title: Rip Off Britain: Food
programme.desc: Gloria Hunniford, Angela Rippon and Julia Somerville investigate the secrets of the food business and whether labels and special offers are always what they seem. In the first episode, they explore some of the best-known restaurants to discover how much of the food is actually prepared on each premises. Plus, a look at definitions of the word `local', free trials of diet pills and why wholemeal bread isn't always prepared in the way people might imagine.(n)

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Martin Roberts, Lucy Alexander and Dion Dublin meet the new owners of properties in Chesterton, Staffordshire, Bestwood in Nottingham, and Strawberry Hill, London.(n)

programme.title: Neighbourhood Blues
programme.desc: Officer Dom Bryant gets an anonymous tip-off that cannabis is being grown at a house in the small village of Burnham-on-Sea, but he finds out that all is not what it seems.(n)

programme.title: Oxford Street Revealed
programme.desc: A Tube strike brings chaos to Oxford Street and John Lewis prepares to overhaul its homeware department, while London's Ice Bar gets a refit.(n)

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Two teams are challenged to scour an antiques fair in Hexham, Northumberland and pick up bargains to sell for profit at auction. Experts David Harper and Anita Manning are on hand to offer advice on the best bargains as both sides find military-themed items. Meanwhile, presenter Tim Wonnacott samples the local cheese.(n)

programme.title: Doctors
programme.sub-title: A House is Not a Home.
programme.desc: Tempers fray when a `homeless' local is exposed as an undercover journalist, then makes a beeline for someone vulnerable, and Al takes an exciting detour en route to Lichfield.(n)

programme.title: The Code
programme.desc: Matt Allwright hosts the quiz in which contestants must answer questions to help crack a three-digit code that will open a safe full of money. The jackpot starts at £3,000 and each time contestants fail - and that could be after just one wrong answer - they have to leave immediately and another £500 is added to the prize. Matt is assisted by quiz expert Lesley-Anne Brewis.(n)

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Jules Hudson heads to Kent to help a Canadian couple with a budget of £650,000 move away from London and find a home in the county. She also takes a private tour of the garden at Sissinghurst Castle, which was created in the 1930s by writer Vita Sackville-West and her husband Harold Nicolson.(n)

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: Sarah Moore is in Altrincham hoping to find some hidden gems she can transform and send off to a new home. Meanwhile, Bex Simon almost meets her match with a filing cabinet that requires all her creative flair.(n)

programme.title: Put Your Money Where Your Mouth Is
programme.sub-title: Katherine Higgins v Phil Serrell Auction.
programme.desc: Philip Serrell and Katherine Higgins face off at a high end auctioneers in Sussex. She plays a risky game when she spends most of her money on a vintage poster she thinks is a sleeper, but will it pay off?.(n)

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz show in which pairs of contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions posed to 100 people before the show. At the end of each round, the team with the most points is eliminated until the final two pairs battle for the chance to compete for a cash prize. Presented by Alexander Armstrong and Richard Osman.(n)

programme.title: Invictus Games 2016
programme.desc: Gabby Logan, Daraine Mulvihill and Tanni Grey-Thompson present highlights of the morning's track and field events from Orlando, Florida. Also in the programme, ex-Royal Marine JJ Chalmers meets a remarkable powerlifter and Rachael Latham reports on the rowing and archery. Plus, Gabby hears the stories of some inspiring military wives.(n)

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Phil and Aunt Sal turn up at Ronnie's after hearing that a familiar face is back in Albert Square. But Peggy has bad news for her family. Johnny is concerned about the future of his law career if Belinda reports him and Buster to the police. It soon seems everything is forgotten when she invites Mick and Linda to a hot-tub party - only for the evening to take an unexpected turn. As Sonia prepares for her doctor's appointment, a worried Bex turns to Stacey for advice.(n)

programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: Arthur and Morven celebrate their love for each other on a day neither will forget. Meanwhile, Mo listens to her head instead of her heart, leading to a last minute dash to the airport, but is she too late? Elsewhere, Serena is devastated when her actions have terrible consequences for the hospital.(n)

programme.title: In the Club
programme.desc: After walking away from her high-flying career, Roanna is struggling to find a new job, so she reluctantly turns to ex-husband Ray for help. Meanwhile, Rick's release date is finally here so an anxious Diane prepares to welcome him home, and Vicky tries to juggle baby Ben with her full time job. However, when she gets caught up in work, things goes terribly wrong, with disastrous consequences. Elsewhere, Jasmin and Dev have to make the biggest decision of their lives.(n)

programme.title: Gareth's Invictus Choir
programme.desc: First in a two-part documentary in which Gareth Malone takes on a new challenge - to form a choir of wounded ex-servicemen and women to perform at the Invictus Games in May. He begins by meeting Prince Harry, the founder of the games, then sets out on his search to find 12 singers, each of whom has a story to tell of the struggles they have faced since medical discharge. Once together, there follows three days of singing lessons, where Gareth soon realises he has to learn a new way of working with such a fragile group. However, the song he chooses for them triggers unexpected emotions.(n)

programme.title: Room 101
programme.desc: Chat-show host Jonathan Ross, former England cricket captain Michael Vaughan and comedienne Sara Pascoe tell Frank Skinner what really gets on their wick, in the hope he will banish their bugbears to the infamous room for ever. The celebrities' gripes include pick 'n' mix, misuse of the word `literally' and the Grim Reaper.(n)

programme.title: Flog It! Trade Secrets
programme.desc: The experts look at how items connected to domestic servants can have as much appeal to collectors as their grander counterparts, and presenter Paul Martin explores the history of the Arts and Crafts movement.(n)

programme.title: Neighbourhood Blues
programme.desc: Rav Wilding reports on an operation to reel in a suspected heroin dealer, a case involving a young shop worker suspected of stealing thousands of pounds' worth of items from his employer, and a neighbour from hell who has the tenants in her block of flats living in fear.(n)

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Jules Hudson heads to the North Wessex Downs area of southern England to help a couple to buy their very first home in Britain. Traditional character is high on the pair's wish list, and they have a £500,000 budget to work within. Jules also visits a master clock maker where he examines the delicate inner workings of a 300-year-old timepiece.(n)

programme.title: Food Detectives
programme.desc: Scientist Alice Roberts, chef Tom Kerridge and consumer journalist Sean Fletcher unite their expertise to help viewers make the best food choices. In the first edition, Alice investigates campylobacter, the most common cause of food poisoning in the UK, often found on fresh chilled chickens. Tom helps a viewer who cannot cook fish without ruining it, and shares his secret for perfect pork using a process called brining. Plus, Sean discovers when is it worth buying premium brands when there are money-saving basic alternatives available.(n)

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don gets his new vegetable patch under way by making raised beds and offers advice on how to cut back herbs. Meanwhile, Nick Bailey marks the 400th anniversary of William Shakespeare's death when he investigates the fact and fiction behind the Bard's potions and poisons at the Chelsea Physic Garden, and there is a visit to Pashley Manor in East Sussex to unearth the story behind the planting of 25,000 tulips.(n)

programme.title: Victoria Derbyshire
programme.desc: Daily news and current-affairs programme offering discussion of breaking stories, exclusive interviews and audience interaction via social media.(n)

programme.title: BBC Newsroom Live
programme.desc: A chance to stay up to date on the day's leading stories, with the latest breaking news as it happens.(n)

programme.title: Daily Politics
programme.desc: Parliamentary proceedings interspersed with discussions, interviews and filmed reports from around the country. Presented by Jo Coburn.(n)

programme.title: Coast
programme.desc: As the team travels the 200 miles from Hull to London, Neil Oliver visits the birthplace of Lord Nelson, and Sutton Hoo, one of Britain's landmark archaeological sites. Alice Roberts heads to the shingle bank at Orford Ness to learn how the first British radar station worked, and Nick Crane explores the home of the early Britons off the Norfolk coast. Miranda Krestovnikoff wades out in the mud of the Wash, while Mark Horton joins the crew of an Essex fishing boat.(n)

programme.title: Athletics
programme.desc: Gabby Logan presents action from the opening Diamond League event of the season, held at the Hamad Bin Suhaim Stadium in Doha, Qatar.(n)

programme.title: My Life on a Plate
programme.desc: Brian Turner accompanies Diane Louise Jordan on a trip to her childhood home of Hatfield, Hertfordshire, where she remembers her mother's Caribbean cooking and school lunches.(n)

programme.title: Holiday of My Lifetime with Len Goodman
programme.desc: Strictly Come Dancing judge Len Goodman invites celebrity guests to reminisce about one of their favourite holidays. TV cook and Hairy Biker Dave Myers accompanies the host on a revisit to the Isle of Man to recall a 1967 seaside vacation where he reveals how his original trip played a significant role in his love of food and motorbikes.(n)

programme.title: Indian Ocean with Simon Reeve
programme.desc: The fourth leg of the adventurer's journey takes him from Oman to the Maldives. He starts in the Strait of Hormuz, where oil from the Gulf is shipped through the narrow channel, then moves on to Mumbai, the ocean's biggest port. In the Maldives, Simon finds arguably the most beautiful collection of tropical coral islands in the world - but the fragile underwater environment is a barometer for the changing nature of the sea, as he witnesses how bleaching has damaged the coral and an entire island has been manufactured as a landfill dump to deal with the problem of rubbish.(n)

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo embarks on a journey to Chichester, with the first leg beginning in Norwich. At the city's Norman castle he uncovers the Victorian public's gory fascination with crime and punishment and finds out how campaigners such as Elizabeth Fry worked to improve conditions for prisoners. Heading west to Thetford, he explores how the Victorian appetite for rabbits and their fur led to special train services to London, and ends in the Suffolk town of Brandon, where he tries his hand at flint-knapping.(n)

programme.title: Flog It
programme.desc: Paul Martin presents an edition about the London auction of a carved Chinese libation cup discovered at a valuation day at Balbirnie House, Fife. The presenter visits the Museum of East Asian Art in Bath to learn more about the object's history and discusses the recent popularity of Chinese art.(n)

programme.title: Eggheads
programme.desc: Jeremy Vine hosts the quiz in which the winners of famous game shows including Mastermind and Who Wants to Be a Millionaire? work as a team to tackle a new set of challengers hoping to win a cash prize.(n)

programme.title: Big Blue UK
programme.desc: Hugh Fearnley-Whittingstall and a team of experts detail the lives of marine animals visiting and thriving in UK waters each summer, beginning by finding out where on the coast it is possible to see dolphins and whales. With contributions by wildlife cameraman Richard Taylor-Jones and BBC Springwatch Extra presenter Lindsey Chapman.(n)

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Anita Manning and David Harper travel to the Isle of Bute, Glasgow and Renfrewshire on the last leg of their journey, before ending at an auction in Paisley. Philip Serrell and Natasha Raskin then take up the baton as they set off on a quest to seek out bargains they hope will make a profit at auction, with their first leg ending at an auction in Llanelli.(n)

programme.title: Choose the Right Puppy for You
programme.desc: Part one of two. Kate Humble presents a guide to buying a dog, featuring advice from experts on how to pick one that best suits prospective owners' lifestyles and home environments. Behaviourist Louise Glazebrook is on hand to help people find the perfect puppy for them - including a family who have never had a dog before and have no idea where to start, as well as a flight attendant who is determined a big dog is right for him.(n)

programme.title: Attenborough's Life That Glows
programme.desc: David Attenborough explores the world of bioluminescence, the often spectacular natural light produced by creatures including glow-worms, fireflies and plankton, using specially designed cameras, some fitted to a new generation of deep-sea submersibles and robots to record instances in the very deep ocean. The programme shows a millipede glowing on the forest floor in California, the mesmerising flashing light patterns of the synchronous firefly, the spooky glow of a rare dragon fish and luminous earth worms in France.(n)

programme.title: Upstart Crow
programme.desc: New series. David Mitchell stars in Ben Elton's comedy that follows William Shakespeare as he starts to make a name for himself as a playwright in London while also trying to be a husband and father in Stratford-upon-Avon. In the first episode, Will struggles to find inspiration for Romeo and Juliet while at the same time having to deal with an angry actor, a very annoying house guest and his family's not-terribly-helpful script suggestions. With Harry Enfield, Paula Wilcox and Liza Tarbuck.(n)

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's events, presented by Emily Maitlis.(n)

programme.title: Burma's Secret Jungle War with Joe Simpson
programme.desc: The first of two programmes in which the mountaineer travels to Burma to tell the story of a guerilla campaign fought behind Japanese lines in the Second World War, which his own father was a part of. Guided by his father's old maps and diaries, he goes in search of the airstrip where the special forces soldiers arrived in the country. However, his journey is thrown into upheaval by current political events in Myanmar.(n)

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: The nine remaining cooks vying to reach the semi-finals are tasked to cook one showstopper dish to win over judges John Torode and Gregg Wallace and secure their place. They have just one and a half hours to perform the feat and inch closer to being crowned the 2016 champion. For one of them, the MasterChef dream will be over.(n)

programme.title: Mary Beard's Ultimate Rome: Empire Without Limit
programme.desc: English Classical scholar Mary Beard explores the myths and revolutions of the Roman Empire, looking at it with an epic scope, and gives her own personal take on the world-defining period. In the first edition, she gains an insight into the deep-rooted psyche of the people of Rome, looks at the expansion of the city, and travels to Greece, where Rome adopted a complex mix of brute force and cultural cringe, and France, where she finds evidence of war methods akin to genocide.(n)

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two.(n)

programme.title: Flog It! Trade Secrets
programme.desc: The experts relive encounters with guests on the programme who had discovered an item of value in an unlikely place and offer advice on how to spot a potential money-spinner. Plus, Paul Martin goes on a treasure hunt in Dartmoor.(n)

programme.title: Neighbourhood Blues
programme.desc: Rob McIvor investigates after art galleries in Bath are inundated with Nazi-themed hate mail, and police in Bridgwater carry out an early morning raid in a quiet residential street.(n)

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: Sarah Moore transforms items reclaimed from a Walsall tip, including an art deco train set and a broken sofa, with help from designer Jay Blades. Arthur Smith narrates.(n)

programme.title: The Hairy Bikers' Pubs That Built Britain
programme.desc: Dave takes Si on a pub tour of the Lake District, following in the footsteps of the poets Wordsworth and Coleridge. They sample negus, a wine-based drink from the late 1800s, and take part in a traditional pub competition to find out who is `The Biggest Liar'.(n)

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo travels from East Grinstead to Guildford, with his trip including a visit to Leith Hill Place to explore the compositions of Ralph Vaughan Williams. He also dons a boiler suit and takes to the footplate of a locomotive on the Bluebell Railway, Britain's first passenger-carrying heritage line, and witnesses the power of dynamite first hand.(n)

programme.title: Victoria Derbyshire
programme.desc: Daily news and current-affairs programme offering discussion of breaking stories, exclusive interviews and audience interaction via social media.(n)

programme.title: BBC Newsroom Live
programme.desc: A chance to stay up to date on the day's leading stories, with the latest breaking news as it happens.(n)

programme.title: Daily Politics
programme.desc: Parliamentary proceedings interspersed with discussions, interviews and filmed reports from around the country. Presented by Jo Coburn.(n)

programme.title: Pressure Pad
programme.desc: General knowledge quiz, hosted by John Barrowman, in which two teams of five players are pitted against each other inside an illuminated arena, known as the Pressure Pad. The team with the most players remaining for the final round will put itself in the strongest position to win the £2,000 jackpot on offer.(n)

programme.title: My Life on a Plate
programme.desc: Brian Turner accompanies Lesley Garrett on a trip to key locations from her childhood in Yorkshire, where she was taught by her parents to make the most out of what was available. The chef then creates two dishes that weave nostalgia and the taste of home together.(n)

programme.title: The TV That Made Me
programme.desc: Actor and comedian Brian Conley invites celebrities to choose the TV programmes that have shaped their lives, beginning with presenter Eamonn Holmes. Among the shows featured are Second World War drama Colditz, children's classic Animal Magic and sci-fi series Star Trek.(n)

programme.title: Holiday of My Lifetime with Len Goodman
programme.desc: The host accompanies Esther Rantzen to the Isle of Wight to relive a holiday she had when she was six years old in 1946. They visit the village of Bembridge for a spot of crabbing, head to Carisbrooke Castle, and enjoy a chairlift ride with views of the coast.(n)

programme.title: Indian Ocean with Simon Reeve
programme.desc: The adventurer reaches Sri Lanka, whose strategic location and tropical spices made it a target for invaders and colonisers for centuries. In the north he visits the scenes of vicious battles between the Tamil minority and the Sri Lankan army, traumatic events from which the population is still recovering. On his way to Bangladesh, he hitches a ride on a trawler, highlighting one of the Indian Ocean's fastest-growing industries - providing prawns for the West. But as he reveals, it comes at a price for the environment.(n)

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo travels from Ipswich to Chelmsford, starting at an agricultural implements works with its own railway sidings. Continuing his journey south-west into Essex, Michael dredges for oysters off Mersea Island before taking the train to Witham, where he discovers a model farming establishment at Tiptree. His final destination is Chelmsford, home to the world's first purpose-built radio equipment factory, established by Guglielmo Marconi.(n)

programme.title: Flog It
programme.desc: An ale jug and an unusual gold scarab are among the items examined by Tracy Martin and Charlie Ross at the Sheldonian Theatre in Oxford. Presenter Paul Martin visits the drawing and print room at the Ashmolean Museum.(n)

programme.title: Eggheads
programme.desc: Jeremy Vine hosts the quiz in which the winners of famous game shows including Mastermind and Who Wants to Be a Millionaire? work as a team to tackle a new set of challengers hoping to win a cash prize.(n)

programme.title: Big Blue UK
programme.desc: Hugh Fearnley-Whittingstall and his team find out where sharks can be spotted in waters surrounding the UK, while Lindsay Chapman looks for shark egg cases washed up on our shore. Can she also find live shark embryos in amongst Devon's seaweed?.(n)

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Philip Serrell and Natasha Raskin continue their road trip as they take in the sights of South West Wales before crossing into England, where they shop in Hertfordshire, Oxfordshire and Buckinghamshire. But who will prove victorious at the auctions in Newent in Gloucester and West London?.(n)

programme.title: Bake Off: Creme de la Creme
programme.desc: Tom Kerridge hosts the second semi-final as three teams return, hoping to impress judges Cherish Finden, Claire Clark and Benoit Blin for a second time and secure a place in the final. For the Miniatures the contestants must make 144 bite-sized petits fours, sable hollandaise biscuits, fruit tarts and Miserables. Their Showpiece involves building a decorative chocolate structure to display 90 items of confectionery, calissons, marshmallows and moulded chocolates.(n)

programme.title: Old School with the Hairy Bikers
programme.desc: New series. At a struggling school in Oxford, Dave Myers and Si King meet head teacher Niall McWilliams and set up an intergenerational experiment. It will pair 12 teenagers with 12 pensioners for one term to see if the resulting partnerships can benefit both groups. With youngsters facing relentless pressure to succeed and rising mental health disorders, coupled with pensioners feeling isolated and forgotten by society, the duo want to see if a simple friendship could help both marginalised generations feel valued and boost their self-esteem.(n)

programme.title: Later Live - with Jools Holland
programme.desc: The pianist welcomes Corinne Bailey Rae, who will be promoting her third album, The Heart Speaks in Whispers, while Elton John performs numbers from his 32nd LP, Wonderful Crazy Night. Plus, London's Bloc Party play tracks from their fifth album, Hymns, and San Francisco-based Kronos Quartet drop in from a British tour. Jools Holland also introduces Mancunian newcomers Spring King, and Toronto-born folk singer Basia Bulat.(n)

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's events, presented by Evan Davis.(n)

programme.title: Horizon
programme.desc: BBC weatherman Peter Gibbs makes an emotional return to the British Antarctic Survey's Halley Research Station, where he lived and worked in the early 1980s. During that period, the station was key to the discovery of the Ozone Hole, and today it is making vital findings about how people's lives are vulnerable to the Sun's activities, as well as studying interplanetary travel and the threat of man-man climate change. In addition to returning to the place he once called home, Peter is on a rescue mission, since the station is under threat of being cast adrift on a huge iceberg.(n)

programme.title: Flog It! Trade Secrets
programme.desc: The experts look at how items connected to domestic servants can have as much appeal to collectors as their grander counterparts, and presenter Paul Martin explores the history of the Arts and Crafts movement.(n)

programme.title: Indian Ocean with Simon Reeve
programme.desc: The fourth leg of the adventurer's journey takes him from Oman to the Maldives. He starts in the Strait of Hormuz, where oil from the Gulf is shipped through the narrow channel, then moves on to Mumbai, the ocean's biggest port. In the Maldives, Simon finds arguably the most beautiful collection of tropical coral islands in the world - but the fragile underwater environment is a barometer for the changing nature of the sea, as he witnesses how bleaching has damaged the coral and an entire island has been manufactured as a landfill dump to deal with the problem of rubbish.(n)

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo embarks on a journey to Chichester, with the first leg beginning in Norwich. At the city's Norman castle he uncovers the Victorian public's gory fascination with crime and punishment and finds out how campaigners such as Elizabeth Fry worked to improve conditions for prisoners. Heading west to Thetford, he explores how the Victorian appetite for rabbits and their fur led to special train services to London, and ends in the Suffolk town of Brandon, where he tries his hand at flint-knapping.(n)

programme.title: Flog It
programme.desc: Paul Martin presents an edition about the London auction of a carved Chinese libation cup discovered at a valuation day at Balbirnie House, Fife. The presenter visits the Museum of East Asian Art in Bath to learn more about the object's history and discusses the recent popularity of Chinese art.(n)

programme.title: Eggheads
programme.desc: Jeremy Vine hosts the quiz in which the winners of famous game shows including Mastermind and Who Wants to Be a Millionaire? work as a team to tackle a new set of challengers hoping to win a cash prize.(n)

programme.title: Big Blue UK
programme.desc: Hugh Fearnley-Whittingstall and a team of experts detail the lives of marine animals visiting and thriving in UK waters each summer, beginning by finding out where on the coast it is possible to see dolphins and whales. With contributions by wildlife cameraman Richard Taylor-Jones and BBC Springwatch Extra presenter Lindsey Chapman.(n)

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Anita Manning and David Harper travel to the Isle of Bute, Glasgow and Renfrewshire on the last leg of their journey, before ending at an auction in Paisley. Philip Serrell and Natasha Raskin then take up the baton as they set off on a quest to seek out bargains they hope will make a profit at auction, with their first leg ending at an auction in Llanelli.(n)

programme.title: Choose the Right Puppy for You
programme.desc: Part one of two. Kate Humble presents a guide to buying a dog, featuring advice from experts on how to pick one that best suits prospective owners' lifestyles and home environments. Behaviourist Louise Glazebrook is on hand to help people find the perfect puppy for them - including a family who have never had a dog before and have no idea where to start, as well as a flight attendant who is determined a big dog is right for him.(n)

programme.title: Attenborough's Life That Glows
programme.desc: David Attenborough explores the world of bioluminescence, the often spectacular natural light produced by creatures including glow-worms, fireflies and plankton, using specially designed cameras, some fitted to a new generation of deep-sea submersibles and robots to record instances in the very deep ocean. The programme shows a millipede glowing on the forest floor in California, the mesmerising flashing light patterns of the synchronous firefly, the spooky glow of a rare dragon fish and luminous earth worms in France.(n)

programme.title: Upstart Crow
programme.desc: New series. David Mitchell stars in Ben Elton's comedy that follows William Shakespeare as he starts to make a name for himself as a playwright in London while also trying to be a husband and father in Stratford-upon-Avon. In the first episode, Will struggles to find inspiration for Romeo and Juliet while at the same time having to deal with an angry actor, a very annoying house guest and his family's not-terribly-helpful script suggestions. With Harry Enfield, Paula Wilcox and Liza Tarbuck.(n)

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's events, presented by Emily Maitlis.(n)

programme.title: Burma's Secret Jungle War with Joe Simpson
programme.desc: The first of two programmes in which the mountaineer travels to Burma to tell the story of a guerilla campaign fought behind Japanese lines in the Second World War, which his own father was a part of. Guided by his father's old maps and diaries, he goes in search of the airstrip where the special forces soldiers arrived in the country. However, his journey is thrown into upheaval by current political events in Myanmar.(n)

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: The nine remaining cooks vying to reach the semi-finals are tasked to cook one showstopper dish to win over judges John Torode and Gregg Wallace and secure their place. They have just one and a half hours to perform the feat and inch closer to being crowned the 2016 champion. For one of them, the MasterChef dream will be over.(n)

programme.title: Mary Beard's Ultimate Rome: Empire Without Limit
programme.desc: English Classical scholar Mary Beard explores the myths and revolutions of the Roman Empire, looking at it with an epic scope, and gives her own personal take on the world-defining period. In the first edition, she gains an insight into the deep-rooted psyche of the people of Rome, looks at the expansion of the city, and travels to Greece, where Rome adopted a complex mix of brute force and cultural cringe, and France, where she finds evidence of war methods akin to genocide.(n)

programme.title: Neighbourhood Blues
programme.desc: Rob McIvor investigates after art galleries in Bath are inundated with Nazi-themed hate mail, and police in Bridgwater carry out an early morning raid in a quiet residential street.(n)

programme.desc: Sarah Moore transforms items reclaimed from a Walsall tip, including an art deco train set and a broken sofa, with help from designer Jay Blades. Arthur Smith narrates.(n)

programme.title: The Hairy Bikers' Pubs That Built Britain
programme.desc: Dave takes Si on a pub tour of the Lake District, following in the footsteps of the poets Wordsworth and Coleridge. They sample negus, a wine-based drink from the late 1800s, and take part in a traditional pub competition to find out who is `The Biggest Liar'.(n)

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo travels from East Grinstead to Guildford, with his trip including a visit to Leith Hill Place to explore the compositions of Ralph Vaughan Williams. He also dons a boiler suit and takes to the footplate of a locomotive on the Bluebell Railway, Britain's first passenger-carrying heritage line, and witnesses the power of dynamite first hand.(n)

programme.title: Victoria Derbyshire
programme.desc: Daily news and current-affairs programme offering discussion of breaking stories, exclusive interviews and audience interaction via social media.(n)

programme.title: BBC Newsroom Live
programme.desc: A chance to stay up to date on the day's leading stories, with the latest breaking news as it happens.(n)

programme.title: Daily Politics
programme.desc: Parliamentary proceedings interspersed with discussions, interviews and filmed reports from around the country. Presented by Jo Coburn.(n)

programme.title: Pressure Pad
programme.desc: General knowledge quiz, hosted by John Barrowman, in which two teams of five players are pitted against each other inside an illuminated arena, known as the Pressure Pad. The team with the most players remaining for the final round will put itself in the strongest position to win the £2,000 jackpot on offer.(n)

programme.title: My Life on a Plate
programme.desc: Brian Turner accompanies Lesley Garrett on a trip to key locations from her childhood in Yorkshire, where she was taught by her parents to make the most out of what was available. The chef then creates two dishes that weave nostalgia and the taste of home together.(n)

programme.title: The TV That Made Me
programme.desc: Actor and comedian Brian Conley invites celebrities to choose the TV programmes that have shaped their lives, beginning with presenter Eamonn Holmes. Among the shows featured are Second World War drama Colditz, children's classic Animal Magic and sci-fi series Star Trek.(n)

programme.title: Holiday of My Lifetime with Len Goodman
programme.desc: The host accompanies Esther Rantzen to the Isle of Wight to relive a holiday she had when she was six years old in 1946. They visit the village of Bembridge for a spot of crabbing, head to Carisbrooke Castle, and enjoy a chairlift ride with views of the coast.(n)

programme.title: Indian Ocean with Simon Reeve
programme.desc: The adventurer reaches Sri Lanka, whose strategic location and tropical spices made it a target for invaders and colonisers for centuries. In the north he visits the scenes of vicious battles between the Tamil minority and the Sri Lankan army, traumatic events from which the population is still recovering. On his way to Bangladesh, he hitches a ride on a trawler, highlighting one of the Indian Ocean's fastest-growing industries - providing prawns for the West. But as he reveals, it comes at a price for the environment.(n)

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo travels from Ipswich to Chelmsford, starting at an agricultural implements works with its own railway sidings. Continuing his journey south-west into Essex, Michael dredges for oysters off Mersea Island before taking the train to Witham, where he discovers a model farming establishment at Tiptree. His final destination is Chelmsford, home to the world's first purpose-built radio equipment factory, established by Guglielmo Marconi.(n)

programme.title: Flog It
programme.desc: An ale jug and an unusual gold scarab are among the items examined by Tracy Martin and Charlie Ross at the Sheldonian Theatre in Oxford. Presenter Paul Martin visits the drawing and print room at the Ashmolean Museum.(n)

programme.title: Eggheads
programme.desc: Jeremy Vine hosts the quiz in which the winners of famous game shows including Mastermind and Who Wants to Be a Millionaire? work as a team to tackle a new set of challengers hoping to win a cash prize.(n)

programme.title: Big Blue UK
programme.desc: Hugh Fearnley-Whittingstall and his team find out where sharks can be spotted in waters surrounding the UK, while Lindsay Chapman looks for shark egg cases washed up on our shore. Can she also find live shark embryos in amongst Devon's seaweed?.(n)

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Philip Serrell and Natasha Raskin continue their road trip as they take in the sights of South West Wales before crossing into England, where they shop in Hertfordshire, Oxfordshire and Buckinghamshire. But who will prove victorious at the auctions in Newent in Gloucester and West London?.(n)

programme.title: Bake Off: Creme de la Creme
programme.desc: Tom Kerridge hosts the second semi-final as three teams return, hoping to impress judges Cherish Finden, Claire Clark and Benoit Blin for a second time and secure a place in the final. For the Miniatures the contestants must make 144 bite-sized petits fours, sable hollandaise biscuits, fruit tarts and Miserables. Their Showpiece involves building a decorative chocolate structure to display 90 items of confectionery, calissons, marshmallows and moulded chocolates.(n)

programme.title: Old School with the Hairy Bikers
programme.desc: New series. At a struggling school in Oxford, Dave Myers and Si King meet head teacher Niall McWilliams and set up an intergenerational experiment. It will pair 12 teenagers with 12 pensioners for one term to see if the resulting partnerships can benefit both groups. With youngsters facing relentless pressure to succeed and rising mental health disorders, coupled with pensioners feeling isolated and forgotten by society, the duo want to see if a simple friendship could help both marginalised generations feel valued and boost their self-esteem.(n)

programme.title: Later Live - with Jools Holland
programme.desc: The pianist welcomes Corinne Bailey Rae, who will be promoting her third album, The Heart Speaks in Whispers, while Elton John performs numbers from his 32nd LP, Wonderful Crazy Night. Plus, London's Bloc Party play tracks from their fifth album, Hymns, and San Francisco-based Kronos Quartet drop in from a British tour. Jools Holland also introduces Mancunian newcomers Spring King, and Toronto-born folk singer Basia Bulat.(n)

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's events, presented by Evan Davis.(n)

programme.title: Horizon
programme.desc: BBC weatherman Peter Gibbs makes an emotional return to the British Antarctic Survey's Halley Research Station, where he lived and worked in the early 1980s. During that period, the station was key to the discovery of the Ozone Hole, and today it is making vital findings about how people's lives are vulnerable to the Sun's activities, as well as studying interplanetary travel and the threat of man-man climate change. In addition to returning to the place he once called home, Peter is on a rescue mission, since the station is under threat of being cast adrift on a huge iceberg.(n)

programme.title: Flog It! Trade Secrets
programme.desc: The experts look at how items connected to domestic servants can have as much appeal to collectors as their grander counterparts, and presenter Paul Martin explores the history of the Arts and Crafts movement.(n)

programme.title: Neighbourhood Blues
programme.desc: Rav Wilding reports on an operation to reel in a suspected heroin dealer, a case involving a young shop worker suspected of stealing thousands of pounds' worth of items from his employer, and a neighbour from hell who has the tenants in her block of flats living in fear.(n)

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Jules Hudson heads to the North Wessex Downs area of southern England to help a couple to buy their very first home in Britain. Traditional character is high on the pair's wish list, and they have a £500,000 budget to work within. Jules also visits a master clock maker where he examines the delicate inner workings of a 300-year-old timepiece.(n)

programme.title: Food Detectives
programme.desc: Scientist Alice Roberts, chef Tom Kerridge and consumer journalist Sean Fletcher unite their expertise to help viewers make the best food choices. In the first edition, Alice investigates campylobacter, the most common cause of food poisoning in the UK, often found on fresh chilled chickens. Tom helps a viewer who cannot cook fish without ruining it, and shares his secret for perfect pork using a process called brining. Plus, Sean discovers when is it worth buying premium brands when there are money-saving basic alternatives available.(n)

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don gets his new vegetable patch under way by making raised beds and offers advice on how to cut back herbs. Meanwhile, Nick Bailey marks the 400th anniversary of William Shakespeare's death when he investigates the fact and fiction behind the Bard's potions and poisons at the Chelsea Physic Garden, and there is a visit to Pashley Manor in East Sussex to unearth the story behind the planting of 25,000 tulips.(n)

programme.title: Victoria Derbyshire
programme.desc: Daily news and current-affairs programme offering discussion of breaking stories, exclusive interviews and audience interaction via social media.(n)

programme.title: BBC Newsroom Live
programme.desc: A chance to stay up to date on the day's leading stories, with the latest breaking news as it happens.(n)

programme.title: Daily Politics
programme.desc: Parliamentary proceedings interspersed with discussions, interviews and filmed reports from around the country. Presented by Jo Coburn.(n)

programme.title: Coast
programme.desc: As the team travels the 200 miles from Hull to London, Neil Oliver visits the birthplace of Lord Nelson, and Sutton Hoo, one of Britain's landmark archaeological sites. Alice Roberts heads to the shingle bank at Orford Ness to learn how the first British radar station worked, and Nick Crane explores the home of the early Britons off the Norfolk coast. Miranda Krestovnikoff wades out in the mud of the Wash, while Mark Horton joins the crew of an Essex fishing boat.(n)

programme.title: Athletics
programme.desc: Gabby Logan presents action from the opening Diamond League event of the season, held at the Hamad Bin Suhaim Stadium in Doha, Qatar.(n)

programme.title: My Life on a Plate
programme.desc: Brian Turner accompanies Diane Louise Jordan on a trip to her childhood home of Hatfield, Hertfordshire, where she remembers her mother's Caribbean cooking and school lunches.(n)
