programme.title: My Life on a Plate
programme.desc: Brian Turner accompanies Lesley Garrett on a trip to key locations from her childhood in Yorkshire, where she was taught by her parents to make the most out of what was available. The chef then creates two dishes that weave nostalgia and the taste of home together.(n)

programme.title: The TV That Made Me
programme.desc: Actor and comedian Brian Conley invites celebrities to choose the TV programmes that have shaped their lives, beginning with presenter Eamonn Holmes. Among the shows featured are Second World War drama Colditz, children's classic Animal Magic and sci-fi series Star Trek.(n)

programme.title: Holiday of My Lifetime with Len Goodman
programme.desc: The host accompanies Esther Rantzen to the Isle of Wight to relive a holiday she had when she was six years old in 1946. They visit the village of Bembridge for a spot of crabbing, head to Carisbrooke Castle, and enjoy a chairlift ride with views of the coast.(n)

programme.title: Indian Ocean with Simon Reeve
programme.desc: The adventurer reaches Sri Lanka, whose strategic location and tropical spices made it a target for invaders and colonisers for centuries. In the north he visits the scenes of vicious battles between the Tamil minority and the Sri Lankan army, traumatic events from which the population is still recovering. On his way to Bangladesh, he hitches a ride on a trawler, highlighting one of the Indian Ocean's fastest-growing industries - providing prawns for the West. But as he reveals, it comes at a price for the environment.(n)

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo travels from Ipswich to Chelmsford, starting at an agricultural implements works with its own railway sidings. Continuing his journey south-west into Essex, Michael dredges for oysters off Mersea Island before taking the train to Witham, where he discovers a model farming establishment at Tiptree. His final destination is Chelmsford, home to the world's first purpose-built radio equipment factory, established by Guglielmo Marconi.(n)

programme.title: Flog It
programme.desc: An ale jug and an unusual gold scarab are among the items examined by Tracy Martin and Charlie Ross at the Sheldonian Theatre in Oxford. Presenter Paul Martin visits the drawing and print room at the Ashmolean Museum.(n)

programme.title: Eggheads
programme.desc: Jeremy Vine hosts the quiz in which the winners of famous game shows including Mastermind and Who Wants to Be a Millionaire? work as a team to tackle a new set of challengers hoping to win a cash prize.(n)

programme.title: Big Blue UK
programme.desc: Hugh Fearnley-Whittingstall and his team find out where sharks can be spotted in waters surrounding the UK, while Lindsay Chapman looks for shark egg cases washed up on our shore. Can she also find live shark embryos in amongst Devon's seaweed?.(n)

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Philip Serrell and Natasha Raskin continue their road trip as they take in the sights of South West Wales before crossing into England, where they shop in Hertfordshire, Oxfordshire and Buckinghamshire. But who will prove victorious at the auctions in Newent in Gloucester and West London?.(n)

programme.title: Bake Off: Creme de la Creme
programme.desc: Tom Kerridge hosts the second semi-final as three teams return, hoping to impress judges Cherish Finden, Claire Clark and Benoit Blin for a second time and secure a place in the final. For the Miniatures the contestants must make 144 bite-sized petits fours, sable hollandaise biscuits, fruit tarts and Miserables. Their Showpiece involves building a decorative chocolate structure to display 90 items of confectionery, calissons, marshmallows and moulded chocolates.(n)

programme.title: Old School with the Hairy Bikers
programme.desc: New series. At a struggling school in Oxford, Dave Myers and Si King meet head teacher Niall McWilliams and set up an intergenerational experiment. It will pair 12 teenagers with 12 pensioners for one term to see if the resulting partnerships can benefit both groups. With youngsters facing relentless pressure to succeed and rising mental health disorders, coupled with pensioners feeling isolated and forgotten by society, the duo want to see if a simple friendship could help both marginalised generations feel valued and boost their self-esteem.(n)

programme.title: Later Live - with Jools Holland
programme.desc: The pianist welcomes Corinne Bailey Rae, who will be promoting her third album, The Heart Speaks in Whispers, while Elton John performs numbers from his 32nd LP, Wonderful Crazy Night. Plus, London's Bloc Party play tracks from their fifth album, Hymns, and San Francisco-based Kronos Quartet drop in from a British tour. Jools Holland also introduces Mancunian newcomers Spring King, and Toronto-born folk singer Basia Bulat.(n)

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's events, presented by Evan Davis.(n)

programme.title: Horizon
programme.desc: BBC weatherman Peter Gibbs makes an emotional return to the British Antarctic Survey's Halley Research Station, where he lived and worked in the early 1980s. During that period, the station was key to the discovery of the Ozone Hole, and today it is making vital findings about how people's lives are vulnerable to the Sun's activities, as well as studying interplanetary travel and the threat of man-man climate change. In addition to returning to the place he once called home, Peter is on a rescue mission, since the station is under threat of being cast adrift on a huge iceberg.(n)

programme.title: Flog It! Trade Secrets
programme.desc: The experts look at how items connected to domestic servants can have as much appeal to collectors as their grander counterparts, and presenter Paul Martin explores the history of the Arts and Crafts movement.(n)

programme.title: Neighbourhood Blues
programme.desc: Rav Wilding reports on an operation to reel in a suspected heroin dealer, a case involving a young shop worker suspected of stealing thousands of pounds' worth of items from his employer, and a neighbour from hell who has the tenants in her block of flats living in fear.(n)

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Jules Hudson heads to the North Wessex Downs area of southern England to help a couple to buy their very first home in Britain. Traditional character is high on the pair's wish list, and they have a £500,000 budget to work within. Jules also visits a master clock maker where he examines the delicate inner workings of a 300-year-old timepiece.(n)

programme.title: Food Detectives
programme.desc: Scientist Alice Roberts, chef Tom Kerridge and consumer journalist Sean Fletcher unite their expertise to help viewers make the best food choices. In the first edition, Alice investigates campylobacter, the most common cause of food poisoning in the UK, often found on fresh chilled chickens. Tom helps a viewer who cannot cook fish without ruining it, and shares his secret for perfect pork using a process called brining. Plus, Sean discovers when is it worth buying premium brands when there are money-saving basic alternatives available.(n)

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don gets his new vegetable patch under way by making raised beds and offers advice on how to cut back herbs. Meanwhile, Nick Bailey marks the 400th anniversary of William Shakespeare's death when he investigates the fact and fiction behind the Bard's potions and poisons at the Chelsea Physic Garden, and there is a visit to Pashley Manor in East Sussex to unearth the story behind the planting of 25,000 tulips.(n)

programme.title: Victoria Derbyshire
programme.desc: Daily news and current-affairs programme offering discussion of breaking stories, exclusive interviews and audience interaction via social media.(n)

programme.title: BBC Newsroom Live
programme.desc: A chance to stay up to date on the day's leading stories, with the latest breaking news as it happens.(n)

programme.title: Daily Politics
programme.desc: Parliamentary proceedings interspersed with discussions, interviews and filmed reports from around the country. Presented by Jo Coburn.(n)

programme.title: Coast
programme.desc: As the team travels the 200 miles from Hull to London, Neil Oliver visits the birthplace of Lord Nelson, and Sutton Hoo, one of Britain's landmark archaeological sites. Alice Roberts heads to the shingle bank at Orford Ness to learn how the first British radar station worked, and Nick Crane explores the home of the early Britons off the Norfolk coast. Miranda Krestovnikoff wades out in the mud of the Wash, while Mark Horton joins the crew of an Essex fishing boat.(n)

programme.title: Athletics
programme.desc: Gabby Logan presents action from the opening Diamond League event of the season, held at the Hamad Bin Suhaim Stadium in Doha, Qatar.(n)

programme.title: My Life on a Plate
programme.desc: Brian Turner accompanies Diane Louise Jordan on a trip to her childhood home of Hatfield, Hertfordshire, where she remembers her mother's Caribbean cooking and school lunches.(n)

programme.title: Holiday of My Lifetime with Len Goodman
programme.desc: Strictly Come Dancing judge Len Goodman invites celebrity guests to reminisce about one of their favourite holidays. TV cook and Hairy Biker Dave Myers accompanies the host on a revisit to the Isle of Man to recall a 1967 seaside vacation where he reveals how his original trip played a significant role in his love of food and motorbikes.(n)

programme.title: Indian Ocean with Simon Reeve
programme.desc: The fourth leg of the adventurer's journey takes him from Oman to the Maldives. He starts in the Strait of Hormuz, where oil from the Gulf is shipped through the narrow channel, then moves on to Mumbai, the ocean's biggest port. In the Maldives, Simon finds arguably the most beautiful collection of tropical coral islands in the world - but the fragile underwater environment is a barometer for the changing nature of the sea, as he witnesses how bleaching has damaged the coral and an entire island has been manufactured as a landfill dump to deal with the problem of rubbish.(n)

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo embarks on a journey to Chichester, with the first leg beginning in Norwich. At the city's Norman castle he uncovers the Victorian public's gory fascination with crime and punishment and finds out how campaigners such as Elizabeth Fry worked to improve conditions for prisoners. Heading west to Thetford, he explores how the Victorian appetite for rabbits and their fur led to special train services to London, and ends in the Suffolk town of Brandon, where he tries his hand at flint-knapping.(n)

programme.title: Flog It
programme.desc: Paul Martin presents an edition about the London auction of a carved Chinese libation cup discovered at a valuation day at Balbirnie House, Fife. The presenter visits the Museum of East Asian Art in Bath to learn more about the object's history and discusses the recent popularity of Chinese art.(n)

programme.title: Eggheads
programme.desc: Jeremy Vine hosts the quiz in which the winners of famous game shows including Mastermind and Who Wants to Be a Millionaire? work as a team to tackle a new set of challengers hoping to win a cash prize.(n)

programme.title: Big Blue UK
programme.desc: Hugh Fearnley-Whittingstall and a team of experts detail the lives of marine animals visiting and thriving in UK waters each summer, beginning by finding out where on the coast it is possible to see dolphins and whales. With contributions by wildlife cameraman Richard Taylor-Jones and BBC Springwatch Extra presenter Lindsey Chapman.(n)

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Anita Manning and David Harper travel to the Isle of Bute, Glasgow and Renfrewshire on the last leg of their journey, before ending at an auction in Paisley. Philip Serrell and Natasha Raskin then take up the baton as they set off on a quest to seek out bargains they hope will make a profit at auction, with their first leg ending at an auction in Llanelli.(n)

programme.title: Choose the Right Puppy for You
programme.desc: Part one of two. Kate Humble presents a guide to buying a dog, featuring advice from experts on how to pick one that best suits prospective owners' lifestyles and home environments. Behaviourist Louise Glazebrook is on hand to help people find the perfect puppy for them - including a family who have never had a dog before and have no idea where to start, as well as a flight attendant who is determined a big dog is right for him.(n)

programme.title: Attenborough's Life That Glows
programme.desc: David Attenborough explores the world of bioluminescence, the often spectacular natural light produced by creatures including glow-worms, fireflies and plankton, using specially designed cameras, some fitted to a new generation of deep-sea submersibles and robots to record instances in the very deep ocean. The programme shows a millipede glowing on the forest floor in California, the mesmerising flashing light patterns of the synchronous firefly, the spooky glow of a rare dragon fish and luminous earth worms in France.(n)

programme.title: Upstart Crow
programme.desc: New series. David Mitchell stars in Ben Elton's comedy that follows William Shakespeare as he starts to make a name for himself as a playwright in London while also trying to be a husband and father in Stratford-upon-Avon. In the first episode, Will struggles to find inspiration for Romeo and Juliet while at the same time having to deal with an angry actor, a very annoying house guest and his family's not-terribly-helpful script suggestions. With Harry Enfield, Paula Wilcox and Liza Tarbuck.(n)

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's events, presented by Emily Maitlis.(n)

programme.title: Burma's Secret Jungle War with Joe Simpson
programme.desc: The first of two programmes in which the mountaineer travels to Burma to tell the story of a guerilla campaign fought behind Japanese lines in the Second World War, which his own father was a part of. Guided by his father's old maps and diaries, he goes in search of the airstrip where the special forces soldiers arrived in the country. However, his journey is thrown into upheaval by current political events in Myanmar.(n)

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: The nine remaining cooks vying to reach the semi-finals are tasked to cook one showstopper dish to win over judges John Torode and Gregg Wallace and secure their place. They have just one and a half hours to perform the feat and inch closer to being crowned the 2016 champion. For one of them, the MasterChef dream will be over.(n)

programme.title: Mary Beard's Ultimate Rome: Empire Without Limit
programme.desc: English Classical scholar Mary Beard explores the myths and revolutions of the Roman Empire, looking at it with an epic scope, and gives her own personal take on the world-defining period. In the first edition, she gains an insight into the deep-rooted psyche of the people of Rome, looks at the expansion of the city, and travels to Greece, where Rome adopted a complex mix of brute force and cultural cringe, and France, where she finds evidence of war methods akin to genocide.(n)

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two.(n)

programme.title: Flog It! Trade Secrets
programme.desc: The experts relive encounters with guests on the programme who had discovered an item of value in an unlikely place and offer advice on how to spot a potential money-spinner. Plus, Paul Martin goes on a treasure hunt in Dartmoor.(n)

programme.title: Neighbourhood Blues
programme.desc: Rob McIvor investigates after art galleries in Bath are inundated with Nazi-themed hate mail, and police in Bridgwater carry out an early morning raid in a quiet residential street.(n)

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: Sarah Moore transforms items reclaimed from a Walsall tip, including an art deco train set and a broken sofa, with help from designer Jay Blades. Arthur Smith narrates.(n)

programme.title: The Hairy Bikers' Pubs That Built Britain
programme.desc: Dave takes Si on a pub tour of the Lake District, following in the footsteps of the poets Wordsworth and Coleridge. They sample negus, a wine-based drink from the late 1800s, and take part in a traditional pub competition to find out who is `The Biggest Liar'.(n)

programme.title: Burma's Secret Jungle War with Joe Simpson
programme.desc: The first of two programmes in which the mountaineer travels to Burma to tell the story of a guerilla campaign fought behind Japanese lines in the Second World War, which his own father was a part of. Guided by his father's old maps and diaries, he goes in search of the airstrip where the special forces soldiers arrived in the country. However, his journey is thrown into upheaval by current political events in Myanmar.(n)

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: The nine remaining cooks vying to reach the semi-finals are tasked to cook one showstopper dish to win over judges John Torode and Gregg Wallace and secure their place. They have just one and a half hours to perform the feat and inch closer to being crowned the 2016 champion. For one of them, the MasterChef dream will be over.(n)

programme.title: Mary Beard's Ultimate Rome: Empire Without Limit
programme.desc: English Classical scholar Mary Beard explores the myths and revolutions of the Roman Empire, looking at it with an epic scope, and gives her own personal take on the world-defining period. In the first edition, she gains an insight into the deep-rooted psyche of the people of Rome, looks at the expansion of the city, and travels to Greece, where Rome adopted a complex mix of brute force and cultural cringe, and France, where she finds evidence of war methods akin to genocide.(n)

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two.(n)

programme.title: Flog It! Trade Secrets
programme.desc: The experts relive encounters with guests on the programme who had discovered an item of value in an unlikely place and offer advice on how to spot a potential money-spinner. Plus, Paul Martin goes on a treasure hunt in Dartmoor.(n)

programme.title: Neighbourhood Blues
programme.desc: Rob McIvor investigates after art galleries in Bath are inundated with Nazi-themed hate mail, and police in Bridgwater carry out an early morning raid in a quiet residential street.(n)

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: Sarah Moore transforms items reclaimed from a Walsall tip, including an art deco train set and a broken sofa, with help from designer Jay Blades. Arthur Smith narrates.(n)

programme.title: The Hairy Bikers' Pubs That Built Britain
programme.desc: Dave takes Si on a pub tour of the Lake District, following in the footsteps of the poets Wordsworth and Coleridge. They sample negus, a wine-based drink from the late 1800s, and take part in a traditional pub competition to find out who is `The Biggest Liar'.(n)

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo travels from East Grinstead to Guildford, with his trip including a visit to Leith Hill Place to explore the compositions of Ralph Vaughan Williams. He also dons a boiler suit and takes to the footplate of a locomotive on the Bluebell Railway, Britain's first passenger-carrying heritage line, and witnesses the power of dynamite first hand.(n)

programme.title: Victoria Derbyshire
programme.desc: Daily news and current-affairs programme offering discussion of breaking stories, exclusive interviews and audience interaction via social media.(n)

programme.title: BBC Newsroom Live
programme.desc: A chance to stay up to date on the day's leading stories, with the latest breaking news as it happens.(n)

programme.title: Daily Politics
programme.desc: Parliamentary proceedings interspersed with discussions, interviews and filmed reports from around the country. Presented by Jo Coburn.(n)

programme.title: Pressure Pad
programme.desc: General knowledge quiz, hosted by John Barrowman, in which two teams of five players are pitted against each other inside an illuminated arena, known as the Pressure Pad. The team with the most players remaining for the final round will put itself in the strongest position to win the £2,000 jackpot on offer.(n)

programme.title: My Life on a Plate
programme.desc: Brian Turner accompanies Lesley Garrett on a trip to key locations from her childhood in Yorkshire, where she was taught by her parents to make the most out of what was available. The chef then creates two dishes that weave nostalgia and the taste of home together.(n)

programme.title: The TV That Made Me
programme.desc: Actor and comedian Brian Conley invites celebrities to choose the TV programmes that have shaped their lives, beginning with presenter Eamonn Holmes. Among the shows featured are Second World War drama Colditz, children's classic Animal Magic and sci-fi series Star Trek.(n)

programme.title: Holiday of My Lifetime with Len Goodman
programme.desc: The host accompanies Esther Rantzen to the Isle of Wight to relive a holiday she had when she was six years old in 1946. They visit the village of Bembridge for a spot of crabbing, head to Carisbrooke Castle, and enjoy a chairlift ride with views of the coast.(n)

programme.title: Indian Ocean with Simon Reeve
programme.desc: The adventurer reaches Sri Lanka, whose strategic location and tropical spices made it a target for invaders and colonisers for centuries. In the north he visits the scenes of vicious battles between the Tamil minority and the Sri Lankan army, traumatic events from which the population is still recovering. On his way to Bangladesh, he hitches a ride on a trawler, highlighting one of the Indian Ocean's fastest-growing industries - providing prawns for the West. But as he reveals, it comes at a price for the environment.(n)

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo travels from Ipswich to Chelmsford, starting at an agricultural implements works with its own railway sidings. Continuing his journey south-west into Essex, Michael dredges for oysters off Mersea Island before taking the train to Witham, where he discovers a model farming establishment at Tiptree. His final destination is Chelmsford, home to the world's first purpose-built radio equipment factory, established by Guglielmo Marconi.(n)

programme.title: Flog It
programme.desc: An ale jug and an unusual gold scarab are among the items examined by Tracy Martin and Charlie Ross at the Sheldonian Theatre in Oxford. Presenter Paul Martin visits the drawing and print room at the Ashmolean Museum.(n)

programme.title: Eggheads
programme.desc: Jeremy Vine hosts the quiz in which the winners of famous game shows including Mastermind and Who Wants to Be a Millionaire? work as a team to tackle a new set of challengers hoping to win a cash prize.(n)

programme.title: Big Blue UK
programme.desc: Hugh Fearnley-Whittingstall and his team find out where sharks can be spotted in waters surrounding the UK, while Lindsay Chapman looks for shark egg cases washed up on our shore. Can she also find live shark embryos in amongst Devon's seaweed?.(n)

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Philip Serrell and Natasha Raskin continue their road trip as they take in the sights of South West Wales before crossing into England, where they shop in Hertfordshire, Oxfordshire and Buckinghamshire. But who will prove victorious at the auctions in Newent in Gloucester and West London?.(n)

programme.title: Bake Off: Creme de la Creme
programme.desc: Tom Kerridge hosts the second semi-final as three teams return, hoping to impress judges Cherish Finden, Claire Clark and Benoit Blin for a second time and secure a place in the final. For the Miniatures the contestants must make 144 bite-sized petits fours, sable hollandaise biscuits, fruit tarts and Miserables. Their Showpiece involves building a decorative chocolate structure to display 90 items of confectionery, calissons, marshmallows and moulded chocolates.(n)

programme.title: How Scotland Works
programme.desc: From a brand new town being developed in Aberdeenshire to a houseboat on a canal, this episode tells the story of Scotland at home through a diverse range of people - and the homes they live in. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Later Live - with Jools Holland
programme.desc: The pianist welcomes Corinne Bailey Rae, who will be promoting her third album, The Heart Speaks in Whispers, while Elton John performs numbers from his 32nd LP, Wonderful Crazy Night. Plus, London's Bloc Party play tracks from their fifth album, Hymns, and San Francisco-based Kronos Quartet drop in from a British tour. Jools Holland also introduces Mancunian newcomers Spring King, and Toronto-born folk singer Basia Bulat.(n)

programme.title: Scotland 2016
programme.desc: David Henderson presents the current affairs programme taking an in-depth look at the stories behind the day's headlines and reporting on the issues affecting Scots.(n)

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's events, presented by Evan Davis.(n)

programme.title: Old School with the Hairy Bikers
programme.desc: New series. At a struggling school in Oxford, Dave Myers and Si King meet head teacher Niall McWilliams and set up an intergenerational experiment. It will pair 12 teenagers with 12 pensioners for one term to see if the resulting partnerships can benefit both groups. With youngsters facing relentless pressure to succeed and rising mental health disorders, coupled with pensioners feeling isolated and forgotten by society, the duo want to see if a simple friendship could help both marginalised generations feel valued and boost their self-esteem.(n)

programme.title: Flog It! Trade Secrets
programme.desc: The experts look at how items connected to domestic servants can have as much appeal to collectors as their grander counterparts, and presenter Paul Martin explores the history of the Arts and Crafts movement.(n)

programme.title: Neighbourhood Blues
programme.desc: Rav Wilding reports on an operation to reel in a suspected heroin dealer, a case involving a young shop worker suspected of stealing thousands of pounds' worth of items from his employer, and a neighbour from hell who has the tenants in her block of flats living in fear.(n)

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Jules Hudson heads to the North Wessex Downs area of southern England to help a couple to buy their very first home in Britain. Traditional character is high on the pair's wish list, and they have a £500,000 budget to work within. Jules also visits a master clock maker where he examines the delicate inner workings of a 300-year-old timepiece.(n)

programme.title: Food Detectives
programme.desc: Scientist Alice Roberts, chef Tom Kerridge and consumer journalist Sean Fletcher unite their expertise to help viewers make the best food choices. In the first edition, Alice investigates campylobacter, the most common cause of food poisoning in the UK, often found on fresh chilled chickens. Tom helps a viewer who cannot cook fish without ruining it, and shares his secret for perfect pork using a process called brining. Plus, Sean discovers when is it worth buying premium brands when there are money-saving basic alternatives available.(n)

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don gets his new vegetable patch under way by making raised beds and offers advice on how to cut back herbs. Meanwhile, Nick Bailey marks the 400th anniversary of William Shakespeare's death when he investigates the fact and fiction behind the Bard's potions and poisons at the Chelsea Physic Garden, and there is a visit to Pashley Manor in East Sussex to unearth the story behind the planting of 25,000 tulips.(n)

programme.title: Victoria Derbyshire
programme.desc: Daily news and current-affairs programme offering discussion of breaking stories, exclusive interviews and audience interaction via social media.(n)

programme.title: BBC Newsroom Live
programme.desc: A chance to stay up to date on the day's leading stories, with the latest breaking news as it happens.(n)

programme.title: Daily Politics
programme.desc: Parliamentary proceedings interspersed with discussions, interviews and filmed reports from around the country. Presented by Jo Coburn.(n)

programme.title: Coast
programme.desc: As the team travels the 200 miles from Hull to London, Neil Oliver visits the birthplace of Lord Nelson, and Sutton Hoo, one of Britain's landmark archaeological sites. Alice Roberts heads to the shingle bank at Orford Ness to learn how the first British radar station worked, and Nick Crane explores the home of the early Britons off the Norfolk coast. Miranda Krestovnikoff wades out in the mud of the Wash, while Mark Horton joins the crew of an Essex fishing boat.(n)

programme.title: Athletics
programme.desc: Gabby Logan presents action from the opening Diamond League event of the season, held at the Hamad Bin Suhaim Stadium in Doha, Qatar.(n)

programme.title: My Life on a Plate
programme.desc: Brian Turner accompanies Diane Louise Jordan on a trip to her childhood home of Hatfield, Hertfordshire, where she remembers her mother's Caribbean cooking and school lunches.(n)

programme.title: Holiday of My Lifetime with Len Goodman
programme.desc: Strictly Come Dancing judge Len Goodman invites celebrity guests to reminisce about one of their favourite holidays. TV cook and Hairy Biker Dave Myers accompanies the host on a revisit to the Isle of Man to recall a 1967 seaside vacation where he reveals how his original trip played a significant role in his love of food and motorbikes.(n)

programme.title: Indian Ocean with Simon Reeve
programme.desc: The fourth leg of the adventurer's journey takes him from Oman to the Maldives. He starts in the Strait of Hormuz, where oil from the Gulf is shipped through the narrow channel, then moves on to Mumbai, the ocean's biggest port. In the Maldives, Simon finds arguably the most beautiful collection of tropical coral islands in the world - but the fragile underwater environment is a barometer for the changing nature of the sea, as he witnesses how bleaching has damaged the coral and an entire island has been manufactured as a landfill dump to deal with the problem of rubbish.(n)

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo embarks on a journey to Chichester, with the first leg beginning in Norwich. At the city's Norman castle he uncovers the Victorian public's gory fascination with crime and punishment and finds out how campaigners such as Elizabeth Fry worked to improve conditions for prisoners. Heading west to Thetford, he explores how the Victorian appetite for rabbits and their fur led to special train services to London, and ends in the Suffolk town of Brandon, where he tries his hand at flint-knapping.(n)

programme.title: Flog It
programme.desc: Paul Martin presents an edition about the London auction of a carved Chinese libation cup discovered at a valuation day at Balbirnie House, Fife. The presenter visits the Museum of East Asian Art in Bath to learn more about the object's history and discusses the recent popularity of Chinese art.(n)

programme.title: Eggheads
programme.desc: Jeremy Vine hosts the quiz in which the winners of famous game shows including Mastermind and Who Wants to Be a Millionaire? work as a team to tackle a new set of challengers hoping to win a cash prize.(n)

programme.title: Big Blue UK
programme.desc: Hugh Fearnley-Whittingstall and a team of experts detail the lives of marine animals visiting and thriving in UK waters each summer, beginning by finding out where on the coast it is possible to see dolphins and whales. With contributions by wildlife cameraman Richard Taylor-Jones and BBC Springwatch Extra presenter Lindsey Chapman.(n)

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Anita Manning and David Harper travel to the Isle of Bute, Glasgow and Renfrewshire on the last leg of their journey, before ending at an auction in Paisley. Philip Serrell and Natasha Raskin then take up the baton as they set off on a quest to seek out bargains they hope will make a profit at auction, with their first leg ending at an auction in Llanelli.(n)

programme.title: Choose the Right Puppy for You
programme.desc: Part one of two. Kate Humble presents a guide to buying a dog, featuring advice from experts on how to pick one that best suits prospective owners' lifestyles and home environments. Behaviourist Louise Glazebrook is on hand to help people find the perfect puppy for them - including a family who have never had a dog before and have no idea where to start, as well as a flight attendant who is determined a big dog is right for him.(n)

programme.title: Attenborough's Life That Glows
programme.desc: David Attenborough explores the world of bioluminescence, the often spectacular natural light produced by creatures including glow-worms, fireflies and plankton, using specially designed cameras, some fitted to a new generation of deep-sea submersibles and robots to record instances in the very deep ocean. The programme shows a millipede glowing on the forest floor in California, the mesmerising flashing light patterns of the synchronous firefly, the spooky glow of a rare dragon fish and luminous earth worms in France.(n)

programme.title: Upstart Crow
programme.desc: New series. David Mitchell stars in Ben Elton's comedy that follows William Shakespeare as he starts to make a name for himself as a playwright in London while also trying to be a husband and father in Stratford-upon-Avon. In the first episode, Will struggles to find inspiration for Romeo and Juliet while at the same time having to deal with an angry actor, a very annoying house guest and his family's not-terribly-helpful script suggestions. With Harry Enfield, Paula Wilcox and Liza Tarbuck.(n)

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's events, presented by Emily Maitlis.(n)

programme.title: Burma's Secret Jungle War with Joe Simpson
programme.desc: The first of two programmes in which the mountaineer travels to Burma to tell the story of a guerilla campaign fought behind Japanese lines in the Second World War, which his own father was a part of. programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's events, presented by Evan Davis.(n)

programme.title: Horizon
programme.desc: BBC weatherman Peter Gibbs makes an emotional return to the British Antarctic Survey's Halley Research Station, where he lived and worked in the early 1980s. During that period, the station was key to the discovery of the Ozone Hole, and today it is making vital findings about how people's lives are vulnerable to the Sun's activities, as well as studying interplanetary travel and the threat of man-man climate change. In addition to returning to the place he once called home, Peter is on a rescue mission, since the station is under threat of being cast adrift on a huge iceberg.(n)

The judges want more Miniatures - 144 perfect breakfast pastries, and for their Showpiece the teams must construct large and elaborate chocolate containers filled with three different types of confectionery.(n)

programme.title: Choose the Right Puppy for You

programme.title: Pressure Pad
programme.desc: General knowledge quiz, hosted by John Barrowman, in which two teams of five players are pitted against each other inside an illuminated arena, known as the Pressure Pad. The team with the most players remaining for the final round will put itself in the strongest position to win the £2,000 jackpot on offer.(n)

programme.title: am.pm
programme.desc: Coverage of the first session of the new Assembly following last week's election.(n)

programme.title: Coast
programme.desc: Alice Roberts visits the salt mines at Carrickfergus and takes a look around Bendhu House, on the top of a cliff at Ballintoy. Neil Oliver presents.(n)

programme.title: The TV That Made Me
programme.desc: Actor and comedian Brian Conley invites celebrities to choose the TV programmes that have shaped their lives, beginning with presenter Eamonn Holmes. Among the shows featured are Second World War drama Colditz, children's classic Animal Magic and sci-fi series Star Trek.(n)

programme.title: Holiday of My Lifetime with Len Goodman
programme.desc: The host accompanies Esther Rantzen to the Isle of Wight to relive a holiday she had when she was six years old in 1946. They visit the village of Bembridge for a spot of crabbing, head to Carisbrooke Castle, and enjoy a chairlift ride with views of the coast.(n)

programme.title: Indian Ocean with Simon Reeve
programme.desc: The adventurer reaches Sri Lanka, whose strategic location and tropical spices made it a target for invaders and colonisers for centuries. In the north he visits the scenes of vicious battles between the Tamil minority and the Sri Lankan army, traumatic events from which the population is still recovering. On his way to Bangladesh, he hitches a ride on a trawler, highlighting one of the Indian Ocean's fastest-growing industries - providing prawns for the West. But as he reveals, it comes at a price for the environment.(n)

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo travels from Ipswich to Chelmsford, starting at an agricultural implements works with its own railway sidings. Continuing his journey south-west into Essex, Michael dredges for oysters off Mersea Island before taking the train to Witham, where he discovers a model farming establishment at Tiptree. His final destination is Chelmsford, home to the world's first purpose-built radio equipment factory, established by Guglielmo Marconi.(n)

programme.title: Flog It
programme.desc: Will Axon and Thomas Plant value items at London Zoo in Regent's Park, including a Ducati camera, a painting by Walter Sickert's brother and a pair of Zulu spears. Presenter Paul Martin tours some of the site's listed buildings, such as the Lubetkin penguin pool and Casson elephant house.(n)

programme.title: Eggheads
programme.desc: Jeremy Vine hosts the quiz in which the winners of famous game shows including Mastermind and Who Wants to Be a Millionaire? work as a team to tackle a new set of challengers hoping to win a cash prize.(n)

programme.title: Big Blue UK
programme.desc: Hugh Fearnley-Whittingstall and his team find out where sharks can be spotted in waters surrounding the UK, while Lindsay Chapman looks for shark egg cases washed up on our shore. Can she also find live shark embryos in amongst Devon's seaweed?.(n)

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Philip Serrell and Natasha Raskin continue their road trip as they take in the sights of South West Wales before crossing into England, where they shop in Hertfordshire, Oxfordshire and Buckinghamshire. But who will prove victorious at the auctions in Newent in Gloucester and West London?.(n)

programme.title: Bake Off: Creme de la Creme
programme.desc: Tom Kerridge hosts the second semi-final as three teams return, hoping to impress judges Cherish Finden, Claire Clark and Benoit Blin for a second time and secure a place in the final. For the Miniatures the contestants must make 144 bite-sized petits fours, sable hollandaise biscuits, fruit tarts and Miserables. Their Showpiece involves building a decorative chocolate structure to display 90 items of confectionery, calissons, marshmallows and moulded chocolates.(n)

programme.title: Old School with the Hairy Bikers
programme.desc: New series. At a struggling school in Oxford, Dave Myers and Si King meet head teacher Niall McWilliams and set up an intergenerational experiment. It will pair 12 teenagers with 12 pensioners for one term to see if the resulting partnerships can benefit both groups. With youngsters facing relentless pressure to succeed and rising mental health disorders, coupled with pensioners feeling isolated and forgotten by society, the duo want to see if a simple friendship could help both marginalised generations feel valued and boost their self-esteem.(n)

programme.title: Later Live - with Jools Holland
programme.desc: The pianist welcomes Corinne Bailey Rae, who will be promoting her third album, The Heart Speaks in Whispers, while Elton John performs numbers from his 32nd LP, Wonderful Crazy Night. Plus, London's Bloc Party play tracks from their fifth album, Hymns, and San Francisco-based Kronos Quartet drop in from a British tour. Jools Holland also introduces Mancunian newcomers Spring King, and Toronto-born folk singer Basia Bulat.(n)

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's events, presented by Evan Davis.(n)

programme.title: Horizon
programme.desc: BBC weatherman Peter Gibbs makes an emotional return to the British Antarctic Survey's Halley Research Station, where he lived and worked in the early 1980s. During that period, the station was key to the discovery of the Ozone Hole, and today it is making vital findings about how people's lives are vulnerable to the Sun's activities, as well as studying interplanetary travel and the threat of man-man climate change. In addition to returning to the place he once called home, Peter is on a rescue mission, since the station is under threat of being cast adrift on a huge iceberg.(n)

programme.title: Flog It! Trade Secrets
programme.desc: The experts look at how items connected to domestic servants can have as much appeal to collectors as their grander counterparts, and presenter Paul Martin explores the history of the Arts and Crafts movement.(n)

programme.title: Neighbourhood Blues
programme.desc: Rav Wilding reports on an operation to reel in a suspected heroin dealer, a case involving a young shop worker suspected of stealing thousands of pounds' worth of items from his employer, and a neighbour from hell who has the tenants in her block of flats living in fear.(n)

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Jules Hudson heads to the North Wessex Downs area of southern England to help a couple to buy their very first home in Britain. Traditional character is high on the pair's wish list, and they have a £500,000 budget to work within. Jules also visits a master clock maker where he examines the delicate inner workings of a 300-year-old timepiece.(n)

programme.title: Food Detectives
programme.desc: Scientist Alice Roberts, chef Tom Kerridge and consumer journalist Sean Fletcher unite their expertise to help viewers make the best food choices. In the first edition, Alice investigates campylobacter, the most common cause of food poisoning in the UK, often found on fresh chilled chickens. Tom helps a viewer who cannot cook fish without ruining it, and shares his secret for perfect pork using a process called brining. Plus, Sean discovers when is it worth buying premium brands when there are money-saving basic alternatives available.(n)

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don gets his new vegetable patch under way by making raised beds and offers advice on how to cut back herbs. Meanwhile, Nick Bailey marks the 400th anniversary of William Shakespeare's death when he investigates the fact and fiction behind the Bard's potions and poisons at the Chelsea Physic Garden, and there is a visit to Pashley Manor in East Sussex to unearth the story behind the planting of 25,000 tulips.(n)

programme.title: Victoria Derbyshire
programme.desc: Daily news and current-affairs programme offering discussion of breaking stories, exclusive interviews and audience interaction via social media.(n)

programme.title: BBC Newsroom Live
programme.desc: A chance to stay up to date on the day's leading stories, with the latest breaking news as it happens.(n)

programme.title: Daily Politics
programme.desc: Parliamentary proceedings interspersed with discussions, interviews and filmed reports from around the country. Presented by Jo Coburn.(n)

programme.title: Coast
programme.desc: As the team travels the 200 miles from Hull to London, Neil Oliver visits the birthplace of Lord Nelson, and Sutton Hoo, one of Britain's landmark archaeological sites. Alice Roberts heads to the shingle bank at Orford Ness to learn how the first British radar station worked, and Nick Crane explores the home of the early Britons off the Norfolk coast. Miranda Krestovnikoff wades out in the mud of the Wash, while Mark Horton joins the crew of an Essex fishing boat.(n)

programme.title: Athletics
programme.desc: Gabby Logan presents action from the opening Diamond League event of the season, held at the Hamad Bin Suhaim Stadium in Doha, Qatar.(n)

programme.title: My Life on a Plate
programme.desc: Brian Turner accompanies Diane Louise Jordan on a trip to her childhood home of Hatfield, Hertfordshire, where she remembers her mother's Caribbean cooking and school lunches.(n)

programme.title: Holiday of My Lifetime with Len Goodman
programme.desc: Strictly Come Dancing judge Len Goodman invites celebrity guests to reminisce about one of their favourite holidays. TV cook and Hairy Biker Dave Myers accompanies the host on a revisit to the Isle of Man to recall a 1967 seaside vacation where he reveals how his original trip played a significant role in his love of food and motorbikes.(n)

programme.title: Indian Ocean with Simon Reeve
programme.desc: The fourth leg of the adventurer's journey takes him from Oman to the Maldives. He starts in the Strait of Hormuz, where oil from the Gulf is shipped through the narrow channel, then moves on to Mumbai, the ocean's biggest port. In the Maldives, Simon finds arguably the most beautiful collection of tropical coral islands in the world - but the fragile underwater environment is a barometer for the changing nature of the sea, as he witnesses how bleaching has damaged the coral and an entire island has been manufactured as a landfill dump to deal with the problem of rubbish.(n)

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo embarks on a journey to Chichester, with the first leg beginning in Norwich. At the city's Norman castle he uncovers the Victorian public's gory fascination with crime and punishment and finds out how campaigners such as Elizabeth Fry worked to improve conditions for prisoners. Heading west to Thetford, he explores how the Victorian appetite for rabbits and their fur led to special train services to London, and ends in the Suffolk town of Brandon, where he tries his hand at flint-knapping.(n)

programme.title: Flog It
programme.desc: Paul Martin presents an edition about the London auction of a carved Chinese libation cup discovered at a valuation day at Balbirnie House, Fife. The presenter visits the Museum of East Asian Art in Bath to learn more about the object's history and discusses the recent popularity of Chinese art.(n)

programme.title: Eggheads
programme.desc: Jeremy Vine hosts the quiz in which the winners of famous game shows including Mastermind and Who Wants to Be a Millionaire? work as a team to tackle a new set of challengers hoping to win a cash prize.(n)

programme.title: Big Blue UK
programme.desc: Hugh Fearnley-Whittingstall and a team of experts detail the lives of marine animals visiting and thriving in UK waters each summer, beginning by finding out where on the coast it is possible to see dolphins and whales. With contributions by wildlife cameraman Richard Taylor-Jones and BBC Springwatch Extra presenter Lindsey Chapman.(n)

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Anita Manning and David Harper travel to the Isle of Bute, Glasgow and Renfrewshire on the last leg of their journey, before ending at an auction in Paisley. Philip Serrell and Natasha Raskin then take up the baton as they set off on a quest to seek out bargains they hope will make a profit at auction, with their first leg ending at an auction in Llanelli.(n)

programme.title: Choose the Right Puppy for You

programme.title: My Life on a Plate
programme.desc: Brian Turner accompanies Lesley Garrett on a trip to key locations from her childhood in Yorkshire, where she was taught by her parents to make the most out of what was available. The chef then creates two dishes that weave nostalgia and the taste of home together.(n)

programme.title: The TV That Made Me
programme.desc: Actor and comedian Brian Conley invites celebrities to choose the TV programmes that have shaped their lives, beginning with presenter Eamonn Holmes. Among the shows featured are Second World War drama Colditz, children's classic Animal Magic and sci-fi series Star Trek.(n)

programme.title: Flog It
programme.desc: An ale jug and an unusual gold scarab are among the items examined by Tracy Martin and Charlie Ross at the Sheldonian Theatre in Oxford. Presenter Paul Martin visits the drawing and print room at the Ashmolean Museum.(n)

programme.title: Eggheads
programme.desc: Jeremy Vine hosts the quiz in which the winners of famous game shows including Mastermind and Who Wants to Be a Millionaire? work as a team to tackle a new set of challengers hoping to win a cash prize.(n)

In addition to returning to the place he once called home, Peter is on a rescue mission, since the station is under threat of being cast adrift on a huge iceberg.(n)

programme.title: World News Today
programme.desc: The day's leading stories.(n)

programme.title: The Wonder of Bees with Martha Kearney
programme.desc: The journalist reflects on the success of her mission to harvest true wildflower honey as she offers her wares to the public at a village fair, before she concludes her year-long beekeeping adventure with a visit to Cornwall's Tregothnan Estate - where she discovers the secrets of the highly prized manuka honey. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Timeshift
programme.sub-title: Timeshift: Magnificent Machines - The Golden Age of the British Sports Car.
programme.desc: A look at how iconic manufacturers such as Jaguar, Austin-Healey, MG and Triumph prospered during the austerity of the post-war years. The programme explores how Britain briefly became the home of the two-seater vehicle and features memorable motors from the era, including the MG Midget, the Sprite and the Jaguar E-Type. Narrated by Tamsin Greig, with contributions by Stirling Moss and Quentin Willson.(n)

programme.title: Britain's Deadliest Rail Disaster: Quintinshill
programme.desc: Neil Oliver tells the story of the 1915 disaster, when two high-speed train collisions near Gretna Green caused a devastating fire that led to more than 220 deaths. Using dramatic reconstructions and contemporary reports, the historian shines a fresh light on the case against the two signalmen jailed for causing the crash, examining evidence there might have been a cover up to prevent the government and railway company from being found responsible.(n)

programme.title: The Dark Ages: An Age of Light
programme.sub-title: What the Barbarians Did for Us.
programme.desc: Waldemar Januszczak continues his trip around the world, exploring whether the Dark Ages were a time of artistic achievement, inspired by novel ideas and religion. He investigates the art produced by the Barbarians, who are often blamed for the collapse of the Roman Empire. Following the journeys of the Huns, Vandals and Goths, he uncovers evidence of creativity they left along the way.(n)

programme.title: Natural World
programme.desc: Naturalist David Attenborough chooses the 10 endangered animals from around the world that he would most like to save from extinction, explaining why these creatures are so important and highlighting the work of biologists helping to keep them alive. His list includes Darwin's frog, the Sumatran rhino, Priam's birdwing butterfly and the black lion tamarin.(n)

programme.title: Everything and Nothing
programme.desc: Part two of two. Professor Jim Al-Khalili explores the science behind `nothingness' and the deepest mysteries of the universe. He sets out to prove that everything came from nothing, and the quantum world of the super-small shaped the vast universe Earth inhabits today.(n)

programme.title: The Genius of David Bowie
programme.desc: A compilation showcasing some of the musician's performances from the BBC archives, including Space Oddity, Life on Mars?, Fashion and The Jean Genie. Plus, Lulu and Mott the Hoople perform Bowie songs, and there are further clips featuring the star's musical collaborators Iggy Pop and Lou Reed.(n)

programme.title: The High Art of the Low Countries
programme.desc: Andrew Graham-Dixon tours the Low Countries, exploring how history has influenced the area's art, architecture and culture. In the first edition, he details how the art of Renaissance Flanders evolved from the crafting of precious tapestries, and begins his journey at the altarpiece of Ghent Cathedral, created by the Van Eyck brothers, explaining their groundbreaking innovation in oil painting and marvels at how the colours are still vibrant today. Plus, he describes how during the era people believed they were preoccupied with the end of the world.(n)

programme.title: Timeshift
programme.sub-title: A Very British Map: The Ordnance Survey Story.
programme.desc: The history of a quintessentially British institution, which was formed in 1791, originally for military reasons before becoming a valuable tool in peacetime for ramblers and adventurers. Timeshift examines how the OS is adjusting to the digital age, with the large folding maps now just a small part of its output.(n)

programme.title: World News Today
programme.desc: The day's leading stories.(n)

programme.title: Insect Worlds
programme.desc: Steve Backshall explores the connections and relationships humans have with insects and their close relatives, the arachnids and crustaceans. He begins by revealing how huge armies of driver ants give houses a five-star clean-up in Kenya, while in China, silkworm caterpillars are credited with shaping culture and distribution. He also explains that, despite people's perceptions of these creepy-crawlies, mankind could not live without them.(n)

programme.title: Eurovision Song Contest 2016
programme.desc: Mel Giedroyc and Scott Mills report from Stockholmm Sweden for the first Semi Final of the Eurovision Song Contest. Eighteen acts will take to the stage but only 10 will make it through to the Grand Final on Saturday. The UK's entry, Joe and Jake, will also join Scott and Mel to discuss all things Eurovision.(n)

programme.title: Timeshift
programme.sub-title: A Very British Map: The Ordnance Survey Story.
programme.desc: The history of a quintessentially British institution, which was formed in 1791, originally for military reasons before becoming a valuable tool in peacetime for ramblers and adventurers. Timeshift examines how the OS is adjusting to the digital age, with the large folding maps now just a small part of its output.(n)

programme.title: Agnetha: Abba & After
programme.desc: Documentary telling the story of Agnetha Faltskog's music career as both a member of the Swedish pop group and a successful solo singer in her own right. Including interviews with Gary Barlow, who features on her 2013 album, plus Abba's Bjorn Ulvaeus and Benny Andersson, DJ Tony Blackburn and lyricist Tim Rice.(n)

programme.title: The Middle
programme.desc: Frankie is forced to wash the dishes with a hose after the sink falls into a sinkhole, Sue tries to receive credit for gym class, and Brick accidently breaks something. American comedy, starring Patricia Heaton.(n)

programme.title: Malcolm in the Middle
programme.desc: Malcolm meets a chess-playing layabout who could be an older version of himself, Lois cannot understand why she is putting on weight and Francis objects to Piama posing nude in an art class - but eagerly volunteers himself when he finds out how much the job pays. programme.title: Malcolm in the Middle
programme.desc: Part one of two. Lois goes into labour, coinciding with a less inspiring surprise in the form of a visit from Grandma Ida (Cloris Leachman). Family comedy, with Frankie Muniz and Jane Kaczmarek.(n)

programme.title: Friends
programme.sub-title: The One with Mac and CHEESE.
programme.desc: Joey auditions for a major TV show about a man and his crime-fighting robot, but Chandler almost ruins everything. With clips from earlier episodes, starring Jennifer Aniston, Courteney Cox, Lisa Kudrow, David Schwimmer, Matthew Perry and Matt LeBlanc.(n)

programme.title: Friends
programme.sub-title: The One Where Ross Meets Elizabeth's Dad.
programme.desc: Ross nervously prepares to meet Elizabeth's dad for the first time and Phoebe decides to write a book about Monica and Chandler. Joey is threatened with dismissal for insulting the operator of the robot alongside which he is due to star in his latest role. Guest starring Bruce Willis.(n)

programme.title: Impractical Jokers
programme.desc: The guys pretend to be newspaper reporters, who get members of the public to give their reaction to an entirely fictional breaking story. They also draw caricatures of passers-by, queue jump at the theatre, and try to sell a bizarre flat. This week's loser then has to pose as an author and give a reading from his latest book.(n)

programme.title: Impractical Jokers
programme.desc: The guys have to teach the world's most uncoordinated karate class and pose as newspaper reporters. They also head out into the street with a massage chair to offer free neck and head rubs. This episode's loser is challenged to steal a stranger's underwear from a laundry basket and wear them on his head.(n)

programme.title: Friends
programme.sub-title: The One Where Paul's the Man.
programme.desc: Elizabeth sneaks away with Ross to her grandmother's cabin for a romantic weekend, unaware her dad and Rachel have had exactly the same idea. American comedy, guest starring Bruce Willis.(n)

programme.title: Friends
programme.desc: Chandler makes the mistake of asking Phoebe to help him choose an engagement ring for Monica, while Rachel urges Paul to open up and reveal his emotions but he ends up revealing too much. Guest starring Bruce Willis.(n)

programme.title: Friends
programme.sub-title: The One with the Proposal - Part One.
programme.desc: Part one of two. Chandler's plans for a romantic proposal are ruined by Richard's reappearance. Ross gets an uncomfortable reminder of his girlfriend's immaturity, while Joey unwittingly buys a boat at an auction. Comedy, starring Matt LeBlanc, Matthew Perry and Tom Selleck.(n)

programme.title: Friends
programme.sub-title: The One with the Proposal - Part Two.
programme.desc: Part two of two. Monica is left reeling by Richard's proposal, which puts pressure on a nervous Chandler to bite the bullet and suggest she marry him instead. Comedy, guest starring Tom Selleck, with Courteney Cox and Matthew Perry.(n)

programme.title: Friends
programme.desc: An ecstatic Monica plans an evening out to celebrate her engagement to Chandler, but ends up accusing Rachel of trying to steal her thunder by kissing Ross. American comedy, starring Courteney Cox, Jennifer Aniston and David Schwimmer.(n)

programme.title: Friends
programme.desc: Monica excitedly starts making preparations for her big day, only to discover her parents have spent all the wedding money on a beach house. Phoebe moves her massage parlour into Ross's apartment and Rachel's choice of reading matter raises eyebrows.(n)

programme.title: Friends
programme.desc: Monica tries to re-create a secret recipe belonging to Phoebe's grandmother, and Chandler accepts an invitation from future father-in-law Jack to play racquetball. Meanwhile, Rachel advises Joey on life on the ocean wave. Comedy, starring Jennifer Aniston and Courteney Cox.(n)

programme.title: Friends
programme.desc: An attractive but unqualified man applies for a job as Rachel's assistant, placing her in a quandary as she struggles to decide between hiring him or a more competent woman. Meanwhile, Joey's TV show is cancelled after only one episode. American comedy, starring Jennifer Aniston and Eddie Cahill.(n)

programme.title: Impractical Jokers
programme.desc: There is a supermarket challenge, strangers must settle crazy debates and the loser delivers a questionable computer presentation.(n)

programme.title: Impractical Jokers
programme.desc: The guys get votes for performances on how to act in a business lunch, and Murray visits a running shop.(n)

programme.title: Friends
programme.sub-title: The One with the Engagement Picture.
programme.desc: Rachel cajoles Joey into taking Tag on a boys' night out, Ross and Phoebe date a couple in the middle of a divorce and Chandler has trouble striking the right pose for his engagement photograph with Monica. American comedy, starring Jennifer Aniston and Lisa Kudrow.(n)

programme.title: Friends
programme.sub-title: The One with the Nap Partners.
programme.desc: Monica agonises over whether Rachel or Phoebe should be her maid of honour, and leaves the pair to sort it out between themselves. She also bumps into Chandler's ex-girlfriend Julie, and is horrified to discover he ended their relationship because she became fat.(n)

programme.title: Friends
programme.sub-title: The One with Ross's Library Book.
programme.desc: Janice cajoles Chandler and Monica into inviting her to the wedding. Ross discovers a surprising fact about his doctoral dissertation and the position it occupies in the university library, and Joey's latest date causes him emotional turmoil. Guest starring Kristin Davis (Sex and the City).(n)

programme.title: Friends
programme.sub-title: The One Where Chandler Doesn't Like Dogs.
programme.desc: Rachel's assistant Tag spends Thanksgiving with the gang, leading to a series of embarrassing revelations, and a puppy smuggled into the flat by Phoebe unnerves Chandler. Comedy, starring Jennifer Aniston and Matthew Perry.(n)

programme.title: Impractical Jokers
programme.desc: The guys pretend to be newspaper reporters, who get members of the public to give their reaction to an entirely fictional breaking story. They also draw caricatures of passers-by, queue jump at the theatre, and try to sell a bizarre flat. This week's loser then has to pose as an author and give a reading from his latest book.(n)

programme.title: Friends
programme.sub-title: The One with All the Candy.
programme.desc: Rachel gets a dressing-down at work for dating Tag, while Monica tries to buy her neighbours' friendship by making sweets for them - but finds their appetites to be greater than her desire to be popular.(n)

programme.title: Friends
programme.sub-title: The One with the Holiday Armadillo.
programme.desc: Phoebe plans to return to her flat and tries desperately to persuade Rachel to join her, while Monica is infuriated by Chandler's inability to tip appropriately. Ross looks after Ben during the holiday season, and dresses as an armadillo to keep him entertained.(n)

programme.title: Impractical Jokers
programme.desc: The guys network their way into some very uncomfortable business conversations, go head to head in a photography presentation, and take part in a time-sensitive challenge.(n)

programme.title: Impractical Jokers
programme.desc: The guys give terrible telemarketing presentations, make odd wishes at a shopping mall fountain, and try to analyse people's dreams on the boardwalk.(n)

programme.title: Impractical Jokers
programme.desc: Joe, Sal, Q, and Murr take to the court to serve up some seriously personal tennis lessons, and then head to the park for a bewildering game.(n)

programme.title: Impractical Jokers
programme.desc: The guys provide a false sense of security to customers at a chemist's, and competition reaches new heights during a rematch of their balloon challenge in a grocery store.(n)

programme.desc: Billy Eichner tests the pop culture knowledge of more passers-by on the streets of New York City, with games including `Quizzed in the face' and `New Year's Eve or deformed'.(n)

programme.desc: Cartman contracts a virus after an operation to remove his tonsils goes awry, leaving him no choice but to find a cure. With the voices of Trey Parker and Matt Stone.(n)

programme.title: South Park
programme.desc: The boys meet Britney Spears as she tries to escape her troubles, and discover the secret of her popularity during a trip to the North Pole. With the voice of Jessie Jo Thomas.(n)

programme.title: South Park
programme.desc: The kids try out a new type of drug - cat urine - after hearing its effects are stronger than other, more well-known, substances. programme.title: Brickleberry
programme.desc: The team face stiff competition from Yellowstone National Park, so Woody devises a plan to identify cute animals and lift Brickleberry in the ratings. Steve hatches an idea for a squirrel-rabbit hybrid called a Squabbit.(n)

programme.title: Two and a Half Men
programme.desc: Walden receives an invitation to the opening of his ex-girlfriend Kate's boutique, and Gretchen hopes to spend more time at Alan's house. Starring Ashton Kutcher and Jon Cryer.(n)

programme.title: Two and a Half Men
programme.sub-title: Lan Mao Shi Zai Wuding Shang.
programme.desc: Walden impulsively decides that he wants to spend the rest of his life with Kate - until he meets Vivian, a random stranger who arrives at his beach house. Meanwhile, Alan and Gretchen grow closer. Comedy, guest starring Mila Kunis.(n)

programme.title: Two and a Half Men
programme.desc: Walden's therapist suggests that casual sex might help him get over his habit of falling in love too quickly. Meanwhile, Alan's new business venture provides him with the perfect opportunity. Comedy, starring Ashton Kutcher and Jon Cryer.(n)

programme.sub-title: Charlie Gets Between Sean and Jordan.

programme.desc: Phoebe encounters a suicidal office worker during her first day as a telemarketer. Ross and Monica are upset to discover their parents intend to sell their childhood home, while Rachel and Chandler blame themselves for breaking Joey's favourite chair.(n)

programme.sub-title: The One Where They All Turn Thirty.

programme.desc: An attractive but unqualified man applies for a job as Rachel's assistant, placing her in a quandary as she struggles to decide between hiring him or a more competent woman. Meanwhile, Joey's TV show is cancelled after only one episode. American comedy, starring Jennifer Aniston and Eddie Cahill.(n)

programme.title: Friends
programme.sub-title: The One with the Engagement Picture.
programme.desc: Rachel cajoles Joey into taking Tag on a boys' night out, Ross and Phoebe date a couple in the middle of a divorce and Chandler has trouble striking the right pose for his engagement photograph with Monica. American comedy, starring Jennifer Aniston and Lisa Kudrow.(n)

programme.title: Friends
programme.sub-title: The One with the Nap Partners.
programme.desc: Monica agonises over whether Rachel or Phoebe should be her maid of honour, and leaves the pair to sort it out between themselves. She also bumps into Chandler's ex-girlfriend Julie, and is horrified to discover he ended their relationship because she became fat.(n)

programme.title: Friends
programme.sub-title: The One with Ross's Library Book.
programme.desc: Janice cajoles Chandler and Monica into inviting her to the wedding. Ross discovers a surprising fact about his doctoral dissertation and the position it occupies in the university library, and Joey's latest date causes him emotional turmoil. Guest starring Kristin Davis (Sex and the City).(n)

programme.title: Friends
programme.sub-title: The One Where Chandler Doesn't Like Dogs.
programme.desc: Rachel's assistant Tag spends Thanksgiving with the gang, leading to a series of embarrassing revelations, and a puppy smuggled into the flat by Phoebe unnerves Chandler. Comedy, starring Jennifer Aniston and Matthew Perry.(n)

programme.title: Friends
programme.sub-title: The One with All the Candy.
programme.desc: Rachel gets a dressing-down at work for dating Tag, while Monica tries to buy her neighbours' friendship by making sweets for them - but finds their appetites to be greater than her desire to be popular.(n)

programme.title: Friends
programme.sub-title: The One with the Holiday Armadillo.
programme.desc: Phoebe plans to return to her flat and tries desperately to persuade Rachel to join her, while Monica is infuriated by Chandler's inability to tip appropriately. Ross looks after Ben during the holiday season, and dresses as an armadillo to keep him entertained.(n)

programme.title: Impractical Jokers
programme.desc: The guys work as bellhops, serve up trouble as hot dog vendors, and go head-to-head presenting odd inventions to a focus group.(n)

programme.title: Impractical Jokers
programme.desc: Hidden camera practical joke show that follows the comedy troupe The Tenderloins.(n)

programme.title: Friends
programme.sub-title: The One with All the Cheesecakes.
programme.desc: Phoebe's ex-boyfriend arrives back in town and Monica is angry at not being invited to her cousin's wedding. Meanwhile, Chandler and Rachel feel guilty for eating a neighbour's cheesecake that was mistakenly delivered to their apartment. Comedy, guest starring Hank Azaria (The Simpsons).(n)

programme.title: Friends
programme.sub-title: The One Where They're Up All Night.
programme.desc: Ross and Joey get trapped on the roof while waiting to watch a meteor shower. Monica's exhaustion leads to trouble with Chandler, and Rachel argues with Tag over which of them failed to post a parcel.(n)

programme.title: Friends
programme.desc: Phoebe encounters a suicidal office worker during her first day as a telemarketer. Ross and Monica are upset to discover their parents intend to sell their childhood home, while Rachel and Chandler blame themselves for breaking Joey's favourite chair.(n)

programme.title: Friends
programme.sub-title: The One Where They All Turn Thirty.
programme.desc: The pals celebrate Rachel's 30th birthday and reminisce about their own, including Monica's attempt to hide her intoxication from her parents, and Ross's embarrassing crisis, which resulted in the purchase of a red sports car. Comedy, starring Jennifer Aniston and David Schwimmer.(n)

programme.title: Impractical Jokers
programme.desc: The guys steal food from customers' plates in a restaurant and try to teach languages they cannot speak. Hidden camera practical joke show following comedy troupe The Tenderloins.(n)

programme.title: Impractical Jokers
programme.desc: The guys are set to work in a bakery, where they must eat their customers purchases and challenge them to pie-eating contests. The loser of this week's games has to pose as an avant garde artist and is sent to a gallery where he must explain the meaning of his work to a gathering of critics.(n)

programme.title: Friends
programme.sub-title: The One with Joey's New Brain.
programme.desc: Joey tells a fellow soap cast member that her character is to be killed off. Rachel and Phoebe sabotage each other's plans to date an attractive man who left his mobile phone in Central Perk, and Ross learns he is not allowed to play the bagpipes at Monica and Chandler's wedding. Guest starring Susan Sarandon.(n)

programme.title: Friends
programme.sub-title: The One with the Truth About London.
programme.desc: Chandler hears a startling revelation about how his relationship with Monica almost failed to get off the ground in London. Joey tries to get ordained via the internet and Rachel teaches Ben practical jokes to play on Ross. Courteney Cox, Jennifer Aniston, Matthew Perry and Matt LeBlanc star.(n)

programme.title: The Middle
programme.desc: Frankie informs the rest of the family that instead of marking Mother's Day they are going to each pull a name out of a hat and do something nice for that person.(n)

programme.title: The Middle
programme.desc: Mike enlists Axl and Brick to help him set up a surprise party for Frankie, and Sue is mocked after posting a sign in the dorm laundry room to help find one of her lost socks.(n)

programme.title: Impractical Jokers
programme.desc: There is a supermarket challenge, strangers must settle crazy debates and the loser delivers a questionable computer presentation.(n)

programme.title: Impractical Jokers
programme.desc: The guys get votes for performances on how to act in a business lunch, and Murray visits a running shop.(n)

programme.title: Broad City
programme.desc: Ilana learns she has run out of time to complete her volunteer hours for her food co-op and persuades Abbi to pose as her while she attends a doctor's appointment.(n)

programme.title: Punk'd
programme.desc: Nick Cannon plays pranks on Ashley Tisdale, Demi Lovato and the New Boyz.(n)

programme.title: Home Shopping
programme.desc: A chance to purchase goods from the comfort of home.(n)

programme.title: Storage Hunters
programme.desc: Brandon and Lori are confused by a 3D printer, but are delighted with the valuation, while Papa Bear bids on two mysterious lots from Brazil.(n)

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson attempts to build a car that is even smaller than the Peel P50 and then tests it out on the streets of London before pitching his concept in the Dragons' Den. James May puts the Bentley Continental GT Speed through its paces by taking it on a rally stage, while Richard Hammond drives the new Pagani Huayra hypercar before handing it over to the Stig. Actor Damian Lewis goes for a spin in the Reasonably Priced Car.(n)

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: The presenters embark on a road trip across Australia's Northern Territory in fast, luxurious GT cars, with Jeremy Clarkson choosing a BMW M6 Gran Coupe, Richard Hammond picking a Bentley Continental GT V8 and James May opting for a Nissan GT-R. The trio set out on an adventure that takes in crocodile-infested rivers, a race around a vast opencast mine and an encounter with one of the world's longest lorries, concluding with an unusual challenge involving a farm, their cars and 4,000 cows. Plus, 24 star Kiefer Sutherland takes to the track in the Reasonably Priced Car.(n)

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Mike uncovers a 1915 motorcycle and a valuable bear trap before falling prey to one of Frank and Danielle's pranks.(n)

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: The guys visit an aviation museum that is closing down and are given their pick of the stock before looking for treasure in an art gallery's outbuildings and a barn.(n)

programme.title: QI XL
programme.desc: Stephen Fry hosts an extended edition of the quiz with a difference, and is joined by Sandi Toksvig, Al Murray, Dara O Briain and regular panellist Alan Davies. programme.title: QI XL
programme.desc: Extended edition. South African comedian Trevor Noah makes his debut on the comedy quiz, joining fellow stand-up Jason Manford, broadcaster Sandi Toksvig and regular panellist Alan Davies. Host Stephen Fry asks a range of fiendish questions on the topic of killers, with points being awarded for interesting answers as well as correct ones.(n)

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: The presenters embark on a road trip across Australia's Northern Territory in fast, luxurious GT cars, with Jeremy Clarkson choosing a BMW M6 Gran Coupe, Richard Hammond picking a Bentley Continental GT V8 and James May opting for a Nissan GT-R. The trio set out on an adventure that takes in crocodile-infested rivers, a race around a vast opencast mine and an encounter with one of the world's longest lorries, concluding with an unusual challenge involving a farm, their cars and 4,000 cows. Plus, 24 star Kiefer Sutherland takes to the track in the Reasonably Priced Car.(n)

programme.title: Charmed
programme.desc: On their first anniversary of becoming witches, the sisters face a cloven-hooved demon called Abraxas, who steals the Book of Shadows and counteracts all the spells they have cast. Prue is forced to deal with the loss of Andy Trudeau, while Piper opens a nightclub.(n)

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: Drama following the lives and loves of a group of teenagers and young adults in Chester.(n)

programme.title: Rules of Engagement
programme.desc: Audrey buys a new chair, which Jeff hates, and the situation spirals out of control as they argue over whether to get rid of it. programme.desc: Murray intervenes when Adam asks Beverly to help him avoid the humiliation of taking a national physical fitness test at school. Meanwhile, Erica decides to have some fun at Barry's expense when he tries to woo her French pen pal.(n)

programme.title: The Goldbergs
programme.desc: Barry hosts a `no parents allowed' birthday party for Adam, instead of the laser tag party that was originally planned. programme.title: Charmed
programme.desc: Phoebe experiences a shocking premonition of herself being burned to death, which prompts the sisters to travel into the future to change her fate.(n)

programme.title: Charmed

programme.title: How I Met Your Mother
programme.desc: Lily and Marshall arrange for Ted to go on a blind date on Valentine's Day. Robin receives an unwanted surprise from Don, while Barney thinks of an innovative way to get women to call him - by holding up his phone number during the Super Bowl.(n)

programme.title: How I Met Your Mother
programme.desc: Ted is humiliated when he sees Tiffany out with a man on an evening they had planned to spend together, confirming his friends' suspicions that he is being strung along. Meanwhile, Lily tries to let down one of her colleagues gently. American comedy, starring Josh Radnor and Alyson Hannigan.(n)

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Leonard becomes concerned that Sheldon will overreact when his friend learns the truth about a past indiscretion, while Penny confronts Raj's old flame Lucy about the way she ended their relationship. Comedy, starring Johnny Galecki, Jim Parsons and Kaley Cuoco-Sweeting.(n)

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Sheldon is dismayed when the group spends the Thanksgiving holiday at Mrs Wolowitz's house, but hits it off with Bernadette's father. Meanwhile, Penny realises she must deal with a mistake from her past when she and Leonard have an argument. Comedy, starring Jim Parsons and Kaley Cuoco-Sweeting.(n)
