programme.desc: Family comedy starring Melissa Joan Hart as a local politician left to look after her niece and nephew after a family scandal, who is forced to seek the help of a male nanny to help her cope with her new responsibilities. With Joey Lawrence.(n)

programme.title: Melissa & Joey
programme.desc: Male nanny Joey moves in to make his childcare work easier, but his 56-inch flat-screen TV disrupts the status quo of the household. Meanwhile, Melissa sets her sights on winning a date with a man she meets at work. Family comedy, starring Melissa Joan Hart and Joey Lawrence.(n)

programme.title: How I Met Your Mother
programme.desc: Ted angers Lily when he brings a random date to her birthday party, and is reminded of all the various women he has brought along to important functions. American comedy, starring Josh Radnor and Alyson Hannigan.(n)

programme.title: How I Met Your Mother
programme.desc: Marshall is mugged at gunpoint, so Lily applies for a firearms licence in the hope it will make them feel safer. However, her husband objects and fabricates a story about being robbed by a monkey in the zoo to calm her down. Meanwhile, Robin interviews him about the incident on the news. Comedy, starring Jason Segel and Alyson Hannigan.(n)

programme.title: Brooklyn Nine-Nine
programme.desc: Detective Jake Peralta and his eclectic group of colleagues at Brooklyn's 99th Precinct are used to having a commanding officer who doesn't make them work too hard or follow the rules too closely. That all changes when tightly wound Captain Ray Holt takes over, determined to make the dysfunctional squad into the best in the borough. Pilot episode of the American comedy, starring Andy Samberg and Andre Braugher.(n)

programme.title: Brooklyn Nine-Nine
programme.desc: Jake is assigned to a minor graffiti case by Captain Holt as punishment for turning up late for work, but the investigation becomes a major headache when the vandal's identity is revealed. Meanwhile, Gina's psychic friend Carlene visits the precinct to help with a case, and upsets Charles with a prediction about his romantic life. American comedy, starring Andy Samberg.(n)

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Sheldon is bothered by the attention he receives in the wake of his heavy element discovery, but is taken aback when his work is disproved by Leonard. Meanwhile, Raj makes Howard and Bernadette feel inadequate when he stays with them for a week and is the perfect house guest.(n)

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Sheldon leaves for Texas when his sister goes into labour. While he is away, the rest of the friends decorate for Christmas and reflect on how much he has changed their lives. Comedy, starring Johnny Galecki, Jim Parsons and Kaley Cuoco-Sweeting.(n)

programme.title: Hollyoaks

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Leonard is invited to visit the Large Hadron Collider in Switzerland and asks Penny to join him as a Valentine's Day treat. However, Sheldon tries to persuade the couple to allow him to take her place.(n)

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory

programme.title: Good Morning Britain
programme.desc: A lively mix of news and current affairs, plus health, entertainment and lifestyle features. Presented by Susanna Reid, Piers Morgan, Ben Shephard, Charlotte Hawkins and Sean Fletcher.(n)

programme.title: Lorraine
programme.desc: Entertainment and fashion news, as well as showbiz stories, cooking and celebrity gossip. Presented by Lorraine Kelly.(n)

programme.title: The Jeremy Kyle Show
programme.desc: The host invites guests to air their differences over family and relationship issues, and provides them with his own brand of no-nonsense advice.(n)

programme.title: This Morning
programme.desc: Phillip Schofield and Holly Willoughby present celebrity chat and lifestyle features, including a look at the stories making the newspaper headlines and a recipe in the kitchen. Including Local Weather.(n)

programme.title: Loose Women
programme.desc: Celebrity interviews and topical studio discussion from a female perspective.(n)

programme.title: Judge Rinder
programme.desc: Cameras follow criminal barrister Robert Rinder as he takes on real-life cases in a studio courtroom.(n)

programme.title: Dickinson's Real Deal
programme.desc: David Dickinson and the team value antiques at the RAF Museum in north London, where a jade pendant attracts the attention of Karen Dalmeny and Mark Stevens haggles over a gold bracelet.(n)

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Game show, hosted by Ben Shephard, in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a £10,000 jackpot.(n)

programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as four contestants pit their wits against ruthless quiz genius the Chaser in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. They work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught.(n)

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: Belle is delighted when Holly takes an interest in her love life, and reveals that she is having an affair with a married man. However, she does not realise Holly has been sent to find out the truth by Cain - who misinterprets the information. Ashley refuses to go to the dementia support group until a fellow sufferer needs his help, David returns home from hospital, and Liv comes between Aaron and Robert.(n)

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: Jason demands that Eileen leaves Tony's funeral service, while Roy and Cathy are appalled to find Alex and his drunken mates having a party in the cafe flat. Elsewhere, Sinead is concerned for Craig when he goes for his date with a reluctant Caitlin.(n)

programme.title: Wild Australia with Ray Mears
programme.desc: Ray explores the Bush in the state of Victoria and tracks down two Australian icons - the kangaroo and the koala. He also canoes across a secret lake in search of the elusive duck-billed platypus, one of the only mammals that lay eggs instead of giving birth.(n)

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: Phelan assures Jason that with his dad gone, he can always look to him for support. Meanwhile, Gail mistakenly thinks Sarah has a new boyfriend, Roy falls out with Cathy, and Todd quizzes Billy about the young lad he gave some cash to.(n)

programme.title: Marcella
programme.desc: The killer's next victim is a six-year-old girl, which devastates Marcella, and a DNA match gives the police team its strongest lead yet. Meanwhile, DI Tim Williamson investigates Andrew Barnes' death - was it really suicide? Crime drama, starring Anna Friel and Jamie Bamber.(n)

programme.title: River Monsters
programme.desc: Jeremy Wade visits southern Africa to see if he can track down a deadly fish that lurks in the eerie waters of the Okavango. A killer with shark-like teeth, there are stories of it hunting in packs and feeding on schooling fish or even human bodies. Jeremy is determined to find out if it is a giant piranha or something equally terrifying.(n)

programme.title: The World Is Not Enough
programme.desc: James Bond is assigned to protect the heiress of an oil dynasty after her father is killed in a bombing at MI6 headquarters. The attack is the work of an infamous terrorist who is unable to feel pain after surviving a gunshot to his head, and who now intends to destroy the world's supply of oil. Spy adventure, starring Pierce Brosnan, Robert Carlyle, Sophie Marceau and Robbie Coltrane.(n)

programme.title: Jackpot247
programme.desc: Viewers are offered the chance to participate in live interactive gaming from the comfort of their sofas, with an entertaining mix of roulette-wheel spins and lively chat from the presenting team. Featuring a variety of prizes and promotions.(n)

programme.desc: The host invites guests to air their differences over family and relationship issues, and provides them with his own brand of no-nonsense advice.(n)

programme.title: This Morning
programme.desc: Phillip Schofield and Holly Willoughby present celebrity chat and lifestyle features, including a look at the stories making the newspaper headlines and a recipe in the kitchen. Including Local Weather.(n)

programme.desc: The panel discuss the issues making the front pages today, and are joined by Geordie Shore's Charlotte Crosby.(n)

programme.title: Judge Rinder
programme.desc: Cameras follow criminal barrister Robert Rinder as he takes on real-life cases in a studio courtroom.(n)

programme.title: Dickinson's Real Deal
programme.desc: David Dickinson and his dealers are in Buckinghamshire, where he and Stewart Hofgartner enthuse over a radiogram, and 'angels' visit Helen Gardiner.(n)

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Game show, hosted by Ben Shephard, in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a £10,000 jackpot.(n)

programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as contestants Harry, James, Rachel and Margaret pit their wits against ruthless quiz genius the Chaser in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. They work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught.(n)

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: Cain is mistakenly convinced that Rakesh is Belle's secret married lover, so he and Holly hold him hostage. However, when Charity discovers that Belle has been out all night, she realises her cousin has made a terrible mistake. Finn begins to suspect Emma is lying to him about her health concerns, Liv stands up to her brother, and Ashley decides to do something to help his fellow dementia sufferers.(n)

programme.title: River Monsters
programme.desc: In Fiji's South Pacific paradise, people are coming under attack. Plunging off the beaten track into the remote mountains of the island's interior, freshwater detective Jeremy battles tropical storms and unforgiving jungles in an all-out search for victims, clues, and culprits. Colourful stories of monstrous fish are woven into the local folklore, but how much of this is fanciful, and how much of it is real?.(n)

programme.title: Fierce
programme.desc: Steve Backshall travels to Queensland, Australia, where he tracks down the smallest and most venomous box jellyfish in the world, the irukandji, and gets hands on with a Stingray. He also encounters the cassowary, a giant flightless bird with a lethal kick, and scours the rainforest for two spiders with extraordinary hunting techniques.(n)

programme.title: Crash: Anatomy of an Accident
programme.desc: On the morning of September 5, 2013, 130 vehicles on the Sheppey Crossing in Kent collided in thick fog. In the chaos that followed, more than 300 people found themselves trapped amidst a sea of crumpled and twisted metal and broken glass. This drama-documentary focuses on the personal stories of some of the people caught up in one of the biggest pile-ups seen on British roads.(n)

programme.title: What Would Be Your Miracle
programme.desc: Emma Willis presents the stories of two more people whose lives are being transformed by modern medicine. After a traumatic birth Livi Wickham was diagnosed as deaf when she was a year old. Now eight, Livi is about to have an operation to fit two cochlear implants that she hopes will allow her to hear her parents, as well as music. Emma also meets retired marine Mac Macgregor, who after an active life began suffering with a condition that causes bodily tremors. His only hope is surgery to apply electrodes to his brain - electrodes he can switch on and off from a controller embedded in his chest. Will either of them get their miracle?.(n)

programme.title: Bargain Shop Wars
programme.desc: Pep&Co enters the competitive school uniform market, putting the range to the test with the help of a bunch of kids enjoying a muddy, fun-filled trial. Trading director Cathy takes a risk on a £1 polo shirt and supersizes her bulk order, while chairman Andy takes on the supermarket juggernauts by bettering their school uniform guarantees. Meanwhile, Salford's super-seller Paula sets herself the goal of selling eight times her weekly target, and Derby staff hold a clearance sale where knickers are just 30p.(n)

programme.title: The Jeremy Kyle Show
programme.desc: The host invites guests to air their differences over family and relationship issues, and provides them with his own brand of no-nonsense advice.(n)

programme.title: Good Morning Britain
programme.desc: A lively mix of news and current affairs, plus health, entertainment and lifestyle features. Presented by Susanna Reid, Piers Morgan, Ben Shephard, Charlotte Hawkins and Sean Fletcher.(n)

programme.title: Lorraine
programme.desc: Lesley Garrett talks to Lorraine about going back to her operatic roots in her UK tour, Pleasure, and Piers Morgan discusses his new documentary series about female killers.(n)

programme.title: The Jeremy Kyle Show
programme.desc: The host invites guests to air their differences over family and relationship issues, and provides them with his own brand of no-nonsense advice.(n)

programme.title: This Morning
programme.desc: Phillip Schofield and Holly Willoughby present celebrity chat and lifestyle features, including a look at the stories making the newspaper headlines and a recipe in the kitchen. Including Local Weather.(n)

programme.title: Loose Women
programme.desc: The panel discuss the issues making the front pages today, and are joined by Geordie Shore's Charlotte Crosby.(n)

programme.title: Judge Rinder
programme.desc: Cameras follow criminal barrister Robert Rinder as he takes on real-life cases in a studio courtroom.(n)

programme.title: Dickinson's Real Deal
programme.desc: David Dickinson and his dealers are in Buckinghamshire, where he and Stewart Hofgartner enthuse over a radiogram, and 'angels' visit Helen Gardiner.(n)

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Game show, hosted by Ben Shephard, in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a £10,000 jackpot.(n)

programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as contestants Harry, James, Rachel and Margaret pit their wits against ruthless quiz genius the Chaser in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. They work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught.(n)

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: Cain is mistakenly convinced that Rakesh is Belle's secret married lover, so he and Holly hold him hostage. However, when Charity discovers that Belle has been out all night, she realises her cousin has made a terrible mistake. Finn begins to suspect Emma is lying to him about her health concerns, Liv stands up to her brother, and Ashley decides to do something to help his fellow dementia sufferers.(n)

programme.title: River Monsters
programme.desc: In Fiji's South Pacific paradise, people are coming under attack. Plunging off the beaten track into the remote mountains of the island's interior, freshwater detective Jeremy battles tropical storms and unforgiving jungles in an all-out search for victims, clues, and culprits. Colourful stories of monstrous fish are woven into the local folklore, but how much of this is fanciful, and how much of it is real?.(n)

programme.title: Fierce
programme.desc: Steve Backshall travels to Queensland, Australia, where he tracks down the smallest and most venomous box jellyfish in the world, the irukandji, and gets hands on with a Stingray. He also encounters the cassowary, a giant flightless bird with a lethal kick, and scours the rainforest for two spiders with extraordinary hunting techniques.(n)

programme.title: Crash: Anatomy of an Accident
programme.desc: On the morning of September 5, 2013, 130 vehicles on the Sheppey Crossing in Kent collided in thick fog. In the chaos that followed, more than 300 people found themselves trapped amidst a sea of crumpled and twisted metal and broken glass. This drama-documentary focuses on the personal stories of some of the people caught up in one of the biggest pile-ups seen on British roads.(n)

programme.title: What Would Be Your Miracle
programme.desc: Emma Willis presents the stories of two more people whose lives are being transformed by modern medicine. After a traumatic birth Livi Wickham was diagnosed as deaf when she was a year old. Now eight, Livi is about to have an operation to fit two cochlear implants that she hopes will allow her to hear her parents, as well as music. Emma also meets retired marine Mac Macgregor, who after an active life began suffering with a condition that causes bodily tremors. His only hope is surgery to apply electrodes to his brain - electrodes he can switch on and off from a controller embedded in his chest. Will either of them get their miracle?.(n)

programme.title: Bargain Shop Wars
programme.desc: Pep&Co enters the competitive school uniform market, putting the range to the test with the help of a bunch of kids enjoying a muddy, fun-filled trial. Trading director Cathy takes a risk on a £1 polo shirt and supersizes her bulk order, while chairman Andy takes on the supermarket juggernauts by bettering their school uniform guarantees. Meanwhile, Salford's super-seller Paula sets herself the goal of selling eight times her weekly target, and Derby staff hold a clearance sale where knickers are just 30p.(n)

programme.title: Planet's Funniest Animals
programme.desc: Humorous clips of pets and other animals in unusual situations.(n)

programme.title: Dinner Date
programme.desc: Jemma from Birmingham chooses three blind dates based entirely on menus created by five potential partners, with each of the successful candidates hoping to win over the lady in question with an evening of fine wining and dining. Narrated by Charlotte Hudson.(n)

programme.title: The Ellen DeGeneres Show
programme.desc: Julia Roberts talks about her new film Mother's Day. Also making an appearance are sword swallower Alex Magala and four-year-old periodic table expert Brielle Mill.(n)

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: Holly's meddling results in a violent confrontation as Cain catches Pete in his house and hits him. Pete announces he is leaving for Scotland as soon as possible, and Finn says he wants to come too - but Emma resorts to desperate measures to ensure that they both stay in Emmerdale. Lawrence worries that he has lost Chrissie's trust for good, Belle fears she might be pregnant, and Harriet urges Ashley to attend a dementia support group.(n)

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: Todd secretly films Phelan making a deal to sell Tony's belongings behind Jason's back, and Carla orders Michelle to concentrate on her marriage. Meanwhile, a paranoid Sarah snaps at Kylie, and Sean is upset when he realises Billy has put their holiday on hold.(n)

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: While Steve tries to win Michelle over with a romantic meal, Liz plans to go to Spain as she can't deal with the bad atmosphere in the run up to Tony's funeral. Meanwhile, Phelan tries to smooth things over with Eileen after being confronted with the damning video footage, and Sarah tells Kylie she reckons Harry can sense his dead father's presence in the house.(n)

programme.title: Psych
programme.desc: Shawn successfully tracks down Lassiter's stolen car, but realises there is more to the case than meets the eye and asks Gus to cut his holiday short to help solve it.(n)

programme.title: Royal Pains
programme.desc: Don remains in a coma - and Hank keeps a vigil at his bedside - but a worried Molly blames the doctor for her father's condition, and reports him for police blood tests. Starring Mark Feuerstein, Paulo Costanzo and Jill Flint.(n)

programme.title: Take Me Out
programme.desc: The love lift delivers a London rugby player, a physiotherapist from Liverpool, a gymnastics coach from Bath and a Glasgow drainage engineer, all of whom are hoping to land a date with one of 30 single women on the Isle of Fernandos. However, to have any chance of succeeding, they must ensure the female participants keep their lights on as a sign of approval. But in the final round, if only one or two remain lit, they will have the choice of opting for the mystery girl, based solely on the sound of her voice. Paddy McGuinness presents.(n)

programme.title: You've Been Framed
programme.desc: Harry Hill narrates a comical selection of mishaps filmed by viewers, including an angry woman who throws a dart into her husband's leg, an electrolysis accident that delivers a powerful electric shock to an unlucky man's nipple and why teaching a toddler to operate a full-size tractor is a bad idea.(n)

programme.sub-title: This Is Not Gonna End Well.
programme.desc: Charlie relies on Jake to be his driver when he loses his licence, and is less than impressed when Alan makes plans to attend Chelsea's birthday party.(n)

programme.title: Two and a Half Men
programme.sub-title: Three Girls and a Guy Named Bud.
programme.desc: Jake discovers that Alan has been secretly dating Eldridge's mother Lindsey, and is so furious he decides to move out and live with Judith full time. Meanwhile, Charlie resolves to drop his booze habit.(n)

programme.title: Family Guy

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: Stewie's favourite teddy bear is ruined by a dog, and he grows attached to Lois after she tries to repair it. Meanwhile, Peter visits the doctor for a flu vaccination, but goes into a state of shock when given a prostate examination.(n)

programme.title: Plebs
programme.desc: Grumio injures another slave in a fight over a carrot and is forced to replace him until he recovers, joining a new household where work is taken seriously. programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: Peter is devastated when his parents get a divorce, but begins to warm to his mother's newsreader boyfriend and reverts to being a child. Meanwhile, Brian is offered his own radio show. Animated comedy, featuring the voices of Seth MacFarlane and Mila Kunis.(n)

programme.title: American Dad
programme.desc: Steve tries to make Stan proud of him by joining a junior football team, but ends up being dropped from the squad by his father. He enlists Roger's help to exact his revenge and recruits a team of misfits to spoil his dad's perfect season.(n)

programme.title: American Dad

programme.title: The Cleveland Show

programme.title: Two and a Half Men
programme.sub-title: A Bottle of Wine and a Jackhammer.
programme.desc: Alan struggles to decide whether to move in with Lyndsey, having become comfortable staying at Charlie's place. However, when he discovers that Judith is not so keen on the idea of his living so close, he gleefully takes the plunge - just to provoke his ex-wife's temper.(n)

programme.title: Two and a Half Men
programme.desc: Despite now living with Lindsey, Alan hooks up with an ex-girlfriend, prompting his eternally put-upon brother to pick at his conscience. However, an accident involving a discarded pipe places Charlie at the mercy of his sibling once again. Comedy, starring Charlie Sheen.(n)

programme.title: The Matrix Revolutions
programme.desc: As the survivors of the human race make their last stand against the machines, freedom fighters Neo and Trinity undertake a desperate journey into the heart of the enemy stronghold seeking a way to end the war, while the rogue computer programme Smith sets about remaking the virtual world of the Matrix in his own image. programme.desc: Holly's meddling results in a violent confrontation as Cain catches Pete in his house and hits him. programme.desc: Stewie's favourite teddy bear is ruined by a dog, and he grows attached to Lois after she tries to repair it. Meanwhile, Peter visits the doctor for a flu vaccination, but goes into a state of shock when given a prostate examination.(n)

programme.desc: The hospital staff are pushed to their limits when an amusement arcade collapses. Medical drama, starring Natalie Anderson and Scott Taylor.(n)

programme.title: Long Lost Family
programme.desc: Inge Dart, 66, grew up in Kenya in the dying days of the British Empire, overshadowed by her domineering mother. After becoming pregnant at the age of 19, she was sent halfway around the world to give birth in secret. Banished to Surrey, she was taken in by a couple who looked after her until her daughter was born. Inge's childhood sweetheart Jeremy soon visited and the young lovers spent what little time they had with their baby. Long Lost Family takes on Inge's search for her child and, in a first for the programme, her daughter's own search for her father Jeremy. Davina McCall and Nicky Campbell present.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order: UK
programme.desc: A murder inquiry is launched when the police are alerted to shocking internet footage showing a teenage girl being attacked and shot. The investigation is hindered by the lack of a body, but the video provides enough clues to eventually put a name to the victim and track down her killers. However, a vow of silence between the defendants means Jake and Alesha face one of their toughest court battles yet.(n)

programme.title: Long Lost Family
programme.desc: Inge Dart, 66, grew up in Kenya in the dying days of the British Empire, overshadowed by her domineering mother. After becoming pregnant at the age of 19, she was sent halfway around the world to give birth in secret. Banished to Surrey, she was taken in by a couple who looked after her until her daughter was born. Inge's childhood sweetheart Jeremy soon visited and the young lovers spent what little time they had with their baby. Long Lost Family takes on Inge's search for her child and, in a first for the programme, her daughter's own search for her father Jeremy. Davina McCall and Nicky Campbell present.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order: UK

programme.title: Double Jeopardy
programme.desc: A man fakes his own death and frames his wife for murder, but after six years in prison she is released. Thriller, starring Ashley Judd, Tommy Lee Jones, Bruce Greenwood and Annabeth Gish.(n)

Thriller, starring Ashley Judd, Tommy Lee Jones, Bruce Greenwood and Annabeth Gish.(n)

programme.title: Total Recall
programme.desc: A construction worker pays to have fake memories of a dream holiday implanted into his brain, but discovers his mind has already been tampered with - apparently to erase his true identity as a secret agent from a colony on Mars. He journeys to the planet in search of the truth, but is drawn into a conflict between the tyrannical ruler and a rebel faction. Paul Verhoeven's sci-fi thriller, starring Arnold Schwarzenegger, Rachel Ticotin and Michael Ironside.(n)

programme.title: Jamie's 15 Minute Meals
programme.sub-title: Chicken Dim Sum and Crab Bricks.
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver is in the kitchen and he prepares chicken dim sum with coconut buns, cucumber pickle and hoi sin sauce, plus `crackin' crab briks', couscous salad and salsa.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Winter Sun
programme.desc: Jonnie Irwin helps Alan and Michele Raine from Sunderland search for a family home in Orlando, Florida, where property prices are half what they were five years earlier.(n)

programme.title: River Cottage Bites
programme.desc: Head gardener Mark Diacono provides a step-by-step guide to planning a vegetable patch, and shows how people can save money by growing their own produce, expanding their culinary horizons and providing the freshest produce around.(n)

programme.title: Beaches
programme.desc: Brash child performer CC and rich girl Hillary become unlikely friends when they first meet at 11 years old. Years later they are still close, but Hillary, who is now a successful lawyer, is stricken with a terminal illness. CC goes to visit her and together they reflect on the highs and lows of their long, volatile relationship. Drama, starring Bette Midler, Barbara Hershey, John Heard and Mayim Bialik.(n)

programme.title: Time Team
programme.desc: Extreme weather takes over during a bid to excavate a medieval leper hospital in Winchester, Hampshire, a site that would have featured a chapel and living quarters. Forensic archaeologist Professor Margaret Cox investigates bones taken from the cemetery, which show an array of severe abnormalities and infections, while the team discovers a well measuring more than 500ft deep.(n)

programme.title: Time Team
programme.desc: The experts visit the Orkney Islands, where a local farmer explains his search for an underground chamber buried beneath a grassy mound known as Mine Howe. As they excavate a flight of stone steps into the dark room, questions are raised as to why it is there.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Winter Sun
programme.desc: Jonnie Irwin helps Alan and Michele Raine from Sunderland search for a family home in Orlando, Florida, where property prices are half what they were five years earlier.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Winter Sun
programme.desc: Presenter Jasmine Harman has her work cut out as she tries to help Gordon Sandilands and his partner Louisa Hunter find a second home in Murcia, Spain for less than £100,000.(n)

programme.title: Selling Houses with Amanda Lamb
programme.desc: Three homeowners in Wokingham, Berkshire, who are struggling to sell their properties compete to sell their houses to first-time buyer Francesca. Raj and Maria are finding buyers are being put off by their decking, and Margaret's interior decoration needs updating. Meanwhile, Bob and Geraldine are putting off buyers with their outdated decor. They each receive £1,000 to make improvements in the hope of finally selling their homes.(n)

programme.title: George Clarke's Amazing Spaces
programme.desc: The architect catches up with designer Max McMurdo, who converted a shipping container into a garden office. This time, Max has gone back to his old school in Bedford to create a classroom out of two more of the containers. George also visits a prototype for a mini home so small it can be driven on the back of a truck, and in Somerset, he meets a couple who have turned a vintage vehicle into a mobile cinema business.(n)

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Kevin McCloud follows the progress of teacher Michele Long and architect Michael Howe, who want to restore and transform a 100-year-old blacksmiths in Co Antrim. With virtually no practical experience, Michael wants to do as much of the project as possible by himself. However, the weather on the coastline is fierce, and the freezing weather coupled with a tight budget of 150k means the build is stretched from one to three years.(n)

programme.title: Vet on the Hill
programme.desc: Liza Tarbuck pops into the surgery with her elderly dog Wilf, and vet Scott Miller's Border terrier Betty has therapy on a water treadmill to help with rehabilitation after emergency spinal surgery. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Thirty-seven-year-old Robert arrives at St Georges Hospital, London after colliding with a car on his motorbike. Scans show he has a bleed on the brain, a broken jaw, and two missing teeth, and he faces potentially life-changing injuries and extensive surgery. Meanwhile, 54-year-old Mary collapsed in the street on the way to work and hit her head. Doctors need to establish whether it is simple fainting, or whether something more sinister is to blame, with tests revealing she will need a pacemaker fitted. Plus, 27-year-old Jessica comes to A&E with a wound that will not heal, after having a lumpectomy to remove breast cancer tissue two months ago.(n)

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: A man with schizophrenia is admitted for the 19th time in a year after failing to take his diabetes medication. Meanwhile, a former betting-shop manager and a 16-year-old both suffer suspected strokes - the 61-year-old, once known as the `memory man', is now coming to terms with his diminishing mental capabilities, while the teenager's identical twin and mother wait by his bedside for the results of a brain scan.(n)

programme.title: Undercover Boss USA
programme.desc: Randy DeWitt, the CEO and co-founder of bar and grill chain Twin Peaks, goes undercover to find out whether the company's culture is keeping up with its rapid growth. Posing as a contestant on a reality TV competition, he works among his own staff.(n)

programme.title: Vet on the Hill
programme.desc: Liza Tarbuck pops into the surgery with her elderly dog Wilf, and vet Scott Miller's Border terrier Betty has therapy on a water treadmill to help with rehabilitation after emergency spinal surgery. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Jamie's 15 Minute Meals
programme.sub-title: Chorizo and Squid, and Simple Spaghetti.
programme.desc: Chef Jamie Oliver prepares a selection of dishes including chorizo and squid with Greek-style couscous salad. Plus, spaghetti, tomato, basil and creamy curd salad.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Winter Sun
programme.desc: Presenter Jasmine Harman has her work cut out as she tries to help Gordon Sandilands and his partner Louisa Hunter find a second home in Murcia, Spain for less than £100,000.(n)

programme.title: River Cottage Bites
programme.desc: John Wright provides a guide to foraging the seaside for clams, and shares a recipe for gremolata.(n)

programme.title: The Cruel Sea
programme.desc: The veteran commander of a British escort vessel guides his inexperienced crew through the dangers of combat at sea during the Second World War Atlantic campaigns. Demoralised by the failure of his last command, the captain faces a life-or-death decision in his duty to sink an enemy vessel. Nautical action adventure, starring Jack Hawkins, Donald Sinden, Stanley Baker and Denholm Elliott.(n)

programme.title: Time Team
programme.sub-title: Warboys, Cambridgeshire: Beacon of the Fens.
programme.desc: Tony Robinson and the team brave freezing weather to explore Chapel Hill on the windswept expanse of the East Anglian Fens. Flint axes and ornately carved stone blocks discovered by the landowners suggest a religious building or prehistoric monument once stood on the small Cambridgeshire outcrop, while other theories about the location's history include a Bronze Age burial ground and a lighthouse. However, the first day of the dig produces evidence the site is even older than the archaeologists expected.(n)

programme.title: Time Team
programme.sub-title: Ulnaby, Co Durham: The Hollow Way.
programme.desc: Tony Robinson and the team travel to the grass-covered remains of the deserted medieval village of Ulnaby in the Durham countryside. Although the site has been photographed, surveyed and written about, it has never been dug before. As work progresses, the convivial atmosphere and the team's patience are tested to the limit when the evidence on the ground does not tally with what the archaeologists have been promised.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Winter Sun
programme.desc: Laura Hamilton tries to help model agency boss Susan Mitchell and her friend Sara Minton find their dream holiday home in Gran Canaria.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Winter Sun
programme.desc: Jonnie Irwin travels to Vero Beach, Florida, to help Deborah and Stephen Price from Cardiff find their dream holiday home on the other side of the Atlantic on a budget of £80,000.(n)

programme.title: Selling Houses with Amanda Lamb
programme.desc: Three homeowners in Sevenoaks, Kent, compete to sell their houses to buyer Rebecca, and are given £1,000 to make improvements to their homes. Robin's empty dwelling makes it hard for potential purchasers to visualize living there, while Jan and Bill must update their decor, and Julia and Chris's home needs to come across less bland and more appealing.(n)

programme.title: George Clarke's Amazing Spaces
programme.desc: The architect prepares to unveil his multi-functional tree house in the grounds of Kielder Water and Forest Park in Northumberland, and meets a couple with big plans to build a theatre in a 1970s caravan. Plus, a man who has created a pub in his garden shed, and a 19th-century shepherd's hut undergoes restoration using Victorian steam-powered machinery.(n)

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Ben and Rachel Hammond have spent a year searching London for somewhere exciting to live with their two daughters, and they have finally stumbled on a 1950s home on a unique plot, situated within the leafy depths of a park in the south of the city. The only problem is the house itself - an ugly, inefficient and uninspiring property - and their solution is to radically transform it into a sleek, modernist masterpiece. But this is no easy task, as Kevin McCloud finds out.(n)

programme.title: Homes by the Med
programme.desc: Charlie Luxton heads to the island of Crete, and visits a sprawling palace of glass, metal and rock west of Chania, featuring a guest block that seems to float above the sea. He also vists a tiny mobile home in an olive grove in the south of the island.(n)

programme.title: Obsessive Compulsive Cleaners
programme.desc: Cleaning obsessives Hayley and Dann head for Plas Teg, a 17th-century Jacobean manor in the heart of Flintshire, north Wales. This 10-bedroom Italian-inspired residence is home to Cornelia and her 12 cats, and is also said to be one of the most haunted houses in Wales. Cornelia is desperate to generate income to restore the Grade I listed building to its former glory, so Hayley and Dann have agreed to spend five days cleaning alongside her, pushing their boundaries and challenging their germ phobia.(n)

programme.title: Sex Toy Stories
programme.desc: Documentary following eight volunteers working with the Ann Summers company to create a new vibrator. The contributors, including a 69-year-old grandmother, a twentysomething virgin and a middle-aged divorcee who has never achieved an orgasm, test existing products on the market and find inspiration in their kitchen cupboards for their dream sex toy, hoping the retailer can get it on to shop shelves in time for Valentine's Day.(n)

programme.title: Jamie's 15 Minute Meals
programme.sub-title: Chicken Dim Sum and Crab Bricks.
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver is in the kitchen and he prepares chicken dim sum with coconut buns, cucumber pickle and hoi sin sauce, plus `crackin' crab briks', couscous salad and salsa.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Winter Sun
programme.desc: Jonnie Irwin helps Alan and Michele Raine from Sunderland search for a family home in Orlando, Florida, where property prices are half what they were five years earlier.(n)

programme.title: River Cottage Bites
programme.desc: Head gardener Mark Diacono provides a step-by-step guide to planning a vegetable patch, and shows how people can save money by growing their own produce, expanding their culinary horizons and providing the freshest produce around.(n)

programme.title: Beaches
programme.desc: Brash child performer CC and rich girl Hillary become unlikely friends when they first meet at 11 years old. Years later they are still close, but Hillary, who is now a successful lawyer, is stricken with a terminal illness. CC goes to visit her and together they reflect on the highs and lows of their long, volatile relationship. Drama, starring Bette Midler, Barbara Hershey, John Heard and Mayim Bialik.(n)

programme.title: Time Team
programme.desc: Extreme weather takes over during a bid to excavate a medieval leper hospital in Winchester, Hampshire, a site that would have featured a chapel and living quarters. Forensic archaeologist Professor Margaret Cox investigates bones taken from the cemetery, which show an array of severe abnormalities and infections, while the team discovers a well measuring more than 500ft deep.(n)

programme.title: Time Team
programme.desc: The experts visit the Orkney Islands, where a local farmer explains his search for an underground chamber buried beneath a grassy mound known as Mine Howe. As they excavate a flight of stone steps into the dark room, questions are raised as to why it is there.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Winter Sun
programme.desc: Jonnie Irwin helps Alan and Michele Raine from Sunderland search for a family home in Orlando, Florida, where property prices are half what they were five years earlier.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Winter Sun
programme.desc: Presenter Jasmine Harman has her work cut out as she tries to help Gordon Sandilands and his partner Louisa Hunter find a second home in Murcia, Spain for less than £100,000.(n)

programme.title: Selling Houses with Amanda Lamb
programme.desc: Three homeowners in Wokingham, Berkshire, who are struggling to sell their properties compete to sell their houses to first-time buyer Francesca. Raj and Maria are finding buyers are being put off by their decking, and Margaret's interior decoration needs updating. Meanwhile, Bob and Geraldine are putting off buyers with their outdated decor. They each receive £1,000 to make improvements in the hope of finally selling their homes.(n)

programme.title: George Clarke's Amazing Spaces
programme.desc: The architect catches up with designer Max McMurdo, who converted a shipping container into a garden office. This time, Max has gone back to his old school in Bedford to create a classroom out of two more of the containers. George also visits a prototype for a mini home so small it can be driven on the back of a truck, and in Somerset, he meets a couple who have turned a vintage vehicle into a mobile cinema business.(n)

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Kevin McCloud follows the progress of teacher Michele Long and architect Michael Howe, who want to restore and transform a 100-year-old blacksmiths in Co Antrim. With virtually no practical experience, Michael wants to do as much of the project as possible by himself. However, the weather on the coastline is fierce, and the freezing weather coupled with a tight budget of 150k means the build is stretched from one to three years.(n)

programme.title: Vet on the Hill
programme.desc: Liza Tarbuck pops into the surgery with her elderly dog Wilf, and vet Scott Miller's Border terrier Betty has therapy on a water treadmill to help with rehabilitation after emergency spinal surgery. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Thirty-seven-year-old Robert arrives at St Georges Hospital, London after colliding with a car on his motorbike. Scans show he has a bleed on the brain, a broken jaw, and two missing teeth, and he faces potentially life-changing injuries and extensive surgery. Meanwhile, 54-year-old Mary collapsed in the street on the way to work and hit her head. Doctors need to establish whether it is simple fainting, or whether something more sinister is to blame, with tests revealing she will need a pacemaker fitted. Plus, 27-year-old Jessica comes to A&E with a wound that will not heal, after having a lumpectomy to remove breast cancer tissue two months ago.(n)

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: A man with schizophrenia is admitted for the 19th time in a year after failing to take his diabetes medication. Meanwhile, a former betting-shop manager and a 16-year-old both suffer suspected strokes - the 61-year-old, once known as the `memory man', is now coming to terms with his diminishing mental capabilities, while the teenager's identical twin and mother wait by his bedside for the results of a brain scan.(n)

programme.title: Undercover Boss USA
programme.desc: Randy DeWitt, the CEO and co-founder of bar and grill chain Twin Peaks, goes undercover to find out whether the company's culture is keeping up with its rapid growth. Posing as a contestant on a reality TV competition, he works among his own staff.(n)

programme.title: Vet on the Hill
programme.desc: Liza Tarbuck pops into the surgery with her elderly dog Wilf, and vet Scott Miller's Border terrier Betty has therapy on a water treadmill to help with rehabilitation after emergency spinal surgery. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: The Cruel Sea
programme.desc: The veteran commander of a British escort vessel guides his inexperienced crew through the dangers of combat at sea during the Second World War Atlantic campaigns. Demoralised by the failure of his last command, the captain faces a life-or-death decision in his duty to sink an enemy vessel. Nautical action adventure, starring Jack Hawkins, Donald Sinden, Stanley Baker and Denholm Elliott.(n)

programme.title: FIA European Truck Racing

programme.title: Inside Grand Prix

programme.title: Auto Mundial
programme.desc: Auto Mundial brings you the latest in the automotive industry on a weekly basis: new cars, technology, and the main motorshows around the planet(n)

programme.title: Ferrari Challenge Europa
programme.desc: Maranello's favourite GT car, the 458, forms the basis of Ferrari's premier one-make European series. Round 2 from Mugello (Trofeo Pirelli)(n)

programme.title: Ferrari Challenge Europa
programme.desc: Maranello's favourite GT car, the 458, forms the basis of Ferrari's premier one-make European series. Round 2 from Mugello (Soppa Shell)(n)

programme.title: IMSA SportsCar Championship
programme.desc: A mix of LMP2, DP and GT machinery, as well as the innovative DeltaWing, take part in this stateside sportscar series(n)

programme.title: Doctor Dolittle
programme.desc: A Victorian veterinary surgeon is certified insane after developing the ability to talk to his patients in their own language. Undaunted, he manages to escape from the asylum and embarks on a quest to locate a rare aquatic snail. Oscar-winning musical comedy, with Rex Harrison, Samantha Eggar, Richard Attenborough and Anthony Newley. Songs include Talk to the Animals and I've Never Seen Anything Like It.(n)

programme.title: Avengers: Age of Ultron Special
programme.desc: Alex Zane goes behind the scenes of the Marvel superhero sequel.(n)

programme.title: The Bravados
programme.desc: A widower visits a town where the men he believes murdered his wife are about to be hanged. When they escape from jail, he takes the law into his own hands and decides to hunt down and kill the fugitives. But over time, he begins to question whether his actions are right. Western, starring Gregory Peck, Joan Collins and Stephen Boyd.(n)

programme.title: D-Day, the Sixth of June
programme.desc: A British colonel and an American captain board a ship heading out on a dangerous mission as part of the Normandy Landings. As the two men prepare for the battle to come, they both reminisce about their love for the same woman. Second World War drama, starring Robert Taylor, Richard Todd, Dana Wynter and Edmond O'Brien.(n)

programme.title: Frost/Nixon
programme.desc: British broadcaster and journalist David Frost comes up with the idea of setting up a series of exclusive televised interviews with the disgraced former president of the United States, Richard Nixon. Believing he could use the publicity as a chance to resurrect his political career and make some easy money, Nixon agrees but soon realises he has underestimated Frost. Fact-based drama, starring Frank Langella, Michael Sheen, Sam Rockwell and Kevin Bacon.(n)

programme.title: My Best Friend's Wedding
programme.desc: A food critic realises she is in love with her best friend just as he announces he is going to marry another woman. Determined to have him to herself, she heads for the wedding with the intention of sabotaging the ceremony - but persuading the groom to give up on his bride-to-be proves harder than expected. Romantic comedy, starring Julia Roberts, Dermot Mulroney, Cameron Diaz and Rupert Everett.(n)

programme.title: Amadeus: The Director's Cut
programme.desc: Composer Antonio Salieri is a favoured artist in the court of Austrian emperor Joseph II, but he finds himself pushed aside in favour of a young Mozart. Salieri admires the younger maestro's music, but is incensed that someone so vulgar and obnoxious should be gifted with such talent, and as jealousy consumes him, he plots his rival's downfall. Extended cut of Milos Forman's period drama, adapted by Peter Shaffer from his own play and starring F Murray Abraham and Tom Hulce.(n)

programme.title: Wild Wild West
programme.desc: A government agent teams up with a gadget-mad master of disguise to investigate the disappearance of several scientists. Their search leads them to an evil genius who is plotting to kill the US president with some bizarre inventions of his own. Sci-fi Western comedy, starring Will Smith, Kevin Kline, Kenneth Branagh, Salma Hayek and Ted Levine.(n)

programme.title: Insomnia
programme.desc: A detective is sent to Alaska to investigate a murder during a month when the sun does not set. Sleep deprivation starts to take its toll, and he accidentally shoots his partner dead. He tries to cover it up, but the criminal they were hunting has seen everything and blackmails the cop into helping him escape justice. Thriller directed by Christopher Nolan, starring Al Pacino, Robin Williams and Hilary Swank.(n)

programme.title: Deep Blue Sea
programme.desc: A scientist researching Alzheimer's disease devises a way to enlarge the brains of killer sharks on an isolated research facility to help develop her theories. However, the experiments result in a marked increase in the creatures' intelligence, and before long they manage to escape their confinement - with bloody consequences. Thriller, starring Saffron Burrows, Thomas Jane, Stellan Skarsgard, LL Cool J and Samuel L Jackson.(n)

programme.title: Klute
programme.desc: A private detective investigates the disappearance of a scientist in New York, but finds his only lead is a prostitute with a tenuous connection to the missing man - and his attempts to gain her help are soon hampered by shadowy figures intent on silencing her. Alan J Pakula's thriller, starring Donald Sutherland, Roy Scheider and an Oscar-winning Jane Fonda.(n)

programme.title: D-Day, the Sixth of June
programme.desc: A British colonel and an American captain board a ship heading out on a dangerous mission as part of the Normandy Landings. As the two men prepare for the battle to come, they both reminisce about their love for the same woman. Second World War drama, starring Robert Taylor, Richard Todd, Dana Wynter and Edmond O'Brien.(n)

programme.title: In Harm's Way
programme.desc: Two Navy officers are disgraced in the aftermath of the attack on Pearl Harbour, one for a disastrous engagement with the enemy and the other for a drunken brawl after learning of his wife's death. They get another chance to prove their worth when they are placed in charge of a vital counter-offensive. Second World War drama, starring John Wayne, Kirk Douglas and Henry Fonda.(n)

programme.title: Ocean's Eleven
programme.desc: A suave ex-convict assembles a gang of sophisticated crooks to pull off a daring heist. He intends to rob three of Las Vegas's biggest casinos simultaneously - and also win back his estranged wife, who is now dating the ruthless owner of all three gambling establishments. Steven Soderbergh's crime comedy, starring George Clooney, Brad Pitt, Julia Roberts, Matt Damon and Bernie Mac.(n)

programme.title: The Matrix
programme.desc: A computer hacker discovers the world around him is nothing more than a virtual-reality fantasy created by malevolent living machines. Entering the devastated real world, he joins freedom fighters risking their lives to bring the truth out into the open and liberate the human race. Sci-fi action thriller, starring Keanu Reeves, Laurence Fishburne, Carrie-Anne Moss and Hugo Weaving.(n)

programme.title: Sense and Sensibility
programme.desc: An impoverished family is taken in by a relative - and while sensible elder daughter Elinor's love for the sensitive Edward Ferrars meets with disapproval from his family, her more passionate younger sister Marianne engages in a disastrous romance with an infamous womaniser. Period drama based on Jane Austen's novel, directed by Ang Lee and starring Emma Thompson, Kate Winslet, Alan Rickman and Hugh Grant.(n)

programme.title: The Golden Voyage of Sinbad
programme.desc: A swashbuckling sailor stumbles across a golden tablet that forms part of a map revealing the way to a magic fountain, which is fabled to bestow untold riches and eternal youth. But first the brave mariner has to battle storms, monsters and the trickery of an evil wizard before he can reach his goal. Fantasy adventure, with John Phillip Law, Tom Baker, Douglas Wilmer, Martin Shaw and Caroline Munro, with effects by Ray Harryhausen.(n)

programme.title: The Hustler
programme.desc: An arrogant pool shark challenges a renowned champion player, only to lose the match and end up broke with his confidence shattered. With the aid of a cut-throat manager, he sets about honing his skills for a rematch - but making it to the top could cost him everything. Oscar-winning drama, starring Paul Newman, Jackie Gleason, George C Scott, Piper Laurie, Murray Hamilton and Myron McCormick.(n)

programme.title: Ocean's Eleven
programme.desc: A suave ex-convict assembles a gang of sophisticated crooks to pull off a daring heist. He intends to rob three of Las Vegas's biggest casinos simultaneously - and also win back his estranged wife, who is now dating the ruthless owner of all three gambling establishments. Steven Soderbergh's crime comedy, starring George Clooney, Brad Pitt, Julia Roberts, Matt Damon and Bernie Mac.(n)

programme.title: Misery
programme.desc: A successful author finds his relief at being rescued from a near-fatal car crash is severely tempered by the discovery that his saviour is a fan with psychopathic tendencies. The situation takes a turn for the worse when she discovers he has killed off her favourite character - and sets about coercing him to do a rewrite in nightmarish fashion. Oscar-winning thriller, starring James Caan, Kathy Bates and Lauren Bacall.(n)

Oscar-winning thriller, starring James Caan, Kathy Bates and Lauren Bacall.(n)

programme.title: The Matrix
programme.desc: A computer hacker discovers the world around him is nothing more than a virtual-reality fantasy created by malevolent living machines. Entering the devastated real world, he joins freedom fighters risking their lives to bring the truth out into the open and liberate the human race. Sci-fi action thriller, starring Keanu Reeves, Laurence Fishburne, Carrie-Anne Moss and Hugo Weaving.(n)

programme.title: The Curse of the Pink Panther
programme.desc: Inspector Clouseau vanishes without trace and another detective must be chosen to solve the mystery of his disappearance. Glad to be rid of the bane of his existence, Clouseau's long-suffering boss makes sure an even more inept investigator gets the job. Comedy, starring Herbert Lom, Ted Wass, Joanna Lumley, David Niven and Robert Wagner.(n)

programme.title: Arthur
programme.desc: Boozy playboy Arthur Bach is content to drift through life without ambition and await the multimillion-dollar inheritance due to him following an arranged high-society wedding. However, on the threshold of the nuptials, Arthur falls for a penniless shoplifter and begins to doubt whether he wants to go through with the ceremony. Comedy, starring Dudley Moore, Liza Minnelli and an Oscar-winning John Gielgud.(n)

programme.title: The Wedding Ringer
programme.desc: A socially awkward young groom-to-be hires a professional best man to make him look good at his forthcoming wedding. Convincing his fiancee and guests that they really do know each other proves to be problematic, but at least a real friendship begins to develop between the mismatched pair. Comedy, starring Josh Gad, Kevin Hart and Kaley Cuoco-Sweeting.(n)

programme.title: The Inbetweeners 2
programme.desc: Awkward teenagers Will, Simon and Neil find university life does not live up to their expectations, and are insanely jealous of Jay's stories of his gap year in Australia. Heading Down Under to meet their friend, they inevitably discover he has exaggerated his escapades - so decide to go in search of a real adventure. Comedy sequel, starring Simon Bird, James Buckley, Joe Thomas and Blake Harrison.(n)

programme.title: Patch Adams
programme.desc: A talented student doctor turns the medical community upside down with his offbeat views about the healing power of laughter. His methods provoke outrage and intense debate among his professors - but his extrovert nature brightens the lives of all kinds of patients. Comedy drama, starring Robin Williams, Monica Potter, Daniel London, Bob Gunton and Philip Seymour Hoffman.(n)

programme.title: Playing It Cool
programme.desc: A cynical screenwriter is given the job of writing a romantic movie, despite being completely jaded about relationships. He is attracted to a woman who is already engaged, and becomes her friend in the hope that it will give him some insight into what love feels like. Romantic comedy, starring Chris Evans and Michelle Monaghan.(n)

programme.title: A Million Ways to Die in the West
programme.desc: A timid farmer abandoned by his girlfriend is fascinated by a mysterious woman who rides into his frontier town. He tries to act the part of a gunslinging Wild West hero to impress her, only to find himself facing a showdown with her notorious outlaw husband. Western spoof, directed by and starring Seth MacFarlane, with Charlize Theron and Liam Neeson.(n)

programme.title: Johnny English
programme.desc: A bumbling secret agent becomes Britain's leading spy following the assassination of all the country's other espionage experts. Single-handedly he sets out to unmask a mysterious villain responsible for stealing the Crown Jewels - but no one is prepared to believe a sinister billionaire is the culprit. Comedy, starring Rowan Atkinson, John Malkovich, Natalie Imbruglia and Ben Miller.(n)

programme.title: The Wedding Ringer
programme.desc: A socially awkward young groom-to-be hires a professional best man to make him look good at his forthcoming wedding. Convincing his fiancee and guests that they really do know each other proves to be problematic, but at least a real friendship begins to develop between the mismatched pair. Comedy, starring Josh Gad, Kevin Hart and Kaley Cuoco-Sweeting.(n)

programme.title: The Inbetweeners 2
programme.desc: Awkward teenagers Will, Simon and Neil find university life does not live up to their expectations, and are insanely jealous of Jay's stories of his gap year in Australia. Heading Down Under to meet their friend, they inevitably discover he has exaggerated his escapades - so decide to go in search of a real adventure. Comedy sequel, starring Simon Bird, James Buckley, Joe Thomas and Blake Harrison.(n)

programme.title: Bad Words
programme.desc: Jason Bateman directs and stars in this dark comedy about a 40-year-old misanthrope who enters children's spelling contests. With Kathryn Hahn, Rohan Chand and Philip Baker Hall.(n)

programme.title: Me, Myself and Irene
programme.desc: A mild-mannered state trooper bottles up his frustrations for years, causing him to develop a split personality. His alter ego is not quite as easy-going - a problem exacerbated when he falls in love and the two sides of his personality become rivals. Comedy from the Farrelly brothers, starring Jim Carrey, Renee Zellweger, Anthony Anderson, Mongo Brownlee and Robert Forster.(n)

programme.title: Monty Python's The Meaning of Life
programme.desc: A series of sketches examining mankind's secrets and taboos through the trials of life from conception to death. Surreal comedy, starring the Python team of Michael Palin, Graham Chapman, John Cleese, Eric Idle, Terry Jones and Terry Gilliam. Featuring introductory short film The Crimson Permanent Assurance.(n)

programme.title: Son of the Pink Panther
programme.desc: Comedy sequel which sees Inspector Clouseau's over-enthusiastic son on the trail of a kidnapped princess, proving to be just as inept as his father every step of the way. Starring Roberto Benigni, Herbert Lom, Claudia Cardinale, Burt Kwouk, Debrah Farentino and Graham Stark.(n)

programme.title: Dead Man on Campus
programme.desc: Two college layabouts learn the room-mates of students who commit suicide are automatically awarded top grades in all subjects, and begin trying to identify the classmate most likely to end it all. Comedy, starring Tom Everett Scott, Mark-Paul Gosselaar and Poppy Montgomery.(n)

programme.title: Arthur 2: On the Rocks
programme.desc: The drunken millionaire sees his playboy lifestyle grind to a halt when a woman he scorned pulls strings to force him into bankruptcy. Although job opportunities are thin on the ground for booze-sodden layabouts, his wife wants a baby and pressures him to find a job and take responsibility for once in his life. Comedy sequel, starring Dudley Moore and Liza Minnelli, with a cameo appearance by John Gielgud.(n)

programme.title: Get Hard
programme.desc: A corrupt businessman is convicted of fraud, and given 30 days to put his affairs in order before starting a prison sentence. He assumes a black employee has a criminal past, and seeks his help in preparing for a life behind bars - not realising that the financially struggling working stiff has never broken the law in his life. Comedy, starring Will Ferrell and Kevin Hart.(n)

programme.title: Never Been Kissed
programme.desc: A clumsy 25-year-old would-be reporter is given the chance to prove herself when she is sent on an assignment to get an inside take on high-school life. However, when she falls for an English teacher, she has trouble maintaining the facade of a calm and sophisticated young lady, as all the bad memories of her awkward younger days come flooding back. Romantic comedy, with Drew Barrymore, Michael Vartan and David Arquette.(n)

programme.title: Ted 2
programme.desc: The foul-mouthed talking teddy bear is horrified to discover that he counts as property according to the law. He and his human best friend hire a pot-smoking lawyer to help them fight a court case and get Ted legally recognised as a person. Comedy sequel, starring Mark Wahlberg and Amanda Seyfried, with the voice of Seth MacFarlane.(n)

programme.title: The Waterboy
programme.desc: An American football team's waterboy puts up with constant ridicule from the players. But one day his anger gets the better of him and he demonstrates an unexpected talent for tackling - so the coach gives him a chance to prove his worth on the pitch. However, he has to keep his blossoming sporting career a secret from his overprotective mother. Comedy, with Adam Sandler, Kathy Bates, Henry Winkler and Fairuza Balk.(n)

programme.title: Blended
programme.desc: Two single parents go on a disastrous blind date, which leaves them both convinced they never want to see each other again. They unwittingly both take their children on holiday to an African resort, where a mix-up results in both families sharing the same room. Romantic comedy, starring Adam Sandler and Drew Barrymore.(n)

programme.title: Ted 2
programme.desc: The foul-mouthed talking teddy bear is horrified to discover that he counts as property according to the law. He and his human best friend hire a pot-smoking lawyer to help them fight a court case and get Ted legally recognised as a person. Comedy sequel, starring Mark Wahlberg and Amanda Seyfried, with the voice of Seth MacFarlane.(n)

programme.title: Get Hard
programme.desc: A corrupt businessman is convicted of fraud, and given 30 days to put his affairs in order before starting a prison sentence. He assumes a black employee has a criminal past, and seeks his help in preparing for a life behind bars - not realising that the financially struggling working stiff has never broken the law in his life. Comedy, starring Will Ferrell and Kevin Hart.(n)

programme.title: The Goonies
programme.desc: Seven youngsters discover an old map and set out on the adventure of a lifetime to save their homes from a land developer by finding a legendary pirate's hidden treasure. However, they first have to navigate a series of booby-trapped underground caverns and outwit a family of crooks also after the loot. Children's adventure, starring Sean Astin, Corey Feldman, Josh Brolin and Martha Plimpton.(n)

programme.title: The Curse of the Pink Panther
programme.desc: Inspector Clouseau vanishes without trace and another detective must be chosen to solve the mystery of his disappearance. Glad to be rid of the bane of his existence, Clouseau's long-suffering boss makes sure an even more inept investigator gets the job. Comedy, starring Herbert Lom, Ted Wass, Joanna Lumley, David Niven and Robert Wagner.(n)

programme.title: Arthur
programme.desc: Boozy playboy Arthur Bach is content to drift through life without ambition and await the multimillion-dollar inheritance due to him following an arranged high-society wedding. However, on the threshold of the nuptials, Arthur falls for a penniless shoplifter and begins to doubt whether he wants to go through with the ceremony. Comedy, starring Dudley Moore, Liza Minnelli and an Oscar-winning John Gielgud.(n)

programme.title: The Wedding Ringer
programme.desc: A socially awkward young groom-to-be hires a professional best man to make him look good at his forthcoming wedding. Convincing his fiancee and guests that they really do know each other proves to be problematic, but at least a real friendship begins to develop between the mismatched pair. Comedy, starring Josh Gad, Kevin Hart and Kaley Cuoco-Sweeting.(n)

programme.title: The Inbetweeners 2
programme.desc: Awkward teenagers Will, Simon and Neil find university life does not live up to their expectations, and are insanely jealous of Jay's stories of his gap year in Australia. Heading Down Under to meet their friend, they inevitably discover he has exaggerated his escapades - so decide to go in search of a real adventure. Comedy sequel, starring Simon Bird, James Buckley, Joe Thomas and Blake Harrison.(n)

programme.title: Patch Adams
programme.desc: A talented student doctor turns the medical community upside down with his offbeat views about the healing power of laughter. His methods provoke outrage and intense debate among his professors - but his extrovert nature brightens the lives of all kinds of patients. Comedy drama, starring Robin Williams, Monica Potter, Daniel London, Bob Gunton and Philip Seymour Hoffman.(n)

programme.title: Playing It Cool
programme.desc: A cynical screenwriter is given the job of writing a romantic movie, despite being completely jaded about relationships. He is attracted to a woman who is already engaged, and becomes her friend in the hope that it will give him some insight into what love feels like. Romantic comedy, starring Chris Evans and Michelle Monaghan.(n)

programme.title: A Million Ways to Die in the West
programme.desc: A timid farmer abandoned by his girlfriend is fascinated by a mysterious woman who rides into his frontier town. He tries to act the part of a gunslinging Wild West hero to impress her, only to find himself facing a showdown with her notorious outlaw husband. Western spoof, directed by and starring Seth MacFarlane, with Charlize Theron and Liam Neeson.(n)

programme.title: Johnny English
programme.desc: A bumbling secret agent becomes Britain's leading spy following the assassination of all the country's other espionage experts. Single-handedly he sets out to unmask a mysterious villain responsible for stealing the Crown Jewels - but no one is prepared to believe a sinister billionaire is the culprit. Comedy, starring Rowan Atkinson, John Malkovich, Natalie Imbruglia and Ben Miller.(n)

programme.title: The Wedding Ringer
programme.desc: A socially awkward young groom-to-be hires a professional best man to make him look good at his forthcoming wedding. Convincing his fiancee and guests that they really do know each other proves to be problematic, but at least a real friendship begins to develop between the mismatched pair. Comedy, starring Josh Gad, Kevin Hart and Kaley Cuoco-Sweeting.(n)

programme.title: The Inbetweeners 2
programme.desc: Awkward teenagers Will, Simon and Neil find university life does not live up to their expectations, and are insanely jealous of Jay's stories of his gap year in Australia. Heading Down Under to meet their friend, they inevitably discover he has exaggerated his escapades - so decide to go in search of a real adventure. Comedy sequel, starring Simon Bird, James Buckley, Joe Thomas and Blake Harrison.(n)

programme.title: Bad Words
programme.desc: Jason Bateman directs and stars in this dark comedy about a 40-year-old misanthrope who enters children's spelling contests. With Kathryn Hahn, Rohan Chand and Philip Baker Hall.(n)

programme.title: Me, Myself and Irene
programme.desc: A mild-mannered state trooper bottles up his frustrations for years, causing him to develop a split personality. His alter ego is not quite as easy-going - a problem exacerbated when he falls in love and the two sides of his personality become rivals. Comedy from the Farrelly brothers, starring Jim Carrey, Renee Zellweger, Anthony Anderson, Mongo Brownlee and Robert Forster.(n)

programme.title: Monty Python's The Meaning of Life
programme.desc: A series of sketches examining mankind's secrets and taboos through the trials of life from conception to death. Surreal comedy, starring the Python team of Michael Palin, Graham Chapman, John Cleese, Eric Idle, Terry Jones and Terry Gilliam. Featuring introductory short film The Crimson Permanent Assurance.(n)

programme.title: Son of the Pink Panther
programme.desc: Comedy sequel which sees Inspector Clouseau's over-enthusiastic son on the trail of a kidnapped princess, proving to be just as inept as his father every step of the way. Starring Roberto Benigni, Herbert Lom, Claudia Cardinale, Burt Kwouk, Debrah Farentino and Graham Stark.(n)

programme.title: Dead Man on Campus
programme.desc: Two college layabouts learn the room-mates of students who commit suicide are automatically awarded top grades in all subjects, and begin trying to identify the classmate most likely to end it all. Comedy, starring Tom Everett Scott, Mark-Paul Gosselaar and Poppy Montgomery.(n)

programme.title: Arthur 2: On the Rocks
programme.desc: The drunken millionaire sees his playboy lifestyle grind to a halt when a woman he scorned pulls strings to force him into bankruptcy. Although job opportunities are thin on the ground for booze-sodden layabouts, his wife wants a baby and pressures him to find a job and take responsibility for once in his life. Comedy sequel, starring Dudley Moore and Liza Minnelli, with a cameo appearance by John Gielgud.(n)

programme.title: Get Hard
programme.desc: A corrupt businessman is convicted of fraud, and given 30 days to put his affairs in order before starting a prison sentence. He assumes a black employee has a criminal past, and seeks his help in preparing for a life behind bars - not realising that the financially struggling working stiff has never broken the law in his life. Comedy, starring Will Ferrell and Kevin Hart.(n)

programme.title: Never Been Kissed
programme.desc: A clumsy 25-year-old would-be reporter is given the chance to prove herself when she is sent on an assignment to get an inside take on high-school life. However, when she falls for an English teacher, she has trouble maintaining the facade of a calm and sophisticated young lady, as all the bad memories of her awkward younger days come flooding back. Romantic comedy, with Drew Barrymore, Michael Vartan and David Arquette.(n)

programme.title: Ted 2
programme.desc: The foul-mouthed talking teddy bear is horrified to discover that he counts as property according to the law. He and his human best friend hire a pot-smoking lawyer to help them fight a court case and get Ted legally recognised as a person. Comedy sequel, starring Mark Wahlberg and Amanda Seyfried, with the voice of Seth MacFarlane.(n)

Romantic comedy, starring Adam Sandler and Drew Barrymore.(n)
