Comedy, starring Will Ferrell and Kevin Hart.(n)

programme.title: The Goonies
programme.desc: Seven youngsters discover an old map and set out on the adventure of a lifetime to save their homes from a land developer by finding a legendary pirate's hidden treasure. However, they first have to navigate a series of booby-trapped underground caverns and outwit a family of crooks also after the loot. Children's adventure, starring Sean Astin, Corey Feldman, Josh Brolin and Martha Plimpton.(n)

programme.title: Malpractice
programme.desc: A nurse takes legal action against the hospital which sacked her for malpractice, but her lawyer soon begins to doubt her innocence when a series of uncanny coincidences add weight to the original allegations of wrong-doing. Thriller, starring Gabrielle Carteris, Stephanie Zimbalist and Markus Flanagan.(n)

programme.title: Deliver Us from Evil
programme.desc: A New York cop is baffled by a series of disturbing, inexplicable crimes sweeping the city. He discovers the terrifying truth behind the crimewave when he meets an unconventional priest, who seeks his help in stopping an outbreak of demonic possessions. Horror, starring Eric Bana, Edgar Ramirez and Olivia Munn.(n)

programme.title: Spy Game
programme.desc: A veteran CIA agent is on the verge of retirement, but when he learns his former protege has been thrown into a Chinese prison and is awaiting execution, he decides to launch a perilous and ill-advised rescue attempt. Thriller, starring Brad Pitt, Robert Redford, Catherine McCormack and Stephen Dillane.(n)

programme.title: Three Days of the Condor
programme.desc: A bookish CIA researcher returns to his field office to find all his colleagues have been murdered in his absence. When he tries to uncover the truth, he also ends up targeted for assassination by his own agency, and is forced to go on the run to discover the reasons why. Sydney Pollack's thriller, starring Robert Redford, Faye Dunaway, Cliff Robertson and Max von Sydow.(n)

programme.title: The Da Vinci Code
programme.desc: A respected academic goes on the run when he is framed for the murder of a French historian. Pursued by the detective on the case and a sinister assassin monk, he strives to unmask the culprit, leading to a conspiracy determined to preserve a 2,000-year-old secret at any cost. Thriller based on Dan Brown's novel, starring Tom Hanks, Audrey Tautou, Ian McKellen, Paul Bettany and Jean Reno.(n)

programme.title: Felony
programme.desc: A cop is involved in a road accident that leaves a boy in a coma, and impulsively lies about his involvement. A colleague urges him to keep quiet to avoid creating a scandal and helps cover up the truth, but his conscience begins to trouble him as an idealistic younger detective becomes suspicious. Crime thriller, starring Joel Edgerton, Tom Wilkinson and Jai Courtney.(n)

programme.title: Kill the Messenger
programme.desc: A journalist is driven to the brink of suicide by a smear campaign after he attempts to expose the CIA's alleged involvement with Contra rebels in Nicaragua and the importing of cocaine into California. Fact-based drama set during the 1990s, starring Jeremy Renner, Rosemarie DeWitt and Ray Liotta.(n)

programme.title: Hostage
programme.desc: A washed-up former hostage negotiator returns to regular police work, but later finds himself forced to draw on his old skills in a bid to save a crooked accountant's children, who have been taken prisoner in their own home by a gang of psychotic delinquents. Thriller, starring Bruce Willis, Kevin Pollak, Ben Foster and Jonathan Tucker.(n)

programme.title: The Da Vinci Code
programme.desc: A respected academic goes on the run when he is framed for the murder of a French historian. Pursued by the detective on the case and a sinister assassin monk, he strives to unmask the culprit, leading to a conspiracy determined to preserve a 2,000-year-old secret at any cost. Thriller based on Dan Brown's novel, starring Tom Hanks, Audrey Tautou, Ian McKellen, Paul Bettany and Jean Reno.(n)

programme.title: Spy Game
programme.desc: A veteran CIA agent is on the verge of retirement, but when he learns his former protege has been thrown into a Chinese prison and is awaiting execution, he decides to launch a perilous and ill-advised rescue attempt. Thriller, starring Brad Pitt, Robert Redford, Catherine McCormack and Stephen Dillane.(n)

programme.title: Face/Off
programme.desc: FBI agent Sean Archer captures terrorist Castor Troy, the man who killed his son. While Troy is in a coma, Archer has the crook's face surgically grafted onto his own so he can go undercover and locate a bomb planted somewhere in Los Angeles. But then Troy regains consciousness - and in turn takes on Archer's identity. John Woo's action thriller, starring Nicolas Cage, John Travolta, Joan Allen, Gina Gershon and Dominique Swain.(n)

programme.title: Point Last Seen
programme.desc: The head of a search and rescue team whose children were kidnapped by her ex-husband hunts obsessively for a girl gone missing in the desert. However, her search is interrupted by news that her spouse has been found - but the children he took are nowhere to be found. Fact-based drama, starring Linda Hamilton and Kevin Kilner.(n)

programme.title: The Enemy Below
programme.desc: The captain of an American destroyer in the South Atlantic is still recovering from the sinking of his previous vessel. He tries to outwit a cunning German U-boat commander, but comes to respect the courage of his enemy. However, his crew fears he is not up to the challenge of defeating his opponent. Second World War thriller, starring Robert Mitchum, Curt Jurgens, Theodore Bikel and David Hedison.(n)

programme.title: Bad Karma
programme.desc: A hardened criminal has a change of heart after a near-death experience, and decides to go straight. His good intentions are threatened when his old partner in crime is released from prison, and tries to blackmail him into carrying out one last heist. Thriller, starring Ray Liotta and Dominic Purcell.(n)

programme.title: Unbreakable
programme.desc: A security guard escapes from the carnage of a train crash miraculously unscathed. He is baffled by what has happened to him - until he is contacted by a frail comic-book dealer, who appears to hold the key to the mystery. Drama from director M Night Shyamalan, with Bruce Willis, Samuel L Jackson, Robin Wright and Spencer Treat Clark.(n)

programme.title: Son of a Gun
programme.desc: An Australian teen jailed for a minor offence is taken under the protective wing of a veteran criminal. On his release, the youngster is invited to join the older man's gang, which is in the process of planning a major gold heist, but finds his loyalties put to the test. Crime drama, starring Brenton Thwaites, Ewan McGregor and Alicia Vikander.(n)

programme.title: Angels & Demons
programme.desc: Academic adventurer Robert Langdon is called in by the Vatican to deal with a crisis. The Pope has died and the four cardinals in line to be his successor have all been abducted by a mysterious sect that is threatening to murder them. As he searches for the kidnapped clerics, Langdon discovers the cult has an even more horrific plan in mind. Thriller sequel to The Da Vinci Code, with Tom Hanks and Ewan McGregor.(n)

programme.title: Honour
programme.desc: A Muslim girl is forbidden from seeing her boyfriend by her traditional parents, but she defies them and the couple run away together. The girl's mother feels the family has been dishonoured, and hires a mysterious bounty hunter to track her down and carry out punishment for her disobedience. Thriller, starring Paddy Considine and Aiysha Hart.(n)

programme.title: Dead Again
programme.desc: A private detective tries to solve the mystery surrounding a woman suffering from amnesia. With the aid of hypnosis, he discovers she is the reincarnation of a murder victim from the 1940s, and that history may be fated to repeat itself. Thriller, starring and directed by Kenneth Branagh. With Emma Thompson, Derek Jacobi, Andy Garcia and Robin Williams.(n)

programme.title: Revenge of the Green Dragons
programme.desc: Two brothers living in New York's Chinatown in the 1980s rise quickly through the ranks of a local gang. When their organisation clashes with a rival, the siblings are targeted by a hard-bitten cop who is determined to clean up the streets. Crime drama, starring Ray Liotta, Justin Chon and Kevin Wu.(n)

programme.title: Angels & Demons
programme.desc: Academic adventurer Robert Langdon is called in by the Vatican to deal with a crisis. The Pope has died and the four cardinals in line to be his successor have all been abducted by a mysterious sect that is threatening to murder them. As he searches for the kidnapped clerics, Langdon discovers the cult has an even more horrific plan in mind. Thriller sequel to The Da Vinci Code, with Tom Hanks and Ewan McGregor.(n)

programme.title: Enemy of the State
programme.desc: A chance encounter with an old friend derails a successful lawyer's fast-track career, plunging him headlong into a deadly game of cat and mouse with relentless government agents capable of anticipating his every move. He quickly realises the only way to save his own life is to expose the truths his pursuers seem so intent on covering up, and seeks out a former intelligence agent to take them on at their own game. Thriller, starring Will Smith, Gene Hackman, Jon Voight and Lisa Bonet.(n)

programme.title: Meet the Robinsons
programme.desc: Orphaned child genius Lewis has an unexpected encounter with a boy who claims to be from the future. With some trepidation Lewis agrees to travel forward through time to meet his new friend's madcap family. However, a bowler-hatted villain threatens his chances of ever returning home. Animated adventure, with the voices of Angela Bassett, Daniel Hansen, Jordan Fry and Tom Selleck.(n)

programme.title: Lilo & Stitch 2: Stitch Has a Glitch
programme.desc: The odd couple return for this animated sequel, in which the lovable, loopy alien gives his adopted family more problems thanks to a major malfunction. With the voices of Dakota Fanning, Tia Carrere and Holliston Coleman.(n)

programme.title: Teacher's Pet
programme.desc: A family remain unaware their dog is super-intelligent, and able to read and speak. The canine genius disguises himself as a boy so he can go to school and longs to be a real human. He seeks out a mad scientist who claims to be able to turn animals into people, but he soon learns that being human is not all fun. Animated adventure, with the voices of Nathan Lane and Kelsey Grammer.(n)

programme.title: The Pacifier
programme.desc: A battle-hardened military veteran fails to protect a government scientist from assassins. He is assigned to safeguard the dead boffin's family in case the killers come after the top-secret technology in his home, but finds looking after kids proves far tougher than taking on hitmen. Family comedy, starring Vin Diesel and Lauren Graham.(n)

programme.title: The Greatest Game Ever Played
programme.desc: A single-minded American golfer's determination helps him to overcome the sport's class prejudice against his working-class background and his father's cynicism for the chance to test his skills against his idol in the 1913 US Open. Fact-based drama directed by Bill Paxton, starring Shia LaBeouf, Stephen Dillane, Elias Koteas and Josh Flitter.(n)

programme.title: Cinderella
programme.desc: An orphan is forced to live a life of servitude by her cruel stepmother. The king of the realm she lives in organises a lavish ball to find a bride for his son, and a caring fairy godmother puts her magic to the task of turning the downtrodden girl into a princess. Disney animated fairytale, with the voices of Ilene Woods, William Phipps and Verna Felton.(n)

programme.title: Cinderella II: Dreams Come True
programme.desc: Animated fairytale anthology, featuring three stories following the princess in the early days of her marriage. Cinderella struggles to fit in with the aristocracy and tries to teach one of her step-sisters to smile. Meanwhile, her mouse friend Jaq wishes he could be human. With the voices of Jennifer Hale and Christopher Daniel Barnes.(n)

programme.title: Cinderella III: A Twist in Time
programme.desc: Cinderella's wicked stepmother steals the Fairy Godmother's magic wand, enabling her to turn back time and ensure her stepdaughter does not attend Prince Charming's lavish ball. Cinderella's rodent pals Jaq and Gus help the distraught heroine to break the evil spell before it's too late. Disney's animated fantasy sequel, with the voices of Jennifer Hale, CD Barnes and Russi Taylor.(n)

programme.title: Pooh's Heffalump Movie
programme.desc: Winnie the Pooh and his pals hear rumbling noises in the distance, and bravely set out to trap the feared and monstrous heffalump. Meanwhile, Roo stays at home and makes friends with a young and amiable heffalump named Lumpy, proving once and for all that the creatures are nothing to be afraid of. Animated adventure, with the voices of Jim Cummings and Brenda Blethyn.(n)

programme.title: The Pacifier
programme.desc: A battle-hardened military veteran fails to protect a government scientist from assassins. He is assigned to safeguard the dead boffin's family in case the killers come after the top-secret technology in his home, but finds looking after kids proves far tougher than taking on hitmen. Family comedy, starring Vin Diesel and Lauren Graham.(n)

programme.title: Cinderella
programme.desc: An orphan is forced to live a life of servitude by her cruel stepmother. The king of the realm she lives in organises a lavish ball to find a bride for his son, and a caring fairy godmother puts her magic to the task of turning the downtrodden girl into a princess. Disney animated fairytale, with the voices of Ilene Woods, William Phipps and Verna Felton.(n)

programme.title: Herbie Goes to Monte Carlo
programme.desc: The adventurous Volkswagen Beetle is entered in the Trans-Europa race from Paris to Monte Carlo. However, he causes chaos for his driver and mechanic when he falls in love with a rival car, whose owner is unaware her vehicle is alive. Meanwhile, a pair of slippery jewel thieves have secreted their loot in Herbie's petrol tank. Disney comedy adventure sequel, starring Dean Jones, Roy Kinnear, Don Knotts and Julie Sommars.(n)

programme.title: The Greatest Game Ever Played
programme.desc: A single-minded American golfer's determination helps him to overcome the sport's class prejudice against his working-class background and his father's cynicism for the chance to test his skills against his idol in the 1913 US Open. Fact-based drama directed by Bill Paxton, starring Shia LaBeouf, Stephen Dillane, Elias Koteas and Josh Flitter.(n)

programme.title: Escape to Witch Mountain
programme.desc: Two psychic children go on the run in an attempt to discover their true origin, hotly pursued by a wicked millionaire who wants to make use of their powers. A lonely widowed man helps them to escape, and leads them on a journey to a mountain where they believe their parents are waiting for them. Disney sci-fi adventure, starring Ray Milland, Donald Pleasence and Eddie Albert.(n)

programme.title: White Fang 2: The Myth of the White Wolf
programme.desc: A white boy races to the aid of Native Americans with the help of his fearless hound, in a bid to prevent their sacred tribal ground being taken over by miners. Adventure sequel set during the Alaskan Gold Rush, and inspired by Jack London's novel, starring Scott Bairstow, Alfred Molina, Charmaine Craig and Geoffrey Lewis.(n)

programme.title: Cinderella II: Dreams Come True
programme.desc: Animated fairytale anthology, featuring three stories following the princess in the early days of her marriage. Cinderella struggles to fit in with the aristocracy and tries to teach one of her step-sisters to smile. Meanwhile, her mouse friend Jaq wishes he could be human. With the voices of Jennifer Hale and Christopher Daniel Barnes.(n)

programme.title: 101 Dalmatians II: Patch's London Adventure
programme.desc: The little pup struggles to establish his own identity among his numerous brothers and sisters. He embarks on an exciting escapade across the capital with his favourite TV star, but the sinister Cruella DeVil returns to cause more havoc. Animated sequel, with the voices of Bobby Lockwood, Barry Bostwick, Jason Alexander, Martin Short and Sam West.(n)

programme.title: Mars Needs Moms
programme.desc: A nine-year-old boy sees a spacecraft land and kidnap his mother. He stows away on board as the ship travels back to the aliens' Mars homeland. As he tries to rescue her, he learns the Martians have taken her because they need Earth mothers to raise their own children. Animated sci-fi adventure, with the voices of Seth Robert Dusky, Dan Fogler and Joan Cusack.(n)

programme.title: Mickey, Donald, Goofy: The Three Musketeers
programme.desc: Three cleaners dream of becoming musketeers - and unexpectedly get the chance to make their wish come true when they are made bodyguards to a princess. However, they do not realise the captain of the guard is plotting to kill her and has given them the job because he thinks they will fail. Animated adventure, with the voices of Wayne Allwine, Tony Anselmo, Bill Farmer and Russi Taylor.(n)

programme.title: Planes: Fire & Rescue
programme.desc: A racing plane suffers damage to his engine, and realises he can never compete again. He starts a new career as a member of a firefighting squadron, which proves more dangerous than he expected when the aircraft have to deal with a massive forest blaze. Animated adventure sequel, with the voices of Dane Cook and Ed Harris.(n)

programme.title: DuckTales the Movie: Treasure of the Lost Lamp
programme.desc: Scrooge McDuck and great-nephews Huey, Dewey and Louie lead an archaeological expedition to find a long-lost genie's lamp once belonging to a notorious bandit, but reckon without a villainous attempt to use its powers in a dastardly plot. Animated Disney adventure, with the voices of Christopher Lloyd, Alan Young and Russi Taylor.(n)

programme.title: The Rocketeer
programme.desc: A maverick pilot in 1930s Hollywood finds an experimental rocket pack that gives him the power to fly. While he plans to use the device in a stunt act, a Nazi spy masquerading as a movie star is also determined to get his hands on it. Sci-fi adventure, starring Bill Campbell, Jennifer Connelly, Timothy Dalton, Alan Arkin and Terry O'Quinn.(n)

programme.title: Mulan II
programme.desc: The warrior heroine is assigned as a bodyguard to three princesses by the emperor of China. When she learns the girls are to be forced into marriage, she decides to help them escape - jeopardising her relationship with her fiance, who remains loyal to the emperor. Disney animated adventure sequel, with the voices of Ming-Na and Lucy Liu.(n)

programme.title: Planes: Fire & Rescue
programme.desc: A racing plane suffers damage to his engine, and realises he can never compete again. He starts a new career as a member of a firefighting squadron, which proves more dangerous than he expected when the aircraft have to deal with a massive forest blaze. Animated adventure sequel, with the voices of Dane Cook and Ed Harris.(n)

programme.title: Mars Needs Moms
programme.desc: A nine-year-old boy sees a spacecraft land and kidnap his mother. He stows away on board as the ship travels back to the aliens' Mars homeland. As he tries to rescue her, he learns the Martians have taken her because they need Earth mothers to raise their own children. Animated sci-fi adventure, with the voices of Seth Robert Dusky, Dan Fogler and Joan Cusack.(n)

programme.title: Alice in Wonderland
programme.desc: A girl meets a mysterious talking rabbit and follows the creature down a hole in the ground. She finds herself in a magical world inhabited by all manner of bizarre creatures and dominated by a short-tempered queen fond of beheading those who displease her. Disney animated fantasy based on Lewis Carroll's novel, with the voices of Kathryn Beaumont and Ed Wynn.(n)

programme.title: Glory Road
programme.desc: A basketball coach takes over a college team in 1960s Texas, but his decision to recruit black people causes uproar. Determined to enlist the best players possible, he sets out to lead his team to the national championships. Sporting drama based on a true story, starring Josh Lucas, Jon Voight and Derek Luke.(n)

programme.title: Freaky Friday
programme.desc: A mother and her rebellious teenage daughter's simultaneous wishes to trade places results in them magically switching bodies for a day and gaining an unforgettable insight into each other's lives. Disney fantasy comedy, with Jodie Foster, Barbara Harris, Patsy Kelly, John Astin, Charlene Tilton and Sorrell Booke.(n)

programme.title: Very Good Girls
programme.desc: Two 18-year-old girls spending their last summer at home before going to university make a pledge to both lose their virginity before beginning their studies. However, their friendship is tested when they both fall for the same man and one of them begins a secret relationship with him. Drama, starring Dakota Fanning and Elizabeth Olsen.(n)

programme.title: Ashby
programme.desc: As part of a school assignment, student Ed Wallis gets to know his neighbour Ashby Holt, an ex-CIA assassin with a personal secret. Comedy drama, with Mickey Rourke, Nat Wolff, Emma Roberts and Sarah Silverman.(n)

programme.title: Ordinary People
programme.desc: A wealthy American family faces upheaval and heartbreak following the tragic death of the eldest son in a boating accident. His brother finds it particularly hard to cope, convincing himself that he should have died instead, and finds little solace in his parents. Robert Redford's directorial debut won four Oscars including Best Film, and stars Donald Sutherland, Mary Tyler Moore and Timothy Hutton.(n)

programme.title: Rain Man
programme.desc: Brash yuppie car dealer Charlie discovers his deceased father has left the family fortune to Raymond, the autistic elder brother he never knew he had. In a bid to get his hands on the money, he tracks down and abducts Raymond - but the ensuing cross-country journey proves to be a profound learning experience. Oscar-winning drama, starring Tom Cruise and Dustin Hoffman, with Valeria Golino, Gerald R Molen and Jack Murdock.(n)

programme.title: Marie Antoinette
programme.desc: Account of the life of the extravagant and controversial former queen of France, following her marriage to Louis XVI at the age of 15 and her ascension to the throne at just 19. The couple seek refuge from the intrigue at court in a life of decadent excess, which ultimately serves to seal their fate. Sofia Coppola's historical drama, starring Kirsten Dunst, Jason Schwartzman, Steve Coogan and Rip Torn.(n)

programme.title: If I Stay
programme.desc: A teenager is torn between her desire to go to university and her relationship with her boyfriend. When she is involved in a car crash that kills her family, she is left in a coma and her spirit is left wandering the hospital until she decides whether to wake up or move on to the afterlife. Drama based on Gayle Forman's novel, starring Chloe Grace Moretz and Mireille Enos.(n)

programme.title: Splash
programme.desc: A lonely New Yorker is rescued from drowning by a mermaid, who falls in love with him and assumes human form so she can seek him out in Manhattan. He is soon equally smitten, and she resolves to keep her true nature a secret from him. However, an obsessive scientist suspects the truth and plans to prove it. Romantic fantasy comedy, starring Tom Hanks, Daryl Hannah and John Candy.(n)

programme.title: Australia
programme.desc: An aristocratic Englishwoman inherits a vast cattle station in the Australian Outback in the 1930s. When her land comes under threat from a rival farmer aiming to build a monopoly, she is forced to lead her herd across the wilderness to secure the farm's future, falling for a tough stock-man and forming a friendship with a half-Aboriginal boy along the way. However, as they make their journey, the country becomes drawn into the Second World War. Baz Luhrmann's romantic drama, starring Nicole Kidman and Hugh Jackman.(n)

programme.title: The Judge
programme.desc: A cynical lawyer returns to his home town to attend his mother's funeral, and is reunited with his disapproving estranged father, the local judge. When an ex-convict is killed in a hit-and-run incident, the judge is accused of the crime, and it falls to his son to represent him. Drama, starring Robert Downey Jr, Robert Duvall, Vera Farmiga and Billy Bob Thornton.(n)

programme.title: Courage Under Fire
programme.desc: An American military official investigates the death of a female helicopter pilot in the 1990 Gulf War to decide whether her actions merit a posthumous Medal of Honour. Meanwhile, he tries to come to terms with a tragic incident he caused himself - and covered up - during the conflict. Drama, starring Denzel Washington, Meg Ryan, Lou Diamond Phillips, Scott Glenn and Matt Damon.(n)

programme.title: In the Name of the Father
programme.desc: Drama adapted from the autobiography of Guildford Four member Gerry Conlon, chronicling his tireless efforts to overturn the life sentence imposed on him for involvement with an IRA bombing, an indictment based on a forced confession. Starring Daniel Day-Lewis, Pete Postlethwaite, Emma Thompson, John Lynch and Mark Sheppard.(n)

programme.title: Captain America: Civil War - Special
programme.desc: The making of the new Marvel superhero movie, which sees Captain America, Iron Man and the rest of the Avengers split down the middle and fighting one another.(n)

programme.title: Reds
programme.desc: Oscar-winning fact-based drama, based on the life of American journalist and activist John Reed, famous for his first-hand account of the 1917 Russian Revolution. The film focuses on his relationship with writer Louise Bryant, whom he first encounters at a meeting for radical thinkers. Leaving her husband, she joins Reed on his journey to Russia as the Bolshevik uprising gets under way. Directed by and starring Warren Beatty. With Diane Keaton, Jack Nicholson and Edward Herrmann.(n)

programme.title: Just One Day
programme.desc: Two unhappy single parents meet while both taking their teenage children on a tour of the university they hope to attend. Frustrated at the youngsters' indifference, they decide to wander off together and explore the campus for themselves, and begin to develop feelings for each other and a revived passion for life. Romantic comedy, starring Andy Garcia and Vera Farmiga.(n)

programme.title: The Seven Year Itch
programme.desc: A bored publisher revels in his new-found freedom after his wife and son go away to the country. When a beautiful but naive actress moves in upstairs, he is tempted to turn his fantasies of an affair with her into reality. But even in his dreams, his conscience has a way of tripping him up. Billy Wilder's comedy, starring Marilyn Monroe, Tom Ewell, Evelyn Keyes and Oscar Homolka.(n)

programme.title: The Fault in Our Stars: Extended Version
programme.desc: Indianapolis teenager Hazel has terminal thyroid cancer and attends a patients' support group, where she meets fellow teen Gus, who lost a leg to the disease. The two fall in love and a shared passion for books leads them on a literary pilgrimage to Amsterdam in search of reclusive author Peter van Houten. Extended version of the romantic drama based on the bestselling novel by John Green, starring Shailene Woodley, Ansel Elgort, Laura Dern and Willem Dafoe.(n)

programme.title: In & Out
programme.desc: An Oscar-winning actor announces on national TV that his former schoolteacher is gay, causing uproar in the close-knit community where he grew up, and forcing the beleaguered tutor to convince his family, fiancee and pupils that he is straight. Comedy, starring Kevin Kline, Matt Dillon, Tom Selleck and Joan Cusack.(n)

programme.title: Titanic
programme.desc: A party of explorers studying the sunken remains of the famous liner meets an elderly woman who was a passenger on the ill-fated maiden voyage. She recounts how she boarded the ship while on the brink of being forced into marriage by her family, and was stopped from killing herself by a penniless artist. She fell in love with her saviour, but the disaster on the horizon meant their time together was doomed to be short. James Cameron's Oscar-winning romantic drama, starring Kate Winslet, Leonardo DiCaprio, Billy Zane, Kathy Bates and Bill Paxton.(n)

programme.title: The Second Best Exotic Marigold Hotel
programme.desc: With the original Best Exotic Marigold Hotel a roaring success, owner Sonny decides the time is right to expand his business empire. But to do so, he and the rest of the residents must pull out all the stops to impress a potential investor's inspector - a task that proves to be easier said than done. Comedy drama sequel, with Dev Patel, Maggie Smith, Judi Dench and Richard Gere.(n)

programme.title: The Theory of Everything
programme.desc: Biopic of Stephen Hawking, exploring the renowned astrophysicist's romance with future wife Jane during their time at university in the 1960s and his initial diagnosis with motor neurone disease, which doctors believed would lead to his death within two years. Undaunted by deteriorating health, he continued his groundbreaking research into the origins of the universe. Starring an Oscar-winning Eddie Redmayne, with Felicity Jones and David Thewlis.(n)

programme.title: Very Good Girls
programme.desc: Two 18-year-old girls spending their last summer at home before going to university make a pledge to both lose their virginity before beginning their studies. However, their friendship is tested when they both fall for the same man and one of them begins a secret relationship with him. Drama, starring Dakota Fanning and Elizabeth Olsen.(n)

Undaunted by deteriorating health, he continued his groundbreaking research into the origins of the universe. Starring an Oscar-winning Eddie Redmayne, with Felicity Jones and David Thewlis.(n)

programme.title: The Fox and the Child
programme.desc: A young girl living in the mountains becomes fascinated by a wild fox inhabiting the woods. She gradually wins the trust of the animal, and a close bond develops. However, her efforts to domesticate the creature and treat it like a family pet have tragic consequences. Drama, starring Bertille Noel-Bruneau and narrated by Kate Winslet.(n)

programme.title: Problem Child
programme.desc: When a couple seek to adopt a child from an orphanage, the administrator sees the chance to rid himself of the bane of his existence - an uncontrollable youngster who causes chaos and destruction wherever he goes. Comedy, starring John Ritter, Amy Yasbeck, Jack Warden, Peter Jurasik and Michael Oliver.(n)

programme.title: The Nut Job
programme.desc: A squirrel living in a city park faces a harsh winter ahead. He sees fresh hope when he discovers a shop selling nuts, and recruits the other animals to carry out a daring heist that will provide enough food to keep them going through the cold months ahead. Animated comedy, with the voices of Will Arnett, Brendan Fraser and Liam Neeson.(n)

programme.title: Ghosthunters: On Icy Trails
programme.desc: A fearful young boy forms an unlikely bond with a loveable green ghost and tries to help him reclaim his haunted house. Family adventure, starring Anke Engelke, Milo Parker and the voice of Bastian Pastewka.(n)

programme.title: Lego DC Comics Super Heroes: Justice League vs Bizarro League
programme.desc: Animated action-adventure, with the voices of Diedrich Bader and Nolan North. Superman and the Justice League team up with their Bizarro League counterparts to thwart Darkseid's attempt to conquer the galaxy.(n)

programme.title: Neverland
programme.desc: Part one of two. Fantasy adventure series based on Peter Pan, telling the story of how an orphaned pickpocket and his gentleman thief mentor are transported to a magical land, becoming the boy who never grew up and his pirate nemesis Captain Hook. Starring Rhys Ifans, Charlie Rowe and Anna Friel.(n)

programme.title: Neverland
programme.desc: Part two of two. Fantasy adventure series based on Peter Pan, telling the story of how an orphaned pickpocket and his gentleman thief mentor are transported to a magical land, becoming the boy who never grew up and his pirate nemesis Captain Hook. Starring Rhys Ifans, Charlie Rowe and Anna Friel.(n)

programme.title: Mrs Doubtfire
programme.desc: A struggling actor's ambitious, no-nonsense wife throws him out and demands a divorce. Desperate to spend time with his children, he puts his talents to good use by donning drag and posing as a Scottish housekeeper to get a job looking after them. Comedy, starring Robin Williams, Sally Field, Pierce Brosnan, Harvey Fierstein and Mara Wilson.(n)

programme.title: Neverland
programme.desc: Part one of two. Comedy, starring John Ritter, Amy Yasbeck, Jack Warden, Peter Jurasik and Michael Oliver.(n)

programme.title: Rugrats Go Wild
programme.desc: A leaky boat leaves the precocious youngsters stranded on a jungle island, but their luck changes when explorers the Wild Thornberrys come to their rescue. However, Thornberry dad Nigel loses his memory, so it falls to his daughter Eliza to save the day. Children's animated adventure, with the voices of Nancy Cartwright, Bruce Willis, Lacey Chabert, Elizabeth Daily and Tim Curry.(n)

programme.title: Problem Child II
programme.desc: Single father Ben Healy with his obnoxious adopted son in tow moves to a new town in search of romance, but ends up with yet another wayward youngster on his hands. Comedy sequel, starring John Ritter, Amy Yasbeck, Charlene Tilton, and Laraine Newman.(n)

programme.title: The Muppets Take Manhattan
programme.desc: Kermit, Miss Piggy, Fozzie Bear and company try to take Broadway by storm with their college show, setting the stage for a host of misadventures as they yearn for stardom in the Big Apple and set out to raise the money to finance their production. Comedy, performed by Jim Henson and Frank Oz, with appearances by Liza Minnelli, Art Carney, Dabney Coleman, Gregory Hines, Joan Rivers, Brooke Shields, Linda Lavin and Elliott Gould.(n)

programme.title: Muppets from Space
programme.desc: Gonzo hits the road with pal Rizzo in tow and goes in search of his roots - only to make the amazing discovery that his parents belonged to a race of aliens. He then has to choose whether to board a UFO and return to his family, or stay with the friends he knows and loves. Family comedy, with F Murray Abraham, David Arquette, Ray Liotta, Andie MacDowell and Rob Schneider alongside the puppets.(n)

programme.title: Dino Time
programme.desc: Three children accidentally activate a time-travel device which transports them 65 million years back in time, where they are protected by a friendly dinosaur. But can they find a way to return to the 21st century while steering clear of all sorts of prehistoric dangers? Animation, featuring the voices of Melanie Griffith, Pamela Adlon and Tara Strong.(n)

programme.title: Groundhog Day
programme.desc: An obnoxious TV weatherman reporting on a small town's annual festival finds himself caught in a bizarre time loop, and is forced to relive the same day over and over again. While at first he tries to exploit his predicament, he is ultimately driven to mend his ways and adopt a less cynical attitude. Comedy, starring Bill Murray, Andie MacDowell, Chris Elliott and Stephen Tobolowsky.(n)

programme.title: Dolphin Tale 2
programme.desc: A dolphin fitted with a prosthetic flipper to replace its injured tail is left in isolation when the only other dolphin in the marine hospital dies. The staff and supporters of the institution search for a new companion for the aquatic mammal, to avoid losing it to another facility. Family drama sequel, starring Nathan Gamble, Morgan Freeman and Ashley Judd.(n)

programme.title: Problem Child
programme.desc: When a couple seek to adopt a child from an orphanage, the administrator sees the chance to rid himself of the bane of his existence - an uncontrollable youngster who causes chaos and destruction wherever he goes. Comedy, starring John Ritter, Amy Yasbeck, Jack Warden, Peter Jurasik and Michael Oliver.(n)

programme.title: Rugrats Go Wild
programme.desc: A leaky boat leaves the precocious youngsters stranded on a jungle island, but their luck changes when explorers the Wild Thornberrys come to their rescue. However, Thornberry dad Nigel loses his memory, so it falls to his daughter Eliza to save the day. Children's animated adventure, with the voices of Nancy Cartwright, Bruce Willis, Lacey Chabert, Elizabeth Daily and Tim Curry.(n)

programme.title: Problem Child II
programme.desc: Single father Ben Healy with his obnoxious adopted son in tow moves to a new town in search of romance, but ends up with yet another wayward youngster on his hands. Comedy sequel, starring John Ritter, Amy Yasbeck, Charlene Tilton, and Laraine Newman.(n)

programme.title: The Muppets Take Manhattan
programme.desc: Kermit, Miss Piggy, Fozzie Bear and company try to take Broadway by storm with their college show, setting the stage for a host of misadventures as they yearn for stardom in the Big Apple and set out to raise the money to finance their production. Comedy, performed by Jim Henson and Frank Oz, with appearances by Liza Minnelli, Art Carney, Dabney Coleman, Gregory Hines, Joan Rivers, Brooke Shields, Linda Lavin and Elliott Gould.(n)

programme.title: Muppets from Space
programme.desc: Gonzo hits the road with pal Rizzo in tow and goes in search of his roots - only to make the amazing discovery that his parents belonged to a race of aliens. He then has to choose whether to board a UFO and return to his family, or stay with the friends he knows and loves. Family comedy, with F Murray Abraham, David Arquette, Ray Liotta, Andie MacDowell and Rob Schneider alongside the puppets.(n)

programme.title: Dino Time
programme.desc: Three children accidentally activate a time-travel device which transports them 65 million years back in time, where they are protected by a friendly dinosaur. But can they find a way to return to the 21st century while steering clear of all sorts of prehistoric dangers? Animation, featuring the voices of Melanie Griffith, Pamela Adlon and Tara Strong.(n)

programme.title: Groundhog Day
programme.desc: An obnoxious TV weatherman reporting on a small town's annual festival finds himself caught in a bizarre time loop, and is forced to relive the same day over and over again. While at first he tries to exploit his predicament, he is ultimately driven to mend his ways and adopt a less cynical attitude. Comedy, starring Bill Murray, Andie MacDowell, Chris Elliott and Stephen Tobolowsky.(n)

programme.title: Dolphin Tale 2
programme.desc: A dolphin fitted with a prosthetic flipper to replace its injured tail is left in isolation when the only other dolphin in the marine hospital dies. The staff and supporters of the institution search for a new companion for the aquatic mammal, to avoid losing it to another facility. Family drama sequel, starring Nathan Gamble, Morgan Freeman and Ashley Judd.(n)

programme.title: Save the Last Dance
programme.desc: A troubled teenager moves to a tough inner-city school after her mother's death, but struggles to settle into her vastly different life - until a new boyfriend helps her discover a fresh sense of purpose through the power of dance. Romantic drama, starring Julia Stiles, Sean Patrick Thomas and Kerry Washington.(n)

programme.title: The Longest Ride
programme.desc: A rodeo rider and a college student fall in love, but begin to question whether they have a future together as their dreams lead them in different directions. They form an unexpected friendship with an old man, whose decades-long tale of love provides them with fresh inspiration. Romantic drama based on the novel by Nicholas Sparks, starring Britt Robertson, Scott Eastwood and Alan Alda.(n)

programme.title: Vendetta
programme.desc: Jimmy Vickers, a rogue SAS officer specialising in interrogation techniques, sets out to take vengeance on the criminal gang that murdered his parents. Action thriller, starring Danny Dyer, Roxanne McKee and Vincent Regan.(n)

Horror, starring Arnold Schwarzenegger and Abigail Breslin.(n)

programme.title: Ricki and the Flash

Comedy drama, starring Meryl Streep, Kevin Kline and Streep's real-life daughter Mamie Gummer.(n)

programme.desc: A virus sweeps across America turning people into zombies, and the government establishes measures to capture those infected and dispose of them once the process is complete. When a teenage girl is infected, her devoted father refuses to hand her over to the authorities, and vows to defend her to the bitter end. Horror, starring Arnold Schwarzenegger and Abigail Breslin.(n)

programme.title: Friday Download: The Movie
programme.desc: A group of teenagers on a road trip breaks down in the middle of nowhere, and finds assistance is in short supply. The friends seek shelter in a spooky mansion, but they quickly discover there is more to their refuge than meets the eye. Comedy based on the children's TV series, starring Tyger Drew-Honey and Shannon Flynn.(n)

programme.title: Ricki and the Flash
programme.desc: A rock singer who abandoned her family to pursue her dreams of stardom returns to her home town. She gets the chance to make amends for her past mistakes as she reconnects with her ex-husband, and helps her daughter to cope with a difficult time in her life. Comedy drama, starring Meryl Streep, Kevin Kline and Streep's real-life daughter Mamie Gummer.(n)

programme.title: Maggie
programme.desc: A virus sweeps across America turning people into zombies, and the government establishes measures to capture those infected and dispose of them once the process is complete. When a teenage girl is infected, her devoted father refuses to hand her over to the authorities, and vows to defend her to the bitter end. Horror, starring Arnold Schwarzenegger and Abigail Breslin.(n)

programme.title: Vendetta
programme.desc: Jimmy Vickers, a rogue SAS officer specialising in interrogation techniques, sets out to take vengeance on the criminal gang that murdered his parents. However, his brutal crusade is placed in jeopardy when it becomes clear the police have teamed up with members of his old unit to stop him completing his mission. Action thriller, starring Danny Dyer, Roxanne McKee and Vincent Regan.(n)

programme.title: Rawhide
programme.desc: Outlaws hold staff and a passenger and her baby hostage at a remote stagecoach station while awaiting the arrival of a shipment of $100,000 in gold bullion. The nervous captives try to stay calm, but the tension between the gang leader and a jumpy henchman grows fraught, ending in a frantic shoot-out - with the infant in the thick of the fray. Western, starring Tyrone Power, Susan Hayward and Jack Elam.(n)

programme.title: The New World
programme.desc: A 17th-century English settler in America falls in love with a native princess, but as conflict erupts between their people he is forced to abandon her. She is converted to Christianity, adopting European culture and forming a romance with a tobacco planter, but remains torn between two worlds. Terrence Malick's epic historical drama, starring Colin Farrell, Q'orianka Kilcher, Christian Bale and Christopher Plummer.(n)

programme.title: Rushmore
programme.desc: A student causes chaos in an exclusive private school with his temperamental nature - and things go from bad to worse when he develops a crush on a teacher. A wealthy but miserable businessman strikes up a friendship with the troubled teenager, but when he also falls for the same woman, all-out war is declared. Wes Anderson's comedy drama, starring Jason Schwartzman, Bill Murray, Olivia Williams and Brian Cox.(n)

programme.title: The Hurricane
programme.desc: Boxer Rubin `Hurricane' Carter dreams of winning the middleweight world title, only to be wrongfully thrown into prison for the murders of three people in a bar. Nineteen years later, a teenager reads the fighter's autobiography and sets out on a campaign to free him. Fact-based drama, starring Denzel Washington, John Hannah, Deborah Kara Unger, Liev Schreiber and Dan Hedaya.(n)

programme.title: Cool Hand Luke
programme.desc: A rebellious small-time crook is sent to a prison in the Deep South, where he becomes a hero in the eyes of his fellow convicts and a thorn in the sides of the warden and the guards by refusing to bow to authority. His defiance escalates when he receives news of his mother's death, and embarks on a series of failed escape attempts. Drama based on Donn Pearce's novel, starring Paul Newman, George Kennedy, JD Cannon and Dennis Hopper.(n)

programme.title: A Fistful of Dollars
programme.desc: A mysterious gunslinger rides into a town on the Mexican border divided by two warring families. After killing the henchmen of one clan, he seems to have made it clear where his loyalties lie and is hired by their rivals. However, he is secretly planning to play them off against each other to his own advantage. Sergio Leone's Western, with Clint Eastwood making his first appearance as The Man with No Name alongside Gian Maria Volonte and Marianne Koch.(n)

programme.title: For a Few Dollars More
programme.desc: An enigmatic gunslinger forms an uneasy alliance with a military veteran to track down a notorious outlaw - but tensions simmer as their very different motives for the hunt put them increasingly at odds. Sergio Leone's Western sequel, starring Clint Eastwood, Lee Van Cleef, Gian Maria Volonte, Josef Egger, Mara Krup and Klaus Kinski.(n)

programme.title: The Good, the Bad and the Ugly
programme.desc: A laconic gunslinger, a ruthless hired killer and a conniving outlaw hunt for a cache of loot during the chaos of the American Civil War. However, each is privy to only part of the information necessary to find it, setting in motion a series of deadly betrayals. The third film in Sergio Leone's Spaghetti Western trilogy, starring Clint Eastwood as the Man with No Name, with Lee Van Cleef and Eli Wallach. With a soundtrack by Ennio Morricone.(n)

programme.title: Enter the Dragon
programme.desc: A powerful crime kingpin hosts a martial arts tournament on his island lair. A former Shaolin monk is recruited by an intelligence agency to enter the tournament and expose the crime lord's opium and slavery rings. He finds himself fighting for his life alongside two Vietnam veterans who are both fleeing their own enemies. Thriller, starring Bruce Lee, John Saxon, Jim Kelly and Kien Shih.(n)

programme.title: Black Snake Moan
programme.desc: A self-destructive nymphomaniac ends up badly beaten and left for dead by the side of the road. She is rescued by a devoutly religious former blues musician, who nurses her back to health - then keeps her chained up in his home as he tries to save her soul. Drama, starring Christina Ricci, Samuel L Jackson, Justin Timberlake and S Epatha Merkerson.(n)

programme.title: The Outlaw Josey Wales
programme.desc: A Confederate soldier refuses to surrender at the end of the Civil War, and is branded a dangerous outlaw. Crossing America in search of sanctuary from the army and bounty hunters, he only wants solitude - but ends up with a strange assortment of travelling companions. Western, directed by and starring Clint Eastwood. With Chief Dan George and Sondra Locke.(n)

programme.title: The Gunfighter
programme.desc: Gunslinger Jimmy Ringo looks forward to a life of domestic peace after being given a chance to settle down with his once estranged wife and their child. However, a young upstart with dreams of slaying a legend challenges Ringo to a gunfight but dies, setting his three vengeful brothers on the older man's trail. Western, starring Gregory Peck, Millard Mitchell, Karl Malden and Helen Westcott.(n)

programme.title: The Necessary Death of Charlie Countryman
programme.desc: A troubled American travels to Romania in the aftermath of his mother's death. He becomes obsessed with a cellist he meets who is concealing a violent past. His efforts to romance her could cost him his life following a run-in with her brutally violent husband. Drama, starring Shia LaBeouf, Evan Rachel Wood and Mads Mikkelsen.(n)

programme.title: Dangerous Liaisons
programme.desc: A philandering aristocrat in 18th-century France schemes with his manipulative former lover to seduce a virtuous young woman. As their conspiracy becomes ever more tangled, events take an unexpected turn. Stephen Frears' Oscar-winning drama of sexual politics, based on Pierre Choderlos de Laclos' novel, starring John Malkovich, Glenn Close, Michelle Pfeiffer, Swoosie Kurtz, Uma Thurman and Keanu Reeves.(n)

programme.title: Magic in the Moonlight
programme.desc: An English magician who exposes fake psychics is approached by his friend to prove that a medium is a fraud exploiting a wealthy family. As he watches the spiritualist at work, he begins to believe that she is the genuine article, challenging his previously unshakeable scepticism. Woody Allen's 1920s-set romantic comedy, with Colin Firth and Emma Stone.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: A wage-slave in his uncle's factory has big ambitions. Just as he comes close to marrying a wealthy socialite, a poor working-class girl with whom he had a brief, casual affair tells him she is pregnant with his child. When she threatens to disclose the truth, he makes a series of decisions which bring terrible consequences in their wake. Oscar-winning drama, starring Montgomery Clift, Shelley Winters, Elizabeth Taylor,and Raymond Burr.(n)

programme.title: Dog Day Afternoon
programme.desc: Hapless Sonny and his sidekick Sal have a plan to rob a Brooklyn bank. The novice crooks thought they would be in and out in 10 minutes, but instead find themselves stuck in an ongoing hostage situation, with the police and the media laying siege to the bank. Sidney Lumet's fact-based drama, starring Al Pacino, John Cazale and Charles Durning.(n)

programme.title: Next Goal Wins
programme.desc: Documentary following the American Samoa football team, rated the worst performing international side in the world. The team has famously only scored two goals in 17 years and have lost every competitive game they have ever played. However, maverick Dutch coach Thomas Rongen is hired and given the task of securing a place for them in the 2014 World Cup.(n)

programme.title: The Face of An Angel
programme.desc: A journalist and a documentary-maker become obsessed with the murder case they are covering. Fact-based drama inspired by Amanda Knox's case and the death of Meredith Kercher in 2007, starring Daniel Bruhl, Kate Beckinsale and Cara Delevingne.(n)

programme.title: Inherent Vice
programme.desc: A drug addled private detective unwittingly becomes embroiled in an elaborate kidnapping case in Los Angeles during the 1970s involving an old flame, her billionaire boyfriend and his wife. Comedy drama based on Thomas Pynchon's acclaimed novel, starring Joaquin Phoenix, Josh Brolin and Reese Witherspoon.(n)

programme.title: Full Metal Jacket
programme.desc: Raw recruits undergo harsh training under a domineering Marine drill sergeant after being called up for service in the Vietnam War, but his brutal methods lead to the breakdown of one of his cadets. Eventually, some of the fully trained soldiers get their first taste of combat in 1968. Stanley Kubrick's drama, starring Matthew Modine, Adam Baldwin, Vincent D'Onofrio and R Lee Ermey.(n)

programme.desc: Outlaws hold staff and a passenger and her baby hostage at a remote stagecoach station while awaiting the arrival of a shipment of $100,000 in gold bullion. Eventually, some of the fully trained soldiers get their first taste of combat in 1968. Stanley Kubrick's drama, starring Matthew Modine, Adam Baldwin, Vincent D'Onofrio and R Lee Ermey.(n)

programme.title: The SpongeBob Movie: Sponge out of Water
programme.desc: The cheery sea creature tries to prevent the precious secret formula from falling into the wrong hands - but when it goes missing, the end of the world approaches. SpongeBob and his friends embark on a quest to get it back, which leads to them developing superpowers and venturing onto dry land. Animated comedy, with the voices of Tom Kenny and Antonio Banderas.(n)

programme.title: Journey to Dinosaur Island
programme.desc: A magical crystal transports a boy to a mysterious island inhabited by prehistoric monsters and littered with lost planes and ships from throughout history. He and a girl who has been brought there from the 1950s try to find a way back to their own times. Fantasy adventure, starring Darius Williams and Kate Rasmussen.(n)

programme.title: Jayne Mansfield's Car
programme.desc: An Alabama woman who left her husband for an Englishman dies in 1969, and her will dictates that she wishes to be buried in her home state. The arrangement results in an awkward first encounter for her two husbands and their families. Drama, directed by and starring Billy Bob Thornton. With Robert Duvall, John Hurt and Kevin Bacon.(n)

programme.title: The Mask
programme.desc: A timid bank clerk stumbles on an ancient mask, which endows whoever wears it with untold superhuman powers, unbridled self-confidence and an irresistible charm for the ladies. Unfortunately, he earns the enmity of a local gangster for daring to flirt with his girlfriend - and when the crook gets wind of the artefact's existence, he covets the power for himself. Comic-book comedy, with Jim Carrey, Cameron Diaz, Peter Riegert and Peter Greene.(n)

programme.title: Sherlock Holmes
programme.desc: The eccentric detective and his confidant Dr Watson investigate the apparent resurrection of a criminal mastermind with links to the occult, who is carrying out a series of seemingly magical murders. The case is complicated by the reappearance of Holmes' duplicitous old flame Irene Adler. Action thriller, starring Robert Downey Jr, Jude Law, Rachel McAdams, Mark Strong and Eddie Marsan.(n)

programme.title: The Boy Next Door
programme.desc: A newly separated teacher embarks on what she believes is a harmless flirtation with the handsome teenager living next door. In a moment of weakness, she succumbs to his advances, and things turn nasty when she tries to end their affair. Thriller, starring Jennifer Lopez, Ryan Guzman and Kristin Chenoweth.(n)

programme.title: Life Partners
programme.desc: Best friends Sasha and Paige are both happily single, seeing their inseparable bond with each other as being just as good as a romantic relationship. However, when Paige starts going out with a man, Sasha faces a struggle to stop things changing between them. Comedy, starring Leighton Meester, Gillian Jacobs, Adam Brody and Gabourey Sidibe.(n)

programme.title: The Mask
programme.desc: A timid bank clerk stumbles on an ancient mask, which endows whoever wears it with untold superhuman powers, unbridled self-confidence and an irresistible charm for the ladies. In a moment of weakness, she succumbs to his advances, and things turn nasty when she tries to end their affair. Thriller, starring Jennifer Lopez, Ryan Guzman and Kristin Chenoweth.(n)

programme.title: Brick Mansions
programme.desc: A ghetto of Detroit is walled off from the rest of the city to contain its criminal population. A cop out for revenge and an ex-convict trying to save his kidnapped girlfriend are forced to team up to stop a drug kingpin carrying out a plan that could destroy the entire city. US remake of French action adventure District 13, starring Paul Walker, David Belle and RZA.(n)

programme.title: Oculus
programme.desc: A woman is reunited with her brother, who was committed to a mental hospital after killing their father, who had tortured and murdered their mother. She believes that a haunted mirror caused their deaths, and takes him back to the site of the tragedy in the hope of confronting the supernatural forces. Horror, starring Karen Gillan, Brenton Thwaites and Katee Sackhoff.(n)

programme.title: Kelly & Cal
programme.desc: A former punk attempting to adapt to suburban family life forms a bond with a disabled teenager, and their friendship gives them a new lease of life. Drama, with Juliette Lewis, Jonny Weston and Josh Hopkins.(n)

programme.title: Journey to Dinosaur Island
programme.desc: A magical crystal transports a boy to a mysterious island inhabited by prehistoric monsters and littered with lost planes and ships from throughout history. He and a girl who has been brought there from the 1950s try to find a way back to their own times. Fantasy adventure, starring Darius Williams and Kate Rasmussen.(n)

programme.title: Fast & Furious 7 Special
programme.desc: Alex Zane visits the Abu Dhabi set of the action movie sequel, and chats to stars Vin Diesel, Dwayne Johnson and Michelle Rodriguez.(n)

programme.title: Wild
programme.desc: A series of devastating personal traumas leave a woman feeling self-destructive and lost. After spending years behaving recklessly, she decides to turn things around by embarking on an epic, solo trek along America's 1,000-mile-long Pacific Crest Trail, which gives her the time and space to reassess her existence. Drama based on a true story, starring Reese Witherspoon and Laura Dern.(n)

programme.title: The Calling
programme.desc: A small-town cop with a drink problem discovers someone is mutilating and murdering people across her district. She realises that the serial killer is hiding a mysterious message inspired by ancient religious texts and becomes dangerously obsessed with deciphering its meaning. Crime thriller based on Inger Ash Wolfe's novel, starring Susan Sarandon and Donald Sutherland.(n)

programme.title: The Riot Club
programme.desc: Two first year students at Oxford join an infamous drinking society for the University's privileged social elite. When they attend an annual dinner at a local pub, the new arrivals are shocked by how far their friends take their hedonistic lifestyle and contempt for others. Drama based on Laura Wade's stage play Posh, starring Sam Claflin, Max Irons and Natalie Dormer.(n)

programme.title: The Top Ten Show 2016
programme.desc: Countdown of the biggest box office hits in Britain and America.(n)

programme.title: Tomorrowland: A World Beyond
programme.desc: A boy genius in the 1960s finds his way into a spectacular futuristic metropolis while attempting to promote his idea for a jetpack. Decades later, he has grown into a disillusioned adult, while a girl who has the talent and enthusiasm he has lost also finds her way into this strange new world, and together they attempt to uncover its secrets. Fantasy adventure, starring George Clooney, Britt Robertson and Hugh Laurie.(n)

programme.title: Cake
programme.desc: A woman whose son died during a car accident that left her in constant pain becomes obsessed with the suicide of a young mother she met at a support group, and forms a touching friendship with her husband. Drama, starring Jennifer Aniston, Anna Kendrick and Sam Worthington.(n)

programme.title: Get On Up
programme.desc: Biopic of James Brown, examining key moments in the soul singer's life, from his impoverished childhood in South Carolina to his rise to become one of the most influential figures in music history, and following his intense friendship with fellow singer Bobby Byrd. Starring Chadwick Boseman, Viola Davis, Nelsan Ellis and Octavia Spencer.(n)

Fantasy adventure, starring George Clooney, Britt Robertson and Hugh Laurie.(n)

programme.title: Fifty Shades of Grey
programme.desc: A naive young literature student's life is thrown into turmoil by an affair with a mysterious billionaire. Initially she is intrigued by his aloof and distant manner, but soon realises he is harbouring dark secrets and desires. Erotic drama based on EL James' bestseller, starring Jamie Dornan and Dakota Johnson.(n)

Unfortunately, he earns the enmity of a local gangster for daring to flirt with his girlfriend - and when the crook gets wind of the artefact's existence, he covets the power for himself. Comic-book comedy, with Jim Carrey, Cameron Diaz, Peter Riegert and Peter Greene.(n)

programme.title: Sherlock Holmes
programme.desc: The eccentric detective and his confidant Dr Watson investigate the apparent resurrection of a criminal mastermind with links to the occult, who is carrying out a series of seemingly magical murders. The case is complicated by the reappearance of Holmes' duplicitous old flame Irene Adler. Action thriller, starring Robert Downey Jr, Jude Law, Rachel McAdams, Mark Strong and Eddie Marsan.(n)

programme.title: The Boy Next Door
programme.desc: A newly separated teacher embarks on what she believes is a harmless flirtation with the handsome teenager living next door. In a moment of weakness, she succumbs to his advances, and things turn nasty when she tries to end their affair. Thriller, starring Jennifer Lopez, Ryan Guzman and Kristin Chenoweth.(n)

programme.title: Brick Mansions
programme.desc: A ghetto of Detroit is walled off from the rest of the city to contain its criminal population. A cop out for revenge and an ex-convict trying to save his kidnapped girlfriend are forced to team up to stop a drug kingpin carrying out a plan that could destroy the entire city. US remake of French action adventure District 13, starring Paul Walker, David Belle and RZA.(n)

programme.title: Oculus
programme.desc: A woman is reunited with her brother, who was committed to a mental hospital after killing their father, who had tortured and murdered their mother. She believes that a haunted mirror caused their deaths, and takes him back to the site of the tragedy in the hope of confronting the supernatural forces. Horror, starring Karen Gillan, Brenton Thwaites and Katee Sackhoff.(n)

programme.title: Kelly & Cal
programme.desc: A former punk attempting to adapt to suburban family life forms a bond with a disabled teenager, and their friendship gives them a new lease of life. Drama, with Juliette Lewis, Jonny Weston and Josh Hopkins.(n)

programme.title: Journey to Dinosaur Island
programme.desc: A magical crystal transports a boy to a mysterious island inhabited by prehistoric monsters and littered with lost planes and ships from throughout history. He and a girl who has been brought there from the 1950s try to find a way back to their own times. Fantasy adventure, starring Darius Williams and Kate Rasmussen.(n)

programme.title: Fast & Furious 7 Special
programme.desc: Alex Zane visits the Abu Dhabi set of the action movie sequel, and chats to stars Vin Diesel, Dwayne Johnson and Michelle Rodriguez.(n)

programme.title: Wild
programme.desc: A series of devastating personal traumas leave a woman feeling self-destructive and lost. After spending years behaving recklessly, she decides to turn things around by embarking on an epic, solo trek along America's 1,000-mile-long Pacific Crest Trail, which gives her the time and space to reassess her existence. Drama based on a true story, starring Reese Witherspoon and Laura Dern.(n)

programme.title: The Calling
programme.desc: A small-town cop with a drink problem discovers someone is mutilating and murdering people across her district. She realises that the serial killer is hiding a mysterious message inspired by ancient religious texts and becomes dangerously obsessed with deciphering its meaning. Crime thriller based on Inger Ash Wolfe's novel, starring Susan Sarandon and Donald Sutherland.(n)

programme.title: The Riot Club
programme.desc: Two first year students at Oxford join an infamous drinking society for the University's privileged social elite. When they attend an annual dinner at a local pub, the new arrivals are shocked by how far their friends take their hedonistic lifestyle and contempt for others. Drama based on Laura Wade's stage play Posh, starring Sam Claflin, Max Irons and Natalie Dormer.(n)

programme.title: The Top Ten Show 2016
programme.desc: Countdown of the biggest box office hits in Britain and America.(n)

programme.title: Tomorrowland: A World Beyond
programme.desc: A boy genius in the 1960s finds his way into a spectacular futuristic metropolis while attempting to promote his idea for a jetpack. Decades later, he has grown into a disillusioned adult, while a girl who has the talent and enthusiasm he has lost also finds her way into this strange new world, and together they attempt to uncover its secrets. Fantasy adventure, starring George Clooney, Britt Robertson and Hugh Laurie.(n)

programme.title: Cake
programme.desc: A woman whose son died during a car accident that left her in constant pain becomes obsessed with the suicide of a young mother she met at a support group, and forms a touching friendship with her husband. Drama, starring Jennifer Aniston, Anna Kendrick and Sam Worthington.(n)

programme.title: Get On Up
programme.desc: Biopic of James Brown, examining key moments in the soul singer's life, from his impoverished childhood in South Carolina to his rise to become one of the most influential figures in music history, and following his intense friendship with fellow singer Bobby Byrd. Starring Chadwick Boseman, Viola Davis, Nelsan Ellis and Octavia Spencer.(n)

programme.title: Tomorrowland: A World Beyond
programme.desc: A boy genius in the 1960s finds his way into a spectacular futuristic metropolis while attempting to promote his idea for a jetpack. Decades later, he has grown into a disillusioned adult, while a girl who has the talent and enthusiasm he has lost also finds her way into this strange new world, and together they attempt to uncover its secrets. Fantasy adventure, starring George Clooney, Britt Robertson and Hugh Laurie.(n)

programme.title: Fifty Shades of Grey
programme.desc: A naive young literature student's life is thrown into turmoil by an affair with a mysterious billionaire. Initially she is intrigued by his aloof and distant manner, but soon realises he is harbouring dark secrets and desires. Erotic drama based on EL James' bestseller, starring Jamie Dornan and Dakota Johnson.(n)

programme.desc: A profile of Michael Johnson, the American sprinter who won four Olympic gold medals, in addition to eight golds at the World Championships. A specialist in both the 200m and 400m events, Johnson broke his own world record at the 1996 Games in Atlanta, winning the 200m final in a time of 19.32 seconds, a record which stood until the emergence of Usain Bolt.(n)

programme.desc: A look at the career of former German long jumper Heike Drechsler, who is the only woman in the history of the event to win two Olympic gold medals, having triumphed in 1992 and 2000.(n)

programme.desc: The life and career of the former Inter Milan, Real Madrid and Brazil star Ronaldo, who retired after a spell back in his home country with Corinthians. The striker once held the record for scoring more goals in the World Cup finals than any other player, but suffered disappointment when losing to France in the 1998 showpiece match, though he made amends by helping his side win the 2002 tournament and claiming the Golden Boot in the process.(n)

programme.title: Football's Greatest Players
programme.desc: The career of former Fiorentina, AS Roma and Argentina star Gabriel Batistuta. The powerful forward is his country's highest scorer of all time with 56 goals in 78 appearances and is still revered in Florence for his lethal finishing, though it was not until he moved to the Italian capital that he was able to win the league title for the first time.(n)

programme.title: Live Ford Football Special
programme.sub-title: West Ham United v Manchester United.
programme.desc: West Ham United v Manchester United (Kick-off 7.45pm). Coverage of the Premier League tie, which is the last-ever game at Upton Park before the Hammers move to the Olympic Stadium. Slaven Bilic's side have enjoyed a highly successful final campaign on this ground, and could still be in with a chance of finishing in the top four. Croatian boss Bilic knows that to be in with a shot of Champions League football next season, his team will have to overcome the Red Devils, who themselves are hoping to qualify for the lucrative competition once again.(n)

programme.title: Sporting Greats
programme.desc: A profile of former Australia rugby league captain Mal Meninga, a centre who was famed for his goal-kicking ability. Meninga now coaches the Queensland State of Origin team and has guided them to a record seven consecutive series victories over New South Wales.(n)

The top eight seeds for this tournament, which are likely to include last year's champion Novak Djokovic, all receive a bye to the second round, but those players seeded nine to 16 will be hoping to avoid an early exit as the players continue their preparations for the French open later this month.(n)

programme.desc: A look back at the life and career of Babe Ruth, arguably the most famous baseball player of all time, whose name is recognised even by those who do not follow the sport. programme.title: Monkey Life
programme.desc: Vet Mike tailors a designer jacket for capuchin Bruce, baby Tia-Nang tries to prove to her mother she is a grown-up, and Marina from the sister sanctuary in Vietnam checks on the progress of the golden-cheeked gibbons.(n)

programme.title: Monkey Life
programme.desc: Alison Cronin goes undercover to save a chimp forced to work as a photographer's prop in Turkey, and turns to her Dorset MP for help.(n)

programme.title: Monkey Life
programme.desc: The world's oldest woolly monkey Xuzie is diagnosed with depression, while concerns remain over Trudy the chimp. At the orang-utan enclosure, there is great excitement over Hsiao-Quai's early delivery.(n)

programme.title: Monkey Life
programme.desc: Staff grow anxious when orang-utan Hsiao-quai refuses to bring her newborn baby indoors during a storm. Ailing chimp Trudy's condition starts to improve when she begins a strict new diet and 38-year-old Xuzie, the world's oldest woolly monkey, gets a treat of giant locusts to help build up her strength. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Ninja Warrior
programme.desc: The world's leading athletes and wrestlers compete against amateurs in one of the most demanding physical challenges ever devised.(n)

programme.title: Ninja Warrior
programme.desc: The world's leading athletes and wrestlers compete against amateurs in one of the most demanding physical challenges ever devised.(n)

programme.title: Nothing to Declare
programme.desc: Fly-on-the-wall documentary accessing the world of national security at Australia's biggest airports as customs and immigration officers tackle drug runners, illegal immigrants and terrorists.(n)

programme.title: Nothing to Declare
programme.desc: Fly-on-the-wall documentary accessing the world of national security at Australia's biggest airports as customs and immigration officers tackle drug runners, illegal immigrants and terrorists.(n)

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.desc: The murder of a swimming-pool cleaner leads the team to a cell of radicalised students who turn out to be plotting an attack on US soil. Meanwhile, Chin Ho takes Grover spearfishing.(n)

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.sub-title: Makani 'Olu a Holo Malie (Fair Winds and Following Seas).
programme.desc: Catherine receives a distressed phone call from a man she met on her tour of duty in Afghanistan, revealing that his son has been taken by the Taliban. Roping in McGarrett, she sets out to rescue the youngster - a mission that prompts her to make a life-changing decision. Michelle Borth and Alex O'Loughlin star.(n)

programme.title: Forever
programme.desc: Henry and Jo enter the cut-throat world of ballet after the discovery of a severed human foot in a blood-soaked dance slipper, found in a bin at a theatre. Away from the case, the doctor tests Adam's theory about the gun that was used to kill him. Fantasy drama, starring Ioan Gruffudd and Alana De La Garza.(n)

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.sub-title: O Ka Pilo'ohana Ka 'Oi (Family Comes First).
programme.desc: SWAT captain Lou Grover finds himself facing a dilemma when a fugitive computer hacker (guest star Nick Jonas of Jonas Brothers fame) kidnaps the lawman's daughter to force him to help steal $100million. How many lines will Grover cross to secure the release of his child? Meanwhile, master criminal Wo Fat lands squarely back on the team's radar. Crime drama, with Chi McBride, Scott Caan and Alex O'Loughlin.(n)

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.sub-title: A'ohe Kahi e Pe'e Ai (Nowhere to Hide).
programme.desc: Return of the police drama. A terrorist using weaponised drones targets the island of O'ahu, so the team must mobilise to prevent the imminent attack. McGarrett and Danno open up about their friendship during a session with a psychologist, while the arrival of Max's new trainee Mindy causes a stir. Alex O'Loughlin, Scott Caan and Masi Oka star, with Jorge Garcia (Lost) joining the cast having made guest appearances in season 4.(n)

programme.title: UK Border Force
programme.desc: Immigration officers at Heathrow's Terminal 3 investigate a Jamaican man they believe to be a drug mule, following an X-ray that revealed suspicious objects inside his stomach. At a London Underground station, a suspected illegal immigrant tries to run from officers, but his escape is hindered by a member of the public.(n)

programme.title: Futurama
programme.desc: The Professor fine-tunes his What-If machine, allowing the friends to see how their lives could have turned out. Leela asks about her true home, Bender finds out what it means to be human, and Fry wonders what life would be like in a video game.(n)

programme.title: Futurama
programme.desc: Bender begins dating the Planet Express ship, but soon grows bored and decides to dump her - just when she is flying the crew away from a furious Omicronian death fleet. The robot is forced to agree to merge his programming with his former lover's, while Fry and Leela desperately try to shut her down before she can fly them all into a quasar. Featuring the voices of Sigourney Weaver and Lucy Liu.(n)

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: The first day of school arrives and Phil misreads how Claire is coping with an empty house, while Jay and Gloria disagree over what Manny should wear. Mitchell and Cameron are very upset when Lily gets a bump to the head. Starring Ed O'Neill (Married with Children) and Julie Bowen (Boston Legal).(n)

programme.title: Futurama
programme.desc: Leela is named Orphan of the Year, but is kidnapped along with Fry and Bender after the robot's toxic waste dumping enrages the sewer mutants. The three manage to escape with the help of two mysterious hooded figures, and Leela realises the pair may hold the key to discovering the truth about her parents after finding a shrine they made devoted to her life.(n)

programme.title: Futurama
programme.desc: Amy's new boyfriend Kif hopes to impress her parents by retrieving their livestock after the herd is stolen by marauding Martians. With the voices of Lauren Tom, Maurice LaMarche and Katey Sagal.(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Blood-curdling tales from America's favourite family in another Halloween special. The spooky stories feature an island inhabited by `manimals', plus tales about an army of Homer clones and zombie cowboys.(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.sub-title: How I Spent My Strummer Vacation.
programme.desc: Homer is asked to help the Rolling Stones with a forthcoming benefit gig, filling his head with dreams of rock 'n' roll stardom. Unfortunately, they only want him to stand in as a roadie. Featuring the voices of Mick Jagger, Keith Richards, Lenny Kravitz, Tom Petty and Elvis Costello.(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.sub-title: Bart vs Lisa vs the Third Grade.
programme.desc: Lisa is thrilled to learn she has been moved up a grade at school - until she discovers Bart's poor performance has caused him to be demoted to the same class. Tensions inevitably develop between the pair, but a crisis during a field trip teaches them the value of working together. With the guest voice of Tony Bennett.(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Marge has plastic surgery in an effort to lose weight, but a mix-up results in her being given breast implants instead - much to Homer's delight. With the guest voices of Adam West and Burt Ward, stars of 1960s TV series Batman.(n)

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Claire and Gloria leave Luke and Manny on babysitting duties while they head off to a day at a spa, while Phil and Mitch go to the movies and Jay and Cam visit a sports bar. However, their days out are ruined when the fire alarm goes off back at the house and Claire suspects the boys are throwing a party.(n)

programme.title: Air Ambulance ER
programme.desc: The crew members are pushed to their limits as they try to save a victim of a cardiac arrest. Fly-on-the-wall documentary following Britain's emergency helicopter medical services.(n)

programme.title: Legends
programme.desc: Martin races against the clock as he searches for Kate, while Ballard gets caught up in a life-changing incident in Lithuania in 1991.(n)

programme.title: Limitless
programme.sub-title: Stop Me Before I Hug Again.
programme.desc: Brian is invited on his first FBI field assignment when he is asked to lend his mind and skills to a unit responsible for catching serial killer, but he finds out the renowned criminal profiler he is working with may have put an innocent man behind bars during the case that made his career. Brian also tries to stay ahead of Rebecca as she takes a step closer to discovering Senator Morra's link to NZT.(n)

programme.title: The Force: Manchester
programme.desc: Officers respond to a series of alcohol-related incidents. Documentary following the work of Greater Manchester Police, which is England's second-largest force.(n)

programme.title: Brit Cops
programme.desc: Documentary series following the work of police officers in Lincolnshire as they tackle crime.(n)

programme.title: Monkey Life
programme.desc: Series following the rescue and rehabilitation of more than 160 neglected and abused primates at the Monkey World Ape Rescue Centre in Dorset, which the founder and his wife built into a 65-acre wildlife park that is home to 15 species.(n)

programme.title: Monkey Life
programme.desc: Staff members at Monkey World Ape Rescue Centre in Dorset face a big challenge as they attempt to move four chimps into a new enclosure during the park's biggest revamp to date.(n)

programme.title: Monkey Life
programme.desc: A keeper heads to Moscow to collect a baby orang-utan called Joly as her future home is built at the park. Meanwhile, Eddi has a `toddler tantrum' in Paddy's chimp group.(n)

programme.title: Monkey Life
programme.desc: Joly, an orphaned orang-utan from Moscow, arrives at the rescue centre in Dorset, but she encounters hostility from her new housemate Hsiao-Ning. Meanwhile, animal manager Jeremy captures the birth of a monkey on camera - and all looks promising as mother and baby get to know each other.(n)

programme.title: Ninja Warrior
programme.desc: The world's leading athletes and wrestlers compete against amateurs in one of the most demanding physical challenges ever devised.(n)
