programme.title: Nothing to Declare
programme.desc: Fly-on-the-wall documentary accessing the world of national security at Australia's biggest airports as customs and immigration officers tackle drug runners, illegal immigrants and terrorists.(n)

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.sub-title: O Ka Pilo'ohana Ka 'Oi (Family Comes First).
programme.desc: SWAT captain Lou Grover finds himself facing a dilemma when a fugitive computer hacker (guest star Nick Jonas of Jonas Brothers fame) kidnaps the lawman's daughter to force him to help steal $100million. How many lines will Grover cross to secure the release of his child? Meanwhile, master criminal Wo Fat lands squarely back on the team's radar. Crime drama, with Chi McBride, Scott Caan and Alex O'Loughlin.(n)

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.sub-title: A'ohe Kahi e Pe'e Ai (Nowhere to Hide).
programme.desc: Return of the police drama. A terrorist using weaponised drones targets the island of O'ahu, so the team must mobilise to prevent the imminent attack. McGarrett and Danno open up about their friendship during a session with a psychologist, while the arrival of Max's new trainee Mindy causes a stir. Alex O'Loughlin, Scott Caan and Masi Oka star, with Jorge Garcia (Lost) joining the cast having made guest appearances in season 4.(n)

programme.title: Forever
programme.desc: As the fantasy saga nears its season finale, the long suffering Henry embarks on an emotional quest that pushes the immortal to his limits - he attempts to find his beloved Abigail.(n)

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.desc: The cops investigate the kidnapping of a Navy Seal's daughter, only to hit a dead end while trying to determine the culprit's motive. However, as the twists unfurl, Jerry is the one who comes up with the big break they need. Meanwhile, Danno receives shocking news about his debt-ridden brother.(n)

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.desc: A robbery goes wrong for a trio of female thieves when they steal something that proves so valuable, they end up with a price on their heads - so Kono goes undercover as a surfer to infiltrate the gang. Meanwhile, Danny sets out to find his brother's hidden millions. Grace Park and Scott Caan star in the crime drama.(n)

programme.title: UK Border Force
programme.desc: Officers search UK-bound lorries and discover illegal immigrants during rush hour in Calais, while police investigate the workforce of a chicken factory.(n)

programme.title: Futurama
programme.desc: Leela is named Orphan of the Year, but is kidnapped along with Fry and Bender after the robot's toxic waste dumping enrages the sewer mutants. The three manage to escape with the help of two mysterious hooded figures, and Leela realises the pair may hold the key to discovering the truth about her parents after finding a shrine they made devoted to her life.(n)

programme.title: Futurama
programme.desc: Amy's new boyfriend Kif hopes to impress her parents by retrieving their livestock after the herd is stolen by marauding Martians. With the voices of Lauren Tom, Maurice LaMarche and Katey Sagal.(n)

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Manny reopens Mitchell's old childhood wound when he takes up fencing, with support from Jay and the rest of the family, and Phil tries to find out if Luke has any hidden talents. American comedy, starring Ed O'Neill and Julie Bowen.(n)

programme.title: Futurama
programme.desc: Bender's yearning to become a memorable figure prompts him to turn into a tyrannical pharaoh on Osiris 4 - so his friends try to teach him some humility and end his despotic reign. With the voices of John DiMaggio, Billy West and Katey Sagal.(n)

programme.title: Futurama
programme.desc: Bender is accidentally shot into space and discovers a microscopic civilisation. The tiny aliens declare him their god - but his attempts to help them soon go awry.(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: The family takes part in a new reality TV show set in the 19th century, which proves unpopular with viewers, prompting the producers to try a series of increasingly desperate and dangerous ploys in a bid to boost ratings. With the guest voice of former boxer Larry Holmes.(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Homer is the target of a mysterious murder attempt at a sauna, so Chief Wiggum orders Sideshow Bob's early release from prison to help identify the culprit. Featuring the guest voice of Kelsey Grammer.(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Bart takes pity on Mrs Krabappel and nominates her for the prestigious Teacher of the Year competition held in Florida, making Principal Skinner fear she will find another job if she wins. With the guest voice of Little Richard.(n)

programme.title: The Flash
programme.desc: Zoom arrives in Central City intent on taking over by any means necessary prompting Barry and Wells to come up with a plan to stop the villain once and for all - but it's extremely dangerous Meanwhile, Rupture crosses over from Earth-2 seeking justice for Reverb's death, while Iris decides she's finally ready to open up to Barry about her feelings for him.(n)

programme.title: A League of Their Own US Road Trip
programme.desc: New series. James Corden invites Jamie Redknapp, Jack Whitehall and Andrew Flintoff to take part in an adventure across America and compete in a series of challenges, with the overall loser having to strip on stage with the Chippendales. In the first edition, the jet-lagged boys land in California and hit the bowling alley, before taking to the field in front of a packed-out crowd at an Oakland Raiders game for a field-goal kicking competition. Finally, they must brave the freezing, shark-infested waters surrounding Alcatraz Island to swim all the way back to San Francisco Bay.(n)

programme.title: Duck Quacks Don't Echo
programme.desc: Lee Mack hosts the comedy panel game, with comedian Bob Mortimer, The Last Leg's Alex Brooker and Strictly Come Dancing host Claudia Winkleman revealing their favourite facts and trying to find if they are scientifically accurate.(n)

programme.title: NCIS: Los Angeles
programme.desc: Callen and the team are assigned to protection detail for a conference attended by the heads of multiple navies, but find themselves searching for a possible North Korean spy.(n)

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.sub-title: Makani 'Olu a Holo Malie (Fair Winds and Following Seas).
programme.desc: Catherine receives a distressed phone call from a man she met on her tour of duty in Afghanistan, revealing that his son has been taken by the Taliban. Roping in McGarrett, she sets out to rescue the youngster - a mission that prompts her to make a life-changing decision. Michelle Borth and Alex O'Loughlin star.(n)

programme.title: Forever
programme.desc: Henry and Jo enter the cut-throat world of ballet after the discovery of a severed human foot in a blood-soaked dance slipper, found in a bin at a theatre. Away from the case, the doctor tests Adam's theory about the gun that was used to kill him. Fantasy drama, starring Ioan Gruffudd and Alana De La Garza.(n)

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.sub-title: O Ka Pilo'ohana Ka 'Oi (Family Comes First).

programme.title: UK Border Force
programme.desc: Immigration officers at Heathrow's Terminal 3 investigate a Jamaican man they believe to be a drug mule, following an X-ray that revealed suspicious objects inside his stomach. At a London Underground station, a suspected illegal immigrant tries to run from officers, but his escape is hindered by a member of the public.(n)

programme.title: Futurama
programme.desc: The Professor fine-tunes his What-If machine, allowing the friends to see how their lives could have turned out. Leela asks about her true home, Bender finds out what it means to be human, and Fry wonders what life would be like in a video game.(n)

programme.title: Futurama
programme.desc: Bender begins dating the Planet Express ship, but soon grows bored and decides to dump her - just when she is flying the crew away from a furious Omicronian death fleet. The robot is forced to agree to merge his programming with his former lover's, while Fry and Leela desperately try to shut her down before she can fly them all into a quasar. Featuring the voices of Sigourney Weaver and Lucy Liu.(n)

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: The first day of school arrives and Phil misreads how Claire is coping with an empty house, while Jay and Gloria disagree over what Manny should wear. Mitchell and Cameron are very upset when Lily gets a bump to the head. Starring Ed O'Neill (Married with Children) and Julie Bowen (Boston Legal).(n)

programme.title: Futurama
programme.desc: Leela is named Orphan of the Year, but is kidnapped along with Fry and Bender after the robot's toxic waste dumping enrages the sewer mutants. The three manage to escape with the help of two mysterious hooded figures, and Leela realises the pair may hold the key to discovering the truth about her parents after finding a shrine they made devoted to her life.(n)

programme.title: Futurama
programme.desc: Amy's new boyfriend Kif hopes to impress her parents by retrieving their livestock after the herd is stolen by marauding Martians. With the voices of Lauren Tom, Maurice LaMarche and Katey Sagal.(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Blood-curdling tales from America's favourite family in another Halloween special. The spooky stories feature an island inhabited by `manimals', plus tales about an army of Homer clones and zombie cowboys.(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.sub-title: How I Spent My Strummer Vacation.
programme.desc: Homer is asked to help the Rolling Stones with a forthcoming benefit gig, filling his head with dreams of rock 'n' roll stardom. Unfortunately, they only want him to stand in as a roadie. Featuring the voices of Mick Jagger, Keith Richards, Lenny Kravitz, Tom Petty and Elvis Costello.(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.sub-title: Bart vs Lisa vs the Third Grade.
programme.desc: Lisa is thrilled to learn she has been moved up a grade at school - until she discovers Bart's poor performance has caused him to be demoted to the same class. Tensions inevitably develop between the pair, but a crisis during a field trip teaches them the value of working together. With the guest voice of Tony Bennett.(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Marge has plastic surgery in an effort to lose weight, but a mix-up results in her being given breast implants instead - much to Homer's delight. With the guest voices of Adam West and Burt Ward, stars of 1960s TV series Batman.(n)

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Claire and Gloria leave Luke and Manny on babysitting duties while they head off to a day at a spa, while Phil and Mitch go to the movies and Jay and Cam visit a sports bar. However, their days out are ruined when the fire alarm goes off back at the house and Claire suspects the boys are throwing a party.(n)

programme.title: Air Ambulance ER
programme.desc: The crew members are pushed to their limits as they try to save a victim of a cardiac arrest. Fly-on-the-wall documentary following Britain's emergency helicopter medical services.(n)

programme.title: Legends
programme.desc: Martin races against the clock as he searches for Kate, while Ballard gets caught up in a life-changing incident in Lithuania in 1991.(n)

programme.title: Limitless
programme.sub-title: Stop Me Before I Hug Again.
programme.desc: Brian is invited on his first FBI field assignment when he is asked to lend his mind and skills to a unit responsible for catching serial killer, but he finds out the renowned criminal profiler he is working with may have put an innocent man behind bars during the case that made his career. Brian also tries to stay ahead of Rebecca as she takes a step closer to discovering Senator Morra's link to NZT.(n)

programme.title: The Force: Manchester
programme.desc: Officers respond to a series of alcohol-related incidents. Documentary following the work of Greater Manchester Police, which is England's second-largest force.(n)

Tension simmers between Bex and Louise, who both have eyes for Square newcomer Shakil, while Jack asks Ronnie if he and Amy can move in.(n)

programme.title: 10 Things to Know About
programme.desc: Aoibhinn Ni Shuilleabhain, Kathriona Devereux and Jonathan McCrea investigate the science behind a variety of topics, beginning with fear. Aoibhinn tackles her phobia of spiders with a hands-on experience, and NUI Maynooth's Dr Brian Roche reveals how fears develop and why people can become crippled by them. Jonathan undergoes a form of waterboarding in an experiment at Trinity College Dublin to determine if stress affects the ability to recall information, while Professor Shane O'Meara talks about the brain's reaction to torture and the psychology of fear.(n)

programme.title: Neven Maguire: Home Chef
programme.desc: Chef Oliver Dunne from Dublin's Cleaver East Restaurant demonstrates how to prepare braised belly of pork, and Neven's own recipes include the ultimate beefburger with crispy potato wedges, and a dessert of toasted coconut and Malibu parfit with pineapple carpaccio and lime meringue.(n)

programme.title: Stetsons and Stilettos
programme.desc: Some of the most competitive jive dancers in the country music scene prepare to take part in Ireland's biggest dancing competition at the Monaghan Town Country Music Festival.(n)

programme.title: Room to Improve
programme.desc: Jean Robinson and Daithi Elliffe seek the help of architect Dermot Bannon to turn a listed 19th-century former schoolhouse at Kilternan, which has scenic views of the Dublin mountains, into their ideal family home. The property has been virtually disused for the past 30 years and is dank and dilapidated, with rotting floors, and the new homeowners are seeking a comfortable and bright dwelling with a modern layout. However, despite a generous budget of 360,000 euros, the constraints of a protected structure, a tight schedule and hidden costs begin to take their toll on the project.(n)

programme.desc: The latest national and international headlines.(n)

programme.title: Garda Down Under
programme.desc: Summer arrives in Australia, and while Gardai-turned-forensics officer Peter Crosbie struggles with the heat during a burglary investigation, Dubliner Joe Connolly relishes an opportunity to celebrate Christmas on the beach with his friends. In Kununurra, approximately 1,800 miles north of Perth, Michael Henderson ventures into the Outback to search for a missing person, but homesick Martin Mitchell and his girlfriend Niamh visit an Irish-themed store.(n)

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Phil and Aunt Sal turn up at Ronnie's after hearing that a familiar face is back in Albert Square. But Peggy has bad news for her family. Johnny is concerned about the future of his law career if Belinda reports him and Buster to the police. It soon seems everything is forgotten when she invites Mick and Linda to a hot-tub party - only for the evening to take an unexpected turn. As Sonia prepares for her doctor's appointment, a worried Bex turns to Stacey for advice.(n)

programme.title: Fair City
programme.desc: Paul tries to avoid looking like he is out-of-the-loop when Jane tells him Oisin is planning a secret party at the Pod. A surprise guest scuppers Decco's romantic plans, and Sean worries his new girlfriend is out of his league.(n)

Christa becomes insecure in her new relationship with Neal when his ex-girlfriend Grace Adams returns to Angels Memorial having spent a year volunteering in Haiti.(n)

programme.title: Silent Witness
programme.desc: The nanny of a Russian oligarch is killed in a botched assassination attempt, a bloody shootout that also leaves an unknown hitman dead. As the team joins forces with young DI Sarah Parks to ascertain the identity of the dead would-be assassin, further questions begin to mount - who would want the businessman dead, and why? First in a two-part story, starring Emilia Fox, David Caves and Richard Lintern, with Lauren O'Neil, Pippa Haywood and Shaun Dingwall.(n)

programme.title: The Restaurant Inspector
programme.desc: Fernando Peire visits the Somerset seaside resort of Weston-super-Mare to help change the fortunes of the Nook & Harbour. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Kevin McCloud revisits Robert and Milla Gaukroger who, when he last saw them, were in danger of their bank foreclosing on their unfinished timber house with views of Lake Windermere. They had begun construction with only a quarter of the £400,000 budget needed, and the physical effort of turning the 1980s property into an eco-home that mirrored the surrounding mountains had begun to put Robert's health at risk.(n)

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Pam remains suspicious of Les's behaviour and it isn't long before she learns an upsetting truth. Glenda realises that Ronnie doubts she is telling the truth about Roxy, so she becomes more determined than ever to earn her eldest daughter's trust and be a part of her life again. Stacey is not very impressed with Martin's new idea, although she soon finds herself being roped in to help - will all go to plan? The residents take drastic action to stop Ian from selling Beale's by preventing customers entering the restaurant.(n)

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Ronnie continues with her mission to find Roxy but is forced to face an upsetting reality about her sister. Ian holds a meeting with the locals in an attempt to convince them to stop boycotting his businesses - but will they listen? Kush and Martin start to clear the air, while it seems Kyle's recent actions are coming back to haunt him.(n)

programme.title: Fair City
programme.desc: Katy struggles to stomach watching Debbie humiliate Eoghan, even though she insists she has ended her affair with Tommy. However, when Debbie meets her secret sweetheart later, it becomes clear they are still very much involved. Meanwhile, Oisin and Charlotte intensify their campaign against Jane, and as Dan and Laura's business falters, Caoimhe and Dean decide to intervene.(n)

programme.title: Stetsons and Stilettos
programme.desc: A look at the world of Irish country music and its fans, beginning with a report from the Cowboys and Heroes festival, where an area of rural Ireland is transformed into the Wild West for one weekend.(n)

programme.title: Room to Improve
programme.desc: Architect Dermot Bannon helps Avril and Andrew Wilson-Rankin, who have dreamt of owning their own home since they first met 10 years previously. The couple have a budget of 260,000 euros to transform a two-storey disused commercial lock-up on a side street in Dun Laoghaire, Dublin, into an urban dwelling complete with exposed brickwork, and internal bridge and a mezzanine level. However, the logistical challenge of working on a restricted site quickly puts the budget and tight schedule under pressure.(n)

programme.title: Shutterbugs
programme.desc: Children capture nature on camera, heading into the countryside to learn about Irish wildlife, and trying to track down one particular animal to photograph.(n)

programme.title: Chloe's Closet
programme.desc: Animated series following four-year-old Chloe, who goes on adventures after dressing up in the outfits she discovers in her magical wardrobe.(n)

programme.title: Fireman Sam
programme.desc: Blaze-tackling antics with the friendly firefighter from Pontypandy.(n)

programme.title: Peter Rabbit
programme.desc: Adventures with the animal and his friends, in a tale inspired by Beatrix Potter.(n)

programme.title: Puffin Rock
programme.desc: Children's animation following the adventures of a family of puffins living on a wild and beautiful Irish island. Narrated by Chris O'Dowd.(n)

programme.title: Mike the Knight
programme.desc: Animated children's adventure set in a medieval kingdom, following the antics of 10-year-old knight-in-training Mike.(n)

programme.title: Go Jetters
programme.desc: Cartoon following four adventure-seeking superheroes as they explore places all around the world.(n)

programme.title: Ella the Elephant
programme.desc: Children's animation about the lovable elephant who likes to help her community.(n)

programme.title: Dig in Diner
programme.desc: From the the coolest diner in town, waitress Muireann and Digger the gardener explore food from the soil to the table, introducing fresh produce and great recipes from every corner of the world.(n)

programme.title: Nelly & Nora
programme.desc: Animation about the adventures of two sisters at a seaside camping park.(n)

programme.title: Angelina Ballerina
programme.desc: Animated adventures with the feisty little mouse who loves to dance and dreams of becoming a famous ballerina.(n)

programme.title: Bob the Builder
programme.desc: Animated antics with the friendly handyman and his hard-working pals.(n)

programme.title: Ballybraddan
programme.desc: Animated drama series about the fifth-year children of Ballybraddan Primary School. Each is facing individual obstacles and trying to find a place in the world, but they all come together as a team on the hurling pitch.(n)

programme.title: Zig and Zag
programme.desc: Animation following the adventures of the alien twin brothers.(n)

programme.title: Shaun the Sheep
programme.desc: Spin-off show following the adventures of Wallace and Gromit's lovable friend.(n)

programme.title: Shaun the Sheep
programme.desc: Spin-off show following the adventures of Wallace and Gromit's lovable friend.(n)

programme.title: The Next Step
programme.desc: Reality-style drama, following the lives of a group of dancers as they attempt to win the regional championships.(n)

programme.title: Dani's Castle
programme.desc: Dani inherits a castle in Northern Ireland and gets more than she bargains for.(n)

programme.title: The Sleepover Club
programme.desc: Drama based on the best-selling books by Rose Impey, following the adventures of five pre-teen girls who belong to their own club.(n)

programme.title: Sam & Cat
programme.desc: Spin-off in which the characters from iCarly and Victorious team up to run a babysitting service.(n)

programme.title: Shake It Up
programme.desc: Following the adventures of best friends CeCe Jones and Rocky Blue, who get jobs as background dancers on TV show Shake It Up Chicago.(n)

programme.title: news2day
programme.desc: Domestic and international news items of interest to younger viewers.(n)

programme.title: Sabrina the Teenage Witch
programme.desc: Supernatural comedy, starring Melissa Joan Hart as the all-American girl with amazing powers.(n)

programme.title: Blue Water High
programme.desc: Drama following the adventures of eight teenagers at a prestigious surf academy in Australia.(n)

programme.title: Neighbours
programme.desc: Brad goes to the police with his suspicions, Paige discovers the identity of a mystery man seen in a photo with John, while Amy rejects Terese's proposal.(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Depressed at getting old, Bart wears a T-shirt to school bearing an adult joke, and is accosted by a marketing manager wanting to promote the new product. Meanwhile, Homer helps Lisa build a nuclear bomb for a school science project. Eric Idle guest stars.(n)

programme.title: Home and Away
programme.desc: Hannah struggles to adjust to life after her operation, Irene starts to come to terms with Claire not being her daughter and Lindsay shakes things up again for Olivia and Hunter.(n)

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Sheldon breaks up with Amy and turns to cats in his search for an alternative to human companionship. However, when he starts to bulk-buy pets, Leonard decides enough is enough and calls for reinforcements to help bring his friend back to his senses. Comedy, starring Jim Parsons.(n)

programme.title: Friends
programme.desc: Rachel joins Joey on the set of his soap opera, where a steamy love scene inspires unexpected feelings - and a saucy dream. Phoebe takes an opportunity to serenade a captive audience, while Chandler plans to whisk Monica away - but ends up inviting Ross. Jennifer Aniston and Matt LeBlanc star.(n)

programme.title: Eurovision Song Contest 2016
programme.desc: Coverage of the Semi-Final, live from Stockholm, Sweden. Artists from 18 countries will sing for a place in the Grand Final on Saturday in the 61st annual Eurovision Song Contest. With commentary from Marty Whelan.(n)

programme.title: Grey's Anatomy
programme.desc: The hospital goes into lockdown when a child is reported missing on the premises. As a result, Ben is unable to get the necessary surgical equipment, but still operates on a pregnant woman - a judgement call that could have massive repercussions for his career.(n)

programme.title: Outlander
programme.desc: Jamie and Claire attempt to extinguish the fires their dinner party ignited. However, the time traveller is set off on an unexpected change of course.(n)

programme.title: Sorry
programme.desc: The threat of mother is ever present even in her absence - as Timothy finds out when his parent takes a holiday. Ronnie Corbett stars.(n)

programme.title: As Time Goes By
programme.desc: Jean insists on going back to work having returned from LA, certain she can overcome jet lag, but Lionel just wants to rest. Comedy, starring Judi Dench and Geoffrey Palmer.(n)

programme.title: The Brittas Empire
programme.desc: Gordon is sacked from his job as manager, but eventually finds another outlet for his rather limited talents. Accepting the situation gracefully, he returns to the leisure centre with a gift of thanks to the staff, and manages to unleash a final, catastrophic chain of events. Comedy, starring Chris Barrie.(n)

programme.title: Steptoe and Son
programme.desc: Harold and Albert attend a family funeral and immediately clash with their common-as-muck relatives over how to divide the loot they think they're about to inherit. Starring Wilfrid Brambell and Harry H Corbett.(n)

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Compo unwittingly bags a jumble sale bargain, an item that transforms him from an old man into a heart-breaking macho man - with a little help from his friends. Comedy, starring Bill Owen and Frank Thornton.(n)

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.sub-title: The Only Diesel-Powered Saxophone in Captivity.
programme.desc: Compo meets a childhood rival and blackmails him into competitions they did when they were 11 to prove their fitness. Auntie Wainwright sells Barry a saxophone with a weird case. Bill Owen, Peter Sallis and Mike Grady star.(n)

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Nora starts a cleaning job at the home of a much-praised widower across the valley, leaving Compo writhing in jealousy. Long-running comedy, starring Bill Owen, Peter Sallis and Frank Thornton.(n)

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Howard secretly buys a van and asks Wesley to customise it for long journeys, but Compo insists on pushing the vehicle to its limits. Truly thinks Clegg is paying too high a tax, so he drags his friend to a council meeting. Auntie Wainwright has Smiler deliver a truck load of junk that the recipient did not order. Peter Sallis and Howard Fyfe star.(n)

programme.title: Abbott and Costello Meet Dr Jekyll and Mr Hyde
programme.desc: Gruesome twosome Bud and Lou star as cops who fall into the hands of a mad scientist, played by Boris Karloff. Horror spoof, with Craig Stevens and Helen Westcott.(n)

programme.desc: Harold and Albert attend a family funeral and immediately clash with their common-as-muck relatives over how to divide the loot they think they're about to inherit. Starring Wilfrid Brambell and Harry H Corbett.(n)

programme.title: Miranda
programme.desc: In a bid to make the most of being young, free and single, Miranda spontaneously books herself into a hotel across the road. She befriends helpful porter Jason and conference organiser Colin, and by the end of her stay, she feels like a new woman. Starring Miranda Hart and Luke Pasqualino.(n)

programme.title: Miranda
programme.desc: Penny decides to throw a party, hoping one of the male guests will turn out to be a suitable partner for Miranda. The singleton is mortified at the idea and invents a number of increasingly bizarre excuses to avoid attending the event. Starring Miranda Hart, Patricia Hodge, Sally Phillips and Adrian Scarborough.(n)

programme.title: Miranda
programme.desc: A handsome stranger loses his wallet in the joke shop, where it is found by Stevie and Miranda - who immediately begin trying to find out which one of them he would prefer to go on a date with. Meanwhile, Gary is offered a new job in Hong Kong, but seems to be waiting for someone to persuade him to stay. Starring Miranda Hart, Sarah Hadland and Tom Ellis.(n)

programme.title: Fawlty Towers
programme.desc: Prudish Basil resorts to increasingly desperate measures to prevent an unmarried couple lowering moral standards at his hotel. Unfortunately, as his efforts become increasingly frantic, he succeeds only in making a fool of himself. Classic comedy, starring John Cleese, Prunella Scales, Andrew Sachs and Connie Booth.(n)

programme.title: Fawlty Towers
programme.desc: The rumour that hotel inspectors are in town brings out the grovelling worst in Basil as he tries to spot the undercover enemy without upsetting all the guests. Comedy, guest starring Bernard Cribbins, with John Cleese and Prunella Scales.(n)

programme.title: Mrs Brown's Boys
programme.desc: Agnes is upset that Trevor has decided to work for a mission project in Africa, and resolves to give him an unforgettable send-off to remind him of the loving family he has in Ireland. Cathy's family counselling session descends into chaos, Buster and Dermot land themselves in trouble because of a circus lion, and neighbour Winnie is delighted that her husband's libido has returned. Comedy, starring Brendan O'Carroll.(n)

programme.title: Little Britain
programme.desc: Myfanwy sets out to improve Daffyd's social life by introducing him to a group of gay Star Trek fans, while Vicky Pollard tries to get served in the pub. Kenny Craig unleashes his hypnotic powers on his hospitalised mother, Lou buys Andy an ice-cream, and Michael and Sebastian examine the headlines.(n)

programme.title: Rex the Runt
programme.desc: Part three of three. Rex drills into the Earth, but ends up letting all the air out and must visit a black hole to put things right. With the voices of Eddie Izzard and Kathy Burke.(n)

programme.title: Cheers
programme.desc: The Boston bar's regulars descend on Carla's house for Thanksgiving dinner, but end up having a food fight. Comedy, starring Rhea Perlman and Ted Danson.(n)

programme.title: Vic Reeves Big Night Out
programme.desc: Vic finds uses for unwanted bark, gets into a confrontation with a rebel and meets Mr Popkins and his doughnuts.(n)

programme.title: The Wrong Mans
programme.desc: Sam negotiates the exchange of Mrs Stevens for Mr Lau's nephew Jason, but Phil almost scuppers the plan. After a dramatic escape, they take Scarlett home to her husband for a less-than-happy reunion, before the pair have to go on the run from both cops and criminals, finding temporary safety in the hands of enigmatic MI5 agent Walker. Comedy thriller, starring James Corden and Mathew Baynton.(n)

programme.title: A Bit of Fry and Laurie
programme.desc: An angry audience member claims ownership of the episode's sketches. A teenage poet helps a headmaster to express himself and a drug dealer applies for a bank loan.(n)

programme.title: Rex the Runt
programme.desc: Wendy is put on trial for shooting Vince, so Rex and Bad Bob represent her in court in the hope that it will make them famous. With the voices of June Whitfield and Judith Chalmers.(n)

programme.title: Rex the Runt
programme.desc: Rex, Wendy and Bob discover a jungle under their duvet and visit Auntie Brenda's University of Love. Featuring the voice of Pam Ayres.(n)

programme.title: Sorry
programme.desc: As his marriage looms, Tim learns that being wed does not necessarily guarantee a happy-ever-after ending.(n)

programme.title: As Time Goes By
programme.desc: Jean tries to organise a new secretary for Lionel, who is troubled by discussions regarding the mini-series. Rocky's honeymoon with Madge ends in hospital after an unfortunate canoeing accident. Judi Dench and Geoffrey Palmer star.(n)

programme.title: The Brittas Empire
programme.desc: Now a national celebrity and hero, Gordon prepares to welcome the Songs of Praise film crew to the newly refurbished Whitbury Leisure Centre, but his plans are thrown into disarray by the suspicion that a serial killer may be trying to put a stop to the proceedings. Pam Rhodes guest stars.(n)

programme.title: Steptoe and Son
programme.desc: Albert's long-running tax fiddle finally comes to light - he has never stopped claiming allowances for Harold's beloved mum, who died 40 years ago. Classic comedy, starring Harry H Corbett and Wilfrid Brambell.(n)

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.sub-title: From Audrey Nash to the Widow Dilhooley.
programme.desc: Lovestruck Truly learns his childhood sweetheart is to return from Australia - and eager to make a good impression, immediately sets about making sure the long-awaited expat receives an unforgettable welcome. Rural comedy, starring Frank Thornton and Bill Owen.(n)

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: On Truly's advice, Compo parades a more daring and glamorous image to impress Nora - and her reaction transports him to new heights. Rural comedy, starring Frank Thornton and Bill Owen.(n)

programme.desc: Compo, Clegg and Truly dispense advice to a hen-pecked husband on the run from his overbearing wife, while Auntie Wainwright causes a stir with her new equestrian venture. Starring Bill Owen, Peter Sallis and Frank Thornton.(n)

programme.sub-title: How Errol Flynn Discovered the Secret Scar of Nora Batty.

programme.title: Men Behaving Badly
programme.desc: Gary dedicates himself to nursing girlfriend Dorothy back to health after an operation to remove her appendix - but soon gets bored and suggests a more intimate form of therapy. programme.desc: Emily Howard has an x-ray that uncovers her secret and Peter Andre reveals the subject of his unusual obsession. Daffyd gets a haircut, Vicky Pollard ends up in court and Dennis Waterman delivers a special birthday message.(n)
